column2: Springboard mentors & career coaches help learners switch careers
column3: Industry experts in data science from companies like Paytm, Myntra, Uber, Swiggy etc have joined hands with Springboard to provide 1:1 mentorship every week to its Indian learners to help them transition to a career in data science. Springboard is a US based online learning platform that seeks to help learners transition their careers through its unique approach.

column2: Law student, who accused Chinmayanand of rape, held for extortion
column3: The law student, who accused BJP leader Swami Chinmayanand of rape, has been arrested by the SIT for allegedly trying to extort money from him, Uttar Pradesh DGP OP Singh said. Earlier, the 23-year-old's lawyer said that they had filed a plea for anticipatory bail in the extortion case filed by Chinmayanand. The BJP leader was arrested last week.

column2: PM Modi gets ‘Global Goalkeeper Award’ for Swachh Bharat campaign
column3: PM Narendra Modi has received the 'Global Goalkeeper Award' for the 'Swachh Bharat' campaign from Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation. PM Modi said, "This honour is not mine but of the crores of Indians who not only fulfilled the 'Swachh Bharat' dream but also made it a part of their daily lives." The campaign benefited women the most, he added.

column2: Symbiosis' SNAP test to take place on 15th December 2019
column3: SNAP test, the online aptitude test for Symbiosis International (Deemed University) is a gateway to 28 programmes offered by 16 institutes. The test structure comprises 3 sections and 110 questions. This year, the current affairs section has been removed. Registrations for SNAP are live and the test will be conducted online on 15th December 2019 in 90 cities across India.

column2: Man posts Salman's pic with red cross as death threat; police launch probe
column3: The Rajasthan Police has said they are investigating death threats against Salman Khan ahead of his court hearing in the blackbuck poaching case later this week. The threat, which carried a photo of Salman with a red cross, was posted on Facebook from an account named Garry Shooter. ''People have alleged...a gang [named] '007' is behind it," said police.

column2: iOS 13, iPadOS bug gives full access to some third-party keyboards
column3: Apple on Tuesday revealed an iOS 13 and iPadOS bug that could grant full system access to third-party keyboards which have the ability to request "full access" permissions. The bug may allow full access permission even if it was not approved, Apple warned. "This issue does not impact Apple's built-in keyboards," the iPhone maker further added.

column2: FB to not fact-check, block politicians' posts for breaking rules
column3: Facebook has confirmed that it won't fact-check politicians' speeches or block their content if it's newsworthy, even if it violates Facebook's hate-speech or other policies. Facebook's global policy and communication head Nick Clegg said the idea behind the move is for users to "judge what politicians say themselves". However, Facebook will delete content that could lead to real-world violence.

column2: Won't allow driverless cars in India as it can take away jobs: Gadkari
column3: Minister of Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari has said he won't allow driverless cars in India. "I was asked whether I oppose new technology. I said not at all," he added. "There are 40 lakh drivers in [India] and a shortage of 25 lakh drivers. I'll not let the jobs of 1 crore people be snatched away," Gadkari said.

column2: OYO's revenue grew 4.4 times in a year by June 2019: CEO
column3: India's most valuable budget hospitality startup OYO's Founder and CEO Ritesh Agarwal, speaking with The Financial Express, revealed that the startup's revenue grew 4.4 times year-over-year in June 2019. "The losses as a percentage of NRV (net realised value) have been on a steady and significant declining curve," he added. OYO is yet to officially file its FY19 financial results.

column2: PhonePe takes BharatPe to Delhi HC over trademark infringement
column3: Payments service provider PhonePe, owned by Flipkart-parent Walmart, has registered a trademark infringement case in Delhi High Court against BharatPe, accusing it of illegally using the suffix "Pe". PhonePe has also sought an injunction order, which wasn't granted in its last hearing. PhonePe had issued a notice to BharatPe last year, following which BharatPe changed its logo and colour scheme.

column2: OYO may raise up to $1 billion at $13.5-15 billion valuation
column3: Gurugram-based budget hospitality startup OYO is reportedly in talks to raise $750 million to $1 billion in fresh funds to infuse in its parent company Oravel Stays. The funding could reportedly be led by Japanese conglomerate SoftBank and OYO's valuation is expected to reach $13.5-15 billion post-funding. OYO will reportedly use the funds towards its five-star and luxury properties worldwide.

column2: NASA successfully launches 17-year-old Indian student's satellite
column3: NASA successfully launched the RamanSat 2 miniature satellite designed by 17-year-old student Aabhaas Sikka on Monday night. The satellite was developed by Sikka during his internship with SPACE India with help from SPACE Group Founder and CMD Sachin Bahmba along with the company's research team. It is carrying equipment to measure the radiation from Sun and space.

column2: PM Modi gifts Trump their framed photograph from 'Howdy, Modi' event
column3: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday gifted US President Donald Trump a framed photograph of them both from 'Howdy, Modi' event in Texas' Houston that was attended by over 50,000 people. PMO shared the picture and tweeted, "Memories from Houston, where history was made!" The photograph was presented as the two leaders met on the sidelines of UN General Assembly session.

column2: We can't attack India, clearly that's not an option: Pak PM Imran Khan
column3: When asked what options are left for him if the international community doesn't respond over Kashmir, Pakistan PM Imran Khan said, "What options have we got apart from [talking to...global community]?" "We can't attack India, clearly that's not an option," he added while speaking during a news briefing at UN. "Apart from that, we're doing everything possible," Khan said.

column2: US Speaker announces impeachment inquiry against President Trump
column3: US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi launched an impeachment inquiry against President Donald Trump, accusing him of violating the Constitution. This comes after reports that Trump called Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and sought his help to investigate Democrat Joe Biden. Pelosi said such actions would mark "betrayal of his oath of office", adding, "No one is above the law."

column2: Bill Barney resigns as CEO from Anil Ambani's RCom; to continue at GCX
column3: Bill Barney on Tuesday stepped down as CEO of Reliance Communications (RCom) to focus full time at the helm of Global Cloud Xchange (GCX) during its corporate restructuring process. Reliance Communications' subsidiary GCX, which makes undersea cable systems, had filed for bankruptcy in the US last week.

column2: Uncontainable excitement: Shweta on dad's Dadasaheb Phalke Award
column3: After Amitabh Bachchan was selected for the Dadasaheb Phalke Award, his daughter, Shweta Bachchan posted a picture of the actor on Instagram and congratulated him. "Whose your Dada (Saheb Phalke)? Uncontainable excitement, pride, tears, and general hysteria," she wrote. Director Karan Johar also congratulated Bachchan and wrote, "I'm honoured and proud to be in the Era of AMITABH BACHCHAN!"

column2: Govt to make certification model for streaming sites: Report
column3: The Information and Broadcasting Ministry has reportedly decided to set up a model for the certification of online video-streaming content after Diwali. Earlier this year, nine video streaming sites in India, including Netflix and Hotstar, had adopted a self-regulatory Code of Best Practices for content.

column2: Deepika Padukone attends Dior's show at Paris Fashion Week
column3: Actress Deepika Padukone on Tuesday attended luxury brand Dior's fashion show at the Paris Fashion Week. Deepika opted for a floral printed strapless gown with a brown headband of the same print and mesh patterned long boots at Dior's Spring/Summer show. She accessorised her look with a Dior handbag, golden jewellery and pulled her hair up into a bun.

column2: Tom Hanks to receive Cecil B DeMille Award at 2020 Golden Globes
column3: Hollywood actor Tom Hanks will be honoured with Cecil B DeMille Award at the Golden Globe Awards on January 5, 2020, the Hollywood Foreign Press Association announced on Tuesday. The award recognises an individual who has made a lasting impact on the film industry. Oprah Winfrey, Morgan Freeman and Meryl Streep have been some of the recipients of the award.

column2: I was raped at 15, rapist said I was sold to him by mom for $500: Demi
column3: Hollywood actress Demi Moore has revealed that she was raped at the age of 15 in her home. She added that the man told her that she had been sold to him by her mother for $500. When asked if she believed the man, Demi said, "I think, in my deep heart no...But she still did give him the access."

column2: WeWork Co-founder Neumann to step down as CEO amid investors' pressure
column3: US-based shared workspaces startup WeWork's Co-founder Adam Neumann is stepping down from the CEO role and will become a non-executive Chairman, a WeWork spokesperson confirmed to CNBC on Tuesday. WeWork Vice-Chairman Sebastian Gunningham and CFO Artie Minson will become co-CEOs, it added. WeWork's largest investor SoftBank's CEO Masayoshi Son led the charge to remove Neumann, CNBC reported.

column2: I was denied entry at 'Howdy, Modi' event due to my comments on PM: Hasan
column3: Indian-American comedian Hasan Minhaj has claimed that he was blacklisted from 'Howdy, Modi' event as the comments he made on PM Narendra Modi in his show "were not appreciated". Hasan also pointed out that although he was blacklisted, the event mentioned his name and displayed his photo while honouring prominent Indian Americans.

column2: Situation very bad in Valley: Ghulam Nabi Azad on reaching Jammu
column3: Senior Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad on Tuesday reached Jammu on the second-leg of his six-day tour of Jammu and Kashmir and said the situation in the Valley was "very bad". "I was not even allowed by the administration to visit 10% of the places where I had planned to go in the Valley during my stay there," said Azad.

column2: Dhoni has done so much, discussion around his future is unfair: Yuvraj
column3: Ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh has said the discussion around ex-India captain MS Dhoni's future is "unfair". "Dhoni has done so much for Indian cricket. He has been the most successful Indian captain, so you got to give him time," he added. "He needs to decide when he wants to go out. He needs to take that call," Yuvraj further said.

column2: BCCI elections to take place on Oct 23 instead of Oct 22: CoA chief
column3: The BCCI's elections have been rescheduled by a day to October 23 in the wake of assembly elections in Haryana and Maharashtra, Chairman of the Committee of Administrators (CoA) Vinod Rai said. Both the states will be voting on October 21 in a single-phase elections. CoA has also extended the deadline for BCCI state units elections to October 4.

column2: Dhoni was not made in a day: Yuvraj on Rishabh Pant's criticism
column3: Stressing that 21-year-old wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant should be given an extended run in international cricket, ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh said, "MS Dhoni was not made in a day. It took a few years so it will take a few years for a replacement also." "If you're going to suppress [Pant], you won't get the best out of him," Yuvraj added.

column2: Bangladesh, Afghanistan share trophy as rain washes out tri-series final
column3: Bangladesh and Afghanistan shared the trophy after the tri-nation T20I series final was washed out without a ball being bowled at the Sher-e-Bangla National Stadium in Dhaka on Tuesday. Afghanistan’s Rahmanullah Gurbaz was named player of the tournament for making 133 runs in four innings. The tri-series also involved Zimbabwe.

column2: It's lingo that is fun: Dhoni on video of friends playing gully cricket
column3: Ex-India captain MS Dhoni took to Instagram to share a video of his friends playing gully cricket. "It's the lingo that’s fun... trial ball, umpires decision last decision. Brings back memory from school days," he wrote. In the video, Dhoni's friend can be seen getting bowled after which he says he wasn't ready and gets out on the next ball.

column2: Mom worried about my marriage as I don't have a degree: OYO Founder
column3: OYO Rooms' 25-year-old Founder and CEO Ritesh Agarwal in an interview to The Financial Express said, "My mom is surely worried about the fact that I don't have a college degree." "She thinks this will impact my chances of finding a bride," he added. Agarwal dropped out of college at the age of 17 and founded OYO Rooms in 2013.

column2: PM Modi knows how to deal with it: Trump on tackling terrorism from Pak
column3: When asked about tackling terrorism from Pakistan, US President Donald Trump said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi knows how to deal with it. "It will be great if (PM Modi and Pakistan PM Imran Khan) can work out something on Kashmir," he added. Trump further said that India and the US will have a trade deal very soon.

column2: PM Modi, Pak PM will get along when they get to know each other: Trump
column3: US President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that he believed Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan will get along when they get to know each other. "I believe these two great gentlemen (PM Modi and Imran Khan) will get together and work something out," Trump further said about the ongoing tensions between India and Pakistan.

column2: Court orders accommodation for Unnao rape survivor, family in Delhi
column3: A Delhi court on Tuesday issued directions under the witness protection guidelines to arrange accommodation for the Unnao rape survivor and her family in Delhi. This comes after the Uttar Pradesh government filed a report in the court stating that the survivor and her family wanted to reside in the national capital as they apprehend threat in their home state.

column2: PM Modi is like Elvis Presley of India: Donald Trump
column3: During the joint press conference after their meeting on the sidelines of the United Nations General Assembly, US President Donald Trump said, "People went crazy at 'Howdy, Modi' event. The crowd loved him." "He is like Elvis Presley of India," Trump added. He further told the Indian reporters, "You've got a great PM, he'll solve all the problems."

column2: You've great reporters, I wish I'd reporters like them: Trump to PM Modi
column3: During a joint press conference with PM Narendra Modi, US President Donald Trump, while responding to an Indian reporter who asked if there was a roadmap to deal with Pakistan-sponsored terror, said, "You've got great reporters." "I wish I'd reporters like them. They're doing better than anybody I have heard," he added. "Where do you find these reporters?" he asked.

column2: Indian Army clears 130 tonnes of garbage from Siachen Glacier
column3: The Indian Army has stated that it has cleaned about 130 tonnes of garbage from the Siachen Glacier. Out of the 130.14 tonnes, 48.14 tonnes of waste is non-biodegradable, while 40 tonnes include glass and plastic waste. The Indian Army further stated it has asked the troops to bring back whatever little garbage they can to the base camp.

column2: Rajnath Singh congratulates Big B for Dadasaheb Phalke Award
column3: Union Minister Rajnath Singh on Tuesday congratulated actor Amitabh Bachchan for being selected for Dadasaheb Phalke Award. "He is one of the actors...who has ruled the hearts of cine lovers for long. In the five decades, he showcased his art of acting and talent in many films," Singh added. I&B Minister Prakash Javadekar made the announcement about it earlier today.

column2: Manchester United post record revenue of £627 million
column3: Premier League side Manchester United announced record revenues of £627 million on Tuesday. "We remain focused on our plan of rebuilding the team and continuing to strengthen our youth system, in line with the philosophy of the club and the manager," the club's executive vice-chairman Ed Woodward said. United have won just two of their last 11 league matches.

column2: Unforgettable: Yusuf who debuted in 2007 WT20 final recalls match
column3: All-rounder Yusuf Pathan, who made his international debut in the 2007 WT20 final against Pakistan, recalled the match on the occasion of the 12th anniversary of India's final victory. "An unforgettable night, a nerve-wracking game - Exactly, 12 years ago, we lifted the...title... A significant day in the history of Indian cricket," he tweeted. Pathan scored 15(8) in the match.

column2: You cannot compare me and Messi: Liverpool's Virgil van Dijk
column3: After losing out to Lionel Messi as the Best FIFA Men's Player of the Year, Liverpool defender Virgil van Dijk said, "[A]s players, you can't compare me and Messi because it's totally different." Van Dijk had earlier beaten Messi and Juventus forward Cristiano Ronaldo to win the UEFA Best Men's Player of the Year award.

column2: India's Korean badminton coach resigns for personal reasons
column3: India's South Korean coach Kim Ji Hyun, who helped PV Sindhu clinch her maiden world title recently, has resigned from her position due to personal reasons. The 45-year-old has gone to New Zealand to take care of her husband Ritchie Marr, who suffered a stroke. Kim was roped in by the Badminton Association of India early this year.

column2: Company claims completing 1st drone flight with microturbine engine
column3: UAV Turbines on Tuesday announced the inaugural flight of its Monarch 5 engine, a first-of-its-kind microturbine propulsion system. The company says this marks 'the first time a small-to-medium-sized drone has been powered by a turbine engine'. It is engineered to provide mid-sized commercial and military unmanned air vehicles with a 'reliable, efficient, safe, heavy-fuel propulsion system'.

column2: Food brand Ketofy raises $250,000 in pre-Series A round
column3: Low-carb food brand Ketofy, operated by Wellversed Health, has raised $250,000 in a pre-Series A round of funding from a group of investors. The investors include former Founding CTO of Indiabulls Tejinderpal Miglani, Indifi Technologies Co-founder Alok Mittal and Sarcha Advisors Founder Rohit Chanana. Based in Gurugram, the startup makes ultra-low-carb and ultra-low glycemic food products.

column2: Low-lying areas in Bihar flooded as Ganga's water level rises
column3: Low-lying areas in Bihar's Lakhisarai have flooded following the rise in the water level of Ganga river. As per reports, locals have alleged that the concerned officials aren't providing any relief measures to the flood-affected victims. "We're witnessing this kind of situation after 30 years...The water has entered the houses and due to which diseases are spreading," a local said.

column2: Trump criticises China, says it has broken promises on trade
column3: Addressing the UN General Assembly, US President Donald Trump on Tuesday criticised China and its trade practices. He accused it of not adopting "promised reforms". Trump added, "China has embraced an economic model dependent on massive market barriers, heavy state subsidies, currency manipulation, product dumping, forced technology transfers and intellectual property theft...on a grand scale."

column2: Venezuelan President Maduro is a 'Cuban puppet': Trump
column3: US President Donald Trump during his speech at the United Nations General Assembly called Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro a "Cuban puppet". "Dictator Maduro... protected by Cuban bodyguards, hiding from his own people while Cuba plunders Venezuela's oil wealth to sustain its own corrupt, Communist rule," he said. The US has recognised Venezuelan opposition leader Juan Guaido as the president.

column2: We'll have trade deal with India soon: Trump during meet with PM Modi
column3: During a bilateral meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday, US President Donald Trump said that the US and India will have a trade deal very soon. The US had ended its preferential trade treatment for India in June. Trump met PM Modi in New York on the sidelines of the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) session.

column2: 19 killed, 300 injured after 5.8-magnitude earthquake hits PoK
column3: At least 19 people were killed and 300 others were injured after a 5.8-magnitude earthquake hit Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) on Tuesday, officials said. The earthquake's epicentre was close to the city of Mirpur in PoK. The tremors were also felt in several Pakistani cities, including Peshawar, Rawalpindi, Lahore and Multan.

column2: Messi votes for Ronaldo at Best FIFA awards, Ronaldo snubs Barça forward
column3: Argentina captain and Barcelona forward Lionel Messi voted for Juventus forward and Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo as his second choice for Best FIFA Men's Player award, FIFA has revealed. Messi, who eventually won the award, chose Sadio Mané and Frenkie de Jong as his first and third choice respectively. Meanwhile, Ronaldo did not vote for Messi for any preference.

column2: Student who accused Chinmayanand of rape not arrested: Her lawyer
column3: The Uttar Pradesh law student who accused BJP leader Swami Chinmayanand of rape was not arrested and the reports claiming this are wrong, said her lawyer Anup Trivedi. He further said that they had filed a plea for anticipatory bail in the case of extortion and blackmail filed by Chinmayanand. The court will hear the matter on Thursday, said Trivedi.

column2: Delhi to be 1st state to give legal protection to vendors: Kejriwal
column3: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said that the national capital will soon become the "first state" to implement the Street Vending Act, 2014, to provide legal protection to street vendors and hawkers. "Because vendors don't have legal status, whatever they do is termed illegal. That's why they are harassed by every department...People extort money from them," Kejriwal said.

column2: PM Modi brought India together, he's the Father of India: Trump
column3: PM Narendra Modi and US President Donald Trump held a bilateral meeting on the sidelines of United Nations General Assembly on Tuesday, where Trump said, "Modi brought India together like a father would bring it together." "And maybe he's the Father of India...we'll call him the Father of India," he added. "I remember India before was very torn," he said.

column2: ED books Sharad Pawar, nephew Ajit in Maharashtra bank scam case
column3: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday registered a money laundering case against Nationalist Congress Party chief Sharad Pawar, his nephew Ajit Pawar and over 70 others in connection with the Maharashtra State Co-operative Bank (MSCB) scam case. The case is based on a Mumbai Police FIR which had named Ajit Pawar and 70 former functionaries of the co-operative bank.

column2: Trump tweets 'hope India-Pak resolve Kashmir issue', deletes it later
column3: US President Donald Trump deleted a tweet where he expressed hope that India and Pakistan will resolve the issue of Kashmir "quickly". Following his meeting with Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Monday, Trump again offered to mediate between India and Pakistan on Kashmir issue if both the countries agreed to it. India has maintained that Kashmir is a bilateral issue.

column2: The future belongs to nations who respect neighbours: Trump at UNGA
column3: Addressing the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA), US President Donald Trump said, "The future belongs to sovereign and independent nations, who protect their citizens, respect their neighbours and honour the differences that make each country special and unique." "If you want democracy, hold on to your sovereignty...If you want peace, love your nation," Trump said urging the "free world".

column2: It has been 50 days of horror for the people of J&K: Cong
column3: Congress on Tuesday said it has been "50 days since lockdown in Kashmir" and that it's "not normal and fine". "It has been...50 days of state-sponsored oppression. 50 days of unlawful arrests. 50 days of horror for the people of Jammu & Kashmir," Congress tweeted. The government has said that restrictions in most parts of J&K have been lifted.

column2: Need most of him as batsman: Selector on Bairstow's Test axing
column3: After wicketkeeper-batsman Jonny Bairstow got dropped from England's Test squad for the New Zealand series, team's selector Ed Smith said, "There's a real opportunity for him to reset...[We need] most out of him as a batsman." Smith added that Bairstow was picked as an outstanding young batsman in 2012. The 29-year-old aggregated 214 runs in 10 innings of Ashes 2019.

column2: Pant doesn't know right method of scoring runs at no. 4: Laxman
column3: Ex-India batsman VVS Laxman has said wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant's aggressive game isn't working for him at number four position. "Pant should bat at number 5...6, where you've...licence to...express yourself...at the moment he doesn't know the right method of scoring runs at number 4," Laxman added. Laxman further said he feels Hardik Pandya and Shreyas Iyer are better for fourth spot.

column2: Karthik scores 52* as TN beat Raj by 6 wkts in Vijay Hazare Trophy
column3: Chasing a 262-run target, Tamil Nadu captain Dinesh Karthik remained unbeaten on 52 off 52 balls as Tamil Nadu handed a six-wicket defeat to Rajasthan in Vijay Hazare Trophy on Tuesday. Tamil Nadu were also helped by Abhinav Mukund, who scored 75 runs in the match. Spinner Rahul Chahar scored 48 runs for Rajasthan.

column2: Federal prosecutors conduct criminal probe into JUUL: Reports
column3: Federal prosecutors in the US have reportedly launched a criminal investigation into e-cigarette maker JUUL Labs. The FDA and attorney generals are already investigating the company's marketing practices and whether they purposefully sought to target minors. JUUL has faced several legal challenges in recent months following hundreds of illnesses linked to e-cigarette use, including deaths.

column2: Fundbox raises $176 million from General Catalyst, others
column3: US-based fintech startup Fundbox has raised $176 million equity financing in a Series C funding round from investors including Allianz SE and General Catalyst. Its total funding to date is around $433.5 million. The new round reportedly valued Fundbox at between $500 million and $1 billion. It plans to ultimately transform B2B payments by creating a Visa-like payments network.

column2: Singapore startup Honestbee owes its ex-employees $1 mn: CEO
column3: Singapore-based grocery delivery startup Honestbee owes 217 former employees nearly $1 million in unpaid salaries, according to an affidavit by CEO Ong Lay Ann. He said Honestbee, which had filed for a six-month debt moratorium, presently has 190 employees, from 523 full-time and 77 part-time workers in January. Honestbee said it will pay the former employees after the current employees.

column2: 83-year-old in Punjab completes master's degree in English
column3: Sohan Singh Gill, aged 83, completed his master's degree in English from a university in Punjab's Jalandhar recently. Gill said he was advised by his vice-principal to pursue MA but could not do it after getting married in 1958 and moving to Kenya. "I decided to prepare for MA in English remembering my vice-principal's advice," he said.

column2: Over 2 lakh streetlights to be installed across Delhi: CM
column3: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said 2.1 lakh street lights will be installed across the city to light up dark areas. "This is the first plan in the world in which a tender of about 30% of the current street light capacity is being launched," he added. Delhi's three private discoms will install the street lights, Kejriwal further said.

column2: No nation should subsidise 'Iran's bloodlust': Trump at UNGA
column3: US President Donald Trump, while speaking at the United Nations General Assembly on Tuesday, said that no responsible country should subsidise "Iran's bloodlust" as they all have duty to act. "As long as Iran's menacing behaviour continues, sanctions will not be lifted. They will be tightened," Trump said. Iranian ruling class has abandoned its people for personal gain, Trump added.

column2: Three maids detained in Singapore for allegedly funding IS
column3: Three Indonesian maids were detained by Singaporean authorities for allegedly donating funds to Islamic State (IS). The trio became supporters of IS after viewing online material last year, including videos of bomb attacks and beheadings, the interior ministry said. They are being held under the Internal Security Act, which reportedly allows for detention without trial for up to two years.

column2: North Korea is 'full of untapped potential': US Prez Trump
column3: North Korea is full of untapped potential but it must denuclearise first to realise that potential, US President Donald Trump said on Tuesday while addressing the United Nations General Assembly. "America knows while anyone can make war, the only the most courageous can choose peace for the same reason we have pursued bold diplomacy on the Korean Peninsula," he added.

column2: US most powerful, hope we don't have to use this power: Trump
column3: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday said the US is the most powerful nation in the world and hopefully it will never have to use this power. Trump added that since he was elected as the US President, the country has spent over $2.5 trillion on completely rebuilding its "great military". He was speaking at the United Nations General Assembly.

column2: MoS for Power seeks basic customs duty on solar panel imports
column3: Union Minister of State for Power RK Singh has asked the Finance Ministry to impose basic customs duty on imported solar cells and panels to boost domestic manufacturing. Under the WTO Information Technology Agreement, also signed by India, solar photovoltaic cells are exempt from basic customs duty. Singh, however, favoured nil duty on imported raw materials for manufacturing solar panels.

column2: Biocon subsidiary acquires Pfizer's research facility
column3: Biocon said its subsidiary, Biocon Biologics, has acquired a Chennai-based biological research facility from Pfizer Healthcare for an undisclosed amount. Biocon CEO Christiane Hamacher said the acquisition will help it accelerate its development of biosimilars from lab to pilot scale. The R&D facility, spread across 60,000 square feet, is expected to be operational in a few months.

column2: Big B to get Dadasaheb Phalke Award, India's highest award in cinema
column3: Amitabh Bachchan has been unanimously selected for the Dadasaheb Phalke Award, Information & Broadcasting Minister Prakash Javadekar announced. "The entire country and international community is happy," Javadekar tweeted. Dadasaheb Phalke Award is the highest and most acclaimed award in Indian cinema conferred upon a veteran luminary in appreciation of his or her lifetime cinematic achievement.

column2: 13th-century painting worth up to €6mn found in French woman's kitchen
column3: A 13th-century Renaissance painting by Cimabue, which is estimated to be worth up to €6 million, has been discovered in a French woman's kitchen in a town near Paris. The woman thought that the painting was an old religious icon when she took it to be valued. She had hung the painting above a hotplate in her kitchen.

column2: Hangovers are an 'illness', rules German court
column3: A German court has ruled that hangovers are an "illness", in a case against a firm making anti-hangover drinks. The court defined illness as "even small or temporary disruptions to the normal state or normal activity of the body". The ruling came after plaintiffs claimed that the company, which offered anti-hangover "shots" and powders, was making illegal health claims.

column2: Taapsee responds to criticism on her & Bhumi's casting in Saand Ki Aankh
column3: Actress Taapsee Pannu has responded after 'Saand Ki Aankh' makers were criticised for casting her and Bhumi Pednekar as 60-year-old sharpshooters. She said, "Did we question when Aamir Khan played a college kid in 3 Idiots?" Earlier, 60-year-old actress Neena Gupta also tweeted on the film's casting and wrote, "At least cast us for roles that suit our age."

column2: Who did Sunil Chhetri, India coach vote for as The Best Men's footballer?
column3: The voting process for The Best FIFA Men's Player award involved every FIFA member nation's senior team captain, head coach and a journalist select their top three preferences. Captain Sunil Chhetri voted for Virgil van Dijk as top preference followed by Lionel Messi and Mohamed Salah. India coach Igor Stimac chose Cristiano Ronaldo followed by van Dijk and Eden Hazard.

column2: Thinking to replace smartphone with basic one: SC judge on tech drawbacks
column3: Leading a Supreme Court bench on drawbacks of technological advances, Justice Deepak Gupta on Tuesday said, "I was thinking of giving up my smartphone and going back to basic phone." Talking about dark web, Justice Gupta said, "I realised one can purchase AK-47 within half an hour." The SC also pressed on urgent need for guidelines to regulate social media.

column2: PM violated foreign policy by backing Trump's candidature: Gehlot
column3: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that PM Narendra Modi violated India's foreign policy by "promoting" US President Donald Trump's candidature for next term. "India has always been non-aligned as envisioned by the first PM Jawaharlal Nehru," said Gehlot. "If the opposition party comes to power in the USA, then it will have a negative impact on India-USA relations," added Gehlot.

column2: UP court rejects Swami Chinmayanand's bail in sexual abuse case
column3: A court in Uttar Pradesh has rejected the bail application of BJP leader Swami Chinmayanand, who was arrested in a sexual abuse case following rape allegations by a law student. Shahjahanpur chief judicial magistrate rejected the bail application of Chinmayanand on Monday, saying it should be moved in the sessions court, Chinmayanand's counsel said on Tuesday.

column2: CA students protest against ICAI alleging errors in paper evaluation
column3: Several students of the ICAI (Institute of Chartered Accountants of India) and candidates who appeared for ICAI exams stage protest against the ICAI alleging error in evaluation of papers. Over 200 students of ICAI staged a protest outside its central Delhi office on Monday. They alleged paper evaluators deducted marks for no reason and correct answers were marked as wrong.

column2: Completely baseless: Pak denies Balakot terror camp reactivated
column3: Pakistan's Foreign Office spokesperson Mohammad Faisal has denied that the Balakot terror camp has been reactivated, calling it "completely baseless". Indian Army Chief General Bipin Rawat had said that Pakistan had reactivated the Jaish-e-Mohammed terror camp bombed by the Indian Air Force in February and that some 500 terrorists were waiting to infiltrate into India.

column2: I deserve to win Nobel prize, but they don't give it fairly: Trump
column3: US President Donald Trump has said that he deserves to win a Nobel prize, but claimed that the award is not given out fairly. "They gave one to (former US President Barack) Obama immediately upon his ascent to the Presidency and he had no idea why he got it...That was the only thing I agreed with him on," Trump added.

column2: UK Parliament to resume tomorrow after SC says suspension unlawful
column3: John Bercow, the Speaker of the UK's House of Commons, has announced that the Parliament will resume following the Supreme Court's ruling that its suspension by Prime Minister Boris Johnson was unlawful. The Supreme Court said Johnson had not given any reason, "let alone a good reason", for suspending the Parliament for five weeks.

column2: Trump's surprise appearance at Climate Summit a step forward: UN chief
column3: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres described US President Donald Trump's surprise appearance at the UN Climate Action Summit 2019 as a "step forward". Trump spent about 15 minutes at the summit. He listened to remarks by Prime Minister Narendra Modi and German Chancellor Angela Merkel before departing to speak at the Global Call to Protect Religious Freedom event.

column2: Saif Ali Khan is the best-dressed man in Bollywood: Arjun
column3: Actor Arjun Kapoor has said that Saif Ali Khan is the best-dressed man in Bollywood and he carries his clothes really well. "He can wear a kurta and a bandana and still make it look good," he added. When asked about his fashion choice on an ordinary day, Arjun said, "I'm a chappal, jeans and t-shirt kind of guy."

column2: Social media giants' anti-extremism body becomes independent
column3: The Global Internet Forum to Counter Terrorism (GIFCT), formed by social media giants Facebook, Microsoft, Twitter and YouTube, announced it will become an independent organisation led by an Executive Director. GIFCT was formed in 2017 to combat extremism on the member platforms. It will have an industry-led board, and an Independent Advisory Committee including members from various governments.

column2: Hacker talks to US couple via camera, plays vulgar music: Reports
column3: A hacker broke into a US couple's Google Nest system and started talking to them through the camera and played vulgar music, reports said. The couple said that the hacker also constantly increased the temperature on the thermostat. The issues continued even after changing the passwords and eventually stopped after they contacted their internet carrier and changed their network ID.

column2: Amazon's wireless earbuds to offer fitness tracking: Report
column3: Amazon is reportedly developing its Alexa-powered wireless earbuds to also function as fitness trackers. The earbuds, codenamed 'Puget', may come with a built-in accelerometer and monitor things like distance covered, calories burned and the pace of running, the CNBC reported. The wireless earbuds are expected to cost below $100 in the US, lower than Apple's AirPods which cost $159.

column2: PayPal Australia ordered audit by financial crime watchdog
column3: Australia's financial regulator on Tuesday ordered an audit of Paypal over its compliance with local anti-money laundering and counter-terrorism financing laws. AUSTRAC also ordered investigations into Paypal over ongoing concerns that it is being used by child exploitation rings in Asia. It directed the auditor to look at the fund transfers and record-keeping, and report back within 120 days.

column2: 3 civilians killed as Naxals blow up oil tanker in Chhattisgarh
column3: Three civilians were killed in Chhattisgarh's Kanker when Naxals blew up an oil tanker with an improvised explosive device (IED) on Tuesday, police said. As per a report, the blast took place when the tanker was on its way to provide fuel to construction vehicles in Dalli Rajhara-Rowghat railway project work. A search operation has been launched by the police.

column2: Attack on woman journalist very unfortunate: Arvind Kejriwal
column3: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said the attack on journalist Joymala Bagchi was "very unfortunate and saddening". "All of us together need to work to reduce the crime incidents in Delhi," Kejriwal said. Bagchi suffered a broken jaw and received injuries on her face and hand after bike-borne phone snatchers dragged her out of a moving autorickshaw on Sunday.

column2: Over 20,000 in HK apply for dialogue session with leader Lam
column3: Hong Kong Chief Executive Carrie Lam on Tuesday said that more than 20,000 people have applied to take part in a dialogue session with her. "We have promised that participants from... different political stands could express their opinions freely, even vent their anger," she said. "I hope the community dialogue could be held in a peaceful... environment," she added

column2: Trump put hold to Ukraine aid before call with Zelenskyy: Report
column3: US President Donald Trump reportedly told his acting chief of staff to withhold about $400-million military aid for Ukraine a week before the phone call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Trump reportedly asked Zelenskyy to probe ex-US Vice President Joe Biden's son. The decision to withhold aid was based on corruption concerns in Ukraine, the report quoting an official said.

column2: Honda to stop sale of diesel cars in Europe by 2021
column3: Honda Motor said on Monday it will stop selling diesel vehicles in Europe by 2021 in favour of models with electric propulsion systems. The move comes as the Japanese automaker moves to electrify all of its European cars by 2025 and follow emissions regulations. In February, Honda said it would shut its only British plant, leading to 3,500 job cuts.

column2: Tremors felt in Delhi, North India after 6.1-magnitude earthquake in Pak
column3: An earthquake of magnitude 6.1 at Richter scale struck 173 km North-West of Lahore, Pakistan on Tuesday evening, as per the European-Mediterranean Seismological Centre (EMSC). Tremors were felt across Delhi NCR, Punjab, Jammu and Kashmir and other north Indian states. The tremors were felt at around 4:35 PM in India.

column2: OnePlus CEO Pete Lau reveals packaging box for OnePlus 7T series
column3: OnePlus CEO Pete Lau tweeted an image revealing packaging of the new retail box of the upcoming OnePlus 7T with the caption, "Red and bold, a return to the OnePlus One's visual design." He also shared a picture of the OnePlus TV, indicating that it might come in two different sizes featuring a bezel-less display.

column2: Volkswagen CEO, Chairman charged with market manipulation in Germany
column3: German prosecutors on Tuesday brought criminal charges of stock market manipulation against Volkswagen CEO Herbert Diess, Chairman Hans Dieter Pötsch and former CEO Martin Winterkorn in relation to an emissions cheating scandal. They intentionally failed to inform investors in time about financial impact of the scandal, the prosecutors' office said. Diess will continue as CEO despite the charges.

column2: UK couple grows trees in the shape of furniture for sustainability
column3: UK couple Gavin and Alice Munro harvest trees which they train to grow into chairs. "Instead of force-growing a tree for 50 years and then cutting it down...the idea is to grow the tree into the shape that you want directly," said Gavin. The average chair takes four to eight years to grow, and another year to dry out.

column2: Pic of living composer used to mourn late musician at Emmy Awards
column3: The Emmy Awards' In Memoriam segment showed the picture of composer Leonard Slatkin, who is alive, instead of late musician André Previn. "The producers for the 71st Emmy Awards, the Television Academy and FOX sincerely apologise for this error," the Television Academy stated. Previn, who won four Oscars and ten Grammys, passed away in February at the age of 89.

column2: At least cast us for roles that suit our age: Neena on 'Saand Ki Aankh'
column3: Actress Neena Gupta has replied after a Twitter user wrote that Shabana Azmi, Jaya Bachchan or Neena should've been cast in 'Saand Ki Aankh' instead of Taapsee Pannu and Bhumi Pednekar. "I was just thinking about this. At least cast us for the roles that suit our age," Neena replied. Taapsee and Bhumi have portrayed 60-year-old sharpshooters in the film.

column2: Bumrah sustains stress fracture, ruled out of Test series vs South Africa
column3: Team India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah has been ruled out of the upcoming home Test series against South Africa after sustaining a minor stress fracture in his lower back. The 25-year-old fast bowler has been replaced by Umesh Yadav in the squad. Notably, Bumrah, who has played 12 Test matches, is yet to play a Test match on home soil.

column2: Who won what at The Best FIFA Football Awards 2019?
column3: Barcelona forward Lionel Messi and 2019 FIFA Women's World Cup-winning US co-captain Megan Rapinoe were named The Best FIFA Men's and Women's Player, respectively. Liverpool manager Jürgen Klopp and former US women's football team coach Jill Ellis won The Best Men's and Women's Coach award, respectively. Hungarian footballer Daniel Zsori won the Puskás Award for his overhead kick goal.

column2: Train driver spots 14-inch gap on tracks, applies emergency brakes
column3: The driver of Islampur-Delhi Magadh Express applied emergency brakes and informed the control room after spotting a 14-inch fracture in the tracks in Uttar Pradesh on Tuesday. The fracture on the tracks was temporarily fixed and the speed limit of 20 km/hr was fixed for the stretch. Due to this, several trains were stranded at different station.

column2: Police can't attach immovable properties during criminal probe: SC
column3: The Supreme Court on Tuesday ruled that police cannot attach immovable properties during the investigation of a criminal case. The court was hearing an appeal filed by the Maharashtra government against a similar order issued by a full bench of the Bombay High Court in 2010. The apex court interpreted Section 102 of the Criminal Procedure Code in the case.

column2: You know President Trump: Pakistan PM on failed Taliban talks
column3: Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan on Monday appeared to hold US President Donald Trump responsible for the failed US-Taliban peace talks. Trump cancelled talks with the Taliban earlier this month over the militant group's attack on US soldiers in Afghanistan. "The deal was about to be signed and you know President Trump...He should have discussed it with us," Khan added.

column2: Where do you find reporters like this: Trump mocks Pak journalist
column3: During a joint media interaction with Pakistan PM Imran Khan, US President Donald Trump mocked a Pakistani journalist who asked a question on Kashmir. "Where do you find reporters like this? These guys are fantastic." Trump told Khan. Trump met Khan on Monday on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly session in New York.

column2: Marilyn Monroe's images from last photo session to be auctioned
column3: Actress Marilyn Monroe's two images, 'Marilyn (Overhead)' and 'Marilyn (Hugging Pillow)', from her last photo session before her death in 1962 are going to be auctioned on October 29. Along with Monroe's pictures, photographer Douglas Kirkland's camera will also be auctioned. "It was extremely intimate. It was just myself, the camera and Marilyn," Kirkland said ahead of the auction.

column2: I pray for your good health: PM to Rishi after he praises US event
column3: After actor Rishi Kapoor praised PM Narendra Modi's 'Howdy, Modi' event in the US, PM Modi tweeted, "Rishi Ji, thanks for your enthusiastic encouragement." "We just missed each other by a few days since you recently left for India from the USA. I pray for your good health. Looking forward to greater participation of yours on social media," he added.

column2: I'd definitely work with her: Himansh on collaborating with ex-Neha
column3: On being asked if he'll collaborate with his ex-girlfriend Neha Kakkar in future, Himansh Kohli said, "If good offers come our way, as a professional, I'd definitely work with her." Talking about his breakup with her, he said, "Whatever happened has happened. I can't change it now." "It's been a year now...I never felt like talking about it," he added.

column2: 40s are the best years for women: Reese Witherspoon
column3: Actress Reese Witherspoon said that she believes 40s are the best years for women. "You've a much clearer idea of who you're...know exactly what you want," she added. "Now, I can play women who have lived more....not simply because I'm in my 40s but because I've gone through that kind of evolution myself," she further said.

column2: Greta Thunberg, you're an inspiration: Rohit Sharma
column3: Indian opener Rohit Sharma praised 16-year-old Greta Thunberg and called her an inspiration in his tweet. "Leaving the saving of our planet to our children is utterly unfair. @GretaThunberg, you're an inspiration. There are no excuses now. We owe the future generations a safe planet. The time for change is now," Sharma's tweet read.

column2: Madras HC asks WhatsApp if it complies with IT Act: Report
column3: Hearing a case on linking social media to one's identity proof, the Madras High Court reportedly asked WhatsApp to confirm whether it complies with the Information Technology Act, 2000. This follows Tamil Nadu accusing WhatsApp of not complying with police probes, despite being bound to the Act's provisions. WhatsApp has been resisting the government's stance on absolute traceability of messages.

column2: I am not a leader of only Jats, but of all people: BS Hooda
column3: Stating that no political party can survive if it takes along only one caste, Haryana Congress leader BS Hooda stated, "I am not a leader of Jats only but of all the people." He added, "We, in the Congress, do not exploit castes to get votes." He also said there is no divide between Jats and non-Jats in Haryana.

column2: Metaform Ventures invests $2 mn in India for tobacco research
column3: Silicon Valley-based investment fund Metaform Ventures is investing $2 million in its India Center of Excellence for research on tobacco cessation related to smokeless tobacco products like 'gutka'. It aims to provide empirical data and evidence to encourage new harm reduction tools and cessation techniques to reduce tobacco usage in India. The fund is led by angel investor Nilesh Jain.

column2: Hyundai, Aptiv to set up $4 billion self-driving car venture
column3: South Korean carmaker Hyundai is setting up a joint venture with Dublin-based global auto parts company Aptiv to develop self-driving vehicle technologies. Hyundai Motor Group affiliates will collectively invest $2 billion in the venture, valuing it at $4 billion. Aptiv, which will own 50% of the joint venture, will contribute its autonomous driving technology, IP and about 700 employees.

column2: Nearly 20% students experience Imposter Syndrome: Study
column3: A study, conducted on a group of students, found that roughly 20% of the students suffer from the Imposter Syndrome. The syndrome is a psychological phenomenon that manifests when people feel like 'frauds' even if they are capable and well-qualified. The study found that if students "reached in" to other students within their major they felt worse.

column2: Determined to stay in India & clear name: Vadra to Delhi HC
column3: Robert Vadra told the Delhi High Court that he was determined to stay in India and clear his name in a money laundering case being investigated by the Enforcement Directorate (ED). He opposed the ED's plea challenging his anticipatory bail in the case. Vadra added that there was no single instance of non-cooperation with the investigation.

column2: Joining US war on terror post 9/11 one of our biggest blunders: Pak PM
column3: After his meeting with US President Donald Trump, Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan called his country joining the US in its war on terrorism in the aftermath of the 9/11 attacks "one of the biggest blunders". "Seventy thousand Pakistanis died in this. We were blamed for the US not winning in Afghanistan," Khan said during an interview.

column2: UK PM Boris Johnson's suspension of Parliament was unlawful: UK SC
column3: The UK's Supreme Court ruled on Tuesday that Prime Minister Boris Johnson's suspension of the Parliament was unlawful. British Opposition lawmakers had claimed that by suspending the Parliament, Johnson sought to reduce the time to debate on Brexit. Johnson had suspended the Parliament from mid-September until October 14.

column2: They're dhan pashu: UP official on Sonakshi not knowing Ramayana answer
column3: Uttar Pradesh official Sunil Bharala, while speaking about actress Sonakshi Sinha not knowing the answer to a question on Ramayana in 'Kaun Banega Crorepati', said, "They are like 'dhan pashu'." "In modern times, these people are only after money...They have no knowledge of history and gods," he added. Bharala further said "nothing can be sadder than this."

column2: Amy Jackson shares first picture of newborn son Andreas
column3: Amy Jackson has shared the first picture revealing the face of her baby boy, who was born on Monday. She shared a Boomerang video in her Instagram story with the caption, "Hi world," and another picture which showed the baby in the arms of a woman, captioned, "Cuddle from Aunty Lils." This is Amy's first child with fiancé George Panayiotou.

column2: Apple confirms will make new Mac Pro in US, not China
column3: Apple has confirmed that it will be manufacturing its new Mac Pro in Texas, US. Apple said it was able to continue making the computer in the US due to a federal tariff exclusion it received for several key parts of the device. Past reports claimed that Apple could move the computer's production to China amid the ongoing trade war.

column2: SC tells govt to frame guidelines to prevent social media misuse
column3: The Supreme Court on Tuesday said that misuse of social media has become "dangerous" and asked the Centre to file an affidavit, within three weeks, on framing of guidelines to prevent the misuse. The court also asked the Centre to strike a balance between the privacy of individuals and sovereignty of the state in the regulations being drafted.

column2: I'm told it's USSR: Tharoor after posting Nehru-Indira 'US visit' pic
column3: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor posted a picture of Former PMs Jawaharlal Nehru and Indira Gandhi, claiming it was from their visit to US in 1954. He stated that a huge crowd gathered for them without "any special PR campaign" or "hyped-up media publicity". Later, Tharoor tweeted, "I'm told this picture...probably is from a visit to the USSR [not US]".

column2: Indonesian sky turns blood-red due to forest fires
column3: Locals from Indonesia's Jambi province took to Twitter to share photos and videos of blood-red coloured skies due to forest fires. Increase in air pollutants filtered some of Sun's wavelengths, Indonesia's meteorology agency said. Indonesia recently arrested 185 people suspected of starting the fires responsible for destroying over 3.28 lakh hectares of nationwide land from January-August 2019.

column2: Father pushes 12-yr-old daughter into sex trade in Kerala, 3 held
column3: A 12-year-old girl of Class 7 on Saturday revealed to Childline officials in Kerala that her father pushed her into sex trade two years ago. An official said, "The instances seem to be numerous and the child seemed to have no count over how many times she was abused." The police has arrested three men including the girl's father.

column2: Why Thomas Cook bosses got large sums: UK PM on tour firm's collapse
column3: After the collapse of Thomas Cook left hundreds of thousands of passengers stranded, UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson questioned whether bosses at the tour firm should have paid themselves "large sums". Johnson also suggested law changes that would force tour operators to properly insure themselves against a business disaster. He also told why ministers refused to bail out Thomas Cook.

column2: US soldier held for allegedly discussing plans to bomb news network
column3: A 24-year-old US Army soldier has been arrested for allegedly discussing plans to bomb a news network. Jarrett William Smith, a private first class infantry soldier, suggested targeting Democratic presidential candidate Beto O'Rourke and also allegedly shared bomb-making instructions online. He was arrested after discussing his plans with an undercover FBI agent.

column2: Woman with 2 reproductive systems has given birth to 4 kids
column3: Lauren Cotter, who was told by doctors that she might never be a mother after being born with two reproductive systems, has given birth to a total of four kids. The condition, which according to WHO affects one in 3,000 women, is called uterus didelphys and it occurs when the uterus fails to fuse properly during development in the womb.

column2: I think Julian Assange has been psychologically tortured: Pamela
column3: Actress Pamela Anderson on a show said that she thinks WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange has been psychologically tortured. "I went to visit him in prison. That's not somewhere you want to leave a dear friend," she added. Assange was arrested after he was charged for aiding Chelsea Manning in cracking a password to a classified US government computer in 2010.

column2: Welcome accorded to PM at 'Howdy, Modi' historic: Anupam Kher
column3: Actor Anupam Kher on Tuesday said PM Narendra Modi's welcome at the 'Howdy, Modi' event was "historic" and "it could never have been imagined". "It was not just a 50,000 crowd waiting for him, it was a 50,000 crowd vibrating to the beats of India," he added. The effect of the event was felt in Pakistan too, Kher further said.

column2: Shiv Sena-BJP seat sharing tougher than India-Pak partition: Raut
column3: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said the task of distributing seats between his party and BJP in the upcoming Maharashtra elections is a very tough task. "Maharashtra is so huge. This division of 288 seats is more difficult than the India-Pakistan partition," he said. The decision on seat-sharing will be conveyed to the media, Raut added.

column2: Rare kaon decay could lead to evidence of new physics model
column3: A CERN experiment demonstrates a new technique which captures and measures the ultra-rare decay of a subatomic particle called a kaon. The results of the experiment show that a precise measurement of the decay process could point towards a new physics model beyond the Standard Model. The Standard Model fails to explain topics like dark matter and the matter-antimatter imbalance.

column2: Cats, like children and dogs, are attached to caregivers: Study
column3: A new study has found that cats, like children and dogs, have attachments to their caregivers. "Our study indicates that when cats live in a state of dependency with a human, that attachment behaviour is flexible and the majority of cats use humans as a source of comfort," said study lead author Kristyn Vitale.

column2: Trade talks with China to resume in two weeks: US official
column3: US Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin on Monday said the country will resume trade talks with China in two weeks in Washington. Mnuchin and US Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer would meet with China's Vice Premier Liu He for the talks. He added the two countries had made some progress in easing their trade tensions in the deputy-level meetings held last week.

column2: 16-yr-old climate activist stares at Trump at UN; video goes viral
column3: A video showing 16-year-old climate activist Greta Thunberg staring at US President Donald Trump at the UN has gone viral. Trump has in the past called climate change a "hoax". He had pulled the US out of the Paris climate deal in June 2017. Thunberg had condemned world leaders during her speech at the UN Climate Action Summit 2019.

column2: Google doesn't need to apply 'right to be forgotten' worldwide: EU court
column3: Google on Tuesday won a landmark case where Europe's top court ruled Google doesn't have to apply the 'right to be forgotten' globally. The 'right to be forgotten' refers to the removal of search result listings to pages containing damaging or false information about a person. Google will now only need to remove such links from search results in Europe.

column2: It was awkward for Boney sir: Urvashi on reports of 'inappropriate touch'
column3: Actress Urvashi Rautela, while speaking about reports which had alleged that producer Boney Kapoor touched her inappropriately in a video, said, "It was nothing like that." "My phone was ringing non-stop for...seven days because it became such a big thing," she added. Urvashi further said she spoke to Boney after the reports surfaced and added it was "awkward" for him.

column2: India's rivers endangered: DiCaprio supports Cauvery Calling initiative
column3: Hollywood actor Leonardo DiCaprio has shared a Facebook post to lend his support to 'Cauvery Calling' initiative. "India's rivers are severely endangered with many of its smaller rivers vanishing. Join Sadhguru and the Isha Foundation in their fight to preserve the Cauvery river," he wrote. The initiative aims to plant 242 crore trees across Cauvery basin to revitalise Cauvery river.

column2: Huawei threatens to stop India investment if denied 5G approvals
column3: World's largest telecoms equipment maker Huawei has threatened to stop India investments if it's denied approvals for its 5G equipment. "I guess [Indian government officials are] taking time to address their concerns. But you can't always think, think and think, but make no decision," Huawei India CEO said. Chinese government officials had earlier also threatened reverse sanctions on Indian firms.

column2: Google launches subscription service with over 350 apps, games
column3: Google has unveiled its subscription service Play Pass that gives Android users access to more than 350 apps and games without ads and in-app purchases. The service will be available to US users this week, Google said. Play Pass has a 10-day free trial and will be priced at $1.99 per month for a year for a limited time.

column2: Snap helping US anti-trust agency probe Facebook: Report
column3: Several Facebook competitors including Snapchat's parent firm Snap are reportedly helping US anti-trust agency FTC to probe Facebook's business practices. Snap has reportedly created a dossier under "Project Voldemort", allegedly containing Facebook secrets. The files in 'Project Voldemort' chronicled Facebook's moves that threatened to undermine Snap's business, The Wall Street Journal reported.

column2: Google to restart Assistant voice clip review, now with consent
column3: Google has said that it will restart the human review of voice recordings accessed through its AI-based Assistant. However, the technology giant added that it will do so only after asking for consent from users. This comes months after a Google contractor leaked private conversations' clips, following which Google admitted it accessed 0.2% of all recordings for transcription.

column2: Reliance Jio-backed Haptik acquires e-commerce chatbot Buzzo.ai
column3: Mumbai-based AI chatbot startup Haptik has acquired AI recommendation chatbot Buzzo.ai reportedly for about $3-4 million. Mumbai-based Buzzo.ai was founded by Vivek Arya and Anand Ramachandran in 2016 and offers personalised recommendations to users. This comes months after Reliance Jio-backed Haptik acquihired Los Angeles-based conversational AI startup Convrg for an undisclosed amount.

column2: Indian among kids who petitioned in UN against 5 nations over climate
column3: India's Ridhima Pandey is among sixteen children, including Swedish activist Greta Thunberg, who filed a petition to UN over climate change against five nations, namely Argentina, Brazil, France, Germany and Turkey. "I want a better future...I want to save our future," Pandey said. In 2017, she filed a case against Indian government for failing to take action against climate change.

column2: Just wait till Modi-Trump talks: MEA after Trump's J&K mediation offer
column3: After US President Donald Trump again offered to mediate on Kashmir, External Affairs Ministry told the media, "You're aware of our position (on mediation)...Just hold on for [PM Narendra Modi-Trump talks on Tuesday]." Trump offered to mediate during his meeting with Pakistan PM Imran Khan and called himself "an extremely good arbitrator" on Monday.

column2: Girl raped on way to school; Principal bars her from attending classes
column3: A girl in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh was allegedly abducted and gangraped by two men while she was on her way to school last week, following which she was barred by her Principal from attending classes. After a probe was ordered in the case, the Principal said he only asked the girl to stay at home for a few days.

column2: European nations back US in blaming Iran for Saudi drone attack
column3: Britain, Germany and France backed the US and blamed Iran on Monday for a drone attack on Saudi oil facilities. The European nations also urged Iran to agree to new talks with world powers on its nuclear and missile programmes and regional security issues. Meanwhile, Iran said European partners have failed to fulfil their commitments under the 2015 nuclear pact.

column2: Trump calls 16-year-old climate activist 'happy young girl'
column3: US President Donald Trump has shared a video of 16-year-old climate activist Greta Thunberg speaking at the UN Climate Action Summit 2019. "She seems like a very happy young girl looking forward to a bright and wonderful future. So nice to see!" he tweeted. "We are in the beginning of a mass extinction," Thunberg said during her speech.

column2: I'm here as a woman of colour: Meghan Markle in South Africa
column3: Addressing a local community in South Africa, the Duchess of Sussex Meghan Markle spoke about her lineage. "I want you to know that for me, I'm here as a mother...as a woman, as a woman of colour, and as your sister," she said. Meghan and her husband Prince Harry are on their official Royal Tour of Southern Africa.

column2: Deepika Padukone to attend Paris Fashion Week for Dior
column3: Actress Deepika Padukone will attend Paris Fashion Week for luxury brand Dior. The fashion week, which started on September 23, will go on until October 1 and it will have designers showcase their latest collection for Spring/Summer 2020. Apart from Dior, brands like Chanel, Givenchy, Lacoste and Chloé will also showcase their Spring/Summer 2020 collection at the Paris Fashion Week.

column2: Female stars are criticised more than male actors: Richa
column3: Actress Richa Chadha has said that mainstream media and social media has been unfair towards the female actors and they get criticised more than their male counterparts. "I can say this from my observation of the way media... questions Priyanka Chopra Jonas, Swara Bhaskar, Sonam Kapoor... for their choices... Do they question the male stars enough as well," she added.

column2: NoBroker may raise up to $130M from Tiger Global, General Atlantic
column3: Bengaluru-based home-rental startup NoBroker is reportedly in talks to raise up to $130 million from Tiger Global Management and General Atlantic at a valuation of $400 million. NoBroker raised a $51-million Series C round in June led by General Atlantic. Founded in the year 2014, NoBroker eliminates brokers in residential rental transactions by connecting owners with tenants directly.

column2: Day isn't far when PoK will be part of India: Union Minister
column3: Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Development of North Eastern Region Jitendra Singh said that the day isn't far when Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) will become India's part. Talking about Kashmir, he added, "Abrogation of Article 370 will benefit the common man of J&K." He further said that some restrictions are there in J&K to "avoid disturbance by anti-social elements".

column2: Ban me if you've a problem: Salman to photographer at Bigg Boss 13 launch
column3: A video from Monday's Bigg Boss 13 launch event shows Salman Khan telling a photographer during an argument, "If you have a problem with me, ban me." The photographer reportedly tried to block Salman's way as the actor was trying to walk on to the stage. Salman then turned to the photographer and called him out for regularly being disruptive.

column2: Lionel Messi wins Best FIFA Men's Player award for the first time
column3: Barcelona and Argentina forward Lionel Messi has been named The Best FIFA Men's Player for the first time. The 32-year-old, who scored 36 goals and helped Barcelona win the La Liga 2018/19, beat two-time winner Juventus forward Cristiano Ronaldo and Liverpool defender Virgil van Dijk. Messi had also helped Barcelona reach Champions League semi-finals last season.

column2: Bank unions call off two-day strike on September 26, 27
column3: Bank unions on Monday called off the proposed two-day strike that was to take place from September 25 midnight to September 27. The decision was announced following a meeting of the bank unions with Finance Secretary Rajeev Kumar. The unions had proposed a strike over bank mergers, wage revision, introduction of a five-day week and reduction in cash transaction hours.

column2: Pakistan envoy to UN calls Boris Johnson Foreign Minister of UK
column3: Pakistan's envoy to the United Nations, Maleeha Lodhi mistakenly called UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson 'British Foreign Minister' in a tweet on Monday. "Prime Minister Imran Khan met British Foreign Minister Johnson this morning," Lodhi had written. She later apologised for the gaffe and shared a new post, writing, "Sorry typo in previous tweet."

column2: Team takes last 5 wickets for 3 runs to win one-day match by 1 run
column3: Chasing a 186-run target in Australian domestic one-day tournament, Tasmania lost their last five wickets for just three runs, handing Victoria a one-run victory. Tasmania were 172/4 after 38 overs and were chasing a bonus point for crossing the target within 40 overs. However, in space of 16 deliveries, Tasmania lost six wickets and were all out for 184.

column2: Facebook to buy neurotech startup to build brain-controlled device
column3: Facebook has announced its plans to buy New York-based startup CTRL-labs that specialises in allowing humans to control computers using their brains. The deal is reportedly worth $500 million-$1 billion. Facebook said the neurotechnology startup will help it develop its planned wristbands which will pick up signals, sent by neurons, from the hand muscles to execute a task intuitively.

column2: Cong's Deora calls PM's Houston address 'momentous 1st'; PM thanks him
column3: Congress' Milind Deora praised PM Narendra Modi's Houston address, saying, It "was a momentous first for India's soft power diplomacy." "My father Murlibhai was one of the early architects of deeper Indo-US ties," he added. Thanking him, PM Modi said, "You're absolutely correct...[about] my friend, late Murli Deora ji's commitment...He would've been really glad to see the strengthening of ties."

column2: Difficult for Muslim parties to question Ayodhya is Ram's birthplace: SC
column3: While hearing Sunni Waqf Board and other Muslim parties' arguments in Ayodhya land dispute case, Supreme Court judge DY Chandrachud said it'll be very difficult for the board and Muslim parties to question Hindu faith that Ayodhya was Lord Ram's birthplace. "Even a Muslim witness has said that Ayodhya is to Hindus what Mecca is to Muslims," he stated.

column2: India is one of our most important friends & partners: US Senator
column3: After PM Narendra Modi's 'Howdy, Modi' event, Republican Senator John Cornyn has said, "India is one of our (US') most important friends and partners." Cornyn also said the two countries share common values of freedom, democracy and free enterprise. "In you, India has a valuable friend," PM Modi told Cornyn in a tweet.

column2: You live in a very friendly neighbourhood: Trump to Pak PM on India
column3: After Pakistan PM Imran Khan told Donald Trump that he would like to talk about neighbouring countries Afghanistan, India and Iran, the US President told him, "You live in a very friendly neighbourhood." Talking about the Kashmir issue, Trump said, "I think I'd be an extremely good arbitrator. I've done it before, believe it or not, and I've never failed."

column2: If both India, Pak want, I'll mediate on Kashmir issue: Trump to Pak PM
column3: During his bilateral meeting with Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan in New York, US President Donald Trump said he is ready, willing and able to mediate again on Kashmir issue. "It's a complex issue. It has been going on for a long time. But if both want it, I will be ready to do it," Trump added.

column2: Election Commissioner Ashok Lavasa's wife gets I-T Dept notice
column3: The Income Tax Department has issued a notice to Election Commissioner Ashok Lavasa's wife Novel Singhal, regarding her income as an independent director of about 10 companies. Notably, Lavasa had dissented in several EC clean chits to PM Narendra Modi and BJP President Amit Shah over the alleged violations of Model Code of Conduct during the Lok Sabha election campaigns.

column2: Police launch probe after poster of 'nude party' in Goa surfaces
column3: Goa police began a probe on Monday after a poster announcing a 'nude party' in North Goa surfaced on social media. The poster claimed that "10-15 foreigners" and "more than 10 Indian girls" will take part in the party. "We will not allow any nude party to happen in the state," an official said.

column2: PM Modi's aggressive remark was well received by 59,000 people: Trump
column3: US President Donald Trump during his meeting with Pakistan PM Imran Khan said PM Narendra Modi made an aggressive statement during 'Howdy, Modi', adding that the remark was very well received by 59,000 people. Without naming Pakistan, PM Modi had criticised the country, saying that decision to revoke Article 370 has caused trouble to those who cannot handle their country.

column2: My biggest personality flaw was my fierce temper: Lata Mangeshkar
column3: Singer Lata Mangeshkar in an interview revealed that her biggest personality flaw was her "fierce temper" and she had "major temper" issues as a child also. "This changed as I grew older," she added. "Now I don't get angry... I sometimes wonder what happened to my fierce temper," she further said.

column2: Syrian refugees disguise as volleyball team to enter Greece
column3: Ten Syrian refugees have been detained while trying to enter Greece disguised as a Ukrainian volleyball team. Greek police said the men were arrested at Athens airport on Sunday after it was discovered that the passports they were carrying had been reported lost or stolen. A police statement said the refugees were trying to reach Zurich.

column2: Deepika Padukone's family office invests in Blu Smart
column3: Deepika Padukone's family office KA Enterprises has invested in electric taxi startup Blu Smart Mobility as part of an angel round of $3 million, the company said. Blu Smart had raised $2.2 million in seed funding led by JITO Angel Network in August. KA Enterprises has also invested in greek yoghurt brand Epigamia and spacetech startup Bellatrix Aerospace.

column2: Online lingerie startup Buttercups shuts down
column3: Bengaluru-based online lingerie brand Buttercups has decided to shut down operations, its Founder Arpita Ganesh announced on LinkedIn last week, months after the website got shuttered. Buttercups had raised about $1 million from investors like Anand Chandrasekaran, Kanwaljit Singh, Manoj Varghese, etc. Ganesh also announced the launch of her marketing and advertising firm The Voice Company.

column2: Mamata won't be able to stop NRC implementation: BJP's Dilip Ghosh
column3: West Bengal BJP President Dilip Ghosh said that state CM Mamata Banerjee wouldn't be able to stop National Register of Citizens (NRC) implementation. "Mamata Banerjee couldn't stop the abrogation of Article 370, demonetisation and the passage of triple talaq bill. In the same way, we are bringing NRC," he added. "They're creating fear among people regarding NRC," he further said.

column2: MBBS graduates will have to work in villages for 2 yrs: Adityanath
column3: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said that doctors graduating from government medical colleges in UP with an MBBS degree will have to work in villages for two years. "Those who have done MD and MS...have to work for one year in rural areas," he added. "No one will be allowed to influence the government for an internship," he further said.

column2: 40 killed at wedding party due to Afghan army raid next door
column3: At least 40 civilians attending a wedding party were killed by explosions and gunfire during a raid by US-backed Afghan forces on an adjacent Taliban hideout, Afghan officials said. "We were going to the bride's house... (when) suddenly the battle began," Mohammad Salim, a relative said. He added that Taliban and security forces ended up killing civilians during the raid.

column2: JSW Steel calls for 25% duty on all steel imports
column3: JSW Steel has called for a 25% safeguard duty on steel imports to protect domestic players. Its Joint MD Seshagiri Rao said steel imports from countries with whom India has a free trade agreement have risen in the present fiscal to 77%. He added most countries have taken safeguard measures against diversion of steel products amid China-US trade war.

column2: Days of playing just lead role are long gone: Actress Manasi Parekh
column3: Actress Manasi Parekh has said she's interested in playing good roles irrespective of their size as she feels that nowadays, movies are not just about the lead characters. "The days of lead roles, per se, I think they are long gone," she added. "It's all about making each character work," the actress, who featured in 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' said.

column2: Fixing can't be totally controlled, greed has no cure: Sunil Gavaskar
column3: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said that match-fixing can not be totally controlled as there will always be an odd person swayed by greed, which cannot be cured. "Greed is a thing which no amount of education, guidance, seminars with anti-corruption guys is going to help. Greed is something that is human," Gavaskar added.

column2: Took the hard decision of stopping our growth in 2015: OYO Founder
column3: OYO Rooms Founder and CEO Ritesh Agarwal in an interview to The Financial Express said, "In 2015, there was a time when we had a lot of complaints regarding our customer service." "We took the hard decision of stopping growth for four months, no matter what our shareholders said," he added. He called it one of the company's best decisions.

column2: Trump makes surprise visit at UN climate meet, listens to PM Modi's speech
column3: US President Donald Trump made a surprise appearance at the UN Climate Action Summit in New York after initially signalling that he would skip it. Trump spent about 15 minutes at the summit and listened to remarks by PM Narendra Modi and German Chancellor Angela Merkel before departing to address a meeting on the persecution of religious minorities.

column2: Time for talking is over; world needs to act now: PM at UN climate summit
column3: During his address at the UN Climate Action Summit in New York, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "The time for talking is over; the world needs to act now." "What we need is a global people’s movement to bring about behavioural change," he added. "India's going to spend approximately $50 billion on water conservation in next few years," he said.

column2: Ministries of Defence and Home Affairs to get all seized drones
column3: All drones seized from across the country by government authorities will be handed over to the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) and the Ministry of Defence (MoD).
