The drones will be distributed equally between the two ministries after a joint inspection. The decision comes after the drone attack on the world's biggest oil company Aramco in Saudi Arabia this month.

column2: No need to fear those who impose Hindi: Journalist Ravish Kumar
column3: Journalist Ravish Kumar on Sunday said that there was no need to fear those who impose Hindi. "The number of Hindi speakers appearing for UPSC exams have reduced, and in Uttar Pradesh, 10 lakh students failed Hindi," said Kumar. "A taxi driver in Bengaluru knows up to five languages and there is something we can learn from that," added Kumar.

column2: Journalist dragged out of moving auto by phone snatchers in Delhi
column3: A woman journalist suffered a broken jaw and received injuries on her face and hand after two bike-borne phone snatchers dragged her out of a moving autorickshaw in Delhi's Chittaranjan Park on Sunday. The miscreants took her phone and fled, while journalist Joymala Bagchi, who works with ANI, received stitches on her chin and had to be shifted to AIIMS.

column2: Man chased by Mumbai airport staffer for calling her 'item'; arrested
column3: A 26-year-old man was arrested by the Mumbai airport police last week after a woman airport staffer chased and nabbed him for calling her an 'item'. The incident took place when the staffer was on her way to the bus station after finishing her duty. The accused was reportedly in an inebriated state.

column2: 6 injured after helicopter crash-lands in Kedarnath during take-off
column3: As many as six people were injured after UTair India helicopter crash-landed during take-off at the Kedarnath helipad in Uttarakhand. The National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) said that the helicopter crash-landed due to technical fault after its rear part hit the ground. The helicopter was taking off for Phata.

column2: 61-yr-old claims technician forgot him inside MRI machine in Haryana
column3: A 61-year-old man has claimed that a technician at a civil hospital in Haryana's Panchkula forgot him inside an MRI machine while he was fastened by a belt on Sunday. The man said he broke the belt and left the machine after 30 minutes due to suffocation. The patient filed a police complaint and also informed the Haryana Health Minister.

column2: You failed us: 16-yr-old Greta tells world leaders at UN Climate Summit
column3: Sixteen-year-old climate activist Greta Thunberg, in an address at United Nations Climate Summit, said the world leaders have failed future generations by failing to act against climate crisis. "The eyes of all future generations are upon you," she added. "I shouldn’t be standing here. I should be back in school on the other side of the ocean," she further said.

column2: All world leaders talk about is money: 16-yr-old climate activist at UN
column3: Sixteen-year-old climate activist Greta Thunberg, during her speech at UN Climate Action Summit, said, "We're in the beginning of mass extinction. And all [world leaders] can talk about is money...How dare you!" "How dare you pretend...this can be solved with business-as-usual and...technical solutions," she added. "You've stolen my dreams and my childhood with your empty words," she further said.

column2: DoT asks phone makers to submit IMEIs by November: Reports
column3: The Telecom Department has reportedly asked Indian and global handset makers to submit the unique identification numbers of phones they manufacture in India by November, for security purposes. The 15-digit unique code, International Mobile Equipment Identity (IMEI), helps the government track lost phones and block stolen ones. A central portal to help users trace their phones was recently piloted.

column2: 'Temple Town' Kumbakonam in Tamil Nadu has 188 temples
column3: Tamil Nadu's Kumbakonam has nearly 188 temples and is widely known as the 'Temple Town'. In the 7th century, Kumbakonam was a capital of the Chola kings, who built the Adi Kumbeswarar Temple, believed to be one of the town's oldest temples. At its centre is the Mahamaham water tank, where the Mahamaham Hindu festival is celebrated every 12 years.

column2: AdvaRisk raises $700K in seed funding led by Sprout Venture
column3: Fraud prevention and investigation startup AdvaRisk has raised $700,000 in a seed funding round led by Sprout Venture Partners. SEA Fund and angel investors including ex-deputy MD of Axis Bank V Srinivasan and ex-MD of Multiples Alternate Asset Management Sharad Bhatia also participated in the round. AdvaRisk claims to have on-boarded a few major banks and NBFCs as clients.

column2: No need to ban petrol and diesel vehicles: Nitin Gadkari
column3: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday said there is no need to ban petrol and diesel vehicles in India as electric mobility has gained momentum on its own. "In the next two years, all buses would be electric," Gadkari added. Think-tank NITI Aayog had proposed to phase out most petrol and diesel-run three and two-wheelers by 2023 and 2025 respectively.

column2: Trump says he discussed Biden in call with Ukrainian Prez
column3: US President Donald Trump on Sunday said that he discussed ex-Vice President and Democratic presidential hopeful Joe Biden and his son Hunter in a call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Trump reportedly asked Zelenskyy to probe Biden's son Hunter. Trump's lawyer Rudy Giuliani alleged Biden tried to interfere in an investigation into a company whose board Hunter sat on.

column2: Legal steps for UK-flagged tanker release completed: Iran
column3: An Iranian government spokesman Ali Rabiei on Monday said that all legal steps had been completed for the release of the detained British-flagged tanker Stena Impero. Rabiei added that he did not know when the vessel would be released. The tanker was seized by Iran while it was sailing in the Strait of Hormuz on July 19.

column2: Video shows hundreds of blindfolded prisoners in China: Report
column3: A drone footage, reportedly from Xinjiang in China, showing hundreds of blindfolded and shackled prisoners guarded by police surfaced online last week. The UN said that at least 1 million Uighurs and other Muslims have been detained in camps in Xinjiang. China described the camps as vocational training centres to help stamp out religious extremism and teach new work skills.

column2: NSE hit by trading glitch towards session end: Reports
column3: The NSE was hit by a trading glitch on Monday leaving investors with no real-time updates, market sources said. The stock prices and index levels were not updating on the terminals linked to the trading platform at around 3:15 pm until the close of trade. As per reports, market regulator SEBI has sought a detailed report on the technical glitch.

column2: Do more with a smoother kind of OS: OnePlus on upcoming 7T series
column3: Ahead of the official unveiling of its OnePlus 7T series, OnePlus has tweeted a video teasing its 90Hz refresh rate display with the caption, "Do more with a smoother kind of OS." The company has also confirmed that the 7T range will make its debut in India on September 26, followed by a launch in London on October 10.

column2: A director wanted to see how my cleavage looks: Surveen Chawla
column3: Actress Surveen Chawla has revealed that she has faced casting couch twice in Bollywood and added, "One filmmaker wanted to see how my cleavage looks and one filmmaker wanted to see how my thighs look." "This sh*t happens, it's real," she added. The actress further revealed that both the directors were named during the #MeToo movement in India.

column2: Still remember when he let me play for CCI at 15: Sachin on Madhav Apte
column3: Condoling the demise of former India Test opener Madhav Apte, former India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Have fond memories of Madhav Apte sir. I got to play against him at Shivaji Park when I was 14." He added, "Still remember the time when he and Dungarpur sir let me play for CCI as a 15-year old. He always supported me."

column2: ICC officially warns Kohli over inappropriate physical contact with player
column3: Team India captain Virat Kohli has received an official warning and one demerit point after being found guilty of "inappropriate physical contact with a player" during the third T20I against South Africa. Kohli had deliberately bumped his shoulder into fast bowler Beuran Hendricks while taking a run in the fifth over.

column2: 50% of our cryptocurrency Libra to be backed by US dollar: Facebook
column3: Facebook in a letter to German politician Fabio De Masi said the US dollar will represent 50% of the backing for its Libra cryptocurrency. The remaining support will come from euro (18%), Japanese yen (14%), British pound (11%) and Singapore dollar (7%). Libra will let users buy things or send money to people with nearly zero fees, Facebook had said.

column2: China studying 'gel-like' substance found on far side of Moon
column3: China is studying a 'gel-like' substance found in a crater on the far side of the moon. China's Chang'e-4 lunar lander's rover, Yutu-2, spotted the matter last month but it had to shut down after that. A theory about the material proposes that it could be melted glass created from meteorites striking the surface of the moon.

column2: 10 killed in collision between bus and tempo traveller in Assam
column3: At least 10 people were killed and several others were injured on Monday in a collision between a bus and a tempo traveller on NH-37 in Demow, Sivasagar district in Assam. The injured were admitted to a hospital. According to reports, the bus which was travelling from Golaghat to Dibrugarh collided with the tempo traveller coming from the opposite direction.

column2: Alleging harassment by colleagues, 22-yr-old policewoman kills self in UP
column3: Alleging harassment by her colleagues, a 22-year-old policewoman committed suicide in UP's Ballia district. She hanged herself from the roof of a barrack in Police Lines in City Kotwali Police Station area on Sunday, Additional SP Sanjay Yadav said. In her suicide note, the woman charged two of her colleagues, including a female, of physical and mental harassment, Yadav added.

column2: As per some people, I'll grow gold wings & fly to moon: Chidambaram
column3: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Sunday tweeted, "I am thrilled to discover that, according to some people, I will grow golden wings and fly away to the moon." This comes after the CBI opposed Chidambaram's bail plea in INX Media case, saying he posed a "serious flight risk" and there was a possibility of him evading the process of law.

column2: BJP MLA booked for abusing, threatening govt official in UP
column3: A case was registered against Bairia BJP MLA Surendra Singh for allegedly abusing and threatening a government official, Uttar Pradesh Police said. A superintending engineer in the state's electricity department had alleged that Singh had called him and pressurised him to transfer a junior engineer. The superintending engineer also alleged that Singh used foul language and threatened him.

column2: Who is the boy who took selfie with PM Modi, Trump at 'Howdy, Modi' event?
column3: The boy who took a selfie with PM Narendra Modi and US President Donald Trump at 'Howdy, Modi' event has been identified as Satvik Hegde. Satvik's family moved to Texas 17 years ago from Karnataka's Sirsi. He was part of the yoga showcase at the event. His father works at a private company and his mother is a school teacher.

column2: Only 3 out of 200 participants show up for farting contest in Surat
column3: Only three out of 200 participants showed up for 'What The Fart' farting contest that was held in Gujarat's Surat on Sunday. The participants weren't able to "perform" on the stage in the given time, following which all three participants were reportedly given prizes. The organisers had brought gas masks and the cloud-shaped trophies to the event.

column2: British veterinarian tries to save orangutan shot 130 times
column3: A video has surfaced online that shows Paul Ramos, a British veterinarian, trying to save the life of an orangutan that had been shot 130 times. Ramos was in Borneo to see the work of animal charities where the injured orangutan was found clinging to a branch in a river. Ramos said he wants to raise awareness about wildlife.

column2: Don't really care about playing against Ronaldo: Balotelli
column3: Former Manchester City forward Mario Balotelli, who will make his Brescia debut against Juventus, said that he doesn't really care about playing against Juventus' Cristiano Ronaldo and that it will be a match like the others. "I think I have worked more during this month and a half than during the last ten years of my career," Balotelli said.

column2: Huawei denies any interest in acquiring Brazilian carrier Oi
column3: Chinese telecom equipment maker Huawei has denied a report claiming that it is teaming up with China Mobile to bid for indebted Brazilian telephone operator Oi. "Huawei has no plans or interest in acquiring Oi or any other Brazilian carrier," it said. Reportedly, the firms were mainly interested in Oi's 3,60,000-kilometer fibre-optic network, ahead of Brazil's planned 5G technology rollout.

column2: Sri Lanka has a 5th century rock fortress 'Sigiriya'
column3: Sri Lanka rock fortress 'Sigiriya' was built in the fifth century by King Kashyapa on a plateau 200 meters higher than the surrounding jungles. The fortress complex includes remnants of a ruined palace surrounded by fortifications, gardens, ponds, canals and fountains. The main entrance was designed in the form of a huge stone lion, whose feet survived through the years.

column2: BJP will not field relatives of MPs for Haryana polls: Report
column3: The BJP will reportedly not allocate assembly poll tickets to the relatives of its MPs or any other elected representative in Haryana. The party has also decided not to allocate tickets to anyone above the age of 75, the report claimed. The decision was reportedly taken during the meeting of BJP's Haryana election committee on Sunday.

column2: Avataar Venture Partners to invest $300 mn in B2B, SaaS startups
column3: Avataar Venture Partners announced a $300 million fund to invest in business-to-business and software-as-a-service startups. The fund was founded by Mohan Kumar, ex-partner with Norwest Venture Partners and Nishant Rao, ex-COO at Freshworks. Backed by US-based HarbourVest Partners, Avataar will invest $10 million-$30 million in startups that have at least $15 million in annual recurring revenues.

column2: Odisha's CyCa OncoSolutions awarded at startup meet in China
column3: CyCa OncoSolutions, a biotech startup from Odisha, has won the third prize at She Loves Tech Global Startup Competition 2019 in Beijing. It was awarded for developing an "efficient" nanotechnology-based molecular drilling device to directly deliver anti-cancer drugs to the affected cells. Founded in 2017 by researcher Nusrat Sanghamitra, the startup was mentored by Kerala Startup Mission (KSUM).

column2: ABVP clashes with police after rally to Jadavpur varsity stopped
column3: ABVP activists on Monday reportedly pelted stones at the police and tried to break barricades after their rally to Jadavpur University in Kolkata was stopped midway. The rally was taken out to protest against the alleged assault on Union Minister Babul Supriyo in the university, reports said. The protestors reportedly raised slogans against the Trinamool Congress government in West Bengal.

column2: On verge of becoming uncivilised: JD(U) on J'khand lynching
column3: Janata Dal (United) national spokesperson Pavan Varma said that India is on the verge of becoming an uncivilised nation. "PM (Narendra Modi) speaks at Houston (US) about the remarkable diversity of our land... on the other hand, we are demonstrating... mob violence in the name of cow," he added. One was killed in a mob-lynching incident in Jharkhand on Sunday.

column2: Jharkhand now known as 'Lynchistan' in country: Brinda Karat
column3: CPI (Marxist) leader Brinda Karat on Monday said there is no law and order in Jharkhand and it is now known as 'Lynchistan'. "After one instance of lynching, government made it clear that they are not with the victim but with the perpetrators," she added. One died and two others were injured in a mob-lynching incident in Jharkhand on Sunday.

column2: Mental health isn't fashion: Model stages protest at MFW runway
column3: Model Ayesha Tan Jones on Sunday held up her hands, on which "mental health is not fashion" was written while she was walking for brand Gucci at the Milan Fashion Week. She was among the models who walked the ramp wearing plain white straitjackets. According to The Guardian, a Gucci spokesperson confirmed that the protest was not planned.

column2: Govt plans to sell Air India, BPCL by March 2020: Report
column3: The government reportedly said on Monday it plans to sell two or three state-owned firms including Air India by March 2020 to raise about $8.5 billion. It aims to sell Bharat Petroleum Corporation and Container Corporation of India to local or foreign firms. It was reported earlier that the government was planning to sell Air India stake to foreign airlines.

column2: Sensex, Nifty see biggest 2-day gain after corporate tax, GST rate cuts
column3: The Sensex and Nifty recorded their biggest ever two-day gain on Monday after the government's move to reduce effective corporate tax to 25.17% and GST rate cuts on hotel tariffs. The Sensex ended 1,075 points up to 39,090 while the Nifty was trading above the 11,600-mark. L&T, ITC, IndusInd Bank, M&M were the biggest gainers in Sensex.

column2: Who won what at the 2019 Emmy Awards held today?
column3: Billy Porter became the first openly gay black man to win the Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series for 'Pose' at 71st Emmy Awards held on Monday. Jodie Comer won the Outstanding Lead Actress in a Drama Series for 'Killing Eve'. The award for Outstanding Television Movie went to 'Black Mirror: Bandersnatch', while 'Chernobyl' was named Outstanding Limited Series.

column2: Amy, fiancé blessed with baby boy; actress shares breastfeeding pic
column3: Actress Amy Jackson on Monday took to Instagram to reveal that she and her fiancé George Panayiotou have been blessed with a baby boy. Sharing a picture which shows her breastfeeding the newborn, the actress wrote, "Our Angel, welcome to the world Andreas." Amy and George have named their son after George's father, British businessman Andreas Panayiotou.

column2: Former India Test opener Madhav Apte passes away aged 86
column3: Former India Test opener Madhav Apte passed away at the age of 86 in Mumbai's Breach Candy Hospital. Apte was the fourth-oldest living Indian Test cricketer. He played seven Tests for India, scoring 542 runs at an average of 49.27 from November 1952 to April 1953. He played 67 first-class matches, scoring 3,336 runs and slamming six centuries.

column2: Apple's Fifth Avenue store in US first to remain open 24x7
column3: Apple reopened its Fifth Avenue store in New York last week, the company's first store that will remain open 24 hours every day. It will be managed by 900 people working in shifts who can speak over 30 languages. The store's gates were opened by Apple CEO Tim Cook and Apple's Senior VP of Retail Deirdre O'Brien.

column2: Doctors study case of Armenian woman who cries 'crystal tears'
column3: Doctors in Armenia are investigating the case of Satenik Kazaryan, a 22-year-old woman who cries 'crystal tears'. The 22-year-old claims that she cries up to 50 jagged-edged tears each day, and has said that her condition is agony and has made her life 'hell'. Armenia's deputy health minister said that Satenik's case is being studied.

column2: SC to hear disqualified K'taka MLAs' plea seeking to contest polls
column3: The Supreme Court has agreed to hear the plea of disqualified Congress and JD(S) MLAs who have sought interim relief to contest by-polls for 15 Assembly seats in Karnataka. A three-judge bench headed by Justice NV Ramana said it would hear the matter on Wednesday. Meanwhile, the Election Commission told the court that the polls should not be stayed.

column2: Man wanted in multiple cow slaughter cases held in Uttar Pradesh
column3: Uttar Pradesh Police on Sunday caught a man allegedly involved in multiple cases of cow slaughter following an exchange of fire in Rampur. The accused, Imran alias Jhamman, was involved in more than half a dozen criminal cases with the majority being cow slaughter cases, police said. One .12 bore pistol and two live cartridges were recovered from him.

column2: Man shoots father dead after mistaking him for wild pig in Italy
column3: An Italian man shot dead his father during a hunting trip in Italy after mistaking him for a wild pig. The two were moving through thick bushes when the man shot his father in the lower abdomen. The 34-year-old, who has been charged with culpable homicide, opened fire when he saw a shadow.

column2: Ex-President Mugabe died from cancer: Zimbabwe President
column3: Former Zimbabwean President Robert Mugabe died from cancer after chemotherapy treatment was stopped because it was no longer effective, a state-owned newspaper quoted President Emmerson Mnangagwa as saying. This is the first time the government has given the cause of his death. Mugabe, who led Zimbabwe to independence, died on September 6 aged 95 in Singapore.

column2: Salman is very humble, willing to help everyone: Disha Patani
column3: Talking about her 'Bharat' co-actor Salman Khan, actress Disha Patani said that he makes everyone feel comfortable as he's very "humble". "I remember people coming to him for help. He's Santa Claus sitting on set, willing to help everyone," she added. Talking about how she was treated in Bollywood being an outsider, Disha said, "People have been... accepting of me."

column2: Malindo Air blames contractor's ex-employees for data breach
column3: Indonesian airline Lion Air's Malaysian unit Malindo Air has blamed two former employees of its e-commerce contractor for its recent passenger data leak. Reportedly, the data of around 30 million passengers of Lion units, like phone numbers and passport details, was stolen and posted online. Malindo said the two employees at GoQuo's Indian development centre "improperly accessed and stole data".

column2: Startup's indoor navigation products to work without Wi-Fi, Bluetooth
column3: Hyderabad-based startup Augmented Byte is creating products for indoor navigation using augmented reality which would not require Wi-Fi or Bluetooth. The system works by scanning a unique image, from the starting point, to start the AR-based navigation in any given space. Augmented Byte's MD, Radha Krishna, said he plans to target 35-40 hospitals for prospective clients in coming one year.

column2: NCP keen on alliance with VBA for Maharashtra polls: Ajit Pawar
column3: NCP leader Ajit Pawar has said that his party would like to forge an alliance with the Prakash Ambedkar-led Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi (VBA) for the upcoming Maharashtra Assembly elections. The VBA contesting the 2019 Lok Sabha polls separately had caused losses to the Congress-NCP alliance, he added. "We are (now) trying to bring together like-minded people," Pawar said.

column2: Cong criticises PM Modi for endorsing second term for Trump
column3: The Congress on Monday criticised PM Narendra Modi for endorsing another term for President Donald Trump during his 'Howdy, Modi' event in the US. "You have violated the time-honoured principle of Indian foreign policy of not interfering in the domestic elections of another country," it said. "This is a singular disservice to long-term strategic interests of India," the Congress added.

column2: Startups to see inflow of investment: Zeta CEO on corporate tax cuts
column3: Enterprise payments startup Zeta's CEO Bhavin Turakhia has said that the government's decision of slashing effective corporate tax to 25.17% "will greatly benefit Indian corporates, with the startup sector slated to see an inflow of investment." "These measures will go a long way in not only augmenting local businesses but also spur the overall growth of the economy," he added.

column2: Pharmarack raises $3 mn in funding round by IvyCap Ventures
column3: Healthcare tech platform Pharmarack has raised $3 million in a Series A funding round led by IvyCap Ventures. Pharmarack had raised $745,000 in pre-Series A funding from Unicorn India Ventures and the Patni Group's Currae Healthtech Fund in 2016. As part of the investment, IvyCap Ventures' Founder and Managing Partner Vikram Gupta will join the healthtech startup's board.

column2: Indian Army organises the first-ever startup weekend in J&K
column3: The Indian Army alongside Shri Mata Vaishno Devi University organised the first-ever startup weekend in Jammu & Kashmir. The event, spanning 20-22 September, let students and entrepreneurs pitch their ideas and business models to investors invited from across India. The large participation shows a shift in mindsets towards entrepreneurship, especially after Article 370's abrogation, said the Army.

column2: Hormone potentially linked to hypersexual disorder identified
column3: According to a study published in the journal Epigenetics, the hormone oxytocin may have a possible role in people with hypersexual disorder. The study featured measuring DNA methylation patterns in the blood from 60 patients with hypersexual disorder and comparing them to samples from 33 healthy volunteers. The study points towards reduction of oxytocin activity as a possible treatment.

column2: New bee species discovered, feared to be nearing extinction
column3: Researchers have discovered nine new species of bees in Fiji with some of them showing signs of exposure to environmental changes. The species have been named to highlight the risks of environmental changes. "Homalictus terminalis is named so to indicate that, like many Fijian bees, it is nearing its limit and is at risk of climate-related extinction," a researcher said.

column2: SC gets 4 new judges, total strength reaches highest-ever 34
column3: Supreme Court on Monday got four new judges as Justices Krishna Murari, S Ravindra Bhat, V Ramasubramanian and Hrishikesh Roy took oaths. This increased the strength of judges in the SC to 34 which is the highest in its history. President Ram Nath Kovind appointed the judges last week who took the oath on Monday under CJI Ranjan Gogoi's administration.

column2: Shame on BJP for creating panic over NRC in Bengal: Mamata
column3: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee accused the BJP of creating panic over National Register of Citizens (NRC) in Bengal. "Shame on BJP...it has led to six deaths. Have faith in me, I'll never allow the exercise in Bengal," she said. "NRC exercise will not be carried out in Bengal or anywhere else in the country," she added.

column2: Reliance Capital criticises CARE for downgrading debt rating
column3: Reliance Capital has criticised CARE Ratings for downgrading its debt to default grade 'D', adding the "unjustified" move will harm the interests of millions of investors. CARE had cited one-day delay in coupon payments on NCDs by Reliance Capital to lenders for the cut, which Reliance attributed to "technical glitch in bank servers". CARE "arbitrarily disregarded" the explanation, Reliance said.

column2: Aim to produce more energy than we consume by 2020: IKEA
column3: IKEA will exceed its 2020 target to produce as much renewable energy as the energy it consumes by 2019 end, Ingka Group, which owns most IKEA stores, said. Ingka Group has spent about $2.8 billion over the past decade in solar and wind energy. IKEA plans to be climate-positive, which means reducing more emissions than it puts out, by 2030.

column2: Terror camp hit by India in Balakot reactivated, confirms Army Chief
column3: Army Chief General Bipin Rawat on Monday confirmed that Balakot terror camp has been reactivated by Pakistan very recently, almost seven months after Indian Air Force jets bombed the Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) terrorist facility there. "This shows Balakot was affected, it was damaged; it highlights some action was taken by the Indian Air Force at Balakot," the Army Chief added.

column2: Ravishing to look at: Deepika on Tissot’s PR100 Chrono Sports
column3: As per brand ambassador Deepika Padukone, Tissot's recently launched PR100 Chrono Sports is "just as ravishing to look at as it's robust in its make." With its sporty and stylish design elements, it is a visual celebration of the strength of womanhood, and with many different styles to choose from it will do extremely well, she added.

column2: Bruna Abdullah shares pic of giving birth to daughter in warm water pool
column3: Brazilian actress-model Bruna Abdullah has shared a picture from the time when she gave birth to her daughter last month. The 32-year-old had delivered her daughter via water birth in a warm water pool. "I hated the idea of having to deal with the side effects of all the medication they would give me at the hospital," Bruna wrote.

column2: Your presence a watershed moment in India-USA ties: PM thanks Trump
column3: Thanking US President Donald Trump for attending the 'Howdy, Modi' event in Houston, Texas, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted, "Your presence was a watershed moment in India-USA ties." "Since assuming office, you have been a steadfast friend of India and the Indian community. Your presence indicates your respect towards India and the Indian diaspora," PM Modi further wrote.

column2: 13 men accused of helping criminal escape jail paraded in underwear
column3: Thirteen men accused of opening fire and helping Haryana criminal Papla alias Vikram Gurjar escape from a police station in Alwar earlier this month were on Sunday paraded in their underwear in Rajasthan. Police said the move was not intended to send any message to the public. The 13 were handcuffed and paraded through a crowded market place.

column2: You might be jealous your partner is with me: PM to US Senator's wife
column3: The Prime Minister Office shared a video of PM Narendra Modi apologising to US Senator John Cornyn's wife as it was her birthday and her husband was at the 'Howdy, Modi' event. "Your life partner is with me, so naturally you must be jealous," he said. "Wish you a happy life," PM Modi told Cornyn's wife.

column2: Mobile app to be used for data collection in 2021 census: Amit Shah
column3: Home Minister Amit Shah has said a mobile app will be used in 2021 census. "It will be a transformation from paper census to digital census," Shah added. This will be the first time in the history of census in India that data will be collected through a mobile app. The census is scheduled to be held in February 2021.

column2: Why not go beyond? Army Chief when asked about repeating Balakot strike
column3: Army Chief General Bipin Rawat, on being asked if the Army is planning another strike like the one in Balakot to counter terrorists, said, "Why should we repeat the same action?" "Why not go beyond that? Let them keep guessing," he added. The Army Chief also confirmed that the terror camp hit by India in Balakot has been reactivated.

column2: Seven students killed as classroom collapses in Kenya
column3: At least seven children have died after a classroom collapsed at a school in the Kenyan capital Nairobi, officials said. The wooden structure at the school collapsed just minutes after the start of the school day on Monday. Dozens of students are reported to be trapped. Emergency services are at the scene.

column2: Make climate fight sexy and fun: Japan's new environment minister
column3: Japan's new environment minister, Shinjiro Koizumi, on Sunday pledged to mobilise young people to push his coal-dependent country toward a low-carbon future by making the fight against climate change "sexy" and "fun". "We are committed to realising a decarbonised society, and we are ready to contribute as a more powerful country in the fight against climate change," he added.

column2: Nobody questioned when SRK killed Shilpa in Baazigar: Shahid
column3: Talking about the criticism over his film 'Kabir Singh', Shahid Kapoor said, "No one brought up Baazigar, when SRK kills Shilpa Shetty. No one said anything about Ranbir Kapoor putting a commode seat on Sonam Kapoor's neck... in Sanju." The actor further said that 'Kabir Singh' was about a flawed character who didn't know how to handle himself.

column2: Anushka among Fortune India's Most Powerful Women in Business
column3: Actress Anushka Sharma on Sunday became the only Bollywood actress to feature in Fortune India's top 50 list of Most Powerful Women in Business 2019. The actress secured the 39th rank and was also the youngest woman on the list. The list featured women who are making an impact by virtue of their business acumen and social and cultural influence.

column2: 'Newton' will remain special to me: Rao on completion of its 2 yrs
column3: Sharing a post on completion of two years of his film 'Newton', Rajkummar Rao on Sunday said, "This film will always remain very special to me for so many reasons. Thank you guys for all your love." 'Newton', which was directed by Amit V Masurkar was India's official entry in the Best Foreign Language Film category at the Oscars 2018.

column2: Kevin Hart may face lawsuit over car accident: Reports
column3: Actor-comedian Kevin Hart will reportedly face a lawsuit after his car crashed in Los Angeles a few weeks ago. The driver and a second passenger of the car, who suffered injuries in the accident, are taking the action against Hart for not having safety features installed in his car, reports added. Hart has also obtained a lawyer, reports further said.

column2: Proud of India: Rishi Kapoor on 'Howdy, Modi' event in US
column3: During PM Narendra Modi and US President Donald Trump's speech at 'Howdy, Modi' event, actor Rishi Kapoor tweeted, "#howdymodi "Go Modi" - "Go Trump" - Houston, US. Proud of our being. Proud of the community. Proud of India." Meanwhile, Salman Khan wrote, "Way to go PM Modi and Prez Trump for a great association between the 2 nations."

column2: Rajasthan's Abhaneri Festival to be held in Dausa from Sept 30
column3: Rajasthan's cultural festival 'Abhaneri Festival', named after the village Abhaneri in the Dausa district, is being held from September 30 to October 1. Abhaneri is popular for the Chand Baori stepwell, one of the largest stepwells built over a thousand years ago. The festival will witness various Rajasthani & local folk performances like Kachhi Ghori, Kalbeliya, Ghoomar and Bhawai.

column2: Indian economy is in good condition: Ravi Shankar Prasad
column3: Union Telecom Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said that Indian economy is in good condition having witnessed 28% rise in foreign investments. "India has become world's second largest mobile manufacturing country following...subsequent demands of products," he added. He also said that IT sector has witnessed highest investment that shows "investors are sure of emerging robust economy of India".

column2: 1 killed, 2 injured in J'khand over suspicion of cow slaughter
column3: In a mob-lynching incident in Jharkhand's Khunti on Sunday, one man was killed and 2 others were injured over suspicion of cow slaughter. "The three villagers...are alleged to have been carving an animal prohibited for slaughtering. Other villagers spotted them and started beating them," said an official. He further added that a few have been detained for questioning.

column2: Punjab Police busts Pakistan-backed KZF terror module, 4 arrested
column3: Punjab Police on Sunday busted a terror module of Khalistan Zindabad Force (KZF) backed by a group based in Pakistan and Germany. The group was planning to unleash a series of strikes in Punjab and adjoining states, police said. Arms including five AK-47 rifles, pistols, satellite phones and hand grenades were seized. Four members of the module have been arrested.

column2: Journalist Ravish Kumar awarded first Gauri Lankesh Memorial Award
column3: NDTV's Ravish Kumar was awarded the first Gauri Lankesh Memorial Award for Journalism by the Gauri Lankesh Memorial Trust. "Indian media is killing democracy....media is portraying ministers as avatars," Ravish said. Talking about Hindi language, he added that we'll be one nation truly when every language is taken into consideration. He was awarded the 2019 Ramon Magsaysay Award last month.

column2: Send 5 non-Indian families to India as tourists: PM Modi to NRIs
column3: Addressing a gathering of Indian community in Houston, PM Narendra Modi requested Indians across the world to send at least five non-Indian families to India as tourists every year. This came after he unveiled the plaque of the Eternal Gandhi Museum in Houston. "The Eternal Gandhi museum will...surely make Gandhi Ji's thoughts popular among youth," read a tweet by PMO.

column2: Oil prices to ease if global tensions do not rise: Oil Min
column3: Oil Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Monday said global oil prices will ease if there is no further escalation in geopolitical tensions. Oil prices rose nearly 19% after drone attacks on two Saudi Arabian oil facilities wiped off about 5% of global supplies. India is the world's third-largest oil importer, depending on imports to meet almost 84% of its oil needs.

column2: 'Game of Thrones' wins Outstanding Drama Series at Emmy Awards 2019
column3: 'Game of Thrones' season 8 won the Outstanding Drama Series award at the 71st Emmy Awards, held on Monday. The series' final season secured 32 Emmy nominations, creating a record for the most number of Emmy nominations received in a single year. Meanwhile, the show's actor Peter Dinklage won in the Best Supporting Actor for a Drama Series category.

column2: Ab ki baar Trump sarkar: PM Narendra Modi at 'Howdy, Modi' event
column3: PM Narendra Modi, during the 'Howdy, Modi' event, backed Donald Trump for a second term as US President. "We in India have connected well with President Trump, the words of candidate Trump, 'Ab ki baar Trump sarkar', rang loud and clear," he said. "When I first met him...he said to me...'India has a true friend in White House'," PM added.

column2: My answer to 'Howdy, Modi?' is 'Everything is fine in India': PM at event
column3: During the 'Howdy, Modi' event at Texas' Houston, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "If you ask me, 'Howdy, Modi?', the answer is 'Everything is fine in India'." PM Modi answered the question in several languages, saying, "Our various languages are an important identity of our liberal and democractic society". "Diversity is the foundation of our vibrant democracy," he added.

column2: Peter Dinklage wins Best Supporting Actor for GoT at Emmy Awards
column3: Peter Dinklage won the Best Supporting Actor in a Drama Series for 'Game of Thrones' at 2019 Emmy Awards. The actor set a record as this was his fourth win at the Emmys. Julia Garner won Best Supporting Actress in a Drama Series for 'Ozark', defeating Sophie Turner, Maisie Williams, Lena Headey, and Gwendoline Christie from 'Game of Thrones'.

column2: WeWork board members seek to remove Adam Neumann as CEO: WSJ
column3: Some board members of US-based co-working space startup WeWork are discussing Co-founder Adam Neumann's removal as CEO, The Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday. CNBC reported the CEO of WeWork's largest investor SoftBank, Masayoshi Son, is also in favour of removing Neumann as WeWork CEO. WeWork board will reportedly meet soon and may propose a non-executive Chairman role for Neumann.

column2: Sensex up 1,300 points in early trade, Nifty rises to 11,600
column3: The Sensex gained 1,300 points in early trade, while the Nifty opened at over 11,600 on Monday. ITC, L&T, Asian Paints, IndusInd Bank, ONGC and HDFC Bank were up between 4% and 6%. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said that the government's move on corporate tax has sent a positive message "not just in India" but around the globe.

column2: PM Modi, Trump pose for selfie on kid's request at 'Howdy, Modi' event
column3: PM Narendra Modi and US President Donald Trump posed for a selfie on the request of a kid at 'Howdy, Modi' event in US on Sunday. The White House shared the picture on Twitter, among other photos from the event. The main event was preceded by a cultural event, which included performances from different states of India and America.

column2: How did the foreign media cover 'Howdy, Modi' event?
column3: Foreign media outlets including the BBC, The Guardian and Al Jazeera covered the 'Howdy, Modi' event which was held in US' Houston. Al Jazeera called it a "rare mass showing for a foreign leader on the American soil", while The Guardian wrote, "A packed venue and a roaring crowd." "Trump hails Indian PM at 'historic' Texas rally," the BBC wrote.

column2: The USA loves India: US Prez Trump on PMO's 'Howdy, Modi' video
column3: After attending the 'Howdy, Modi' event along with Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Houston, Texas, US President Donald Trump shared a video posted by PMO and tweeted, "The USA Loves India!" Trump also shared a video of the crowd at the event which was attended by over 50,000 Indian-Americans and several US lawmakers. "Incredible," the US President captioned the video.

column2: India-US friendship flag replaces US Presidential Seal at 'Howdy, Modi'
column3: US President Donald Trump's administration replaced the Presidential Seal with an India-US friendship flag on the presidential lectern during the 'Howdy, Modi' event in Houston, Texas on Sunday. Every lectern from where a US President speaks, be it a joint press conference or an election speech or any speaking engagement either domestically or overseas, carries a Presidential Seal.

column2: India and US working together to fight radical Islamic terrorism: Trump
column3: During the 'Howdy, Modi' event, US President Donald Trump said that India and US are working together to fight radical Islamic terrorism. "Today we honour all of the brave American and Indian military service members who work together to safeguard our freedom. We are committed to protecting innocent civilians from the threat of radical Islamic terrorism," he said.

column2: PM Narendra Modi invites Donald Trump to come to India with family
column3: While concluding his address at 'Howdy, Modi' event, PM Narendra Modi invited President Donald Trump to come to India with his family. "Our friendship will take our shared dreams and our vibrant future to new heights," he added. "President Trump calls me a tough negotiator. But he himself is a master at the 'Art of the Deal'," PM earlier said.

column2: Where were conspirators of 9/11, 26/11 attacks found: PM Modi at US event
column3: During the 'Howdy, Modi' event in Texas' Houston, PM Narendra Modi, in an apparent reference to Pakistan, said, "People who can't even handle their own country are having problem with what India is doing." "Be it 9/11 in US, or 26/11 in Mumbai, where were the conspirators found? Time has come to fight a decisive battle against terrorism," he added.

column2: Standing ovation for MPs who revoked Article 370 after PM's request
column3: Indian MPs who supported revoking Article 370 got a standing ovation at the 'Howdy, Modi' event in US after PM Narendra Modi's request. "India has given farewell to Article 370," he said. "Article 370 deprived people of J&K and Ladakh of development. Terrorist and separatist elements were misusing the situation. J&K people have now got equal rights," PM Modi added.

column2: Sophie Turner, Maisie Williams walk on the red carpet of Emmy Awards
column3: Actresses Sophie Turner and Maisie Williams were among the celebrities who walked on the red carpet of the 71st Emmy Awards. Turner wore a floor-length pink gown with a belt and paired her outfit with silver heels, a diamond necklace and a ring. Meanwhile, Maisie wore a V neck black dress by JW Anderson, which was half encrusted with sequins.

column2: AI-powered app claims to spot skin cancer with 95% accuracy
column3: An AI-powered app called SkinVision claims it can spot forms of skin cancer with 95.1% accuracy. Created by an Amsterdam-based company, the app lets users gradually track and assess their skin changes. It works by studying irregular patterns, colours, asymmetry, etc. in a user's skin using a photo. The app gives a review within 30 seconds of submitting the photo.

column2: Facebook to shut down group stories feature from Sept 26
column3: Facebook has announced that it will soon shut down its group stories feature on September 26. The group feature has been available globally since December. It allowed administrators and members of the social media's groups to post videos and photos that disappear within 24 hours. Users will still be able to post short-lived content through their personal profiles.

column2: Fadnavis will be CM again after Maha Assembly polls: Shah
column3: Ahead of the October state Assembly elections in Maharashtra, Home Minister Amit Shah said that Devendra Fadnavis will return as CM. Shah added that NDA government in Maharashtra will return with three-fourth seats. "People of Maharashtra should show Congress, NCP their place for opposing the abrogation of the articles that ensured full integration of J&K with India," he further said.

column2: Indian startup IPLT to launch all-electric heavy-duty truck
column3: Gurugram-based startup Infraprime Logistics Technologies (IPLT) is planning to launch an electric truck, claimed to be India's first all-electric heavy-duty truck, within the next 1.5 months. The startup claimed the 60-tonne truck, a medium-haul logistics vehicle, has a range of 200 kilometres with load and 400 kilometres without it. IPLT is also planning to set up its own charging stations.

column2: Data is the new oil, new gold: PM Modi at 'Howdy, Modi' event
column3: PM Narendra Modi, during the 'Howdy, Modi' event in Texas' Houston, said that data is the 'new oil' and 'new gold' and added, "If there is one country in the world where data is cheapest, then that is India." Highlighting the use of digital technology, he added that nearly 50 lakh Indians filed their I-T returns online on August 31.

column2: Gorkhas left out of NRC will not go to foreigners' tribunals: BGP
column3: Bharatiya Gorkha Parisangh (BGP) on Sunday said the Gorkhas left out of the National Register of Citizens (NRC) in Assam will not file appeals in the foreigners' tribunals to challenge their exclusion. To try the Gorkhas in such tribunals would be an insult to their Indian identity, the BGP added. The BGP claims to represent 10.5 million Gorkhas in India.

column2: Thousands march for ban on abortions in Slovakia
column3: Thousands marched in Slovakia's capital Bratislava on Sunday calling for a ban on abortions in the country. On-demand abortions are allowed up until 12 weeks of pregnancy while abortions for health reasons are allowed until 24 weeks. Protesters carried signs saying "A human is human regardless of size" and "Who kills an unborn child kills the future of the nation".

column2: South Africa defeat India in Bengaluru T20I as series ends in a 1-1 draw
column3: South Africa defeated India by 9 wickets in the third T20I in Bengaluru as the three-match series ended in a 1-1 draw. India had won the second T20I in Mohali to register their first victory against South Africa on Indian soil. The first T20I was abandoned due to rain. The first India-South Africa Test will begin on October 2.

column2: Salman's fans stopped calling me 'Bhabhi' after Hate Story: Zareen
column3: Actress Zareen Khan, on being asked about Salman Khan's fans' "fixation" with her and being called 'Bhabhi' by them, said, "Most of those comments stopped after I did 'Hate Story'." When asked to explain a video which showed her saying she and Salman are getting married, Zareen clarified, "I was asked...what's the best rumour I'd like to spread about myself."

column2: Ghulam Nabi Azad meets people in Anantnag after SC orders
column3: Senior Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad, who is on a visit to Jammu and Kashmir following Supreme Court orders, on Sunday visited Anantnag district in south Kashmir where he met people in a government housing colony. An SC bench, headed by CJI Ranjan Gogoi, allowed Azad to visit four districts, Srinagar, Jammu, Baramulla, and Anantnag, to meet the people there.

column2: Gavaskar asks 'Who should bat at no. 4' in KBC style, BCCI shares video
column3: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar, while commentating in third India-South Africa T20I today, asked 'Who should bat at number four for India' in Kaun Banega Crorepati style. He added this could really be a question in KBC. BCCI shared a video of the same, writing, "This is gold from Sunny G...How is that for a KBC rendition, Sunny G Style?"

column2: AAP releases list of 22 candidates for Haryana Assembly polls
column3: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Saturday released a list of 22 candidates for the next month's Assembly polls in Haryana. Two women figured in the list released by AAP's Haryana unit President Naveen Jaihind. AAP had not contested the Assembly polls in 2014, in which the BJP came to power for the first time in Haryana.

column2: Uber almost worthless, an app my cat could've written: Oracle Co-founder
column3: Oracle Co-founder Larry Ellison met some entrepreneurs at his US residence this week where he called Uber and shared workspace company WeWork "almost worthless". On Uber, Ellison said that losing money to gain market share is "idiotic" and that "Uber has an app my cat could've written". He added that it's "bizarre" of WeWork to call itself a technology company.

column2: Parents drown 20-day-old twin daughters due to 'weak financial condition'
column3: Parents in a village in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar district drowned their 20-day-old twin daughters, with the father claiming they could not have borne the expenses for their daughters. "Our financial condition is very weak," he added. The couple, who have a seven-year-old son, were arrested on Sunday. The bodies of the girls were recovered and sent for postmortem, police said.

column2: 8 killed, 20 injured as bus crashes into truck in Rajasthan
column3: Eight people were killed while over 20 suffered injuries after a bus crashed into a truck in Rajasthan's Ajmer district on Sunday. The incident happened near Lamana village. "Two trucks were coming from the other side. The bus got stuck in the middle and collided with one," a passenger said. The injured were shifted to Jawaharlal Nehru Hospital in Ajmer.

column2: Supreme Court to have permanent Constitution bench from October 1
column3: The Supreme Court is going to have a permanent five-judge Constitution bench from October 1 to decide cases related to the interpretation of Constitution, statutes, and laws. Presently, the Constitution bench, comprising a minimum of five judges, is set up on a reference made by a three-judge bench on complex questions of law, which require authoritative pronouncement.

column2: Will be a great day in Texas: Donald Trump ahead of 'Howdy, Modi' event
column3: Ahead of the 'Howdy, Modi' event, US President Donald Trump tweeted, "Will be in Houston to be with my friend. Will be a great day in Texas!" Trump is expected to deliver a 30-minute speech on India and Indian Americans at the event. Around 50,000 people will attend the event where PM Narendra Modi will address the Indian diaspora.

column2: Wanted Al-Qaeda terrorist Kalimuddin arrested in Jharkhand
column3: The Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) of Jharkhand Police has arrested an Al-Qaeda terrorist named Mohhamad Kalimuddin Mujahiri. "Kalimuddin is the most wanted terrorist of Al-Qaeda. He has been arrested from Tatanagar railway station. He was preparing and motivating the youths for jihad in the Indian subcontinent," said ML Meena, Additional Director General of Police (ADGP).

column2: Ferrari's Sebastian Vettel wins a Grand Prix after 392 days
column3: Ferrari's Sebastian Vettel took a Grand Prix win in Singapore on Sunday, 392 days since his last Grand Prix win. Meanwhile, Vettel's teammate Charles Leclerc, who had earlier registered his fifth consecutive pole position start, finished second in the race. Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton finished fourth in the race, behind Red Bull's Max Verstappen.

column2: Bengaluru to get AI-powered traffic signals soon
column3: The Joint Commissioner of Police (Traffic) BR Ravikanthe Gowda said Bengaluru will soon use artificial intelligence for efficient traffic regulation. The new AI cameras will study traffic density and decide on how much time to allow vehicles to clear a signal. The aim is to allow motorists to save fuel and give them an idea about when they can move.

column2: US approves tariff exemptions for Apple on 10 imported items
column3: The US trade regulators have approved 10 out of 15 tariff exemption requests filed by Apple on computer components imported from China. These components were among the tariffs the US imposed on $200-billion worth of Chinese imports last year. This will reportedly help Apple continue assembling Mac Pro in the US with lowered costs of importing some Mac Pro parts.

column2: High-altitude 'funeral' being hosted for lost Swiss glacier
column3: Around 100 individuals are attending a high-altitude 'funeral' to mark the disappearance of an Alpine glacier. Dressed in black, the participants are to make a two-hour march up the side of Pizol mountain. Once on top, a chaplain and several scientists will make speeches in remembrance of the glacier accompanied by alphorns, a wooden instrument used by mountain dwellers.

column2: Venus may have had stable climate for billions of years: Study
column3: A new study has claimed that Earth's neighbouring planet Venus may have had a stable climate for billions of years before a transformation starting over 700 million years ago resurfaced around 80% of the planet. As a part of the study, scientists created a series of five simulations assuming different levels of water coverage on the planet.

column2: Species declined by 53%, could lead to future extinction: Study
column3: A new study by the World Wildlife Fund and the Zoological Society of London analysed 268 species to report that the average species declined by 53%, a drop that could lead to extinction in the future. Notably, a recent report had found that a million animal and plant species could go extinct in the decades ahead because of climate change.

column2: 19.96 lakh ghost beneficiaries in Assam Anganwadi centres: RTI
column3: As many as 19.96 lakh ghost beneficiaries have been identified at Anganwadi centres in Assam through a daily headcount, according to an RTI query. In Assam, there are a total of 62,153 Anganwadi centres in which 36,24,973 beneficiaries are enrolled. Earlier, the Centre had asked all the states to conduct a headcount of all the beneficiaries of Anganwadi centres.

column2: Biden urges investigation into Trump's call to Ukrainian Prez
column3: Former US Vice President Joe Biden on Saturday called for an investigation into reports that US President Donald Trump pressed his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskyy to investigate Biden and his son Hunter. Trump's lawyer Rudy Giuliani alleged Biden tried to have Ukraine's top prosecutor ousted in 2016 because of an investigation into a company whose board Hunter sat on.

column2: Afghan Taliban meets Chinese Government in Beijing
column3: A Taliban delegation met China's special representative for Afghanistan Deng Xijun in Beijing on Sunday to discuss the group's peace talks with the United States, Taliban spokesman Suhail Shaheen said. "The Chinese special representative said the US-Taliban deal is a good framework for the peaceful solution of the Afghan issue and they support it," Shaheen added.

column2: HK protestors trample Chinese national flag, throw it in river
column3: A group of protestors in Hong Kong on Sunday trampled on the Chinese national flag and later threw it into the Shing Mun river. The protestors also reportedly smeared paint on the flag while bystanders cheered and applauded. For over three months, Hong Kong has witnessed pro-democracy protests that began after the introduction of the now-suspended extradition bill.

column2: Don't need a trade deal with China before 2020: Donald Trump
column3: US President Donald Trump said on Friday that he does not 'need' a trade deal with China before the 2020 presidential election. Trump also said he did not want a 'partial deal' with Beijing adding that his relationship with Chinese President Xi Jinping is strong but hit a 'little spat'. "China's being affected very badly. We're not," he added.

column2: Rohit Sharma equals MS Dhoni's record for playing most T20Is for India
column3: Team India opener Rohit Sharma has equalled former India captain MS Dhoni's record for playing the most number of T20I matches for India. The third T20I against South Africa today is Rohit's 98th T20I match. Dhoni has featured in 98 T20Is, scoring 1,617 runs. Dhoni and Rohit are followed by Suresh Raina, who has played 78 T20I matches.

column2: Govt to take control of online movie ticket sales: Telangana Minister
column3: Telangana's Cinematography Minister Talasani Srinivas Yadav said on Saturday the state government will take control of online movie ticket sales by launching its own portal under the supervision of State Film Development Corporation (FDC). All the private online ticket sellers will be routed through FDC, he added. He said this will prevent GST evasion by private players.

column2: After my 1st film's success, I believed I could be next Big B: Suniel Shetty
column3: Speaking about ups and downs in his career, Suniel Shetty said, "I was very happy when my first movie was successful. That success paired with my trained body allowed me to believe...I'd be the next Amitabh Bachchan." "Unfortunately, it remained a distant dream," he added. Speaking about his acting being criticised, Suniel said he's glad he took it positively.

column2: Article 370 was a 'nasoor' that bloodied Kashmir: Rajnath Singh
column3: Addressing a public rally in Patna, Bihar on Sunday, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that Article 370 was a 'nasoor' (cankerous wound) in the Constitution that had bloodied "our beloved heaven on earth, Kashmir". Rajnath Singh further said that Article 370 and Article 35A were the biggest cause which gave birth to terrorism in Kashmir.

column2: Dhoni extends break till November, unavailable for B'desh T20Is: Report
column3: MS Dhoni, who took a break from cricket to serve in Territorial Army after India's ouster from 2019 World Cup, has extended his break till November, as per reports. Dhoni will miss out on both Vijay Hazare Trophy and the home T20I series against Bangladesh. After serving his regiment, Dhoni had also made himself unavailable for the South Africa series.

column2: Team uses cardboard cutout of unavailable player for winners' photo
column3: During the winners' group photo following their T20 Blast 2019 victory, Essex used a cardboard cutout of their Australian spinner Adam Zampa, who missed the semi-final and the final. The cutout showed the 27-year-old spinner celebrating a wicket posing like Hulk. Zampa missed the later stage of the tournament as he went to Australia to feature in the Marsh Cup.

column2: Killing in name of Lord Ram an insult of Hindu religion: Tharoor
column3: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Sunday said that it was an insult of Hindu religion and Lord Ram that someone uses his name to kill another person. Tharoor added that those who are defaming the Hindu religion in the name of Hindutva, are doing so because it is their political ideology which has nothing to do with the Hindu religion.

column2: Nobel winners ask Bill Gates Foundation to revoke PM Modi's award
column3: Nobel Peace Prize laureates Mairead Maguire, Tawakkol Abdel-Salam Karman and Shirin Ebadi have written to the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation to revoke the Global Goalkeepers Goals Award to Prime Minister Narendra Modi. "Under Prime Minister Modi's leadership, India has descended into dangerous and deadly chaos that has consistently undermined human rights, democracy," they wrote.

column2: Philosopher, guide: Sitharaman on pic with daughter on Daughters' Day
column3: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday took to Twitter to share an old picture of herself with her daughter Vangmayi Parakala. "Can say so much and more about daughters...A friend, philosopher and a guide. Here's this on #DaughtersDay," she wrote. Daughters' Day is celebrated in India every year on the fourth Sunday of September.

column2: UPSC asks about 'challenges to culture in the name of secularism'
column3: The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) on Saturday asked "What are the challenges to our cultural practices in the name of secularism?" in the Civil Services Mains exam. The General Studies Paper 1 reportedly also had questions like "What makes Indian society unique in sustaining its culture?" and "Did Indian renaissance play a role in the emergence of national identity?"

column2: Video of Delhi priest dancing on 'Kudukku' song goes viral
column3: A video of 31-year-old Delhi priest, Father Mathew Kizhackechira, has gone viral on social media where he can be seen dancing on 'Kudukku' song from Malayalam actor Nivin Pauly’s movie 'Love Action Drama'. The video, shared by the actor himself, has garnered over 2.8 lakh views on Instagram. The whole dance number was an impromptu jig, Father Mathew said.

column2: 4 Karnataka league cricketers summoned over match-fixing suspicion
column3: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) has summoned four cricketers who participated in the Karnataka Premier League (KPL) in relation to a match-fixing scandal. The players were allegedly in touch with Belagavi Panthers' owner Ali Asfak Thara who has already been questioned by the CCB. Bengaluru's Joint Commissioner of Police Sandeep Patil said that a detailed investigation was required.

column2: Google tests incognito mode for Maps
column3: Google is testing the 'incognito mode' for Maps and may roll out the feature soon. The technology giant had announced the feature at its annual developer conference earlier this year, among other privacy-focused tools. The mode will let users search for places or navigate to them without the activity being saved to their Google accounts.

column2: Won't forget sacrifice by disqualified JD(S), Cong MLAs: BJP
column3: The BJP will not forget the sacrifice made by disqualified Congress and JD(S) MLAs, Karnataka Revenue Minister and BJP leader R Ashoka said. Resignations by a few Congress and JD(S) MLAs brought down the Congress-JD(S) coalition government in Karnataka in July. The MLAs were disqualified by the then Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar till the expiry of the Assembly term.

column2: PoK wouldn’t have existed if Nehru hadn't declared ceasefire: Shah
column3: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday said that Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) would not have come into existence had former PM Jawaharlal Nehru not declared an untimely ceasefire with Pakistan. Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel should have handled Kashmir instead of Nehru, he added. Shah also said that revocation of Article 370 in J&K was BJP's desire to keep the country undivided.

column2: Pepperfry planning IPO in 12-15 months: Co-founder Ambareesh Murty
column3: Pepperfry is planning an Initial Public Offering (IPO) in 12-15 months, Co-founder Ambareesh Murty said. "The company is on a clear path to full-year profitability by FY21 though we will get very close to being profitable by this October itself," Murty said. Established in 2012, Pepperfry has so far raised about $200 million from investors including Goldman Sachs.

column2: Uber sues New York City for capping drivers' cruising time
column3: Uber is suing New York City, seeking to halt a new rule limiting the time ride-hail drivers can spend cruising in parts of Manhattan without passengers. Uber argued the rule, capping roaming ratio at 31% of driving time by July, would "threaten the viability" of ridesharing. NYC has also banned the issuance of new licences to for-hire vehicles until August.

column2: Chinese delegation cancels goodwill visit to US farms
column3: Chinese officials in the US for trade talks cancelled their goodwill visit to farms in Montana and Nebraska. Reports earlier claimed an interim deal could be reached, involving China resuming purchase of US farm goods. However, US President Donald Trump later said he wants a "complete trade deal" and not just an agreement for China to buy American agricultural goods.

column2: Italian brand Marni showcases its collection at Milan Fashion Week
column3: Italian brand Marni on Friday showcased its Spring/Summer 2020 collection at the Milan Fashion Week, the fabric of which was made from recycled plastic and organic cotton. The guests at the show were sitting on recompressed-cardboard benches, under the trees which were made out of recycled plastic bottles. The show featured models walking in flip-flops wearing long colourful dresses.

column2: India's Petronet signs MoU with US firm Tellurian to buy LNG
column3: State-run Petronet has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with US-based Tellurian to import up to five million tonnes per annum of liquefied natural gas (LNG). As per the deal, Petronet will make an equity investment, of reportedly $2.5 billion, in Tellurian's Driftwood project in Louisiana. The companies said they'll endeavour to finalise the transaction agreement by March 31, 2020.

column2: US corporate sector hails India's move to cut tax rate for companies
column3: The US corporate sector hailed the government for reducing income tax rate to 25.17%, adding that it would help uplift the economic slowdown. It added that this would allow global companies a 'good option' for growing their manufacturing base in the country. The government cut the income tax rate for companies by almost 10 percentage points to 25.17% on Friday.

column2: Secretly brought my wife to stay with me in boys' hostel: Pankaj
column3: Actor Pankaj Tripathi has revealed he secretly brought his wife to stay with him in the boys' hostel of National School of Drama as he got married before finishing his course. He added that when the boys got to know, they were very helpful. However, Pankaj revealed the warden soon learnt about it and asked him when he'd be shifting.

column2: Had threesomes with ex-husband to show I could be fun, regret it: Demi
column3: Hollywood actress Demi Moore has revealed in her book that she had two threesomes with ex-husband Ashton Kutcher as she "wanted to show him how great and fun [she] could be". She added that she regrets them as Ashton used them as an excuse to cheat on her. Demi, 15 years older to Ashton, got divorced from him in 2013.

column2: Yuvraj once in a lifetime player, BCCI should retire his jersey: Gambhir
column3: Former India opener Gautam Gambhir has said that the BCCI should retire Yuvraj Singh's jersey number 12 for his performance in the 2007 T20 World Cup and in the 2011 World Cup. "It will be a fitting tribute to a once-in-a-lifetime cricketer," Gambhir added. Yuvraj retired from international and BCCI cricket on June 10.

column2: I did not know ICC rules: CoA chief Vinod Rai on Dhoni's balidaan badge
column3: Talking about the controversy surrounding MS Dhoni sporting the 'balidaan' (sacrifice) badge in 2019 World Cup, CoA chief Vinod Rai said he didn't know the ICC had rules about what one can put on their gloves. "Then I was shown 11 pages of ICC norms...So we had to withdraw. It was a genuine oversight by me," he added.

column2: Thought selling fashion online was a stupid idea: Jabong Co-founder
column3: Manu Kumar Jain, who co-founded Jabong in 2011, in a recent podcast said that his first thought on selling fashion online was that it was a "stupid idea". He said he was surprised that people were willing to buy shoes and clothes online. He quit Jabong in 2014 and is currently Global VP of Xiaomi and MD of Xiaomi India.

column2: French startup's 'water taxi' pulled over by police during tests
column3: A 'water taxi' developed by French startup SeaBubbles was pulled over by police in Paris during its tests over concerns that it was going too fast. "Our vehicle has the right to go at 30 kmph when normally the speed limit on the river is 12 kmph," SeaBubbles Co-founder Anders Bringdal said. "They just checked our paperwork," he added.

column2: Hardest are days when I dream of you: Mufti's daughter on Daughter's Day
column3: Iltija, the daughter of detained former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti, took to her mother's Twitter account to share her childhood picture on the occasion of Daughter's Day. "It’s been 48 days since you were taken from us. Hardest are days when I dream of you & wake up with an agonising pain in my heart," she wrote.

column2: Pak should not commit mistake of repeating 1965 and 1971: Rajnath
column3: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Sunday said, "Pakistan shouldn't commit the mistake of repeating 1965 and 1971." "If they repeat it, then they should think what will happen to Pakistan-occupied Kashmir," he further said. Adding that Pakistan is already getting discouraged, Singh also said, "Pakistan PM Imran Khan comes to PoK and says countrymen don't go to India-Pakistan border."

column2: Pakistani fake social media handles using KBC to trap people: Govt
column3: Security agencies have discovered that Pakistan-based operatives are attempting to use the popularity of Kaun Banega Crorepati (KBC) to trap individuals through fake social media handles. "It has been reported by cyber cell, Ministry of Defence that adversaries are...making individuals join WhatsApp groups and sending fake KBC messages," a security advisory issued by the Defence Ministry said.

column2: Suspect in 1985 hijacking of US aircraft arrested in Greece
column3: A 65-year-old Lebanese man suspected of involvement in the hijacking of a US aircraft in 1985 has been arrested in Greece. The plane's 153 passengers and crew members were kept as hostages for 17 days. Two years after the hijacking, the suspect was reportedly arrested in Germany but was later exchanged with two Germans who had been abducted in Beirut.

column2: Iranian held by Somali pirates since 2015 freed
column3: Mohammad Sharif Panahandeh who was among 21 crew members of a boat hijacked in March 2015, has been released by Somali pirates. "This guy was dying, he looked like a skeleton," a former British army officer who helped negotiate his release said. Eight of the hostages died, five escaped, and Iran freed four last year.

column2: 10 killed as truck loses control, rams into crowd in China
column3: Ten people were killed and 16 others were injured after a truck lost control and rammed into a crowd at a traditional market in China on Sunday. The truck was coming down an incline when the driver lost control in Huashi town in Hunan province, police said. The driver has been taken into custody and investigation is underway.

column2: I don't think creativity can be a race: Alia Bhatt
column3: Actress Alia Bhatt has said that she is very competitive by nature but she doesn't believe creativity can be a race. "Then you are maligning, or kind of bringing down the value of creativity," she added. "Whatever number you are - 1st, 12th or 14th, you'll be remembered for the content you put out there," she further said.

column2: Facebook picks 6 winners for Ethics in AI research awards in India
column3: Facebook has chosen six projects from India as winners of its 'Ethics in AI' research awards held in June with a regional focus of India. The project winners, declared on Friday, focused on areas like governance, cultural diversity and operationalising ethics. The project was open to academic institutions, think tanks, and research organisations registered and operational in India.

column2: Facebook buys Israeli hybrid chatbot startup Servicefriend
column3: Facebook has acquired Israel-based hybrid chatbot startup Servicefriend, to reportedly build customer service bots for its planned digital wallet 'Calibra'. Co-founded in 2015 by Ido Arad and Shahar Ben Ami, the startup provides hybrid AI-based bot technology to enterprises for the purpose of customer service. The co-founders have apparently joined Facebook within the Calibra group.

column2: Mu Sigma to pay $2.5 million to settle US visa case
column3: Analytics firm Mu Sigma has agreed to pay $2.5 million in an out-of-court settlement in a visa fraud dispute. It was found that the firm was circumventing US visa regulations by flying in Indian employees on a B-1 visitor visa and misrepresenting the nature of their intended visit to the US. The investigation began in 2013 following a whistleblower's tip-off.

column2: Fintech startup Hotfoot raises $250,000 from angel investors
column3: Chennai-based fintech startup Hotfoot has raised $250,000 in a funding round from a group of angel investors. Founded in 2016, the startup offers solutions to enable end-to-end digital processing of different types of loans. Hotfoot said it plans to raise funding in the next pre-Series A round by July-August 2020.

column2: Mulayam Singh to lose his Mercedes SUV after bungalow
column3: Former Uttar Pradesh CM and Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav will reportedly lose his government-alloted Mercedes SUV after losing the bungalow allotted to him. "Our budget doesn't allow us...so we'll give another suitable car...to him," an official said. "Government can spend crores of rupees in publicity...[T]his proves that BJP is pursuing politics of vendetta," an SP leader said.

column2: J'khand court awards death sentence to man for raping 4-year-old
column3: A special POCSO court in Jharkhand's Giridih on Saturday awarded death sentence to a man who was found guilty of raping and killing a four-year-old girl. In the same case, the court gave life sentence to his father. Reportedly, the victim was raped in March last year and was strangulated to death and her body was dumped in a field.

column2: Married women happier than those in live-in: RSS-linked group
column3: Findings in a survey conducted by Pune-based RSS-linked organisation Drishti Stree Adhyayan Prabodhan Kendra have reportedly claimed that married women are happier than those in live-in relationships. RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat will reportedly release the survey on Tuesday, after his interaction with foreign media. Bhagwat's interaction with foreign media is a routine exercise, an official said.

column2: Bella Hadid walks the ramp for Missoni at Milan Fashion Week
column3: Model Bella Hadid on Saturday evening walked for the brand Missoni at the Milan Fashion Week. The 22-year-old model wore a multicoloured crop top with a matching unbuttoned shirt and paired it with a floral printed skirt. She also wore multicoloured slip-on shoes in contrast to her skirt and accessorised her look with a thin necklace.

column2: There has been a lot of speculation, but Salman is a true friend: Katrina
column3: Katrina Kaif, on being asked about her equation with Salman Khan at India Today Conclave 2019, said, "It's a friendship that has lasted 16 years, he's a true friend." "He's a...person who's there for you when you need him," she added. "I know there has been a lot of speculation...but...bottom line is he's a true friend," Katrina further said.

column2: I cried when homosexuality was decriminalised in India: Karan
column3: Filmmaker Karan Johar has revealed at India Today Conclave 2019 that he cried on the day homosexuality was decriminalised in India when parts of Section 377 were scrapped. "There was finally freedom...That particular day, 6th of September, was ironically my father's birthday," he said. "The next step is gay marriages are allowed in our country," Karan further said.

column2: Arjuna awardee rally driver's car kills 3 during National Championship
column3: Three people, including a minor, were killed after Arjuna awardee rally driver Gaurav Gill's car hit a motorcycle during a FMSCI Indian National Rally Championship race on Saturday. Gill, who sustained injuries in his ribs and is also facing respiratory problems due to the crash, is reportedly out of danger. Those killed broke the barricade and entered the track.

column2: Hospitality has subjective issues like sheets' whiteness: OYO CEO
column3: OYO Founder and CEO Ritesh Agarwal, commenting on customer complaints about the quality of properties and services, said, "We've had our fair share of learnings. In hospitality, there are some tough and subjective issues - the whiteness of the sheets and even water temperature." The 25-year-old added that OYO accepts the issues and is ready to resolve them and change.

column2: Jaish facility hit by India in Balakot fully functional again: Report
column3: Almost seven months after Indian Air Force jets bombed the Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) terrorist facility in Pakistan's Balakot, the group has revived the complex and is training 40 jihadists, according to a report. "We have reports about Jaish fidayeen waiting for lifting of telecom restrictions in J&K to infiltrate and launch attacks," the report quoted a national security official as saying.

column2: Indian-origin chef Kiran Verma to prepare 'NaMo Thalis' for PM in US
column3: Indian-origin chef Kiran Verma will prepare special meals for PM Narendra Modi, which would be offered during his visit to the US for 74th session of the United Nations General Assembly. There will be two thalis, NaMo Thali which will include methi thepla, dal and khichdi, and NaMo Mithai Thali, which has gajar halwa, rasmalai, shrikhand, gulab jamun and kheer.

column2: Kashmiri Pandit kisses PM Modi's hand to thank him for Article 370 move
column3: A Kashmiri Pandit kissed PM Narendra Modi's hand in the US to thank him for revoking Article 370. "Thank you on behalf of 7 lakh Kashmiri Pandits," the man said. PM Modi, who arrived in the US on Saturday, also interacted with the members of the Sikh and Dawoodi Bohra communities. "Howdy Houston!" PM Modi tweeted following his arrival.

column2: PM bends to pick up flower that fell from bouquet presented to him
column3: A video shows PM Narendra Modi bending to pick up a flower that fell from a bouquet presented to him at George Bush Intercontinental Airport in US' Houston. PM Modi was received by US Ambassador to India Ken Juster and Indian Ambassador to the US Harsh Shringla among other officials. "Honoured to welcome PM Narendra Modi to Houston," Juster tweeted.

column2: College official made sexual advances, promised good marks: Andhra girl
column3: Alleging sexual harassment against an Andhra Pradesh nursing college correspondent, a female student has lodged a complaint with the police. "The correspondent made sexual advances towards me and promised me of good grades and placement in a private hospital," the 22-year-old student said. "Students with a poor background and those from lower caste are his soft targets," she added.

column2: Anchor calls Aaditya Thackeray Rahul Gandhi of Shiv Sena; says I regret it
column3: News anchor Anjana Om Kashyap tweeted after she called Aaditya Thackeray Rahul Gandhi of Shiv Sena on live TV. "I regret it. This, by no means, reflects the views of the channel or the network," she tweeted. Reacting to her tweet, a user wrote, "And the amount of malice, you spread for Rahul Gandhi, you never regret?"

column2: UP constable fires shots in air after dhaba owner tells him food is over
