She said there's already an RBI circular regarding the same. She also announced that banks will hold 'shamiana' meetings in 400 districts to disburse loans to retail customers and MSMEs.

column2: BJP's Chinmayanand admitted getting naked massage from UP law student: SIT
column3: Naveen Arora, the chief of Special Investigation Team (SIT) probing the Chinmayanand case, has said the BJP leader admitted to almost every allegation levelled against him by the UP law student. He added the allegations include sexual conversations and naked body massage. "Chinmayanand said he doesn't want to say more as he is ashamed of his acts," Arora added.

column2: US woman's blood turns navy blue after taking pain relief medicine
column3: A US woman's blood turned navy blue after she took a pain relief medicine following a toothache. The woman was treated with an antidote, methylene blue, at a hospital. Doctors said the condition had been triggered by benzocaine. She was given a second dose and spent the night in the hospital for observation before being sent home the next morning.

column2: Step to cut corporate tax is historic: PM Narendra Modi
column3: After Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced lowering of corporate tax rate to 22% for firms that do not avail any exemptions, PM Narendra Modi called the move "historic". "It will give a great stimulus to Make in India, attract private investment from across the globe, improve competitiveness of our private sector [and] create more jobs," PM Modi tweeted.

column2: Google adds animations for Friends characters for 25th anniversary
column3: Google has added 'Easter Egg' animations to celebrate popular television series Friends' 25th anniversary. Clicking on the icons in front of the main characters' names, shown after searching, reveals the animations. Searching 'Friends glossary' shows terms significant to the show, including "unagi", "phalange", "transponster" and "Joey's apple", along with their meanings and a quote from the show.

column2: Kangana undergoes prosthetic measurements for Jayalalithaa's biopic
column3: Kangana Ranaut's team on Friday shared pictures of the actress undergoing prosthetic measurements at Jason Collins' studio in US' Los Angeles for Jayalalithaa's biopic titled 'Thalaivi'. "Jason has previously worked for Captain Marvel creating prosthesis for Brie Larson. Needless to say, Jayalalithaa's biopic will definitely be something mind blowing," her team wrote.

column2: We'll soar high if Pak stoops low by raising Kashmir at UN: India
column3: When asked whether he expected Pakistan to raise the Kashmir issue at the UN General Assembly session, Indian Ambassador to the UN Syed Akbaruddin stated, "Our response to them is we soar high. They may stoop low, we soar high." Akbaruddin said, "We've seen them mainstream terrorism...they now want to mainstream hate-speech," adding, "Poison pens don't work for too long."

column2: Pak PM can't accept J&K developing again: Indian envoy in op-ed
column3: In an op-ed in The New York Times, Indian Ambassador to the US Harsh Vardhan Shringla has written that Pakistani PM Imran Khan finds it difficult to accept Kashmir is back on the road to progress following the repeal of Article 370. Pakistan has vested interests in preventing prosperity so it can use terrorism as a political tool, Shringla added.

column2: Apple prepones iOS 13.1, iPadOS release by 6 days to September 24
column3: Apple has shifted the launch date of its iOS 13.1 update and iPadOS from September 30 to September 24. Apple, which launched iOS 13 worldwide yesterday, likely did so after several iPhone 11 reviewers notified it of buggy behaviour in iOS 13, reports claimed. The 13.1 update will include ETA sharing in Maps and automated Siri Shortcut actions.

column2: BJP leader Chinmayanand sent to 14-day judicial custody
column3: BJP leader Swami Chinmayanand was sent to 14-day judicial custody by a court after his arrest on Friday. Uttar Pradesh DGP OP Singh stated, "There has been no delay in the case. We have also arrested three people over extortion threats to Swami Chinmayanand." Chinmayanand has been accused of rape and blackmail by a 23-year-old law student.

column2: Doorstep alcohol delivery by startup HipBar banned in Karnataka
column3: The Karnataka High Court has banned online sale and home delivery of alcoholic beverages in the state by India's first legal alcohol home delivery startup HipBar. The social stigma attached to it as far as the family and society are concerned cannot be lost sight of, Justice S Sujatha said. A petition filed by the Chennai-based startup was also dismissed.

column2: Poisoned pens don't work for too long: Indian envoy to UN on Pak
column3: In a veiled reference to Pakistan, India's Ambassador and Permanent Representative to the United Nations, Syed Akbaruddin said, "Poisoned pens do not work for too long." "It's for every country to determine its trajectory, how it wants to approach global platforms," he added. His remarks come ahead of PM Narendra Modi and Pakistan PM Imran Khan's address at the UN.

column2: Supriyo shares pic of accused who beat him up at Jadavpur University
column3: Union Minister Babul Supriyo, who was allegedly beaten up and heckled by students at Jadavpur University, shared a picture of the accused who allegedly "led the assault". "We will find him out and then see what [West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee] does to him in terms of charging him for assault without ANY PROVOCATION whatsoever from our/my side," Supriyo tweeted.

column2: Pak activist who highlighted Army's abuses flees to US after threats
column3: Gulalai Ismail, the Pakistani human rights activist who highlighted the abuses committed by Pakistan's military, has fled to the US following threats to her and her family. She had also spoken about the abuses suffered by Pakistani women, including forced marriages and honour killings. Ismail is accused of "anti-state activities" and "inciting violence".

column2: Indonesians oppose law criminalising consensual sex outside marriage
column3: Indonesians have signed a petition opposing a law that criminalises consensual sex outside marriage. A maximum one-year prison term can be applied to a person who has sex with someone who is not their spouse. There would also be a maximum four-year prison term for women who have an abortion, applicable if there is no medical emergency or rape involved.

column2: It's bigger than last 20 budgets: Fund manager Samir Arora on tax cuts
column3: After the government reduced the effective corporate tax rate to 25.2% from about 35%, Singapore-based fund manager and Helios Capital Founder Samir Arora tweeted, "This is not bigger than budget, this is bigger than last 20 budgets." Billionaire Uday Kotak called it a "big bang reform". Biocon Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw said the move will firmly revive growth and investment.

column2: I couldn't provide for my family when I left Delhi: Piyush Mishra
column3: Actor Piyush Mishra, who starred in 'Gangs of Wasseypur', said that after doing theatre for 20 years in Delhi, he was exhausted. "When I left from here, I was completely broken....I couldn't provide for my family...Aaj ki tareek mein main sampann hoon," he added. Commenting on his return to acting in theatre, he said that his confidence has gone.

column2: You amaze me every single day: Alia on dad Mahesh Bhatt's b'day
column3: On her father Mahesh Bhatt's 71st birthday today, Alia Bhatt shared throwback pictures of them together and wished him, "Hey pops. It's been great knowing you for the last 26 years...you're a good guy...also you're very funny." "Did I tell you I think you're super talented too? Happy Birthday Daddy. You amaze me every single day...I love you," she added.

column2: UAE's Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque has world's largest hand-woven carpet
column3: The Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque located in Abu Dhabi, UAE, has the world's largest hand-woven carpet measuring 5,630 square metres. It is the largest mosque in the UAE, which covers an area of more than 12 hectares and can accommodate 40,000 worshippers at one time. The mosque, which has over 80 domes, houses several crystal and gold gilded chandeliers.

column2: Will construct Ram temple not of stones but gold: Hindu Mahasabha
column3: Swami Chakrapani of Hindu Mahasabha said that if the Ayodhya verdict comes in favour of the Hindus, a Ram temple "not of stones and bricks but of gold" will be constructed. He added that Hindus from all over the world will contribute. This comes after CJI Ranjan Gogoi said that hearings are likely to be completed by October 18.

column2: PETA praises Air India's proposal to serve low-fat meals
column3: People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals (PETA) has praised Air India for its proposal to serve its crew cost-effective low-fat meals. In a letter to Air India, PETA has urged the airline to serve vegan meals to its crew members and passengers on all flights. PETA added that such a move would support government's Eat Right India initiative.

column2: Difference with Centre not on PoK, but on Article 370: Tharoor
column3: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor said that he doesn't differ with Centre's stand on Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) issue. "Pakistan has no right on the PoK and they've given the territory to China which does not belong to them," he added. He further said that the way Article 370 was revoked in Jammu and Kashmir, violated the spirit of the Constitution.

column2: BJP's Chinmayanand, accused of raping UP law student, arrested
column3: Police have arrested BJP leader Swami Chinmayanand, who has been accused of rape and blackmail by a law student in Uttar Pradesh. The 23-year-old student had given her statement to a Special Investigation Team (SIT) and also submitted a pen drive containing videos as evidence. Earlier, Chinmayanand was treated by doctors after he complained of uneasiness.

column2: Shooting on streets near White House in US, several people injured
column3: Several people have been injured in a shooting on the streets of Washington DC, not far from the White House, reports said. Citing police, local media reported that six people were injured in the incident. The local media also posted images on Twitter of ambulances carrying victims from the scene and said that there had been a "massive" police response.

column2: SP Jain Global 12th in Forbes' list of top int'l 1-yr MBA programs
column3: SP Jain's Global MBA program climbed four places to be ranked #12 in Forbes' latest ranking of the world's top 1-year international MBA programs. SP Jain is one of two Indian-origin schools to feature in the top 15 this year. SP Jain has campuses in Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, and Sydney.

column2: Govt proposes to cut corporate tax rate for domestic firms: Sitharaman
column3: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Friday proposed to reduce corporate tax rates for domestic companies and new manufacturing companies ahead of the 37th GST Council Meeting. She added domestic companies would have option to pay income tax at 22% if they don't avail any exemptions or incentives from financial year 2020. This is being done to promote growth, she stated.

column2: Shanker Basu appointed RCB strength and conditioning coach
column3: Former Team India trainer Shanker Basu has been appointed as the strength and conditioning coach of Royal Challengers Bangalore. Apart from Basu, Adam Griffith has been appointed the bowling coach, Sridharan Sriram has been named the batting and spin bowling coach and Evan Speechly has been appointed the physio. Earlier, RCB had named Mike Hesson as director of cricket operations.

column2: Apple activates Watch ECG, irregular heart rhythm feature in India
column3: Apple has activated two new health-related options, ECG and irregular heart rhythm detection, for its Apple Watch Series 4 users in India with the watchOS 6 update. First announced in September 2018, the two options were released only in the US in December 2018, after clearance by the US FDA. The Apple Watch Series 5 will ship with the features.

column2: Disney might have merged with Apple if Steve Jobs were alive: CEO
column3: Walt Disney CEO Bob Iger wrote in a Vanity Fair article, "I believe that if Steve [Jobs] were still alive, we would've combined our companies or at least discussed the possibility very seriously." Iger added that the late Apple Co-founder had disclosed his cancer to him and offered a choice to back out of Pixar acquisition. Jobs died in 2011.

column2: Guv went there without telling govt: TMC on Jadavpur varsity incident
column3: TMC has criticised West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar for visiting the Jadavpur University without informing the state government after BJP leader and Union Minister Babul Supriyo was allegedly heckled by students there. Calling it "most unfortunate and shocking", the party said that even Supriyo went to the university to attend an ABVP-organised event without informing the government.

column2: Delhi BJP leader slaps ex-Mayor wife, removed from party post
column3: Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari has removed party's Mehrauli District President Azad Singh from his post after he slapped his wife, an ex-South Delhi Mayor, at the party office. The incident took place after a meeting related to upcoming elections with Union Minister Prakash Javadekar. Party leaders said the two have been involved in a marital discord for many years.

column2: Ratan Tata-backed Upstox raises $25 million from Tiger Global
column3: Mumbai-based online stockbroking platform Upstox has raised $25 million in its second round of institutional funding from American hedge fund Tiger Global Management. Backed by Kalaari Capital and Chairman Emeritus of Tata Sons Ratan Tata, Upstox had raised around $4 million in last institutional round in 2016. It was founded by Ravi Kumar and Shrini Viswanath.

column2: Airbnb announces it is planning to go public next year
column3: US-based home-sharing rental platform Airbnb has announced that it plans to go public during 2020. "We have already said that we're taking the steps to be ready to go public in 2019...doesn't mean we'll go public in 2019," Co-founder Nathan Blecharczyk had said in March. Airbnb was last privately valued at $31 billion in September 2017, according to PitchBook.

column2: Criminal probe on vaping after 530 illness cases, 7 deaths in US
column3: The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has opened a criminal investigation into the vaping supply chain following reports of vaping-related lung illness. FDA said over 530 people have been affected and seven deaths have been attributed to the illness so far. Symptoms of the illness, the cause of which remains unknown, include coughing, shortness of breath, vomiting, among others.

column2: 1 killed, 5 injured in shooting near White House
column3: One person was killed and five others wounded in a shooting on the streets of Washington DC, not far from the White House, police said. Police have not apprehended a suspect and do not know the motive behind the shooting, said Metropolitan Police commander Stuart Emerman. He added it is not an active shooting situation.

column2: Gas-like smell reported in parts of Mumbai; 9 fire tenders deployed
column3: Citizens from several areas across Mumbai complained of gas-like smell on Thursday night, following which BMC deployed nine fire tenders to find the source of the smell. Meanwhile, Mahanagar Gas Limited said that they have deployed an emergency team, adding, "So far we haven't come across any breach in our pipeline system which could result in leakage of gas."

column2: Salman's sister Arpita, husband Aayush expecting second child
column3: At the 20th IIFA Awards held in Mumbai on Wednesday, actor Aayush Sharma, who is married to Salman Khan's sister Arpita Khan Sharma, confirmed that they're expecting their second child. "The new arrival is very exciting. Yes, Arpita and me [sic] are expecting a second baby," Aayush told the media. The couple has a 3-year-old son named Ahil.

column2: 'Kaho Naa... Pyaar Hai' named Best Film in 20 years at IIFA 2019
column3: Rakesh Roshan was named the IIFA BIG 20 Award Winner for Best Picture for 'Kaho Naa... Pyaar Hai' at the 20th International Indian Film Academy Awards (IIFA). IIFA BIG 20 Award Winner for Best Performance In A Leading Role went to Ranbir Kapoor (Male) and Deepika Padukone (Female). Rajkumar Hirani won the IIFA BIG 20 Award for Best Director.

column2: Gun violence cost the US $229 billion per year: Report
column3: Gun violence cost the US $229 billion annually, amounting for 1.4% of its GDP, a report commissioned by Congressional Democrats said. While lost income was cited by the report as the biggest cost, other expenses included employer costs, police and criminal justice responses and health care treatment. There were reportedly 40,331 gun violence-related incidents this year as of Wednesday.

column2: I'm not cut out for that life: Akshaye Khanna on marriage, having kids
column3: Actor Akshaye Khanna, while sharing his views on marriage and having children, said, "I'm not cut out for that life; for sharing my life. Whether it's getting married, or having kids." Everything important to you becomes less important, because the child gains utmost importance. Those kind of alterations...are not the things I want to do," he added.

column2: Deepika shares meme comparing her IIFA Awards 2019 outfit to a mop
column3: Actress Deepika Padukone on Thursday shared a meme which compared the outfit worn by her at the 2019 IIFA Awards to a mop. The actress had worn a custom made purple gown along with a veil by designer Gaurav Gupta. "Close enough," the meme said to which Deepika reacted with 'ROFL' on her Instagram story.

column2: Hope to find women who gave us free burgers when I was 11: Ronaldo
column3: Cristiano Ronaldo, in an interview, said he wants to find the three women who used to give him and his friends free burgers when he was 11. Ronaldo, who left his hometown to play football at 11, added the women helped him when he had no money. "I want to invite them to have dinner with me," the 34-year-old added.

column2: Man Utd beat Astana in Europa League as 17-yr-old Greenwood sets record
column3: Manchester United defeated Kazakhstan's Astana 1-0 in their Europa League Group L opener at Old Trafford on Thursday. Striker Mason Greenwood scored the only goal of the match, becoming Manchester United's youngest-ever goalscorer in European competitions at the age of 17 years and 353 days. Meanwhile, Arsenal defeated Eintracht 3-0 in their Europa League opener.

column2: Yuvraj shares throwback pics, says never thought he'd hit 6 sixes in a row
column3: Ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh took to Twitter to share throwback pictures of himself on the 12th anniversary of his six sixes in a row. In one picture, a young Yuvraj can be seen playing cricket inside a house. "12 years! Never thought I will hit 6 in a row. Although started practicing very early...special memory. 666666," he captioned the pictures.

column2: Who is Air Marshal RKS Bhadauria, Indian Air Force's 26th chief?
column3: Air Marshal RKS Bhadauria, who hails from Uttar Pradesh, will take over as 26th Chief of the Air Staff. Bhadauria was commissioned in fighter stream of IAF on June 15, 1980. He has over 4,250 hours of flying experience on 26 types of fighters and transport aircraft. He was the Chairman of India's negotiating team for the Rafale deal.

column2: Delhi policeman gives pistol to daughter to practise, suspended
column3: Delhi Police Reserve Inspector Dinesh Kumar was suspended after a video purportedly showing Kumar handing his service pistol to his daughter in North West District police line shooting range surfaced online. The video reportedly shows Kumar in uniform while his daughter takes aim and shoots with the service pistol. "It is a dereliction of duty," said DCP Vijayanta Goyal Arya.

column2: US cuts $160 million in funding to Afghanistan over corruption
column3: The US has cut $160 million in funding to Afghanistan, citing high levels of corruption in the Afghan government and financial mismanagement. The fund of $100 million was intended for an energy infrastructure project in Afghanistan, while $60 million was earmarked for planned assistance. The US said it would complete the project but would do so using an "off-budget" mechanism.

column2: Tunisia's ex-Prez Ben Ali, whose ouster sparked Arab Spring, dies
column3: Zine El-Abidine Ben Ali, the former Tunisian President whose ouster in 2011 triggered the Arab Spring, died in exile in Saudi Arabia at the age of 83. Ben Ali came to power in 1987 after overthrowing then-President Habib Bourguiba in a coup. He took over as head of military security in 1964 and as head of national security in 1977.

column2: TRAI may defer scrapping call connect fee, Vodafone Idea stock up 12%
column3: Vodafone Idea shares rose 12% on Thursday after TRAI floated a consultation paper to review the January 1 deadline for telecom operators to end Interconnect Usage Charges. An operator pays the charges to a rival network for connecting calls of its subscribers. Airtel and Vodafone Idea, which have higher incoming than outgoing traffic, will benefit if the scrapping is deferred.

column2: India says it meets criteria for trade benefits that US removed
column3: Foreign Secretary Vijay Gokhale on Thursday said India meets the criteria for trade concessions that the US eliminated in June. The US removed India from the Generalized System of Preferences (GSP) programme that allowed duty-free entry for $5.6 billion worth of its exports to the US. The US should take a call on reinstating the trade privileges, Gokhale added.

column2: It'll not take Smith long to be the captain again: Ponting
column3: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting said that once the captaincy ban of batsman Steve Smith ends, it'll not take long for him to be named as the team's captain again. "I don't know what the Australian public might think about that," he added. Steve Smith was banned for two years from captaincy for his role in the 2018 ball-tampering scandal.

column2: Don't know how Virat bhaiya scores these many runs: Deepak Chahar
column3: Fast bowler Deepak Chahar praised India captain Virat Kohli by calling him a "next level player". "I don't know how Virat bhaiya manages to score these many runs and that too with such consistency," the 27-year-old added. Virat Kohli became the highest run-scorer in T20I cricket after scoring 72*(52) in the second T20I against South Africa on Wednesday.

column2: UP progressing at bullock-cart speed: Akhilesh Yadav
column3: After Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath claimed that the state has seen development during his tenure so far, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said UP is developing at snail's pace. "The pace of development is not that of a double-engine machine but of a bullock cart," he added. "The UP government is making false claims and celebrating," Yadav further said.

column2: Wipro Consumer Care launches venture fund to invest in startups
column3: Wipro Consumer Care and Lighting, Wipro Enterprises' FMCG brand, has announced the launch of a venture fund to invest in start-ups in the consumers brand space called Wipro Consumer Care - Ventures. The company has appointed former Wipro General Manager Sumit Keshan as the Managing Partner of the fund. The fund will invest in companies in India and Southeast Asia.

column2: Israeli PM Netanyahu calls on rival Gantz to form unity govt
column3: Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu on Thursday called on his challenger Benjamin "Benny" Gantz to form a unity government after no clear winner emerged from the September 17 polls. Gantz's party stood at 33 seats in Israel's 120-seat Parliament while Netanyahu's party stood at 31 seats. Israel held its second election after Netanyahu failed to form a government after April polls.

column2: Many options short of war with Iran: Trump after Saudi attacks
column3: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday said there were many options short of war with Iran after drone attacks on Saudi Arabia's oil facilities. Saudi Arabia displayed remnants of drones and missiles it said were used in the attacks, describing them as evidence of Iran's involvement. Trump recently ordered the US Treasury to "substantially" increase the sanctions on Iran.

column2: Taliban truck bomb kills at least 20 in Afghanistan
column3: At least 20 people were killed and 95 wounded after a Taliban-led bomb explosion took place in a truck near a hospital in southern Afghanistan on Thursday. The casualties are expected to rise as rescuers sift through the rubble, an official said. Taliban claimed the target of the attack was the nearby building of the government's intelligence department.

column2: Nirav Modi remanded to custody in UK prison till October 17
column3: Fugitive diamantaire Nirav Modi was on Thursday remanded to judicial custody for another 28 days till October 17. Nirav has been lodged in London's Wandsworth prison since March in connection with the nearly $2 billion PNB fraud and money laundering case. The 48-year-old appeared through video-link before Westminster Magistrates' Court in London. His trial is expected for May 2020.

column2: 18 people jailed in Noida for forcefully stopping vehicles amid strike
column3: Eighteen people were jailed by the district administration in Noida for forcefully stopping vehicles and snatching keys during the strike by various transport associations on Thursday. The strike was held in Delhi-NCR against the hike in penalties under the new Motor Vehicles Act. Incidents of commuters being forcefully taken out from cabs and autorickshaws by protestors were also reported.

column2: Sunny, Karisma charged with pulling train's chain in 1997; file review plea
column3: Sunny Deol and Karisma Kapoor filed a 'review petition' in a District and Session Judge court in Jaipur on Thursday. They challenged the Railway Court's action on a case of alleged 'chain pulling' incident during the shooting of 'Bajrang' in 1997, which reportedly led to a delay by 25 minutes. The court has scheduled the next hearing for September 24.

column2: Film body provides aid to 92-yr-old composer who said he has no money
column3: The Indian Performing Right Society (IPRS) has come to the aid of 92-year-old music composer Vanraj Bhatia following reports about his financial situation. Headed by lyricist Javed Akhtar, the IPRS is a registered body which safeguards the rights of lyricists, music composers and music publishers in the country. Bhatia earlier said he has no rupee left in his bank account.

column2: I had mic in hand, junior had willow: Shastri shares Yuvraj's six 6s video
column3: On the 12th anniversary of former India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh's six sixes in an over, Team India head coach Ravi Shastri shared a video of the event. "12 years ago, I had microphone in my hand and junior had the willow. Relive the magic," Shastri captioned the video. Shastri was commentating in the match when Yuvraj set the record.

column2: Australia have got the best bowling attack in the world: Tim Paine
column3: Australia Test captain Tim Paine has said that Australia have got the best bowling attack in the world. “Last year we were a bit lost and were finding our way. I know we have found it now and I am confident this group is the beginning of a very exciting era in Australian cricket," he said about his team.

column2: Smith is a better Test batsman than Indian skipper Kohli: Panesar
column3: Spinner Monty Panesar has said that Australia batsman Steve Smith is a better Test batsman than Virat Kohli. "But if you take an overall package, especially limited-overs, Virat stands out. He is overall a world-class batsman. Virat is the best batsman in the world. Smith is the best Test batsman in the world," Panesar added.

column2: India-born Abu Dhabi billionaire to build film city in Kashmir
column3: Abu Dhabi-based billionaire BR Shetty has announced to build a film city spread across 12 square kilometres in Jammu and Kashmir. He had pledged $1 billion to J&K and $5 million towards New India Development Fund during PM Narendra Modi's visit to the UAE last month. Born in Karnataka, Shetty is the Founder of NMC Healthcare and fintech startup Finablr.

column2: Karnataka boy swims in drain after losing PUBG bet, video surfaces
column3: A video of a Karnataka boy swimming in a drain has surfaced. Reports said that the boy was confident about winning PUBG game and accepted the challenge by his friends of swimming in the drain if he lost the game. After the video surfaced, parents in Karnataka's Belagavi staged protests, demanding a ban on the online game.

column2: Andhra Pradesh govt bans private practice by government doctors
column3: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on Wednesday directed that private practice by government doctors be banned and they be financially compensated in lieu of the loss incurred. The decision was based on the recommendations of an expert committee on healthcare headed by Dr Sujatha Rao. The committee made over 100 recommendations in its report to CM Reddy.

column2: BJP MP Babul Supriyo heckled at Jadavpur University in Kolkata
column3: Union Minister Babul Supriyo was shown black flags and allegedly heckled by some students at Jadavpur University in Kolkata. Supriyo had gone to address a seminar organised by ABVP there. "I did not come here to do politics. But I am saddened by the behaviour of some of the students...They pulled me by my hair and pushed me," said Supriyo.

column2: Military strike on Iran would lead to all-out war: Foreign Minister
column3: Any US or Saudi military strike against Iran would lead to an "all-out war", Iran's Foreign Minister Javad Zarif said. "We don't want war, we don't want to engage in a military confrontation...But we won't blink to defend our territory," Zarif added. This comes after the US and Saudi Arabia blamed Iran for the drone attacks on Saudi oil facilities.

column2: US drone strike accidentally kills 30 pine nut farmers in Afghanistan
column3: A US drone strike intended to hit an Islamic State hideout accidentally killed at least 30 pine nut farmworkers in Afghanistan's Nangarhar province, officials said. The strike came as the farmers were resting after having finished collecting pine nuts. Around 150 workers were there for harvesting, with some missing after the strike, the owner of the pine nuts field said.

column2: Banks to erect shamianas in 400 districts to give out loans
column3: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said that state-run banks along with NBFCs will hold meetings in shamianas at public places to lend to retail customers. The meetings will take place till September 29 in 200 districts and from October 10-15 in another 200 districts. The banks have been told to bring five fresh customers for loans for every existing customer.

column2: PM Modi to meet BP, ExxonMobil executives in US next week
column3: The External Affairs Ministry on Thursday said Prime Minister Narendra Modi will meet executives from energy majors BP and ExxonMobil in the US next week to discuss investment opportunities. He will also attend a separate investment event with executives from JPMorgan Chase & Co, Lockheed Martin, Mastercard and Walmart. PM Modi will be visiting the US from September 21-27.

column2: Mohammed Azharuddin files nomination for HCA President post
column3: Former Team India captain Mohammed Azharuddin filed his nomination papers for the post of Hyderabad Cricket Association's (HCA) President today. Azharuddin, who is the first batsman to aggregate 9,000 ODI runs, was barred from contesting the election for the same post in 2017, citing lifetime ban for match-fixing by BCCI. The HCA will be holding the elections on September 27.

column2: People will target Sindhu at Olympics, they've year to plan: Coach
column3: Badminton coach Pullela Gopichand has said that PV Sindhu, who recently became the first Indian to win a gold at the World Championships, will be a strong contender for the gold medal at the 2020 Tokyo Olympics. "There is competition...it...just gets more for Sindhu because she will be the target, people have a year to plan against her," he added.

column2: Researchers create biometric tool to unlock smartphones with earbuds
column3: Researchers at the University of Buffalo in New York have developed a biometric tool for smartphones that would unlock them by using earbuds. The prototype, called EarEcho, uses wireless earbuds to authenticate smartphone users through the unique geometry of their ear canal. The user's smartphone will receive the sound signature from EarEcho through Bluetooth, the researchers said.

column2: Posters seeking ban on Digvijaya's entry in temples come up in MP
column3: Days after Congress leader Digvijaya Singh claimed that people wearing "saffron robes" were committing rapes, some posters came up in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal demanding a ban on his entry in temples. "This is an appeal of Hindu society that doors of temples should be closed for anti-Hindu Digvijaya Singh," a poster read. The poster also had Singh's photo on it.

column2: Odisha man sentenced to death for raping, killing 6-yr-old girl
column3: A man was sentenced to death by a special court in Odisha on Thursday for raping and killing a six-year-old girl in April 2018. The girl had reportedly gone to purchase biscuits on April 21, 2018, when the man raped and brutally assaulted her. This was the fourth death penalty given in last two months in Odisha by POCSO courts.

column2: Mongolian President Battulga arrives in India on State Visit
column3: President of Mongolia Khaltmaagiin Battulga arrived in India on Thursday for a 5-day State Visit till September 23, a first by a Mongolian President in last 10 years. He is expected to meet President Ram Nath Kovind and PM Narendra Modi on Friday. India and Mongolia had established a Strategic Partnership in 2015 during PM Modi's visit to Mongolia.

column2: BJP repeating Unnao case negligence in Chinmayanand case: Cong
column3: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Thursday alleged that the BJP and the Uttar Pradesh police are repeating the "negligence" shown in Unnao rape case in Chinmayanand case. Priyanka also accused the BJP and the UP police of "protecting" the accused in the two cases. A 23-year-old law student had accused BJP leader Swami Chinmayanand of rape and blackmail.

column2: Pompeo says attack on Saudi oil facilities was an 'act of war'
column3: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Wednesday said the drone attack on Saudi Arabia's oil facilities was an 'act of war' and Houthi's claim of it was inaccurate. "This was an Iranian attack... you can subcontract out the devastation... it doesn't change the fingerprints of the Ayatollah as having put at risk the global energy supply," he added.

column2: Chandrayaan-2 orbiter's performance satisfactory: ISRO
column3: Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) has released an official update on Chandrayaan-2. Orbiter continues to perform scheduled science experiments to complete satisfaction and performance of all orbiter payloads is satisfactory, it said. A National level committee consisting of academicians and ISRO experts are analysing the cause of communication loss with the lander, the statement added.

column2: Former Infosys CEO Vishal Sikka raises $50 mn for his AI startup
column3: Former Infosys CEO Vishal Sikka has said that his startup Vianai Systems raised $50 million from undisclosed investors. The startup's website says that it is looking at opportunities in design thinking and Artificial Intelligence (AI). The startup has several advisors including former SAP CEO Henning Kagermann and former PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi among others.

column2: Shivakumar sent to Tihar Jail after being discharged from hospital
column3: Congress leader DK Shivakumar, who has been accused in a money laundering case, was on Thursday sent to Tihar Jail after he was discharged from a hospital in Delhi. He has been reportedly lodged in the same jail compound as former Finance Minister P Chidambaram. A special CBI court had remanded Shivakumar to judicial custody till October 1 on Tuesday.

column2: Hyd man burnt alive on suspicion of killing woman with black magic
column3: A 24-year-old man was allegedly lynched and burnt alive in the outskirts of Hyderabad, on suspicion that he performed black magic. According to police, family members of Lakshmi, a woman who died on Tuesday due to ill health, suspected that B Anjaneyulu, an auto driver, had performed black magic on her and threw him into her burning pyre on Wednesday.

column2: PM Modi won't discuss Article 370 at UN: Foreign Secretary
column3: Foreign Secretary Vijay Gokhale said on Thursday that PM Narendra Modi won't discuss the issue of Article 370 at the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA), calling it an internal matter. "PM Modi will discuss development, climate change and several multilateral issues at UNGA," Gokhale added. "PM will present his vision about India's role at the international platform," Gokhale further said.

column2: I don't carry a wallet, keep cash to give tips at hotels: Trump
column3: US President Donald Trump said he doesn't carry a wallet but keeps cash in the back pocket of his trousers to give tips at hotels. "I'm telling you, maybe a President's not supposed to do it, but I like to leave a tip," Trump added. His remarks came after a $20 note was seen dangling from his back pocket.

column2: Woman held for daughter's death after giving her heroin to help sleep
column3: A 33-year-old woman has been arrested in the US in connection with the death of her one-year-old daughter for allegedly giving her small doses of heroin over the course of two months to help her sleep. Kimberly Nelligan had also given heroin to her two older children in the past. She's been charged with child endangerment and possession of drugs.

column2: Belgian pilot left hanging from electricity line as jet crashes
column3: A Belgian Air Force F-16 fighter jet crashed in France on Thursday, leaving one pilot hanging from a high-voltage electricity line. While both pilots ejected from the aircraft, the parachute of one of them got caught in the electricity line. The F-16 jet crashed 50 metres from a house, damaging part of the roof of the building.

column2: Indian couple name newborn daughter 'Mirae' after mutual fund
column3: A Sweden-based Indian couple, Vishal and Dhanishta Kharparde, have named their daughter 'Mirae' drawing inspiration from the Mirae Asset Mutual Fund. The parents, who are resident Indians, have invested in one of the mutual fund's schemes over the past few years. "It is very humbling and at the same time inspiring to hear this," Mirae Asset CEO Swarup Mohanty said.

column2: RBI reserves can fund defence or security exigencies: Bimal Jalan
column3: Former Governor Bimal Jalan has said that RBI's revaluation reserves can be partially used to fund defence or security exigencies if the need arises. The revaluation reserves, currently left untouched, are accumulated due to the depreciation of the rupee. A panel led by Jalan recently recommended a new formula for the transfer of surplus reserves to the government.

column2: China releases 10,000 tonnes of pork from state reserves
column3: China has released 10,000 tonnes of pork from state reserves to tackle rising prices and shortages caused by an African swine fever epidemic. The sale comes as the country prepares to celebrate a week-long national holiday for the 70th anniversary of the People's Republic of China. The disease wiped out 100 million pigs in China, the world's largest pork consumer.

column2: Jennifer Aniston was told to lose 14 kg to stay in Hollywood: Book
column3: Actress Jennifer Aniston was asked to lose 30 pounds (14 kg) if she wanted to stay in Hollywood, as per a book written by Saul Austerlitz. "Los Angeles was a tough place to be an actress - it was a tough place to be a woman - and Jennifer Aniston's agent was reluctantly levelling with her," it further said.

column2: PM is behind railway thefts: C'garh Minister after losing luggage
column3: Chhattisgarh Minister Premsai Singh Tekam blamed PM Narendra Modi after his bag was stolen in a train. "Modi ji is behind the thefts in railways and he is also responsible for the thefts of bags belonging to ministers," Tekam alleged. "This is his achievement in 100 days," the minister further said.

column2: There is no economic crisis in India: Prakash Javadekar
column3: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar on Thursday said there is no economic crisis in India, adding that the government is taking all necessary steps to strengthen the economy. "I want to say that the fundamentals of the country's economy are strong," he added. "Some reactions from non-banking financial companies are there. But we are addressing all issues," Javadekar further said.

column2: Now even Cong doesn't react to what Digvijaya says: Javadekar
column3: After Congress leader Digvijaya Singh's 'saffron-clad rapists' remark, Union Minister Prakash Javadekar on Thursday said that now even the Congress party does not give importance to what he says. "Why should we react? He has this mentality...he has been making such statements," Javadekar added. Singh on Tuesday said that people are wearing saffron clothes and raping.

column2: Karnataka to constitute Innovation Authority: CM Yediyurappa
column3: The Karnataka government will constitute an Innovation Authority and a vision group for startups, and revise the Information Technology policy, CM BS Yediyurappa said on Thursday. The Innovation Authority will be headed by him as the chairman and Deputy CM CN Ashwathnarayan as co-chairman, CM Yediyurappa added. Karnataka is on a mission to promote inclusive growth, he said.

column2: Fashion brand criticised for 'school shooting' themed clothes
column3: Fashion brand Bstroy was criticised after they showcased their clothes at a show in New York, which were themed on mass school shootings in the US. The designs featured bullet holes and names of the schools where the shootings happened. "I lived through this... to make money off of something pathetic like this is disgusting," one of the survivors said.

column2: Govt open to sell some Air India stake to foreign airline: Reports
column3: The government is reportedly in favour of selling some amount of stake in Air India to a foreign airline. The government has moved about $4.2 billion worth of Air India's debt to a separate holding company. Meanwhile, the carrier is also planning to cut the base price of its real estate assets by about a quarter to attract more buyers.

column2: Human skeleton found in Telugu actor Nagarjuna's farmland
column3: A highly decomposed body of an unidentified person was found in the premises of a farmland in Papireddyguda in Telangana's Rangareddy district on Wednesday. According to the Cyberabad police, it is an unused agricultural land purchased by Telugu actor Nagarjuna. Police suspect that the death could have taken place around six months ago and they have initiated an investigation.

column2: Air Marshal RKS Bhadauria appointed next IAF chief
column3: The government has appointed Air Marshal RKS Bhadauria as the next Chief of Air Staff. Bhadauria will succeed Air Chief Marshal Birender Singh Dhanoa. He had taken over as the Vice Chief of the Indian Air Force on May 1, succeeding Air Marshal Anil Khosla. Bhadauria has over 4,250 hours of experience on 26 types of fighters and transport aircraft.

column2: You are a great player, wish you continued success: Afridi to Kohli
column3: Former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi took to Twitter to congratulate Team India captain Virat Kohli, who became T20I cricket's highest run-scorer on Wednesday. "You are a great player indeed, wish you continued success, keep entertaining cricket fans all around the world," Afridi tweeted. Notably, Kohli is currently the only cricketer who averages 50+ in all three international formats.

column2: Google to launch tokenised cards for Indian debit, credit card users
column3: Google on Thursday announced that it's bringing tokenised cards to Indian debit and credit cardholders to allow them to pay for things using a digital token instead of their actual card number. The feature will be rolled out to Google Pay users in the coming weeks. It will start with Visa cards for HDFC, Axis, Kotak and Standard Chartered banks.

column2: Unfortunate that Sharad Pawar is making false statements: PM Modi
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday said that it was unfortunate that senior leaders like NCP President Sharad Pawar were making false statements. PM Modi said, "They like the neighbouring country. They think that the rulers there work for welfare. But the whole of Maharashtra and India knows, and the whole world knows where the factory of terror is."

column2: Delhi Assembly Speaker disqualifies Chandni Chowk MLA Alka Lamba
column3: Delhi Assembly Speaker Ram Niwas Goel on Thursday disqualified Chandni Chowk MLA Alka Lamba from the legislative assembly on the grounds of defection. Lamba had joined the Congress party this month after she resigned from the primary membership of the Aam Aadmi Party on Twitter. AAP MLA and Spokesperson Saurabh Bharadwaj had filed a petition for her disqualification.

column2: Mamata meets Amit Shah in Delhi, hands over letter on NRC
column3: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee met Union Home Minister Amit Shah at North Block in New Delhi on Thursday. Mamata stated, "I handed over a letter to him, told him that of the 19 lakh people left out of NRC, many are Hindi speaking, Bengali speaking and local Assamese. Many genuine voters have been left out."

column2: I request bayan bahadurs to trust judiciary: PM Modi on Ram Temple
column3: Addressing a rally in Nashik ahead of Maharashtra Assembly elections, PM Narendra Modi said that some 'bayan bahadurs' have started speaking nonsense on Ram Temple. He said the matter was sub judice in the Supreme Court and the court was listening to all the parties. He added, "I request these people to trust the judiciary of India, for God's sake."

column2: Developed back pain due to no chair, pillow in Tihar cell: Chidambaram
column3: Former Finance Minister P Chidambaram on Thursday told a Delhi court he developed back pain as there was no pillow or chair in his cell in Tihar jail. "There were chairs outside the room, I used to sit there during the day, now that too is withdrawn," he added. "Because I was using it, they've taken it away," he said.

column2: We have to hug each Kashmiri, make Kashmir paradise again: PM Modi
column3: Addressing a public rally in Maharashtra's Nashik on Thursday, PM Narendra Modi said, "We have to hug every Kashmiri and make heaven there (Kashmir) again." He added, "Till yesterday, we used to say - Kashmir is ours, now every Hindustani will say, we've to create a new Kashmir." He said that the government's decision for J&K is for India's unity.

column2: Pakistanis going to India to fight are enemies of Kashmiris: Pak PM
column3: Pakistan's Prime Minister Imran Khan has said that anyone from his country who goes to fight in Kashmir "is as an enemy of the Kashmiris". He claimed that India needed just "an excuse to launch crackdown on the people of Kashmir". Khan further promised to raise the Kashmir issue at the United Nations General Assembly next week.

column2: Manmohan planned attack on Pak if 26/11 was repeated: Ex-UK PM
column3: Former UK PM David Cameron, in his book 'For The Record', revealed that former PM Manmohan Singh had once told him "that another terrorist attack like that in Mumbai in July 2011 and India would have to take military action against Pakistan." Cameron also said he "got on well" with Singh and described the former Indian PM as "saintly man".

column2: Car crashes into lobby of Trump Plaza in New York
column3: A car crashed into the lobby of the Trump Plaza residential tower in New Rochelle, New York, injuring two people, police said. The black Mercedes-Benz car crashed through glass doors of the building before coming to rest inside. Authorities said that the crash appeared to be an accident but the police are still investigating.

column2: Rohingyas are Bangladeshis: Myanmar's Suu Kyi told UK's ex-PM Cameron
column3: Former UK PM David Cameron has revealed in his book that Myanmar's Aung San Suu Kyi had told him in 2013 that Rohingya Muslims in her country "are Bangladeshis". "She became the de facto leader in 2015, and the violence against the Rohingya went on," Cameron wrote. Suu Kyi has been criticised for not acting against the persecution of Rohingyas.

column2: Vaping devices still available on Amazon, Flipkart after ban: Reuters
column3: Some vaping products were still listed on Flipkart and Amazon on Thursday, while several other websites discontinued their sales a day after the government's ban, according to Reuters. A Reuters reporter successfully placed an order for a vape device on Amazon on Thursday, it said. Websites such as Vapestop and Litejoy, which offered vaping products online, discontinued their operations.

column2: Square Yards raises $20 million from BCCL, others
column3: Square Yards has raised $20 million of equity capital from investors including Bennett Coleman and Company (BCCL), Genkai Capital, DBS Securities, etc. Some existing investors also participated in the round. Founded in 2013, Square Yards is backed by Anil Ambani led-Reliance Group. It has so far raised about $50 million in equity and over $25 million in debt financing.

column2: Sanskrit made compulsory in all U'khand schools from class 3 to 8
column3: Uttarakhand government has made Sanskrit language compulsory in all government and private schools from classes three to eight. Arvind Pandey, state's School and Sanskrit Education Minister, made the announcement about the move and said that this generation should know this ancient language. "We must acknowledge that this language has enriched our culture beyond measure," Pandey added.

column2: Britain heading for a no-deal Brexit: EU
column3: European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker on Wednesday warned that Britain was headed for a no-deal Brexit. The issue of Irish border, on whether to return to a hard border with security checks and tariffs with the European Union or not, remains unsolved. British PM Boris Johnson has insisted on leaving the EU on October 31 with or without a deal.

column2: NASA orbiter failed to capture image of Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander: Official
column3: NASA's Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter failed to capture images of Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander after it passed over its landing site, NASA official Joshua Handal has said. "The Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter Camera acquired images around the targeted landing site, but the exact location of the lander wasn't known so the lander may not be in the camera field of view," he stated.

column2: Dog follows Salman Khan on IIFA green carpet; video shared online
column3: A video which shows a dog following actor Salman Khan on the green carpet of IIFA Awards 2019 has been shared by photographer Viral Bhayani. "Every dog has his day this was his time to shine and he knew #SalmanKhan is a big animal lover," he captioned the video. Commenting on it, a user wrote, "Who let the dogs out."

column2: Yuvraj only player to hit 6 sixes in 1 over off fast bowling
column3: Yuvraj Singh is the only player to hit six sixes in an over off pace bowling, achieving the feat in a Stuart Broad over in an India-England World T20 match on September 19, 2007. Yuvraj went on to score international cricket's fastest fifty off 12 balls, becoming the second player to hit six sixes off an over at world level.

column2: Google Assistant to be available to Indian users without internet
column3: At its 'Google for India' event on Thursday, the company announced its virtual assistant will also be available to people who have the most basic cellphone with no internet access. A 24×7 telephone line on Vodafone-Idea telecom networks could be dialled by users to access the service. Google said it's been testing the line in Lucknow and Kanpur.

column2: Told Google CEO world will adopt what's successful in India: Prasad
column3: Union IT Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad on Thursday said that last year on his visit to Google's Silicon Valley facility, he asked Google CEO Sundar Pichai to make India a launchpad for products. Prasad said he told Pichai, "What becomes successful in India, surely the world is going to adopt it." Prasad was speaking at the Google for India event.

column2: Apple communications head Dowling quits company after 16 years
column3: Apple's Communications VP and public relations head Steve Dowling has quit the technology giant after 16 years. "He has decided to leave Apple to spend some much deserved time with his family," Apple said. This marks the departure of the third top executive from Apple in 2019 after former Senior VP for retail Angela Ahrendts and design chief Jony Ive.

column2: 650 India startups benefited from startup-focused programs: Google
column3: Google India on Thursday took to Twitter to announce that 650 Indian startups have benefited from startup-focused support programs like its own Launchpad Accelerator. Google highlighted Mumbai-based AI startup Wadhwani which has developed a mobile app that helps cotton farmers identify pests just by taking a picture. Google announced the same under its 'Internet Saathi' program for rural India.

column2: Google announces a new AI research centre in India
column3: Google, at its 'Google for India' event on Thursday, announced that it's opening an AI research centre in Bengaluru. The centre, called Google Research India, will focus on advancing fundamental computer science research to develop tools that can be used by government and private entities. "We will continue to invest in AI-powered flood forecasts," Google VP of Engineering added.

column2: Couldn't give farm loan waiver in MP, Rahul should apologise: Cong MLA
column3: Madhya Pradesh Congress MLA Lakshman Singh on Wednesday said, "We've not been able to fulfil the promise of farm loan waiver in the state." "Rahul Gandhi should apologise to the farmers and clarify to them how long it will take for loan waiver," he added. "It'll send a good message to the farmers who are angry," he further said.

column2: Indians' buying power hasn't risen in line with car prices: Bhargava
column3: Maruti Suzuki Chairman RC Bhargava has said that purchasing power of Indians hasn't risen in line with the increase in car prices. This had led many to postpone purchases as prices have been increased to adhere to new emission norms, he added. Bhargava further said there is "no point" in a temporary cut in the GST rate on vehicles.

column2: Lyft faces lawsuit that alleges kidnapping at gunpoint, rape
column3: US ride-hailing giant Lyft is facing another lawsuit pertaining to its handling of alleged sexual assaults by drivers on its platform. The lawsuit alleged that the plaintiff's driver kidnapped her at gunpoint and she was raped by the driver and other men. "Alison remembers the men cheering and high-fiving each other as they continued to rape her," the lawsuit claimed.

column2: Announced e-cigarette ban as Health Minister is out of India: Sitharaman
column3: After drug-maker Biocon's head Kiran Mazumdar Shaw tweeted why Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced e-cigarette ban instead of Health Minister Harsh Vardhan, Sitharaman replied that Vardhan was out of India. On Shaw's remark that Sitharaman should announce fiscal measures, she stated, "As Finance Minister...I've been...regularly speaking about measures...[taken] on matters of economy."

column2: People forced out of cabs, autos amid transport strike in Delhi-NCR
column3: Several incidents of commuters being forced out of their cabs and autorickshaws by drivers protesting against the new Motor Vehicles Act in Delhi-NCR were reported on Thursday. At the Akshardham area, protesters vandalised a cab for ferrying passengers. The United Front of Transport Association on Wednesday claimed that over 50 transport associations and unions were participating in the strike.

column2: Thrilled, it was a special experience: Rajnath on flying Tejas
column3: After he flew the indigenously built Tejas fighter jet for some time during a sortie on Thursday, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh stated, "I was very thrilled and it was a special experience... I was enjoying." Singh added, "The flight was very smooth and comfortable... I want to praise the bravery of our air force fighters and all the armed forces."

column2: Israeli PM to skip UN General Assembly over awaited poll results
column3: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will skip the UN General Assembly session in New York next week over the awaited results of the recently-held general election. It will be the first time Netanyahu has skipped the General Assembly session since 2010. Israeli Foreign Minister Israel Katz will attend the session instead.

column2: UK PM Johnson confronted by father of sick child at hospital
column3: UK PM Boris Johnson was confronted by a man at a hospital in London over the poor facility there. The man, named, Omar Salem, said his seven-day-old daughter had been "gravely ill" and that the hospital was not doing enough. "You come here for a press opportunity," the man told Johnson, referring to cameras filming the confrontation.

column2: Vicky Kaushal pays homage to martyrs of 2016 Uri attack
column3: Vicky Kaushal on Wednesday paid homage to the soldiers who were martyred in 2016 Uri terror attack. He shared a collage of their pictures and captioned, "Remembering the brave hearts we lost on this day 3 years ago." Vicky's film 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' was based on the strikes carried out by the Indian Army in retaliation to Uri attack.

column2: Neha creates daughter's Instagram account as she turns 10 months old
column3: Actress Neha Dhupia has created an Instagram account of her daughter, Mehr, after she turned 10 months old on Wednesday. Neha also shared the pictures of Mehr on Instagram and captioned, "May the sun always shine on you... may your head always be high...your ponytail even higher...our baby girl." Neha gave birth to Mehr in November last year.

column2: Gautam Budh Nagar will overtake Gurugram in development: UP Min
column3: Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Jai Pratap Singh on Wednesday said Gautam Budh Nagar would move ahead of Gurugram in development and economic activity once the Noida International Greenfield Airport project at Jewar becomes operational. "We have acquired 745 hectares of...land...for the development of the airport," he added. Singh claimed that the airport project would encourage industrial growth.

column2: Ranveer named Best Actor, Alia wins Best Actress award at IIFA 2019
column3: Ranveer Singh was named Best Actor for 'Padmaavat', while Alia Bhatt received the Best Actress award for 'Raazi' at the 20th IIFA Awards held in Mumbai. The awards for Best Supporting Actor and Best Supporting Actress went to Vicky Kaushal and Aditi Rao Hydari for 'Sanju' and 'Padmaavat', respectively. This was the first time IIFA Awards were held in India.

column2: Schools shut in Mumbai, Thane, Konkan amid heavy rain warning
column3: All schools and junior colleges in Maharashtra's Mumbai, Thane and Konkan region would remain closed on Thursday in view of the heavy rainfall warning by the India Meteorological Department, state's Minister of School Education Ashish Shelar announced. He added that the decision to keep schools open in other parts would be taken by their District Collectors based on local conditions.

column2: 'Raazi' named Best Picture at IIFA Awards 2019
column3: 'Raazi' was named Best Picture at the 20th International Indian Film Academy Awards (IIFA) held in Mumbai on Wednesday. Starring Alia Bhatt and Vicky Kaushal, the film is about a Kashmiri spy married to a Pakistan man during the Indo-Pakistan War of 1971. Ishaan Khatter and Sara Ali Khan won the awards for Best Debut Male and Female, respectively.

column2: Mountain lion breaks into US family's house; police shares pic
column3: A family in California, US called the sheriff's office after a mountain lion broke into their house. "He...ended up cornered in a bathroom," the sheriff's office wrote while adding that the deputies broke the window to coax the animal out. They also shared a video of its rescue along with a picture on Facebook.

column2: Covering a journey of 2 hrs in 20 mins: Akshay on taking metro ride
column3: Actor Akshay Kumar on Wednesday shared a video, which shows him taking a ride in a metro in Mumbai. "Travelled #LikeABoss from Ghatkopar to Versova beating the peak hours traffic," he wrote in the caption. Akshay revealed in the video that the journey by metro would take him only 20 minutes, as compared to a 2-hour journey by road.

column2: Di Maria scores twice against former team as PSG beat Real Madrid 3-0
column3: Angel Di Maria scored twice to help PSG defeat his former team Real Madrid 3-0 in their opening Champions League Group A match on Wednesday. Meanwhile, Manchester City defeated Shakhtar Donetsk 3-0, while Juventus were held to a 2-2 draw by Atletico Madrid. On Tuesday, defending champions Liverpool suffered a 0-2 defeat at the hands of Napoli.

column2: Apple files application to trademark the term 'Slofie'
column3: Apple has filed an application with the US Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) to trademark the term "Slofie". Apple added the slo-mo video feature to its 2019 iPhone lineup's front cameras to record videos in slow motion, which it termed 'slofies'. The application was filed in terms of "downloadable computer software for use in capturing and recording video".

column2: Microsoft to buy back up to $40 billion in stock
column3: Microsoft has announced that its board has approved a share buyback programme of up to $40 billion. The software giant also declared a quarterly dividend of 51 cents per share, 11% higher than the preceding quarter. It returned $7.7 billion to shareholders in the form of share repurchases and dividends in the fourth quarter of its fiscal year 2019.

column2: FB, Instagram to restrict cosmetic surgery, diet product posts
column3: Facebook-owned Instagram has announced that the two platforms have started restricting some cosmetic surgery and diet product posts from September 18. The new rules will result in age restrictions being applied to some posts and other posts being removed entirely. "This policy is part of our ongoing work to reduce the pressure that people can sometimes feel," Instagram said.

column2: Will not be swayed by media trial in Chinmayanand case: SIT
column3: Inspector General of Police Naveen Arora, who is heading the SIT investigating rape allegations against BJP's Swami Chinmayanand, has stated, "Any arrest will only be made on the ground of solid evidence." Urging the public to be patient, Arora added, "The SIT is only answerable to the court, not media...We can't be swayed by a particular person or media trial".

column2: Ex-Flipkart employees' fintech startup Groww raises $21 million
column3: Bengaluru-based online investments startup Groww has raised over $21 million in a Series B funding round led by US-based VC firm Ribbit Capital. The funding round saw participation from existing investors Sequoia India and Y Combinator. Launched in 2017 by former Flipkart employees Lalit Keshre, Harsh Jain, Neeraj Singh and Ishan Bansal, Groww operates in the direct mutual funds' space.

column2: Youngsters want gadgets over cars as they have Ola, Uber: Bhargava
column3: Maruti Suzuki Chairman RC Bhargava has said youngsters would rather buy gadgets than cars as they find shared mobility like Ola and Uber economical. "So, what Finance Minister said is 100% correct," Bhargava added. "Today, a youngster wants to buy a nice smartphone and wants to meet his friends at a restaurant and have a good time," he further said.

column2: SoftBank CEO took $3-bn loan to invest in Vision Fund: Bloomberg
column3: SoftBank Group's Founder and CEO Masayoshi Son loaned himself around $3 billion to invest in the Japanese conglomerate's first, $100-billion Vision Fund, Bloomberg reported citing sources. The 62-year-old has pledged 38% of his stake in the Japanese firm as collateral for personal loans from 19 banks, regulatory filings revealed. The loan was swapped for equity in the fund, Bloomberg added.

column2: Rajnath Singh controlled, flew Tejas jet for some time: DRDO Chief
column3: Rajnath Singh, who on Thursday became the first Defence Minister to fly in the indigenously built Tejas fighter jet, also "controlled and flew" the aircraft for some time, DRDO chief G Satheesh Reddy said. "There was no problem. I kept following instructions given by (Air Vice Marshal) N Tiwari," Singh said. He also called it "an amazing and exhilarating experience".

column2: Super 30 Founder honoured with 'Education Excellence Award' in US
column3: Super 30 Founder and mathematician Anand Kumar has been felicitated with Education Excellence Award 2019 by non-profit organisation Foundation For Excellence in US's California. At the event, Kumar said, "Indians have been doing wonders in different fields across the globe, including the USA, and it would be immensely satisfying for them to give something back to their society."

column2: US Army plays 'Jana Gana Mana' for Indian Army during joint exercise
column3: A US Army band played the Indian National Anthem, 'Jana Gana Mana', during a joint exercise between the Indian and US Army at the Joint Base Lewis-McChord in Washington. A video shows the US soldiers playing the anthem using trumpets and drums. Earlier, the Indian and American soldiers were seen singing and dancing to Indian marching song 'Badluram ka badan'.

column2: Trudeau apologises after pic shows him in brownface makeup at party
column3: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau on Wednesday apologised for wearing brownface makeup to an 'Arabian nights' theme party at a school where he taught 18 years ago. Stating it was a "racist thing to do", Trudeau said, "I'm deeply sorry I did that." A photograph of Trudeau with brown makeup on his face, neck and hands was published by TIME magazine.

column2: My dad watched trailer of Made In China before he passed away: Rao
column3: During the trailer launch of his upcoming film 'Made In China', Rajkummar Rao revealed that he made his father watch the trailer in the hospital. "I requested Dinesh Vijan (producer) and I asked him I want to show my trailer to my father...I was so happy, he saw the trailer," he added. Rao's father passed away earlier this month.

column2: I was dropped from a project for not looking 'rural' enough: Zareen
column3: Actress Zareen Khan has revealed she was dropped from a film based in rural India and was told she doesn't look "rural" enough due to her complexion and body structure. "I was like, 'Okay, are we stereotyping rural women?' It's not that everyone...is dark; there are some...on the heavier side as well, with fair skin and light eyes," she added.

column2: In pictures: Bollywood celebrities attend IIFA Awards 2019
column3: Many Bollywood celebrities, including Ranveer Singh, Deepika Padukone and Alia Bhatt, on Wednesday, attended International Indian Film Academy Awards in Mumbai. Ranveer wore a grey suit with a red dupatta draped diagonally over his shoulder and completed his look with a ponytail. Meanwhile, Deepika wore a floor-length purple gown with a hood and complimented her look with long silver earrings.

column2: Prisoners in Kerala will soon run fuel stations
column3: Under the state government's initiative, the prisoners in Kerala will soon manage fuel stations that will be opened in the outer campuses of three central jails in the state. At least 15 convicted prisoners would be identified and trained to run fuel stations on a shift basis. The fuel stations will be set up by the Indian Oil Corporation.

column2: Kohli becomes highest run-scorer in T20I cricket, overtakes Rohit
column3: India captain Virat Kohli has become the highest run-scorer in T20I cricket, achieving the feat in the second T20I against South Africa on Wednesday. Following his 72*(52), the 30-year-old has now scored 2,441 runs in T20I cricket, seven more than Rohit Sharma. Further, Kohli is currently the only batsman in international cricket to have 50-plus average in all three formats.

column2: Govinda has ruled B'wood: Chunky on actor's claim of not getting his dues
column3: Speaking about Govinda's claim that he didn't get his dues in the industry, Chunky Panday said, "He has ruled [Bollywood] since like 1991. He has had the greatest run." "He has enjoyed great superstardom. He has got his dues. But we want to see him more," Chunky added. He further said there's no better actor than Govinda in the country.

column2: Akshay shares pics of autorickshaw covered with plants, praises driver
column3: Actor Akshay Kumar on Wednesday shared pictures of an autorickshaw covered with plants that he clicked while he was on his way to his shoot. "Extremely proud of him and his efforts to go green in his own little way. #GreenWorld," he added. The tweet received comments like 'Every effort counts' and 'Great effort in...packed city'.

column2: Truck carrying 20,000 kg of Nutella overturns on US highway
column3: A truck loaded with 44,000 pounds (nearly 20,000 kilograms) of Nutella cocoa spread flipped on a highway in Indiana, US on Monday evening. The truck driver, Chuhar Singh, told the police that the truck flipped after a car in front of the truck slammed its brakes unexpectedly. The highway was closed for about 2.5 hours after the accident.

column2: Paine reveals he played part of 5th Ashes Test with broken thumb
column3: Australia Test captain Tim Paine has revealed he played a part of the fifth Ashes Test with a broken thumb. He added that his thumb was broken towards the end of the Test. "[The thumb] is not displaced, so I should be right to get back into training early," the 34-year-old wicketkeeper added. England defeated Australia in the fifth Test.

column2: Biker falls 70 feet off cliff in US, lands in water and survives
column3: Rick Hogge, a biker from US' Texas, survived after falling 70 feet off a cliff after landing in water. The entire incident was captured on a camera attached to his helmet. The footage shows how Hogge lost his balance while trying to avoid rocks. "I thought about my kids on the way down," Hogge said about the fall.

column2: My bicycle kick goal greatest but not better than sex: Ronaldo
column3: Cristiano Ronaldo, in an interview with Piers Morgan, rated his bicycle kick goal against Juventus in Champions League as the greatest he has scored. On being asked if it was better than sex, Ronaldo replied, "No. Not with my Geo [girlfriend Georgina Rodríguez]". He added the goal is "probably one of the best" he has seen by any player.

column2: South African pacer records best bowling first-class figures in 63 years
column3: South African fast bowler Kyle Abbott took 17 wickets for 86 runs for Hampshire against Somerset in County Championship. The 32-year-old picked up nine wickets for 40 runs in the first innings and eight wickets for 46 runs in the second. Abbott's 17/86 are the best bowling figures in a first-class match since ex-England spinner Jim Laker's 19/90 in 1956.

column2: Hyderabad BJP MLA announces vigilante army to fight anti-nationals
column3: Hyderabad BJP MLA Raja Singh has announced the creation of a vigilante army in Bengaluru to fight "terrorists, traitors, anti-nationals, and enemies of the country within". In a video message, Singh said, "Six months ago, we had initiated a camp. We had invited Hindus from all over the country. I want to inform that this camp is going very well."

column2: At 17.5 million, Indian diaspora largest in the world: UN report
column3: India was the leading country of origin of international migrants in 2019 with a 17.5 million strong diaspora, according to new estimates released by the United Nations. Migrants from Mexico constituted the second-largest diaspora (11.8 million), followed by China (10.7 million), Russia (10.5 million) and Syria (8.2 million). The number of international migrants reached 272 million, the UN said.

column2: London overtakes Mumbai in rupee trading with $46.8 bn daily volume
column3: London has overtaken Mumbai to become the top centre for trading the Indian rupee, according to the Bank for International Settlements. The average daily volume for the rupee in the UK jumped 430% to $46.8 billion in April 2019 from $8.8 billion in 2016. In contrast, the average daily volume of rupee trading in India was $34.49 billion.

column2: E-cigarettes harmful & addictive, why are we debating: Health Secy
column3: Speaking after Cabinet's decision to ban e-cigarettes, Health Secretary Preeti Sudan said, "Why are we debating if it's more harmful or less? It is harmful. It is addictive." "The entire next generation will be going down the drain if we don't control it now," she added. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman suggested India's youth were viewing e-cigarettes as a "style statement".

column2: Dhawan will be unstoppable in next 3 yrs if he keeps fit: Harbhajan
column3: Spinner Harbhajan Singh has said there are no better openers than Shikhar Dhawan and Rohit Sharma in any format. "If Dhawan continues working on his fitness in...coming 2-3 years...he'll be unstoppable," Harbhajan added. Dhawan, who was ruled out of World Cup mid-tournament due to injury, had made his international comeback in limited overs series against West Indies in August.

column2: Nearly 2 lakh teacher posts are vacant in UP: Priyanka Gandhi
column3: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Tuesday criticised Uttar Pradesh government for nearly two lakh vacant posts for teachers. "Youth is waiting for job openings...But BJP government...says that North-Indian youth lack skills," she said. Notably, Union Minister Santosh Gangwar had earlier said that there is no dearth of employment opportunities but north Indian candidates lack qualification.

column2: Development in J&K should prompt PoK people to join India: Guv
column3: Jammu and Kashmir Governor Satya Pal Malik on Wednesday said that instead of taking over Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) by force, the development in J&K should prompt people there to join India. "If we can...secure the future of [J&K] children...I can guarantee...you will get [PoK] without a confrontation," he added. People of Kashmir should be treated with respect, Malik further said.

column2: One nation, one language is against federal structure: Moily
column3: After Home Minister Amit Shah called Hindi a "unifying" language, Congress leader Veerappa Moily on Wednesday said Shah's statement was against India's federal structure. "It is most appropriate for the unity of the country that Shah withdraws such statements," Moily added. Earlier today, Shah clarified that he only requested for learning Hindi as the second language after one's mother tongue.

column2: Jharkhand Police reinstates murder charge in Tabrez lynching case
column3: Jharkhand Police on Wednesday reinstated the charge of murder in mob lynch victim Tabrez Ansari's case after it was dropped in the charge sheet submitted on July 29. Ansari's wife had demanded a CBI inquiry into the incident. In video, Ansari was seen being beaten up with rods while tied to a pole and forced to chant 'Jai Shri Ram'.

column2: 2 jump off Secretariat building, fall on safety net; detained
column3: Two teachers seeking funds for divyang schools attempted suicide by jumping from the second floor of the Secretariat building in Mumbai on Wednesday. They were saved as they fell onto the safety net of the building, police said. The teachers, identified as Hemant Patil and Arun Netore, were later detained by the police.

column2: Patna airport runway shut down for 3 hrs, 2,000 fliers affected
column3: Operations at the Patna airport runway were suspended for three hours on Wednesday after a fire tender got stuck near the runway. The shutdown resulted in the diversion of nine flights, delay of three others on the ground and affected around 2,000 passengers. It was later removed with the help of cranes and other equipment, Airports Authority of India said.

column2: Fire in Liberia school leaves at least 27 people dead
column3: At least 27 people, including many children, died after a fire broke out at an Islamic school in Liberia on Tuesday. "The kids were learning the Quran when the fire broke out," police spokesman Moses Carter said. "My prayers go out to the families of children that died last night," Liberian President George Weah tweeted.

column2: China launches probe after panda on loan to Thailand dies
column3: Experts from the China Conservation and Research Center for the Giant Panda will investigate the death of 19-year-old Panda Chuang Chuang in Thailand's Chiang Mai Zoo. Chuang Chuang reportedly collapsed in the zoo on Monday after eating bamboo. Chuang Chuang had been on loan to the zoo from China since 2003 along with his mate Lin Hui.

column2: Attack on Saudi real test of global will to act: Crown Prince
column3: Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman on Wednesday said the attack on kingdom's oil facilities posed a "real test of the global will" to confront subversive acts that threaten stability. The September 14 drone attacks on the oil facilities were claimed by Yemen's Houthi rebels. However, Saudi Arabia and the US have blamed Iran for carrying out the attacks.

column2: Care Ratings downgrades Rana Kapoor-owned Morgan Credits
column3: Care Ratings has downgraded ratings of Rana Kapoor's Morgan Credits (MCPL) from A minus to BBB minus over fall in stock price of the underlying shares of YES Bank, which are held by MCPL. As of March 31, MCPL held 3.03% stake in YES Bank. Along with its entities, the company held 10.62% stake in the bank.

column2: India defeat South Africa in a T20I at home for the first time
column3: India defeated South Africa by 7 wickets in the second T20I at Mohali on Wednesday to take a 1-0 lead in the three-match series. This is the first time that India defeated South Africa on home soil after having lost their first two T20Is against them in India in 2015. The third T20I will take place in Bengaluru on Sunday.

column2: Pak declines request to let PM Modi's plane to fly through its airspace
column3: Pakistan has rejected a request by India to allow Prime Minister Narendra Modi's plane to fly through the Pakistani airspace for his upcoming visit to the US. PM Modi is scheduled to visit the US from September 21-27. Pakistan had recently denied permission to President Ram Nath Kovind's aircraft to use its airspace during an official visit to Iceland.

column2: Saudi displays evidence of attack by Iran on its oil plants
column3: Saudi Arabia on Wednesday displayed wreckage of drones and missiles it said were used in the attacks on two of its oil facilities, calling them "undeniable" evidence of Iran's involvement in the attacks. A total of 25 drones and missiles were used in the attacks launched from Iran, Saudi Arabia said. Yemen-based Houthi rebels had claimed responsibility for the attacks.

column2: Trump to increase sanctions on Iran after attacks on Saudi oil plants
