column3: On being asked if he fears getting typecast, actor Varun Sharma said that he doesn't fear getting typecast and he won't stop doing comedy roles. "Comedy is the genre that has given me an acceptance and... identity," he added. The actor further said that he likes to make people laugh and it's one of the toughest things to do.

column2: Archer can help us regain Ashes in Australia: Ben Stokes
column3: England Test vice-captain Ben Stokes believes that young pacer Jofra Archer can help the team regain the Ashes when they travel to Australia next in the 2021-22 season. Archer picked up 22 wickets in the recently-concluded five-match Ashes 2019 series which ended in a 2-2 draw. "[D]on't think I've seen a more talented bowler in my time," Stokes said.

column2: HTC names Yves Maitre as new CEO after Cher Wang steps down
column3: HTC Corporation has appointed Yves Maitre as the new CEO as current Chief Cher Wang steps down from the position but remains the company's Chairperson. Maitre was previously with telecom giant Orange, where he worked for over a decade and served as EVP of Partnerships and Connected Objects. Wang was appointed as CEO of HTC in 2015.

column2: Jammu & Kashmir decision inspired from Sardar Patel: PM Modi
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that the government's decision on Jammu and Kashmir (revocation of Article 370) was inspired from Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel. "The country has taken an important decision with the inspiration of Sardar Patel, to walk a new path to resolve a decades-old problem," PM Modi said. He was addressing a public rally in Gujarat's Kevadiya.

column2: Delhi HC permits JNU to declare result of JNUSU elections
column3: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday permitted the Jawaharlal Nehru University to declare the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) election results. The HC also disposed of the petition of students alleging that their nominations were illegally rejected for elections of JNUSU councillor. Earlier, the results were scheduled to be released on September 8.

column2: Dalit BJP MP denied entry into Karnataka village
column3: BJP MP A Narayanaswamy on Monday was reportedly denied entry into Gollarahatti village in Karnataka as he belongs to a community classified as Scheduled Caste. "We have traditions, there is history of incidents, so people said he shouldn't be allowed," a villager said. The BJP's Chitradurga MP claims he had gone there to discuss the issues faced by the villagers.

column2: Cognizant India appoints Ramkumar Ramamoorthy as new CMD
column3: Cognizant Technology Solutions has appointed Ramkumar Ramamoorthy as Chairman and Managing Director of Cognizant India and named him head of India operations, Cognizant CEO Brian Humphries announced on Tuesday. Ramamoorthy will directly report to the company's executive committee. He has been with Cognizant for over two decades and was appointed as Executive Director of India operations in 2017.

column2: Blast at Afghanistan President Ghani's rally kills 8, injures 10
column3: A bomb blast at Afghanistan President Ashraf Ghani's campaign rally has killed at least eight people and has injured 10 others, police officials said. Ghani was present at the time of the explosion but is safe and unharmed, his campaign spokesman Hamed Aziz said. Presidential elections in Afghanistan are scheduled to be held on September 28.

column2: Katy Perry & Dua Lipa to perform at OnePlus Music Festival
column3: International pop-stars Katy perry and Dua Lipa will be performing at the first-ever OnePlus Music Festival set to be held on November 16 in Mumbai. Indian artists like Amit Trivedi, Ritviz, The Local Train and Aswekeepsearching will also be part of the lineup at the festival. Tickets for the concert are now available for sale.

column2: Pigeon poops on politician during interview about pigeon poop problem
column3: A pigeon pooped on a US politician during an interview about pigeon poop problem at a Chicago station. "I think they (the birds) just got me. That's what happens to my constituents. They get shit on all the time," Jaime Andrade said. He has been trying to clean up the station, which is covered in bird waste and feathers.

column2: That's me at 47, free and unfiltered: Lisa Ray on no-makeup selfie
column3: Actress Lisa Ray took to Instagram and shared a no-makeup selfie of herself, captioned, "That's me at 47, free and unfiltered." "Do we have the courage to be seen as we are? I did not when I was younger," she added. "Not everyone will recognise your worth, but love your skin and the stories it tells," the post further read.

column2: No time to sabotage anyone's career: CINTAA on Shilpa's allegations
column3: After actress Shilpa Shinde alleged that she stopped getting good work as Cine and TV Artistes' Association (CINTAA) didn't want people to work with her, CINTAA called her claims "baseless". The body added it doesn't have time to "make efforts to sabotage anyone's career". "We have nothing to do with people who are not our members," a CINTAA official said.

column2: Instagram Music starts rolling out for users in India
column3: Instagram has started rolling out its Instagram Music feature in India that lets users add background music to their Stories, on both Android and iOS. The feature can either be accessed before the creation of a story by swiping right on the feed or from the stickers panel post-creation. It was first rolled out in the US in June 2018.

column2: Manoj Tiwari celebrates PM's birthday at India Gate with BJP workers
column3: BJP workers led by party MP Manoj Tiwari celebrated Prime Minister Narendra Modi's birthday at India Gate in Delhi. The BJP workers waved placards and party flags and raised slogans hailing PM Modi. They also cut a cake that had 370 and 35A written on it in an apparent reference to Article 370 and Article 35A.

column2: This is betrayal: Mayawati as BSP MLAs join Congress in Rajasthan
column3: After all six BSP MLAs in Rajasthan joined Congress, BSP supremo Mayawati said, "This is a betrayal to BSP movement, which has been done again when the party was providing support to Congress without any conditions." "Congress party in Rajasthan...has once again proved that it is unreliable and a cheat," she added.

column2: Sonia wishes PM Modi healthy, happy life on his 69th birthday
column3: Interim Congress President Sonia Gandhi wished PM Narendra Modi a healthy, happy and long life on his 69th birthday on Tuesday. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal also wished him, tweeting, "We wish him a long and healthy life." Meanwhile, Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy tweeted, "Wishing him a long, healthy and successful life ahead in service of the Nation."

column2: WeWork may halt IPO over investors' valuation, governance concerns
column3: Co-working space giant WeWork is expected to halt its Initial Public Offering (IPO), The Wall Street Journal reported. Investors reportedly raised questions on how much the company is worth and raised concerns about its corporate governance. Past reports had claimed that WeWork, last valued at about $47 billion in January, could seek a valuation as low as $15-18 billion.

column2: Those who oppose Hindi have no love for India: Tripura CM
column3: Tripura CM Biplab Deb has said, "The people who are opposing Hindi as the national language are those who have no love for the country." He further said he supports Hindi as the national language as most of the citizens speak the language. This comes after Home Minister Amit Shah said Hindi is one language that can unite the country.

column2: Chinmayanand complains of uneasiness, doctors treat him in his ashram
column3: Rape accused BJP leader Swami Chinmayanand was examined by a team of doctors at his ashram after he complained of uneasiness on Monday night. Chinmayanand had reportedly been suffering from loose stools for the past few days. A law student has accused the BJP leader of raping her and filming her while she was taking a bath to blackmail her.

column2: Israel heads to poll for the second time in 6 months
column3: Israelis headed to vote in the country's general election on Tuesday for the second time in six months. The election was called after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu failed to form a coalition following an election in April. It is the first time Israel has ever had two general elections in a single year.

column2: Trump says he doesn't want war after attacks on Saudi oil plants
column3: US President Donald Trump on Monday said it looked like Iran was behind the drone attacks on oil plants in Saudi Arabia, adding that he didn't want to go to war. This comes as the attacks sent oil prices soaring and raised fears of a new Middle East conflict. Iran has rejected US accusations that it was behind the attacks.

column2: Current account under threat if oil price surge continues: RBI
column3: India's current account and fiscal deficit could take a hit if oil prices continue to rise after the attack on Saudi Arabian oil facilities, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said on Monday. "We should allow a few more days...before taking a final view," he added. India, the world's third-biggest oil importer, depends on imports for about 85% of its oil needs.

column2: Dream Girl shows what a clean family comedy should be: Ayushmann
column3: Talking about his film 'Dream Girl', Ayushmann Khurrana said that the film shows audiences what a clean family comedy should be and it allows them to bring their family to theatres. "Audiences want to see the most disruptive... content," he added. Ayushmann further said that he feels glad to have people feel connected with the kind of cinema he's doing.

column2: PM Modi is country's honour: Gautam Gambhir on PM's birthday
column3: BJP MP Gautam Gambhir greeted PM Narendra Modi on his 69th birthday and called him the country's honour. "He gives the same respect to Parliament and his mother and bows only before them. We are proud of such a PM," he tweeted. BJP is celebrating PM's birthday as 'Seva Saptah' wherein they have announced several social initiatives across the country.

column2: Privileged to be your partner in nation building: Shah on PM's b'day
column3: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday wished Prime Minister Narendra Modi on his 69th birthday, tweeting, "It is a privilege to be a partner with you in nation-building as a public representative, a worker and a countryman." He also called PM Modi "the country's most popular leader, a symbol of strong will, decisive leadership and tireless hard work."

column2: 4 held for alleged rape of former Muzaffarpur shelter home inmate
column3: Four people were arrested in connection with the alleged rape of a former Muzaffarpur shelter home inmate, Bihar police said on Monday. As per reports, the woman said in her complaint that the four belong to the same family and two of them are brothers. The incident reportedly took place on Friday and the complaint was filed on Saturday.

column2: Reservation alone can’t ensure community’s progress: Gadkari
column3: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday said reservation is required for socially and economically backward classes but it cannot alone ensure community's development. "Communities which got maximum reservation have progressed — this thinking is also not true," he added. "When people fail to get a ticket on the basis of their works, they play the caste card," Gadkari further said.

column2: Kendall, Gigi walk the ramp for Burberry at London Fashion Week
column3: Kendall Jenner on Monday presented Burberry's Spring/Summer 2020 collection along with model Gigi Hadid at the London Fashion Week. Kendall wore a white and brown jacket with a black skirt and completed her look with a handbag and loose bright blonde hair. Meanwhile, Gigi wore a white top with grey patterns on it and paired it with high-waisted trousers.

column2: After Emmy for SpaceX coverage, NASA wins another for Mars mission
column3: NASA won the Outstanding Original Interactive Program award at the 71st Creative Arts Emmy Awards for its coverage of the InSight mission to Mars. InSight is the first mission to study the deep interior of Mars. This comes a day after NASA also won the Outstanding Interactive Program award for multimedia coverage of SpaceX's Demonstration Mission 1 last March.

column2: Harvey Weinstein asked me if I've slept with famous women: Cara
column3: Model-actress Cara Delevingne has revealed producer Harvey Weinstein told her to "get a beard", adding that "she'd never make it in the industry as a gay woman". "In the beginning, I don't think it helped," Cara said while speaking about revealing her sexual orientation. She added that he'd name famous women and asked her if she has slept with them.

column2: Kabir Bedi shares address of composer who said he has no money
column3: Actor Kabir Bedi on Monday tweeted that he visited 92-year-old National Award-winning composer Vanraj Bhatia, who revealed that he has no money. "ALL friends should help him at this difficult time," he added. After a Twitter user asked him for Bhatia's bank details, Bedi replied it'd be simpler to send a cheque at his home and shared the composer's address.

column2: Did you spot India's Moon lander: Brad Pitt in call to ISS
column3: Hollywood actor Brad Pitt in a call to the International Space Station (ISS) asked astronaut Nick Hague if he spotted Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander on the Moon. "No, unfortunately," Hague replied. "Space is hard. Things that should be easy, when you try to do them in Space they just get harder," the astronaut further said.

column2: YouTube tests 'card' feature to show users' comment history
column3: YouTube is testing a feature called profile cards to list a commenter's recent comments over the past 12 months on a channel when clicked on the commenter's name. Presently, clicking on a commenter's name directs users to their channel. "We hope that it will...help creators recognise some of their best commenters," YouTube's Director of Product Management Tom Leung said.

column2: Apple to invest $1 bn to expand iPhone production in India: Report
column3: Apple is reportedly investing $1 billion through its partners to expand the manufacturing of iPhones in India. The move by the American technology giant comes amid the trade war between the US and China, which could result in Apple being forced to hike prices. A past report had claimed that Apple is planning to expand production to Vietnam alongside India.

column2: OYO Founder's $1.5 billion share buyback gets CCI approval
column3: Budget hospitality startup OYO's Founder Ritesh Agarwal has secured the approval for a $1.5-billion share buyback plan from the Competition Commission of India (CCI). Agarwal is purchasing a $1.5-billion stake from early OYO investors Lightspeed Venture Partners and Sequoia India and is receiving a $2-billion loan from three Japanese lenders. He will invest the rest $500 million in the startup.

column2: Hyundai, Kia Motors to acquire minority stake in Ola Electric
column3: Hyundai and Kia Motors are finalising an agreement to acquire a minority stake in Ola Electric Mobility, regulatory filings revealed. This comes around six months after the two entities concluded a $300-million investment into the ride-hailing giant's electric mobility business arm. Ola Electric Mobility had reportedly turned into a unicorn after a $250-million investment by SoftBank in July.

column2: 'Pedo guy' common insult when I was growing up: Elon Musk to court
column3: Founder of Tesla and SpaceX Elon Musk argued in court that his tweet calling British diver Vernon Unsworth a 'pedo guy' was meant to be an insult and not an accusation. "Pedo guy was a common insult used in South Africa when I was growing up," Musk argued. Unsworth had helped rescue 12 boys from a Thai cave last year.

column2: We put fear of law into hearts of criminals: UP DGP OP Singh
column3: Uttar Pradesh DGP OP Singh has stated that the police has rounded up around 10,000 criminals in the past two years and neutralised 96 gangsters carrying rewards on their heads. He said, "We put the fear of law into the hearts of gangs and criminals in each district." The public now knows that UP police means business, he added.

column2: PM Modi releases butterflies at Gujarat park on his birthday
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi released butterflies at a butterfly park in Gujarat on his birthday on Tuesday. Earlier in the day, PM Modi shared a video of 'Statue of Unity' that he captured from a helicopter. PM Modi, who turned 69, also visited a cactus garden and said, "We must keep taking people's feedback to further improve the garden."

column2: Boat was pulled into whirlpool: Survivors recall Godavari boat tragedy
column3: Recalling the Godavari boat tragedy on Sunday, in which at least 11 people were killed and around 24 are missing, survivor Jyoti Babu said, "The boat was being pulled into a whirlpool." A survivor named Madhulata, who lost her 12-year-old daughter while her husband is missing, said, "I told them not to rescue me. There's no point in staying alive."

column2: NGO members to declare having no role in religious conversion: Govt
column3: The Home Ministry has said that all members of NGOs, receiving foreign funds, will have to declare before the government that they weren't prosecuted or convicted for religious conversions. All the members must also certify through an affidavit that they have never been involved in "diverting" foreign funds or propagating "sedition" or "advocating violent means", the ministry stated.

column2: 'India's most popular leader,' Union Ministers wish PM Modi on b'day
column3: Wishing PM Narendra Modi on his 69th birthday, Home Minister Amit Shah called PM Modi India's "most popular leader, a symbol of strong will...and tireless hard work." Meanwhile, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said PM Modi's "visionary leadership has helped India in scaling new heights of glory". "Inspired by your untiring efforts to serve our nation," Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman tweeted.

column2: DRDO's unmanned aircraft crashes during test flight in Karnataka
column3: A Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) unmanned aircraft crashed in an agricultural field during a test flight in Karnataka's Chitradurga district on Tuesday. Police said the aircraft crashed during flight from Aeronautical Test Range (ATR), an outdoor testing and evaluating facility being set up by DRDO for unmanned and manned aircraft, in Challakere in the district.

column2: I met PM Modi, he didn't ask me for Zakir Naik: Malaysia PM
column3: Speaking about the proposition to return Islamic preacher Zakir Naik to India, Malaysian PM Mahathir Mohamad on Tuesday said he met PM Narendra Modi and the latter didn't ask for Naik. "This man could also be troublesome for India," Mohamad added. Earlier, Foreign Secretary Vijay Gokhale had said PM Modi raised Naik's extradition issue during a meeting with Malaysian PM.

column2: Neena Gupta wins Best Actress award at film festival in Boston
column3: Actress Neena Gupta won Best Actress award at the India International Film Festival of Boston for the film 'The Last Color'. The film which is directed by chef Vikas Khanna also won the award in the Best Feature Film category. Neena thanked everyone for their support while Vikas Khanna wrote, "Super proud of our big victory at IIFFB 2019."

column2: Raj HC accepts plea against Saif, Sonali in blackbuck poaching case
column3: The Rajasthan High Court on Monday accepted an appeal against the acquittal of Saif Ali Khan, Sonali Bendre, Tabu, Neelam and Dushyant Singh in the 1998 blackbuck poaching case. It was filed by the state government after they were acquitted by a magistrate court in 2018 due to lack of evidence. Earlier, Salman Khan was convicted in the case.

column2: Scientists to let ship drift, get trapped in Arctic ice for months
column3: For a new study related to the Arctic region, scientists will deliberately let a ship named Polarstern drift in the sea ice off Siberia, from where it will eventually become locked in the ice for months of the Arctic winter. Researchers from 19 countries are set to take part in this project, which is aimed at studying global climate change.

column2: Ajay Kumar Singh is new Press Secretary to President Kovind
column3: Political journalist Ajay Kumar Singh was on Monday appointed as the Press Secretary to President Ram Nath Kovind, according to an official order by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet. Ajay succeeds Ashok Malik whose term ended in July 2019. Ajay, 55, has previously worked with TOI, The Telegraph and is currently associated with the Firstpost as a contributor.

column2: Performers are show-offs: Singhvi on Trump joining 'Howdy, Modi'
column3: Congress MP Abhishek Singhvi commented on US President Donald Trump's decision to join PM Narendra Modi's 'Howdy, Modi' event at Houston on September 22. Borrowing singer Elton John's words, Singhvi tweeted, "I think performers are all show-offs anyway. Unless you show off, you're not going to get noticed." PM Modi will address more than 50,000 Indian-Americans at 'Howdy, Modi' event.

column2: Apollo introduces Apterra AT2 SUV tyres in India
column3: Apollo Tyres believes that bad roads go to good places and has thus introduced the Apollo Apterra AT2 tyres, designed to conquer the toughest terrains so that you can travel to places you've never seen before. The tyres offer superior safety during high-speed driving and braking, long-term durability, puncture resistance and quick steering response for traversing all terrains.

column2: B'wood was frustrating as I had to convince people I'm Indian: Hazel
column3: Hazel Keech, who made her debut in 2011 with 'Bodyguard', has opened up about staying away from Bollywood. "It was frustrating coming to Bollywood, growing up in a...Hindu-traditional Indian household with a British father and trying to convince people I'm Indian after being judged by my name and accent," she said. "Today we've leading actresses from different nationalities," Hazel added.

column2: Youngsters will have to prove themselves in 4-5 opportunities: Kohli
column3: Team India captain Virat Kohli has said that the youngsters would get four to five opportunities to prove themselves in T20I cricket. "We have 30 odd games (before T20 World Cup). From team's point of view, it is very clear. Even when I got into the team it is not like I was expecting 15 opportunities," he added.

column2: Federer won't be 'destroyed' if Nadal wins 20 Grand Slams: Coach
column3: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer's long-term coach Severin Luthi has said Federer won't be "completely destroyed" if Rafael Nadal wins 20 Grand Slam titles. "I don't think Federer stresses about Nadal catching him up," Luthi added. "It's good for the fans. Especially those who thought it was all over when Federer had 16-17 and Rafa had 14," he said.

column2: Meant a lot to receive standing ovation from the crowd: Steve Smith
column3: Talking about getting a standing ovation from the crowd at The Oval after his last innings in 2019 Ashes, Australia batsman Steve Smith said, "It meant a lot to have that reception." "The series has ebbed and flowed...I've loved every minute and I'm...proud of how I've been able to perform for Australia and to bring the urn home," he added.

column2: All official languages equal: Yediyurappa after Shah's remarks
column3: The official Twitter handle of Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa's office on Monday posted, "All official languages in our country are equal. However, as far as Karnataka is concerned, Kannada is the principal language." Yediyurappa added, "We will never compromise its importance." This comes after Home Minister Amit Shah's tweet that Hindi was the only language that can unite the country.

column2: All 6 BSP MLAs in Rajasthan join Congress
column3: All six MLAs from BSP joined Congress in Rajasthan after submitting their letter to Assembly Speaker CP Joshi on Monday night. Congress now has 106 seats in the 200-seat Assembly. BSP's Joginder Singh Awana said they took the decision considering the development of their constituencies and welfare of the people of the state.

column2: KhataBook may raise up to $85 million from Tencent, GGV
column3: Mumbai-based fintech startup KhataBook is in advanced talks to raise up to $85 million, where Chinese gaming giant Tencent may invest $70-75 million, Entrackr reported. The rest $5-10 million will come from GGV Capital, as per Entrackr's sources. KhataBook has raised a $20-million Series A round from DST Partners Fund, Ribbit Capital along with 20 angel investors, the sources added.

column2: Girl dies after contracting rare brain-eating amoeba while swimming
column3: Lily Mae Avant, a ten-year-old girl from US' Texas, who was infected by a brain-eating amoeba while swimming in a river has passed away. Avant succumbed to the often-fatal amoeba known as Naegleria fowleri on Monday after having been placed in a medically-induced coma. Within days of her swim, she came down with a fever and a headache.

column2: UP law student who accused Chinmayanand of rape testifies in court
column3: The 23-year-old law student, who accused BJP leader Swami Chinmayanand of raping her on several occasions, recorded her 164 CrPC statement in a magisterial court in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur on Monday. The girl was produced in court by the Special Investigating Team and was escorted by several policewomen as she arrived in court. She earlier submitted 43 videos to SIT.

column2: Man offers 1.25kg gold crown at Varanasi temple to mark PM's b'day
column3: A man in Varanasi has offered a gold crown weighing 1.25 kg to Lord Hanuman at Sankat Mochan Temple to mark PM Narendra Modi's 69th birthday. Adding that he had vowed to offer the crown if PM Modi formed the government for second time, the man said it's with faith that PM Modi's and India's future should shine like gold.

column2: 76-yr-old Australian cyclist dies after being attacked by swooping bird
column3: A 76-year-old cyclist died in a bicycle crash while trying to escape from a swooping magpie in Australia's Wollongong. The man was riding a pushbike on an off-road path when he veered off to avoid the magpie. He hit a fence post and was thrown to the ground. This comes amid the onset of prime magpie swooping season in Australia.

column2: David de Gea extends Manchester United contract until 2023
column3: Manchester United's 28-year-old goalkeeper David de Gea has signed a new contract to stay with the club until 2023. De Gea had joined the club in 2011 and has made 367 appearances so far. "All I want is to help this team achieve what I believe we can and win trophies again, together," De Gea said in a statement.

column2: FB announces trimming tool for live videos, IGTV scheduling feature
column3: Facebook announced several new updates and features for content and video creators on Monday. The new features include a trimming tool for live videos, publishing and scheduling video content on Instagram and IGTV for up to six months in advance and a 'rehearsal' feature to broadcast live only to Page admins and editors to test new production setups, etc.

column2: DD India will soon be available all over world: Javadekar
column3: Doordarshan (DD) India will soon be available all over the world, Union Minister Prakash Javadekar said on Monday at an event to mark the 60th Foundation Day of DD. He also said that credibility is the unique selling proposition of Doordarshan. "We have to become no.1 again. Earlier, we were no.1 when there was no one," he added.

column2: PM Modi to start his 69th birthday with mother's blessings
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will start his 69th birthday by seeking the blessings of his 95-year-old mother Heeraben on Tuesday, reports said. PM Modi will fly to Gujarat on Monday night. PM Modi will also visit Sardar Sarovar Dam in Narmada district which has been illuminated and the water is at the highest level at 138.68 metres, reports added.

column2: India's many languages are not her weakness: Rahul Gandhi
column3: A couple of days after Home Minister Amit Shah said on the occasion of Hindi Diwas that Hindi is the language which can unite India, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi tweeted that India's many languages are not her weakness. Rahul enlisted 23 Indian languages along with 23 Indian National flags. Earlier, Congress said that three-language formula should not be tinkered with.

column2: Evidence indicates Iranian arms used in Saudi attack: Saudis
column3: The Saudi-led military coalition battling Yemen's Houthi movement said on Monday that the attack on Saudi Arabian oil plants was carried out with Iranian weapons. "The terrorist attack did not originate from Yemen as the Houthi militia claimed," coalition spokesman Colonel Turki al-Malki said. Iran had dismissed US accusations that it was responsible for the assault on Saudi oil facilities.

column2: OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma files for bankruptcy
column3: Purdue Pharma filed for bankruptcy on Sunday and announced a $10 billion plan to settle thousands of lawsuits that accused the firm of fuelling the US opioid crisis. Over 2,600 lawsuits have been filed alleging Purdue falsely promoted painkiller OxyContin by downplaying the risk of addiction. US data said the public health crisis killed nearly 4,00,000 people between 1999-2017.

column2: Over 46,000 UAW workers go on strike against General Motors
column3: Over 46,000 workers from the United Auto Workers (UAW) union went out on strike against General Motors Sunday night after its workers' four-year contract expired without an agreement. Full-time and temporary workers walked out of about 33 plants as well as about 22 parts warehouses across the US. The workers have demanded higher wages, health care benefits, job security, etc.

column2: OnePlus 7T series to launch on September 26 in India
column3: OnePlus has announced that it will host the launch event of the OnePlus 7T series on September 26 at the Indira Gandhi Arena in New Delhi at 7 pm. The company also confirmed that the upcoming smartphone series will feature a 90Hz refresh display. The global launch event for the series will take place in London on October 10.

column2: Like actors, writers should also set their fee: Rang De Basanti writer
column3: 'Rang De Basanti' writer Kamlesh Pandey has said nowadays there's a new plan which ensures fair pay to writers. "Actors set their own fees, so a writer should also set his or her fees according to how hard one has worked," he added. Kamlesh said writers should incorporate suggestions from actors and producers as long as it helps the story.

column2: Spot boy would've been paid more: 'Rang De...' writer on taking less pay
column3: 'Rang De Basanti' writer Kamlesh Pandey has said he was so driven to make the Aamir Khan-starrer that he took on the job for "very less" remuneration. "The money I got, the spot boy would've got paid more," he added. "I don't feel sad about that though...It was my decision because I could afford to...work for less money," said Kamlesh.

column2: Game of Thrones gets 10 awards at Creative Arts Emmy Awards 2019
column3: 'Game of Thrones' season 8 has received ten awards at the Creative Arts Emmy Awards held over the weekend, the most of any series in the kick-off to this year's Primetime Emmys. It won in categories including Outstanding Sound Editing for a Comedy or Drama Series and Outstanding Special Visual Effects. 'The Simpsons' won an award for Outstanding Animated Program.

column2: Evils forced me to tell you that I am HIV+: Welsh rugby legend Thomas
column3: Ex-Wales rugby captain Gareth Thomas has revealed he is HIV+, adding that he wanted to make his diagnosis public himself. "It is my secret to tell you not the evils that make my life hell, threatening to tell you before I do," he said in a Twitter video. "I want to remember what it's like to live again," he added.

column2: Ronaldo breaks down into tears talking about his late father in interview
column3: Five-time Ballon d'Or winner Cristiano Ronaldo broke down while talking about his late father in a recent interview. On being asked by the interviewer about what makes him sad, the 34-year-old Juventus forward said, "To be the number one and [my father] didn't see anything. He didn't see me receive awards. All my family saw my success but not him."

column2: England, Australia cricketers celebrate Ashes together in dressing room
column3: England and Australia cricketers shared dressing room at The Oval after 2019 Ashes ended in a draw. England cricket team's official Twitter account shared a picture showing players chatting with each other and having beer, with the caption, "This is what Ashes cricket is all about!" This is the first time in 47 years that Ashes ended in a draw.

column2: 80-year-old Italian TV pundit fired over 'give Lukaku 10 bananas' remark
column3: Luciano Passirani, an 80-year-old Italian TV pundit, has been fired over his racist remarks against Inter Milan's Belgian forward Romelu Lukaku. Passirani made the remark while praising the footballer over his one-on-one skills. "If you go one-on-one with him he'll murder you. The only way to come up against him is...give him 10 bananas to eat," Passirani had said.

column2: Steve Smith makes the ugliest hundreds with his technique: Jonty Rhodes
column3: On being asked to choose between Australia batsman Steve Smith and Team India captain Virat Kohli, ex-South Africa cricketer Jonty Rhodes said, "I enjoy watching Virat Kohli." "Steve Smith, with that action and technique, makes the ugliest hundreds I've ever seen but the man just keeps scoring runs," he added. Smith scored 774 runs in the recently concluded Ashes.

column2: You never write off champion players: Justin Langer on David Warner
column3: Talking about David Warner, who scored 95 runs in 2019 Ashes, Australia head coach Justin Langer said, "It doesn’t matter what sport...you never write off champion players. They tend to come good, don't they?" "There’s plenty of upside still to his batting," Langer added. Notably, England fast bowler Stuart Broad dismissed Warner 7 out of 10 times in the series.

column2: No Shah or Sultan should break unity in diversity promise: Haasan
column3: Actor-turned-politician Kamal Haasan on Monday released a video on Twitter, wherein he said, "The unity in diversity is a promise we made when we made India into a Republic. Now, no Shah, Sultan or Samrat should renege on that promise." This comes after Home Minister Amit Shah's tweet that Hindi was the only language that can unite the whole country.

column2: 5,000 delivery execs log out from Zomato over revised payments: Report
column3: Around 2,000-3,000 delivery executives in Mumbai and another 3,000 in Bengaluru have logged out of food delivery app Zomato and are protesting since Saturday, The News Minute reported. They claimed Zomato reduced their per delivery earning and increased the number of orders that guarantee an incentive. Delivery executives in Bengaluru have also written to Zomato opposing the new incentive scheme.

column2: ED objects to Shivakumar's bail plea, says he will sway witnesses
column3: The Enforcement Directorate on Monday filed objections to Congress leader DK Shivakumar's bail application at a special court in Delhi. The ED stated that Shivakumar could influence witnesses and tamper with evidence if granted bail. "Investigation has revealed names of various persons and entities. Interrogation of these persons is necessary to take the case to its logical conclusion," added ED.

column2: Hyderabad college that asked girls to wear long kurtis withdraws dress code
column3: Hyderabad's St Francis College for Women which made it mandatory for girls to wear long kurtis has withdrawn the dress code. This comes after students protested against the dress code and had alleged moral policing by the college authorities since August. A student earlier claimed that college authorities told them that a long kurti would get them good marriage proposals.

column2: 14-year-old boy dies after stepping on exposed wire in Chennai
column3: A 14-year-old boy was electrocuted to death after he stepped on an exposed live wire on a street in Chennai. The News Minute report said that the wire was not isolated or buried properly by the Tamil Nadu Electricity Board (TNEB) personnel. A police case under section 304A (death due to negligence) was registered against the TNEB personnel.

column2: IndiGo flights from Delhi land in Istanbul without passengers' luggage
column3: IndiGo is being criticised by passengers after its flights that took off from Delhi over the weekend landed in Istanbul without loading passengers' checked-in luggage. IndiGo said that few flights to Istanbul had certain payload restrictions due to "exceptionally heavy headwind", resulting in offloading of luggage. "All the left behind baggage will be carried today," IndiGo said on Monday.

column2: Indian woman cricketer approached for match-fixing during England series
column3: The BCCI's Anti-Corruption Unit (ACU) has filed an FIR in Bengaluru against Rakesh Bafna and Jitendra Kothari for an alleged attempt to fix an India-England women's match this year. Bafna allegedly approached an Indian woman cricketer and offered her money. The cricketer had reported the approach to the ACU and had even recorded her conversation with the bookie.

column2: For English cricket the summer has been a success: Joe Root
column3: Following the end of the Ashes 2019, England captain Joe Root termed the summer as a 'success' for English cricket. After winning the last Test, Root said, "The performance this week was a lot closer to the template of where we want to be moving forward in Test cricket... [I]t looks a hell of a lot better than 3-1."

column2: IAF appoints India's first woman defence attaché abroad
column3: The Indian Air Force appointed Wing Commander Anjali Singh as India's first woman defence attaché at an Indian mission abroad. Wing Commander Singh has been posted at the Indian embassy in Moscow and took charge on September 10. Attachés reportedly play a crucial role in the country’s military diplomacy and assist in defence cooperation, training, procurement and security among others.

column2: Kartarpur corridor to be opened for pilgrims on Nov 9: Pak
column3: Kartarpur corridor will be opened for Indian pilgrims from November 9, the Pakistani official heading the corridor project said on Monday. So far 86% of the work on the corridor has been completed, Project Director Atif Majid said. The corridor will give the Indian pilgrims access to Gurdwara Darbar Sahib in Pakistan's Kartarpur, the final resting place of Guru Nanak.

column2: 20-year-old youth burnt alive over inter-caste relationship in UP
column3: A 20-year-old Dalit man was allegedly burnt alive over his relationship with a woman from another caste in Uttar Pradesh's Hardoi district. The man was beaten up, kept hostage in a house before being set ablaze. His mother died of shock after hearing the news. An FIR has been filed against five people including two family members of the girl.

column2: Bombay HC dissatisfied with SIT report on Pansare murder case
column3: The Bombay High Court on Monday expressed displeasure over the probe report submitted by the Special Investigation Team in the murder case of Govind Pansare. The court said that the investigating officer had stated information based on other cases (probes into murders of Narendra Dabholkar and Gauri Lankesh). The investigating officer failed to list independent steps, the court added.

column2: Snowden calls on French President Macron to grant him asylum
column3: Former US National Security Agency contractor Edward Snowden, who leaked classified documents detailing US government surveillance programs, has called on French President Emmanuel Macron to grant him asylum. "Protecting whistleblowers is not a hostile act," Snowden said in an interview. Snowden unsuccessfully applied for asylum in France in 2013 under Macron's predecessor, Francois Hollande.

column2: Health insurance fraudsters to be named and shamed: NHA, IRDAI
column3: The National Health Authority and the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India said health insurance fraudsters under Ayushman Bharat should be publicly named and shamed. The move aims to stop them from committing malpractices and improve the Indian health insurance sector, their joint report said. It also suggested other practices for effective healthcare through health insurance.

column2: Director wanted me to 'rehearse a kissing scene': Zareen Khan
column3: Actress Zareen Khan has revealed that she has faced harassment by "sexual predators" in the industry. Recalling one of her experiences during her early days in the industry, Zareen said a director wanted her to "rehearse a kissing scene" but she refused. Zareen added that another person asked her if she would be interested in "being more than friends".

column2: Cine and TV Artistes' association didn't want people to work with me: Shilpa
column3: Actress Shilpa Shinde has said she won't do television shows and added, "The work I was getting wasn't good enough." "After a point, I realised that was because [Cine and TV Artistes' Association] didn't want people to work with me," she added. Shilpa had filed an FIR against her last show's producer accusing him of sexual harassment and mental torture.

column2: Not a single bullet fired, no life lost in J&K since Aug 5: Centre
column3: The Centre on Monday told the Supreme Court that not a single bullet was fired and not a single life had been lost since the abrogation of Article 370 in Jammu and Kashmir on August 5. The Centre's reply came after the court asked the Centre and the J&K government to restore normalcy in the state as soon as possible.

column2: I can't read a pitch: Paine on losing 5th Ashes Test after winning toss
column3: After losing the fifth Ashes Test after winning the toss and electing to bowl first, Australia captain Tim Paine admitted he cannot read a pitch, adding he's always 50-50 before the toss. "We're trying to get to stage where the toss isn't that important to us. You've got to win games of cricket when you lose a toss," he added.

column2: Pant will be rapped on the knuckles if he repeats mistakes: Shastri
column3: Team India head coach Ravi Shastri has said that 21-year-old wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant will be rapped on the knuckles if he repeats his mistakes. "No one will change his style but match awareness and shot selection become crucial in particular situations," Shastri added. "It's time for him to...just show the world how devastating he is," he further said.

column2: TNPL players approached by unknown persons on WhatsApp, probe ordered
column3: Several Tamil Nadu Premier League players have complained to the BCCI's Anti Corruption Unit (ACU) that they were approached by unknown persons on WhatsApp to fix matches. The BCCI's ACU has started an internal investigation in the matter. As per reports, an India player, an IPL regular and a Ranji Trophy coach are among those who figure in the investigation.

column2: IIT-Kharagpur students build home-rechargeable three-wheeler
column3: A team of students and professors at the Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur has built 'Deshla', an electric three-wheeler that can be charged at home. Three-year research and development for building the vehicle was led by mechanical engineering professor Vikranth Racherla. Deshla can run at a speed of up to 50 kmph and is more stable and jerk-free on roads.

column2: Govt seeks to limit private carpooling to 4 rides a day: Report
column3: The Central Government has reportedly finalised the draft policy guidelines for carpooling by private car owners. The guidelines include a KYC of users of the service to be made mandatory. The draft policy, which will go for public comments soon, also includes limiting a maximum of four rides per day per individual.

column2: Home rental platform NestAway raises $5 million from Goldman Sachs
column3: Co-living and home rental platform NestAway has raised close to $5 million from its existing investor Goldman Sachs. The funding comes at a time when reports suggest that NestAway is planning to close Series D round in the range of $150 million. In May, Tiger Global Management and Chiratae Ventures had participated in Series D round with $10 million investment.

column2: Fake Clinic Plus shampoo sachets, Lakme cosmetics seized in Odisha
column3: A huge quantity of fake cosmetic products, including Clinic Plus shampoo sachets, Lakme cosmetics and face wash was seized from several shops in Odisha's Kantabanji on Saturday night. A team of police and officials of Hindustan Unilever Ltd (HUL) conducted raids on several stores after receiving a tip-off. Police have detained two businessmen in this connection for questioning.

column2: Pune surgeon waits as driver changes car's flat tyre, bus runs them over
column3: Pune-based spine surgeon Dr Ketan Khurjekar and the driver of his car were killed and two other doctors injured after they were hit by a speeding bus on Pune-Mumbai Expressway near Talegaon on Sunday night. The doctors were waiting for the driver to change car's punctured tyre when the bus collided into them. The driver of the bus is absconding.

column2: Kerala freezes decision on new Motor Vehicles Act implementation
column3: The Kerala government will write to the Central government over the new Motor Vehicles (Amendment) Act, 2019, and has put on hold the decision on its implementation in the state. The decision was taken at a high-level meeting chaired by Transport Minister AK Saseendran on Monday. Earlier, Telangana also refused to impose the new fines under the amended Act.

column2: US woman swallows engagement ring in sleep while dreaming about it
column3: A US-based woman named Jenna Evans swallowed her engagement ring while dreaming about it last week. "I actually remember doing it, but I thought I was dreaming, so I went back to sleep," said Jenna, who shared her abdomen's X-ray on Facebook. The ring was later removed from her small intestine through an upper endoscopy.

column2: Anil Ambani's Reliance Communications unit GCX files for bankruptcy
column3: Anil Ambani-led Reliance Communications' unit Global Cloud Xchange (GCX Ltd) has filed for bankruptcy. The bankruptcy filing by the company comes after it failed to pay $350 million on its 7% bonds that matured at the beginning of August. GCX Ltd owns the world's largest private undersea cable system.

column2: I was five when I started learning Bharatanatyam: Aditi Rao Hydari
column3: Actress Aditi Rao Hydari has said that she started learning Bharatanatyam at the age of five and it was her choice to do so. "I was in boarding school and my mother was... insistent that I finish my education, I performed a lot before I became an actor," she added. She further said that one shouldn't compare themselves with others.

column2: Patriotic Muslims will vote for BJP: Karnataka Minister
column3: Karnataka Minister KS Eshwarappa said that patriotic Muslims will vote for the BJP and unpatriotic ones will hesitate. "Such outrageous statements is not in tune with democratic system," the Congress tweeted in response. Ahead of Lok Sabha polls, Eshwarappa had said that the BJP will not give tickets to Muslims as they don't believe in the party.

column2: They are cowards: Pawar on those quitting the NCP
column3: NCP chief Sharad Pawar termed those leaving the NCP to join the BJP as "cowards" and said the people of Maharashtra will take care of such people in the election. "There are some people who have lost their self-respect and switched over to the BJP," he added. Senior NCP leader Udayanraje Bhonsle quit the party and joined the BJP recently.

column2: Karnataka minister compares Cong MLAs to 'eunuchs'
column3: Karnataka's Rural Development and Panchayat Raj Minister KS Eshwarappa on Sunday compared some Congress MLAs to hijra (eunuch). A few Congress MLAs did not join the BJP because Muslims would not vote for them and it's a hijra (eunuch) behaviour, he said. Eshwarappa added that he never pleased the (Muslim) community and still managed to win the votes.

column2: AttainU raises angel funding from ex-Google India MD, others
column3: Edtech startup AttainU has raised an undisclosed amount in angel funding from ex-Google India MD Shailesh Rao and ex-Intuit India MD Nikhil Rungta. Financial technology firm SnapMint's Founder Anil Gelra, invoice discounting startup KredX's Founder Manish Kumar and LetsVenture also took part in the round. AttainU offers full-time, seven-month-long online software engineering courses.

column2: China will help us send 1st astronaut to space: Pak Tech Minister
column3: Pakistan Federal Minister for Science and Technology Fawad Hussain has said that China will help Pakistan send its first astronaut to space by the year 2022. The minister further added that the selection process for the astronaut would start in 2020, with the Pakistan Air Force playing an important part in the process.

column2: Ratul Puri's ED custody extended by 3 days in AgustaWestland case
column3: A Delhi court on Monday extended Ratul Puri's Enforcement Directorate (ED) custody by three days till September 19 in connection with money laundering case related to AgustaWestland VVIP chopper scam. Puri was arrested by the ED on September 4 and earlier his custody was extended till September 16. Ratul Puri is Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Kamal Nath's nephew.

column2: If there is a need, UP will implement NRC: CM Yogi
column3: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said that if there was a need to implement National Register of Citizens (NRC) in UP, he would do so. Adityanath added that NRC was important for national security and would put an end to the suffering of the poor due to illegal immigration. He also praised the NRC implementation in Assam.

column2: Roland Mouret presents her collection at London Fashion Week
column3: Designer Roland Mouret showcased his Spring/Summer 2020 collection at the London Fashion Week. The show featured a model in a light coloured overcoat with leaf patterns on it and others sporting checked suits and wide-legged trousers. Meanwhile, designer Simone Rocha's show was a 19th-century setup, with models wearing layered and embroidered dresses in dual tones.

column2: Surreal to graduate from 1-bedroom apartment to new house: Sidharth
column3: Sidharth Malhotra said in an interview that it's quite surreal for him to progress from a one-bedroom shared apartment to his new house with many bedrooms to himself. "When I moved to Mumbai, my friends became a support system," he added. Talking about marriage, Sidharth further said, "And when I do get married, my wife will become a support system."

column2: NASA wins Creative Arts Emmy for coverage of SpaceX mission
column3: American space agency NASA won the Outstanding Interactive Program award at the 71st Creative Arts Emmys for its multimedia coverage of SpaceX's Demonstration Mission 1 last March. SpaceX sent an uncrewed version of its Crew Dragon capsule on a six-day test flight to the International Space Station as part of NASA's Commercial Crew Program.

column2: Pak has too good education that you nearly died: Heena to Malala
column3: Reacting to Nobel Peace Prize winner Malala Yousafzai's tweets on schoolchildren in Kashmir, Indian shooter Heena Sidhu said, "Ok so you propose handing over Kashmir to Pakistan [which has] tooooo good of an education that you nearly lost your life." "[You] ran away from your country never to return," Sidhu added. Malala claimed that she spoke to Kashmiri people.

column2: BCCI accepts Karthik's apology, says matter now closed chapter
column3: The BCCI on Monday accepted wicketkeeper-batsman Dinesh Karthik's unconditional apology for violating a clause of his central contract by watching Trinbago Knight Riders' CPL match from the dressing room without taking the board's permission. "The matter is now a closed chapter," a BCCI official said. Karthik's contract bars him from being associated with any private overseas T20 league.

column2: Karti writes b'day letter to Chidambaram, takes dig at Modi govt
column3: Congress leader P Chidambaram turned 74 years old on Monday inside Delhi's Tihar Jail and his son Karti Chidambaram wrote a letter to him, taking a dig at PM Narendra Modi-led government. "You are turning 74 today and no 56!!! can stop you," wrote Karti. "[Government] celebrating how wonderfully the GDP is at a 6-year low of 5%," he added.

column2: At heart, I feel 74 yrs young: Chidambaram from Tihar on 74th b'day
column3: Former Finance Minister P Chidambaram, who is in custody in Tihar jail in connection with the INX Media case, turned 74 on Monday. His family tweeted on his behalf, "My family have brought me greetings from friends, party colleagues and well-wishers." "I'm reminded that I'm 74 years old...Indeed I am but at heart I feel 74 years young," he added.

column2: Pak man abuses elderly Indian woman in UK over Kashmir issue
column3: A video showing a Pakistani man abusing an elderly Indian woman in UK's Birmingham has surfaced online. "We will not tolerate India. We will fight till the end...till the last drop of blood. The way India moved us, we will move you from here. You will not stay here," the man can be heard saying in the video.

column2: Asked Shivsainiks to prepare to lay Ram Temple's 1st brick: Uddhav
column3: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray said that his party workers have been asked to prepare to lay the first brick for Ram Temple in Ayodhya. Thackeray said their hopes have increased with "all that the government was doing". "I'd urge the government to take a bold step...just like the way the government acted in abrogation of Article 370," Thackeray added.

column2: Prez Kovind stuck for 3 hrs in Zurich, Air India orders full inquiry
column3: Air India has ordered a "full inquiry" into the incident where President Ram Nath Kovind's flight was delayed at Zurich airport for three hours on Sunday after the aircraft developed a technical snag. The aircraft was scheduled to fly the President from Zurich to Slovenia. President drove to the airport but was asked to return to his hotel.

column2: After drone attacks, Houthi rebels say Saudi oil plants still a target
column3: Iran-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen on Monday said that Saudi Aramco's oil processing plants are still a target and could be attacked at "any moment", warning foreigners to leave the area. Saudi should stop its "aggression and blockade on Yemen", the rebels added. Houthi rebels had claimed the drone attacks that targeted two oil facilities of Saudi Aramco last week.

column2: Iran says President Rouhani won't meet Trump at UN
column3: A day after the White House left open the possibility of talks between Iranian President Hassan Rouhani and US President Donald Trump, Iran on Monday said Rouhani would not meet Trump at the UN. Such an event is not on our agenda, Iranian Foreign Ministry added. This follows US claim Iran was behind drone attacks on two Saudi oil facilities.

column2: Nobody knows what's going on between Justin and I: Wife Hailey
column3: Hailey Baldwin, who got married to Justin Bieber in September last year, defended their marriage in an interview and said that nobody from the outside knows what's going on between them. "I wake up every morning with this person. I'm the only person that has direct dialogue with this person. This is my relationship," Hailey added.

column2: Russell Simmons banned by NYC yoga studio over #MeToo accusations
column3: Russell Simmons, who was accused of at least 12 rape and sexual misconduct cases during the #MeToo movement, has been banned from New York City yoga studio Modo Yoga NYC. The owners of the studio in a statement said they received complaints from their students who were uncomfortable with his alleged conduct outside Modo. "I'm... hurt by it," Russell said.

column2: Invisible mob on internet lynch people without info: Rahul Bhat
column3: Actor Rahul Bhat, who portrayed a rape accused director in the film 'Section 375', said that the film talks about how easily things can be manipulated and a person is called guilty without any proper trial. "There is an invisible mob on the internet; they lynch a person without knowing what it's all about," he added.

column2: There will always be new entrants: Vaani on Janhvi and Sara
column3: Talking about her competition with Janhvi Kapoor and Sara Ali Khan, actress Vaani Kapoor said that there will always be new entrants in the film industry. "They are so good and everybody is putting in a lot of effort," she added. "I do my best... instead of worrying about what project did and didn't come to me," she further said.

column2: Still learning how to get the best out of Archer: Joe Root
column3: England captain Joe Root has said that he is still learning how to get the best out of England's new pacer Jofra Archer. "[W]e have got to be careful of expecting too much of him. He is a young guy at the start of his career, playing in three formats, and he is still learning," Root said about the pacer.

column2: MIT researchers create ML-driven tool to predict cardiovascular death
column3: Researchers at MIT have developed a machine learning system, 'RiskCardio', to better predict death caused by cardiovascular issues that block or reduce blood flow. The system uses the patient's first 15 minutes of raw electrocardiogram (ECG) signal and places them into different risk categories. It can predict whether a person will die within 30 days or up to a year.

column2: Google launches YouTube Music Charts for Indian users
column3: Google, on Monday, launched YouTube Music Charts in India which will list track artists, songs, music videos, and what's trending. It will also be available within YouTube Music. This comes days after YouTube announced it will no longer count advertising views on Music Charts after it saw artists and record labels using growth hacks to increase views on their videos.

column2: Volkswagen agrees to pay up to $127 mn to settle diesel scandal
column3: Volkswagen said on Monday that it agreed to pay between $87 million to $127 million to settle a lawsuit brought on behalf of several Australian customers over the global diesel emissions scandal. In 2015, it was revealed that about 11 million Volkswagen, Audi and Skoda vehicles worldwide were fitted with illegal defeat devices that were designed to cheat emissions tests.

column2: Roots Ventures invests in health food startup Kaarya Naturals
column3: Roots Ventures has invested an undisclosed amount in Mumbai-based health food startup Kaarya Naturals. It retails protein and health bars under the brand eighty20. Launched in 2017 by nutritionist Kajal Bhatia, eighty20 claims to make 100% natural, vegan, gluten-free and minimally processed healthy snacks. Roots Ventures has already completed eight early-stage investments till date.

column2: Victoria Beckham showcases her collection at London Fashion Week
column3: Designer Victoria Beckham on Sunday showcased her Spring/Summer 2020 collection at the London Fashion Week. The show featured models wearing dresses in an array of lengths and designs along with layered suits and low-cut gowns in cream, green, yellow and other colours. Talking about her collection, Victoria said, "Lightness, easiness, freedom... It's about dynamic women today, women in motion."

column2: Restore normalcy in J&K, keep in mind national security: SC to Centre
column3: The Supreme Court has asked the Centre to ensure normal life is restored in J&K and to also keep in mind national safety and security while doing so. Schools, hospitals, public transport should function properly, the SC said. The SC also asked the Union of India and J&K government to file an affidavit over petitions challenging Article 370 revocation.

column2: I will visit J&K if requirement arises: CJI Ranjan Gogoi
column3: Chief Justice of India Ranjan Gogoi on Monday said that he will visit Jammu & Kashmir if requirement arises. "It's very very serious if people are unable to approach the J&K High Court," Gogoi added. The SC has also allowed Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad to visit J&K, saying, "He will not make any speeches or hold any public rally."

column2: SC issues notice to Centre on plea seeking release of Farooq Abdullah
column3: Supreme Court has issued notices to the Centre and Jammu & Kashmir government after hearing a plea by MDMK chief, Vaiko, for release of former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah. Vaiko, in his petition, claimed Abdullah isn't being allowed to attend a seminar organised by him in Chennai. The court has fixed the matter for hearing on September 30.

column2: Farooq Abdullah detained under Public Safety Act: Reports
column3: Former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah has been detained under the Public Safety Act (PSA), as per reports. His residence in Srinagar has been declared as a subsidiary jail, reports added. There is, however, no bar on meeting relatives and friends. The PSA allows detention of any individual for up to two years without a trial.

column2: Google may soon let users search with screenshots: Report
column3: Google is pairing two mobile screen-related features, 'Edit & Share screenshots' and AI-powered 'What's on my Screen', according to a report. A new feature called 'Smart Screenshots' in the latest version of the Google 10.61 app brings up an updated toolbar when users take a screenshot, it added. The toolbar includes the 'Lens' option, allowing users to perform a search.

column2: Lee Fixel to invest $1 bn in startups including those in India: Report
column3: Former Tiger Global executive Lee Fixel is reportedly looking to invest around $1 billion through his new fund 'Addition' as soon as a non-compete agreement with his former employer expires. He plans to actively invest in technology startups in India and South-East Asia. As the head of Tiger Global’s private equity business, Fixel led the firm's investment in Flipkart.

column2: Special gesture, I'm delighted: PM Modi on Trump attending US event
column3: After the White House confirmed that US President Donald Trump will be attending the 'Howdy, Modi' event in Houston, PM Narendra Modi called it a "special gesture". PM Modi said he is delighted that President Donald Trump will join him at the event. "Looking forward to joining the Indian origin community in welcoming him at the programme," PM Modi added.

column2: Kim Jong-un invited Trump to North Korea in letter: Report
column3: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un invited US President Donald Trump to visit the country in a letter sent in August amid stalled denuclearisation talks, a South Korean newspaper reported on Monday, citing diplomatic sources. Kim spoke of his "willingness" for a third summit in the letter, which was reportedly sent in the third week of August.

column2: US 'locked & loaded' for potential response to Saudi attacks: Trump
column3: US President Donald Trump has said the country is "locked and loaded" for a potential response to the drone attacks on two Saudi Arabia oil facilities. This comes after State Secretary Mike Pompeo said that Iran was behind the attacks. "We are waiting to hear from Saudi as to who they believe was the cause of these attacks," Trump added.

column2: August wholesale inflation remains unchanged at 1.08%
column3: The wholesale price-based inflation in August remained unchanged at 1.08% on a month-on-month basis, government data showed on Monday. Wholesale inflation in primary articles like fruits, vegetables, wheat and milk was at 1.3% in August. In July, wholesale inflation had come in at a 25-month low of 1.08% owing to cheaper food and oil prices.

column2: Rachel Bloom announces pregnancy after winning Emmy award
column3: Actress Rachel Bloom on Saturday announced her pregnancy after winning an Emmy for best original music and lyrics at the Creative Arts Emmy Awards. "I'm three months pregnant. I get to tell my child that she was with me when this happened," she said. This will be her first child with Dan Gregor, with whom she got married in 2015.

column2: They'll have to approach me: Nawazuddin on working in Hollywood
column3: Talking about working in Hollywood, Nawazuddin Siddiqui said that if they want to work with him, they'll have to approach him. "Much like the craze in Pakistani actors to work in Bollywood, Indian actors too want to work in Hollywood," he added. "If I'm getting to do good work...why should I look for work in Hollywood?" he further said.

column2: Less stigma around depression today but long way to go: Deepika
column3: Deepika Padukone on Sunday attended an event on mental health in Delhi on behalf of her Live Love Laugh foundation. "I don't think there is as much stigma as there used to be four years ago. But we certainly have a long way to go," she said. Deepika further thanked the media for opening up the conversation around mental health.

column2: Norwich spent £1.4 mn in transfers, beat City who spent £1 bn
column3: Norwich City, who ended defending champions Manchester City's winning streak with a 3-2 win, spent £1.4 million in transfers while a recent study claimed that City were the first team to have spent £1 billion to build the team. Norwich have reached the top flight this season and have acquired their current top-scorer Teemu Pukki after a free transfer.

column2: Instagram working on TikTok-like video tool 'Clips': Report
column3: Instagram has been developing a new Story camera mode called "Clips" since early July, app and security researcher Jane Manchun Wong said. The feature, similar to TikTok's video tools, reportedly lets users record multiple segments of videos within a single video Story, overlay music and adjust the clips' speed and timer. It is unclear when the feature will be released.

column2: US teen sues JUUL, says vaping left lungs like a 70-yr-old's
column3: An 18-year-old boy from the US is suing e-cigarette maker JUUL for deceptive marketing, alleging that vaping for over a year left his lungs "like a 70-year-old's". Adam Hergenreder claimed he suffered a lung disease and was hospitalised over laboured breathing. The lawsuit alleged JUUL deliberately markets to young people without fully disclosing the presence of dangerous chemicals in products.

column2: Kae Capital to raise up to $60 mn for third VC fund: Report
column3: Early-stage investor Kae Capital is reportedly in talks to raise its third venture capital fund of up to $60 million. Kae Capital is expected to increase its funding ticket size to a million from the existing ticket size of $500,000-800,000. Founded in 2010 by Sasha Mirchandani, it has close to 70 investments in startups like 1mg, LoanTap and Truebil.

column2: Only experts in macroeconomics can revive economy: Swamy
column3: In his new book 'Reset: Regaining India's Economic Legacy', BJP MP Subramanian Swamy has said, "Today, the economy suffers from clueless economic stewardship." He added that only the experts in macroeconomics can revive the economy. "Economy is debilitated by serious multiple structural flaws that make this current slowdown unlike any other we've experienced since Independence," he wrote.

column2: Govt to set up 1,023 fast-track courts for over 1.66 lakh rape cases
column3: The Ministry of Law and Justice has proposed to set up 1,023 special fast-track courts (FTSCs) for speedy trials of over 1.66 lakh pending rape and POCSO cases. "Each FTSC is expected to dispose of 41-42 cases each quarter and at least 165 cases every year," stated the proposal. 389 FTSCs will exclusively handle POCSO cases.

column2: Beardo Thunder Sale to go live today
column3: Beardo is presenting its biggest ever 3-day 'Beardo Thunder Sale' which offers up to 70% off on all products. Beardo offers a wide range of men's grooming products, focussing on beard care, skin care, and hair care. It seeks to offer hassle-free products that are effective on men. Log on to www.beardo.in to take part in the 'Thunder Sale'.

column2: Trump to join PM Modi to address 50,000 Indian-Americans in US
column3: US President Donald Trump will join PM Narendra Modi to address 50,000 Indian-Americans at the 'Howdy, Modi' event in Houston on September 22. "It will be a great opportunity to emphasise the strong ties between US and India," the White House said. "The two leaders addressing the event is historic and unprecedented," Indian envoy to the US Harsh Shringla said.

column2: Article 370 history now, will see normalcy in J&K soon: Ram Madhav
column3: BJP National General Secretary Ram Madhav on Sunday said, "Article 370 is history now in Jammu and Kashmir, very soon we will see normalcy returning to Union Territory of Jammu and Kashmir." He added, "Things will normalise, fruits of development will reach people." Madhav said the government will take up other issues like Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) at the appropriate time.

column2: Malala urges UN to intervene in Kashmir, gets criticised
column3: Nobel Peace Prize winner and Pakistani education rights activist Malala Yousafzai has urged the UN to work towards peace in Kashmir and help children in the Valley to go back to school. Malala's remarks were criticised by Twitter users, who questioned her silence on the plight of the girls belonging to the minority community in Pakistan.

column2: Pankaj Advani wins his record 22nd world billiards title
column3: Pankaj Advani on Sunday increased his tally of world titles to 22 by winning a fourth straight final in the 150-up format at the IBSF World Billiards Championship in Mandalay in Myanmar. Further, In the short format of billiards, this is Advani’s fifth title in the last six years. Advani defeated Myanmar's Nay Thway Oo in the final.

column2: Quinton de Kock reminds me of Brian Lara, Kumar Sangakkara: Gambhir
column3: Former India cricketer Gautam Gambhir has said that South Africa wicketkeeper-batsman Quinton de Kock reminds him of Kumar Sangakkara and Brian Lara. "He is one of those gorgeous left-handers which I always aspired to be but could never be. Hopefully, he delivers as a captain but not at the cost of curtailing fluidity of his batting,” Gambhir added.

column2: Cummins sets record for most wickets in a Test series without a five-for
column3: Australia fast bowler Pat Cummins has set the world record for taking most wickets in a Test series without picking up a five-wicket haul. The 26-year-old pacer took 29 wickets in the 2019 Ashes, overtaking former Australian bowler Wayne Clark's record of 28 wickets without a five-wicket haul in a Test series. Cummins has taken 118 wickets in 24 Tests.

column2: Newly-wed couple shot dead in suspected honour killing in Punjab
column3: In a suspected case of honour killing, a newly-wed couple was allegedly shot dead by the woman's relatives in Punjab's Naushera Dhalla village on Sunday. According to SHO Kiranjit Singh, the relatives of the woman intercepted the couple on a road when they were on a motorcycle. The woman's relatives then allegedly shot them dead and fled from the spot.

column2: Jammu and Kashmir elections only after delimitation: JP Nadda
column3: BJP working president JP Nadda has said that the elections in Jammu and Kashmir will be held only after the delimitation of seats. Nadda said that ST seats will be reserved for Gujjars and Bakarwals in both Valley and Jammu. Delimitation is the process of fixing limits of territorial constituencies in a country or a province with a legislative body.

column2: Ex-inmate of Muzaffarpur shelter home allegedly raped by 4 of a family
column3: An ex-inmate of Bihar's Muzaffarpur shelter home was allegedly raped by four men in a moving vehicle in Bettiah town, police said. The woman said the four belong to the same family and two of them are brothers. The shelter home came into news in 2018 after a social audit report highlighted that over 30 girls were allegedly raped there.

column2: Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict back in prison after 51 days
column3: Nalini, a convict in Rajiv Gandhi assassination case, was sent back to women's prison in Tamil Nadu's Vellore on Sunday after spending 51 days on parole. The Madras High Court had granted a month's parole to Nalini to make arrangements for her daughter's marriage. The court had later extended her parole by three weeks. She was released on July 25.

column2: 'Silicon Valley' creators making series on Match.com: Report
column3: John Altschuler and David Krinsky, co-creators of television series 'Silicon Valley', are developing a series on the origins of dating website Match.com, Variety magazine reported. They are reportedly adapting a book titled 'The Players Ball: A Genius, a Con Man, and the Secret History of the Internet's Rise'. The book tells how Gary Kremen created Match.com using a $2,500 loan.

column2: Spain beat Argentina 95-75 to win Basketball World Cup
column3: Spain beat Argentina 95-75 to win the Basketball World Cup in Beijing, their first title in 13 years. Phoenix Suns point guard and tournament MVP Ricky Rubio scored 20 points and created three assists, while NBA champion and Toronto Raptors' Marc Gasol added 14 points and seven assists in the final. France won bronze with a 67-59 win over Australia.

column2: I was pissed off with Hazard for losing ball twice: Courtois
column3: Speaking about compatriot and new Real Madrid signee, Eden Hazard's La Liga debut, goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois said he got "pissed off" with Hazard for losing possession twice. "It became 3-1 and then 3-2 and we knew we couldn't drop points again. In the end, I was able to make the stop to save us," Courtois said about the 3-2 win.

column2: Lock screen bypass flaw found in Apple's upcoming iOS 13
column3: Security researcher Jose Rodriguez has discovered a security flaw in Apple's upcoming iOS 13 allowing anyone to bypass iPhone lock screen protection. Using an incoming FaceTime call and Siri's VoiceOver feature, anyone can access the iPhone's contact information like phone numbers and e-mail addresses. The iOS 13, releasing globally on September 19, will likely not contain the bug's fix.

column2: PopSockets launches grips for beverages called PopThirst
column3: PopSockets, which makes grips for smartphones, has launched grips for cup holders called PopThirst. The PopThirst works with both hot and cold beverages. They are 'designed with a non-slip foam material that prevents hand slippage' and will be available to purchase starting September 15. Founded in 2012, the company had generated about $90 million in profit in 2018 alone.

column2: AI-based weapons, robots could cause atrocities: Ex-Google worker
column3: Laura Nolan, a former Google software engineer who had resigned after being assigned to work on a project to enhance US military drone technology, has said that AI-based autonomous weapons should be banned. "[A]ny advanced weapons systems should be subject to meaningful human control, otherwise they have to be banned because they are far too unpredictable and dangerous," Nolan added.

column2: Plastic pollution has entered Earth's fossil record: Study
column3: A study conducted by researchers at the University of California San Diego has found that plastic pollution is now a part of the Earth's fossil record. Scientists studied the layers of the Earth in California dating back to 1834. They found that deposits of plastic have increased exponentially since the end of World War II, doubling around every 15 years.

column2: Bihar's people have rejected Nitish Kumar: Former Union Minister
column3: Former Union Minister of State for HRD and Rashtriya Lok Samta Party (RLSP) leader Upendra Kushwaha said, "Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has done nothing in terms of education, healthcare and employment," and added that people of Bihar have rejected him. "The Mahagathbandhan will contest the Assembly elections together and bring justice to the people of Bihar," he further said.

column2: UK PM likens himself to Incredible Hulk, vows Oct 31 Brexit
column3: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson likened himself to the comic book character The Incredible Hulk and stressed his determination to take Britain out of the European Union on October 31. "The madder Hulk gets, the stronger Hulk gets," he said. "Hulk always escaped, no matter how tightly bound... and that is the case for this country," Johnson added.

column2: Saudi Aramco assures Indian refinery of oil supply: Report
column3: Saudi Arabian state-owned oil giant Saudi Aramco has reportedly assured an Indian refinery that there will be no immediate impact on oil supplies, after its two oil plants suffered drone attacks on Saturday. Aramco told the refinery it will deliver them crude from other sources and has adequate inventory. It has lost half of its production capacity in the attacks.

column2: HK protesters sing UK national anthem in plea to Britain
column3: Hundreds of Hong Kong protesters singing "God Save the Queen", UK's national anthem, and waving Union Jack flags rallied outside the British Consulate on Sunday. The protestors demanded that the former colonial power ensures China honours its commitments to the city's freedoms. Demonstrators also held banners reading "One country, two systems is dead" and "UK save Hong Kong".

column2: Not one rupee left in my bank account: National Award-winning composer
column3: National Award-winning composer Vanraj Bhatia, who composed songs for films including '36 Chowringhee Lane' and 'Manthan', has said, "I've no money...not one rupee left in my bank account." To make ends meet, British crockery at his residence has been put up on sale. The 92-year-old is reportedly also suffering from "severe hearing loss" and has "extended bouts of memory lapses".

column2: If you want to copy my song, at least do a good job: Pak singer to Salim
column3: Pakistani singer Farhan Saeed has accused singer-composer Salim Merchant of copying the song 'Haareya' from his song 'Roiyaan'. "If you want to copy my song, do it after asking me and if you don't want to ask at least do a good job!#stopstealing," Farhan tweeted. "I just heard [Roiyaan]. It's a mere coincidence that...Haareya is like your song," Salim replied.

column2: Step out the day it gets boring: Meghna Malik to female actors
column3: Meghna Malik has said female actors should step out the day it gets boring and not think about the money. Talking about young female actors playing the roles of aged women, Meghna added, "When the character remains central and interesting, you should do it." The 37-year-old had played the role of an aged woman in 'Na Aana Iss Des Laado'.

column2: Alia looks exactly like her mother: Azmi on still from 1983 film 'Mandi'
column3: Actress Shabana Azmi on Saturday took to social media to share a still from her 1983 film 'Mandi' which also starred Alia Bhatt's mother Soni Razdan. "Alia Bhatt looks exactly like her mother Soni Razdan. Here is proof," Azmi captioned the still from the movie. In the still shared by her, actress Smita Patil can also be seen.

column2: England beat Australia in 5th Test as Ashes ends in a draw after 47 years
column3: England defeated Australia by 135 runs in fifth Test as 2019 Ashes ended in a 2-2 draw. This is the first time since 1972 that an Ashes series ended in a draw. Australia won 14 of the 24 Ashes series played between the two drawn series. Overall, it is the sixth time that an Ashes series ended in a draw.
