Karjol added that he's not in favour of levying high fines for traffic violation.

column2: Sacked NSA John Bolton was a disaster on North Korea: Trump
column3: US President Donald Trump said that former NSA John Bolton had been a "disaster" when it came to handling North Korea. Trump added Bolton had offended North Korean leader Kim Jong-un by demanding that he follow a "Libyan model" and hand over all nuclear weapons. Trump fired Bolton earlier this week, saying he "strongly disagreed with many" of Bolton's suggestions.

column2: I miss my kids' young days, hardly get time with them: Ayushmann
column3: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana in an interview said that due to his hectic film schedule, he is missing the young days of his kids as he hardly gets any time to be with his family. "I am travelling most of the time... shooting four films back to back," he added. "They miss me and I miss them immensely," he further said.

column2: Canadian PM Trudeau dissolves Parliament, elections on Oct 21
column3: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau on Wednesday called for general elections on October 21 and formally kicked off a six-week re-election campaign. Trudeau met with Governor General Julie Payette, Queen Elizabeth II's representative in Canada and requested the dissolution of parliament. "We've done a lot these past four years, but the truth is we're just getting started," Trudeau said.

column2: Indian, Chinese troops face off in Ladakh; issue resolved after talks
column3: Soldiers of the Indian Army and People's Liberation Army of China were engaged in a confrontation near the border in Ladakh on Wednesday. The face-off was over following delegation-level talks between the two sides, the Indian Army said. Reportedly, the Chinese troops had objected to Indian Army's presence when their patrol was moving around the northern bank of Pangong Tso.

column2: Whatever happens, happens: Brad's son when asked if their relation is over
column3: Actor Brad Pitt's 18-year-old adopted son Maddox, on being asked if his relationship with Brad is "over", said, "Whatever happens, happens." When the interviewer asked if Brad is expected to visit him in college, Maddox replied, "I don't know about that." It was reportedly after an altercation between Maddox and Pitt in 2016 that Angelina Jolie filed for divorce.

column2: Some people took cheques and kept quiet: Actress Chahatt on MeToo
column3: Television actress Chahatt Khanna has called the #MeToo movement a "fashion trend" and added, "Some of them...took cheques and kept quiet. Jinka publicity stunt tha, woh kaam kar gaya." "There were quite a few actors whose names should have surfaced but didn't," she added. Chahatt further questioned, "Agar suffering hoti hai, then why wait for a platform like MeToo?"

column2: Lost foreign films as makers felt I don't look like typical Indian: Aditi
column3: Actress Aditi Rao Hydari has revealed she lost many international films because in most cases, the makers felt she doesn't look like a 'conventional Indian'. "It's surprising how I've been told that I look different quite a number of times," she added. "There are instances when even after giving a good audition, the role didn't come to me," said Aditi.

column2: Int'l community believes India, not us: Pak minister on Kashmir
column3: Speaking about Kashmir, Pakistan's Federal Minister for Interior Ijaz Ahmad Shah said, "People do not believe us...in the international community." Blaming Pakistan's "ruling elite", including PM Imran Khan for "destroying" country's image, Shah stated, "We say they (India) impose curfew and aren't giving medicines to people of J&K. People do not believe us but they believe them."

column2: Lahiru Thirimanne, Dasun Shanaka to lead Sri Lanka in Pakistan
column3: Lahiru Thirimanne and Dasun Shanaka have been named as Sri Lanka's ODI and T20I captains respectively for the tour of Pakistan. This comes two days after Dimuth Karunaratne and Lasith Malinga, the incumbents, opted out of the tour citing security concerns. Sri Lanka and Pakistan are scheduled to play three ODIs and three T20Is between September 27 and October 9.

column2: Anything is possible: Gurpreet after India hold Qatar to 0-0 draw
column3: After India held Asian champions Qatar to a 0-0 draw in a FIFA World Cup Round 2 qualifying match, goalkeeper Gurpreet Singh Sandhu said, "I feel extremely proud of the team." "We've played just two matches, and we've played well, that too against two powerful teams. It gives us...added motivation and confidence that in football, anything is possible," he added.

column2: Amazon allegedly lists some toys without confirming their safety
column3: Amazon allegedly allows the sale of some toys before verifying the "required safety documentation", as per an email seen by CNBC. Amazon reportedly asked some sellers for the document to be submitted by September 9, two weeks after they started selling their products. This comes after recent reports which claimed that over 4,000 unsafe products were found listed on Amazon.

column2: AIADMK leader uses Jayalalithaa's memorial as venue for son's wedding
column3: AIADMK leader S Bhavanishankar held his son's wedding ceremony at the premises of late Tamil Nadu CM J Jayalalithaa's memorial on the Marina Beach in Chennai on Wednesday. The memorial was decorated with flowers, and the couple sat in front of the samadhi for the wedding ceremony. AIADMK's two-leaves symbol was also drawn on the samadhi's floor using flowers.

column2: WeWork communications head quits ahead of planned IPO
column3: WeWork's Chief Communications Officer Jennifer Skyler has resigned from the co-working space giant to become the Chief Corporate Affairs Officer at American Express. Skyler, a former Consumer Communications Director at Facebook, has worked at WeWork for over 3.5 years. This comes ahead of the startup's planned move to go public, which it had confidentially filed its documents for in April.

column2: Water vapour found on 'super-Earth' in habitable zone in a first
column3: NASA's Hubble Space Telescope has helped astronomers find evidence of water vapour on a 'super-Earth' exoplanet in its star's "habitable zone" for the first time. The planet, K2-18b, is around 110 light-years away with temperatures neither too hot nor too cold which can support the presence of liquid water. However, scientists said it likely has a very high-pressure atmosphere.

column2: Shahid has lived longer, I can benefit from his experience: Mira
column3: Talking about her 14-year age gap with husband Shahid Kapoor, Mira Rajput Kapoor said, "He's lived longer... I can benefit from his experience, and he can benefit from my fresh perspective." Mira further said that their arranged marriage wasn't a challenge and added, "The change from Delhi to Mumbai was actually a... pleasant one." They got married in July 2015.

column2: Coolie No. 1 producer thanks firefighters after fire broke out on sets
column3: After a major fire broke out on the sets of Varun Dhawan and Sara Ali Khan starrer 'Coolie No. 1' on Wednesday, producer Jackky Bhagnani thanked firefighters, Mumbai Police and the BMC officials for their timely assistance. "After a concerning situation on the sets of #Coolieno1 The fire was put out immediately with no casualties," he added.

column2: I don't get sometimes why Joe Root is under so much scrutiny: Tim Paine
column3: Australia Test captain Tim Paine has said he "doesn't get sometimes why England Test captain Joe Root is under so much scrutiny". "We know how competitive he is, we know how good he is, we know he’ll be coming hard and looking to bounce back this week so he’s a huge wicket for us as he always is," Paine added.

column2: Over 3,000 shifted from low-lying areas of Sardar Sarovar Dam
column3: Nearly 3,400 people living in low-lying areas near the Sardar Sarovar Dam have been shifted to safer places after its water level crossed the 136-metre mark, officials said on Wednesday. The reservoir was receiving an inflow of 8.5 lakh cusec water, of which 8 lakh cusec was being released, Sardar Sarovar Narmada Nigam Limited's chief engineer PC Vyas, said.

column2: Ayushmann, Kriti urge you to change your address with MagicBricks
column3: Ayushmann Khurana and Kriti Sanon have joined hands with MagicBricks for #PataBadloLifeBadlo campaign, urging you to live a better life with a better address, access to better amenities for fitter self, homes nearby work to save time, more space for bigger dreams, among others. The actors connect with the campaign as they tasted success after changing their address to Mumbai.

column2: I am dating someone, he is not an actor or a cricketer: Taapsee
column3: Actress Taapsee Pannu has confirmed that she's dating someone and added, "[He] isn't into the profession where people are more curious about him. He isn't an actor or a cricketer." "He's not even from here around," she added. "People who are genuinely interested in my life [and] not just to make gossip columns about it, know about it," said Taapsee.

column2: Chennai couple reunite with son kidnapped 20 yrs ago & adopted in US
column3: Chennai-based couple Nageshwar Rao and Sivagami reunited with their 22-year-old son Avinash on September 8 in Chennai, 20 years after he was was kidnapped in 1999 and sent to the US for adoption. Their son was kidnapped by an autorickshaw driver and sold to an orphanage that facilitated illegal adoptions. The couple met Avinash after a long legal battle.

column2: Smith should not be associated with any cricketing great: Monty Panesar
column3: Spinner Monty Panesar has said that Australia batsman Steve Smith's name should not be associated with any cricketing great. "Because of the sandpaper incident, Smith will always be below the 'great' status," he added. "There's a difference between a good player and a great player. If we'll compare Smith with Ricky Ponting, we'd be tarnishing Ponting's image," he further said.

column2: We sent U19 team to SL after Easter attack, expect reciprocation: Akhtar
column3: Former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar has said that he is "so disappointed" after 10 Sri Lankan players pulled out of their tour to Pakistan. He added that Pakistan expects reciprocation from Sri Lanka as they had sent their Under-19 team to Sri Lanka after the Easter attacks. "Their board is cooperating, players should also," he added.

column2: Gayle smashes his 22nd T20 hundred, 14 more than the 2nd best
column3: Playing for Jamaica Tallawahs against St Kitts and Nevis Patriots in CPL, opener Chris Gayle smashed 116 runs off 62 deliveries, his 22nd hundred in T20 cricket. Gayle has hit 14 more hundreds than next best Michael Klinger. Gayle helped his team set a total of 241/4, however, St Kitts and Nevis Patriots chased down the target in 18.5 overs.

column2: Cricketer Pragyan Ojha blessed with baby boy, shares first glimpse
column3: Cricketer Pragyan Ojha took to social media to reveal that he and his wife Karabee Baral were blessed with a baby boy on September 7. He also shared a glimpse of the newborn, writing, "For all things my hands have held, the best by far is you." Notably, the baby boy was born two days after the cricketer's birthday.

column2: New law to create fear, we're losing 2% GDP due to accidents: Gadkari
column3: Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari has said the amended Motor Vehicles Act has been implemented to create fear and respect for the law. "It isn't a revenue making proposal but a proposal to save lives. We're losing 2% GDP due to road accidents," he added. "It isn't the intention of the government to increase fines to get revenue," he further said.

column2: Ratul Puri's ED custody extended for 5 days in AgustaWestland case
column3: A Delhi court on Wednesday extended businessman Ratul Puri's Enforcement Directorate (ED) custody till September 16 in a money laundering case related to AgustaWestland chopper scam. The ED told the court that fresh evidence was recovered during the probe and added that Puri's further custodial interrogation was required in the investigation. Puri was arrested by the ED on September 4.

column2: Man calls ex-staffer to pay dues, rapes her and leaves her in brothel
column3: A 27-year-old Mumbai businessman has been arrested for allegedly raping his former employee and leaving her in a brothel. The woman said that the accused asked her to meet him for collecting her salary dues and took her to a beach where he offered her alcohol, following which she got dizzy. Next day, she found herself in a brothel.

column2: 15-yr-old raped by 3 men, runs half-a-km to escape man trying to help
column3: A 15-year-old girl on her way to a temple with her friends was abducted, beaten and raped by three men in Rajasthan, police said on Wednesday. She was so traumatised that she also tried to escape from the man trying to rescue her, and ran half-a-kilometre naked. When she eventually stopped, the man gave her clothes and took her home.

column2: If Taliban comes back to US, will use power like never before: Trump
column3: US President Donald Trump warned on Wednesday that if the Taliban "comes back" to the US, the country will use "the power the likes of which it has never used before". Trump added that US forces "hit them" harder than ever in Afghanistan. The US President's remarks came at a ceremony to mark the anniversary of the 9/11 attacks.

column2: Multiple people stabbed at workplace in US; suspect detained
column3: Multiple people were stabbed at a workplace in Tallahassee, US, on Wednesday. Police said that they have taken a suspect in custody but it was not immediately clear if the suspect is an employee. Local media reported that employees of the company chased the suspect to the parking lot of a neighbouring Coca-Cola plant.

column2: Warner's lean patch will test his character: Justin Langer
column3: Talking about Australia opener David Warner, who has registered three ducks in his eight 2019 Ashes innings, team's coach Justin Langer said, "He's a world-class player...so it's going to be a good test of his character." The former opener added, "He hasn't got the runs he wants at the moment but jeez I'm looking forward to seeing...when he does."

column2: Guys are still trying to make sense of World Cup loss: Williamson
column3: Two months after losing 2019 World Cup final on boundary count, New Zealand captain Kane Williamson said, "Guys are still thinking about it...trying to make sense of it." "It's one of those games which...you'll look back on and really have appreciated being involved," he added. He further praised team's unity saying he is proud of the way they stuck together.

column2: Don't join NDA just for a ministerial berth: Shiv Sena MP
column3: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Wednesday said that those leaving other parties to join the Shiv Sena-BJP alliance should not do it only to become MLAs, MPs and ministers. Those planning to join us should fully accept the ideology of Hindutva, Raut said. "We want the expansion of Hindutva ideology in both the country and the state," he added.

column2: Nitish is and will remain captain of NDA in Bihar: Deputy CM
column3: Bihar's Deputy CM Sushil Modi on Wednesday tweeted that CM "Nitish Kumar is the captain of NDA in Bihar and will remain its captain" in the next Assembly polls scheduled in 2020. This comes amid talks of change in leadership in Bihar's ruling NDA. "When the captain is hitting four and six...where is the question of any change," Modi added.

column2: Truebil raises $1 mn from Japan-based Spiral Ventures
column3: Used car marketplace Truebil raised $1 million in a fresh funding round from Japan-based Spiral Ventures. Truebil had raised $14 million in Series B funding in a mix of equity and debt in January. Founded by IIT alumni Suraj Kalwani, Ravi Chirania, Shubh Bansal, etc. in 2015, it follows integrated online and offline model for buying and selling pre-owned cars.

column2: Study Gujarat model on traffic fines: Karnataka CM to officials
column3: The Karnataka CMO on Wednesday said that Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa has instructed officials to study the Gujarat model of revised traffic fines and implement something similar in the state. "Citizens are facing inconvenience due to the hefty fine amounts," Yediyurappa told officials. This comes after the Gujarat government announced reductions in traffic fines by up to 90% on Tuesday.

column2: 3 Delhi men beaten, taken to police over child-lifting rumours
column3: Three men were beaten up in the national capital's Abul Fazal area on Tuesday over allegations of child-lifting. "After immersing the Ganesh idol, [the three men] had come out to eat in the area when the public labelled them as child-lifters and attacked," a police official said. After beating, people handed them over to the police.

column2: Pak builds 30 terrorist launch pads across LoC in J&K: Report
column3: Pakistan is reportedly building 30 terrorist launch pads across the Line of Control (LoC) to infiltrate terrorists into J&K. "Pakistan army and the ISI (Inter-Services Intelligence) are moving militants of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) and Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) into these launch pads," the report citing security sources said. The sources also claim that militants from Afghanistan are being mobilised towards the LoC.

column2: St Vincent & Grenadines 79th to join India-led Int'l Solar Alliance
column3: Saint Vincent and the Grenadines on Wednesday became the 79th country to join India-led International Solar Alliance (ISA). The initiative was launched by France and India during the Climate Change Conference (COP21) in Paris in November 2015. The PM of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines Ralph Gonsalves had arrived in India on Sunday for a five-day official visit.

column2: Chinese woman dislocates jaw while laughing, left with mouth open
column3: A Chinese woman was left with her mouth stuck open after she dislocated her jaw while laughing very hard. The incident took place when the woman was travelling on a train bound for Guangzhou in south China. A doctor on the train was eventually able to reset the jaw of the woman, who had dislocated it earlier as well.

column2: Dear India, that is my team: Chhetri as India hold Qatar for 0-0 draw
column3: After India held Asian champions Qatar for a goalless draw in 2022 FIFA World Cup Qualifier, captain Sunil Chhetri tweeted, "Dear India, THAT is my team and THOSE are my boys! Cannot describe how proud I'm at this moment." "Not a big result for the table, but in terms of a fight, as big as it can get," he added.

column2: Domestic violence case against Yuvraj Singh closed as accuser apologises
column3: The domestic violence case against ex-India cricketer Yuvraj Singh, his mother Shabnam Singh and brother Zorawar Singh has been closed after Zorawar's estranged wife Akanksha apologised to the family. "[Yuvraj's] great reputation was put at stake for personal mala fide reasons in the most unfair manner in hope of gaining some kind of advantage," the family said in a statement.

column2: Prosus, which holds Naspers' Swiggy stake, valued at $138bn on listing
column3: Prosus, which comprises South African group Naspers' global internet assets, surged as much as 32% on its first day of listing in Amsterdam to value the business at about $138 billion. The Naspers spin-off owns a $131 billion stake in Tencent, as well as investments in India's Swiggy, Byju's and Meesho. Naspers is retaining a controlling 75% stake in Prosus.

column2: Had many days with only 1 meal in first 6 yrs of One97: Founder
column3: Vijay Shekhar Sharma said following 9/11 attacks it was clear there wouldn't be any hope for venture capital investments in young Indian companies like One97 Communications, which he founded in 2001. "I ended up raising my Series A investment from SAIF Partners and Ash Lilani in 2007! In those six years, had many days with only one meal," Sharma added.

column2: Alleged video of Chinmayanand getting naked massage surfaces online
column3: A video purportedly showing BJP leader Swami Chinmayanand naked and receiving a massage by a woman has surfaced online. A website which posted screenshots from the video claimed that it was shot by the woman herself by a camera fitted in her spectacles. Chinmayanand is currently under investigation for the alleged rape of an Uttar Pradesh law student.

column2: Dalits allege dominant castes locked their water supply in TN
column3: The Dalits in Tamil Nadu's Kayampatti village alleged that the dominant OBC community has put a lock on the valve of the pipeline, serving water to their households from an overhead tank, for last several years. The Dalits said their water supply has been limited because of the lock. Block Development Officer said they have ordered to remove the lock.

column2: Video of 'moonwalk' on pothole-ridden Bengaluru road recreated in Mexico
column3: Days after a video by Bengaluru-based street artist Baadal Nanjundaswamy showing a man dressed as astronaut walking on potholes shown as Moon went viral, a digital advertising agency has recreated it on a road in Mexico. The video, shot in Pachuca, shows someone dressed up in an astronaut suit carrying Mexican flag and walking slowly on an uneven surface.

column2: India supports UN's call for direct Taliban-Afghan govt talks
column3: India has supported the UN's call for direct talks between the Taliban and the Afghan government. "It's the Afghan people who will implement and bear the consequences of any agreements arrived at. Hence outcomes having...political mandate and (which) are arrived at in an inclusive and democratic way alone can ensure stability," India's Permanent Representative to the UN, Syed Akbaruddin, said.

column2: India successfully test fires Man Portable Antitank Guided Missile
column3: The Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) on Wednesday successfully test fired indigenously developed Man Portable Antitank Guided Missile (MPATGM) from a firing range in Kurnool, Andhra Pradesh. This was the third successful testing of MPATGM. The missile fired from a tripod hit the target, which was mimicking a functional tank, in the top attack mode and completely destroyed it.

column2: Police constable suspended for stalking, harassing woman in TN
column3: A police constable named Prabakaran was suspended for stalking and harassing a 35-year-old married woman on Tuesday in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore. Prabakaran allegedly followed the woman's two-wheeler, and blocked her way. He allegedly verbally abused her after telling her that she looked beautiful and complimenting her eyes. Police recovered alcohol bottles from his bike and said that he was drunk.

column2: Trump shares campaign poster on running for 3rd term in 2024
column3: US President Donald Trump shared an image of a campaign poster that bears his name and the year 2024, apparently joking that he would run for a third term in office in 2024. The US Constitution mandates a limit of two four-year presidential terms. Trump had earlier shared a parody video suggesting that he could be President '4EVA'.

column2: Fed 'boneheads' should cut interest rates to zero 'or less': Trump
column3: US President Donald Trump called on Federal Reserve to lower interest rates to "zero, or less", saying the US "should always be paying the lowest rate". "A once in a lifetime opportunity that we're missing because of 'Boneheads'," he tweeted. The Washington Post had reported that Trump could personally save millions of dollars annually in interest if Fed lowers rates.

column2: Audi unveils AI:Trail quattro concept with drones as headlights
column3: Audi unveiled its new all-electric, all-terrain AI:Trail quattro concept at the 2019 Frankfurt Motor Show which has drones as headlights called 'Audi Light Pathfinders'. The vehicle will have a total of five rotorless, triangular, electrically-operated drones with integrated matrix LED elements that can fly around the vehicle, shining light on the path ahead as well as recording videos.

column2: Add impartial stories about us on upcoming news tab: FB to curators
column3: Facebook has sent a memo to its employees containing guidelines for curators for its upcoming news tab which instructed them not to censor 'bad news' about the company. The memo also notified curators to "impartially share stories about Facebook, Facebook executives and tech at large". Facebook confirmed in August that it will launch the news tab later this year.

column2: BJP holds statewide protest against Kamal Nath govt in MP
column3: Madhya Pradesh BJP on Wednesday held a statewide protest against Chief Minister Kamal Nath-led Congress government over delayed promises and other issues. "Farmers loans have not been waived off...There is no unemployment allowance...while electricity rates continue to be very high," BJP's state President Rakesh Singh said. Police later arrested Singh along with several other party workers.

column2: Marsplay raises pre-Series A round led by Venture Highway
column3: Fashion e-commerce platform Marsplay has raised an undisclosed amount of pre-Series A round of funding led by Venture Highway. The round saw participation from Alvin Tse from Xiaomi and Jonathan Lau, Partner, Cadorna Ventures. Existing angels including the personal offices of Shailesh Rao, partner with TPG Growth and Nikhil Mohta, Director, ICICI Ventures also participated in the round.

column2: Man allegedly commits suicide by jumping before Delhi Metro train
column3: A 40-year-old man allegedly committed suicide by jumping in front of a train at Adarsh Nagar Metro Station on Wednesday. The man died on the spot and the police didn't find any suicide note. Notably, the DMRC is running a campaign where it is appealing commuters to ask for help to overcome problems instead of giving up.

column2: Doctor beaten up with helmet by patient's relatives in Hyd
column3: A woman house surgeon was assaulted by a patient's relatives at Hyderabad's Gandhi Hospital on Monday. The patient was brought in with severe burn injuries and we weren't able to stabilise the patient, a doctor said. The relatives then started beating the house surgeon and when she tried escaping, one of them struck her with a helmet, the doctor added.

column2: Arab League condemns Netanyahu's plans to annex Jordan Valley
column3: Arab League condemned a plan by Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu to annex parts of Palestinian territories as "aggression" undermining any chances of a peace settlement with the Palestinians. Netanyahu on Tuesday said he planned to annex the Jordan Valley, a large swathe of the occupied West Bank, if he is re-elected in polls to be held on September 17.

column2: Hong Kong protests called off to mark 9/11 attacks anniversary
column3: Hong Kong activists on Wednesday called off anti-government protests in remembrance of the September 11, 2001 terror attacks on the US. The protestors also denounced a Chinese state newspaper report claiming that protesters were planning "massive terror" attacks in Hong Kong. Anti-government protests in Hong Kong began after a bill to allow extraditions to China was introduced.

column2: UK accuses Iran of selling oil from seized tanker to Syria
column3: The UK on Tuesday said Iranian tanker Adrian Darya-1 had sold its crude oil to Syria, breaking assurances it had given not to sell crude to Syria. The tanker was seized by British Royal Marines in July, in Gibraltar, on suspicion of being en route to Syria. Gibraltar released the tanker after receiving written assurances from Iran.

column2: US drops 36,000 kg of bombs on 'ISIS-infested island'; shares video
column3: US Air Force jets dropped 36,000 kg of bombs on what the US called an "ISIS-infested island" in Iraq, a video of which was shared on Twitter. F-15 and F-35 jets were used to bomb the Qanus Island. Troops were then sent in to clear the area, that was described as a 'transit hub' for ISIS militants coming from Syria.

column2: Nick Jonas criticised for posing with cigar for magazine
column3: Singer Nick Jonas has been criticised for posing with a cigar for a magazine. Some users commented, "Smoking is bad" and "Oh your poor lungs". Several others also mentioned that his wife, actress Priyanka Chopra suffers from asthma. "Your wife has asthma. I hope you're thoughtful enough to not smoke when she's around," a comment read.

column2: Apple gains $11 billion in market value after iPhone 11 launch
column3: Apple's market value rose by over $11 billion after the September 10 event where the technology giant launched its 2019 lineup of phones among other devices and services. Apple unveiled iPhone 11, iPhone 11 Pro and iPhone 11 Pro Max, starting at $699, Apple Watch Series 5 and the seventh-generation iPad. It also announced its video streaming service Apple TV+.

column2: Right to life given to humans: Owaisi to PM over his cow remark
column3: AIMIM MP Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said, "Cow is a sacred animal for our Hindu brothers but in Constitution, the right to life and equality has been given to humans. I hope the PM will keep it in mind." This comes after Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that some people get uneasy whenever they hear the words 'cow' and 'Om'.

column2: Thousands protest in Bengaluru over Shivakumar's arrest
column3: Thousands of protesters affiliated to the Congress, Janata Dal (Secular), Karnataka Rakshana Vedike and Vokkaliga organisations held a march on Wednesday in Bengaluru against the arrest of Congress leader DK Shivakumar. The Enforcement Directorate had arrested Shivakumar in a money laundering case on September 3. The ED also summoned Shivakumar's daughter to appear before it on Thursday.

column2: Have evidence against Chinmayanand on pen drive: UP law student
column3: Uttar Pradesh law student who has accused BJP leader Swami Chinmayanand of rape has said a pen drive has been submitted to the SIT, which has vital evidence against Chinmayanand. The pen drive was submitted to the SIT by her friend, who claimed that the pen drive contains a video that's enough to expose the "real face" of Chinmayanand.

column2: New Motor Vehicle Act too harsh, can't implement in West Bengal: CM
column3: Calling the new Motor Vehicle Act "too harsh", West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday said she cannot implement the Act in the state right now. "Our government officials are of the opinion that if we implement it, it will overburden the people," she added. She also said that the new Act was against the federal structure of the government.

column2: UK extends work visas for foreign students by two years
column3: The UK government has allowed international students to stay in the country for two years after graduation to find a job, reversing a decision made in 2012 by then-Home Secretary Theresa May. The move partially aims to recruit students from disciplines such as maths, engineering and technology. Over 4.5 lakh international students studied in the UK in 2017-18.

column2: Essel Group's Rajesh Sethi named NBA India's Managing Director
column3: The National Basketball Association (NBA) has appointed Rajesh Sethi as the Managing Director of NBA India effective September 12. He was most recently with Essel Group, where he held various leadership roles with the group's entities, including SITI Networks, Zee Entertainment and Ten Sports. Sethi will oversee the league's basketball and business development initiatives in India.

column2: JPMorgan tells staff to make it clear Taiwan is part of China
column3: JPMorgan has told employees to ensure they don't refer to Hong Kong, Macau or Taiwan as separate countries. They should be Hong Kong SAR, Macau SAR and Taiwan, China, on first reference, Supervisory Analyst Global Manager Stuart Marston said in an email. JPMorgan recently became the first foreign company to take control of its onshore Chinese mutual fund joint venture.

column2: Ravichandran Ashwin takes 4 wickets on his return to county cricket
column3: India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin took four wickets in the first innings for Nottinghamshire against Kent as he made his return to county cricket after the India-West Indies Test series. Ashwin was also named the team's Player of the Month for July and August after he took 23 wickets and scored 197 runs in his first three matches.

column2: Will teach lesson to TDP if they don't behave: YSRCP leader
column3: YSRCP leader Kasu Mahesh Reddy on Wednesday said TDP leaders must change their behaviour else they will be taught a lesson. "They shouldn't act over smart or their game will be over," Reddy added. Earlier today, TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu was put under house arrest after he announced a protest over alleged killings of TDP workers by YSRCP workers.

column2: Government's next agenda is to retrieve PoK: Jitendra Singh
column3: Union Minister Jitendra Singh on Tuesday said that next agenda of the government is to "retrieve" Pakistan occupied Kashmir (PoK) and make it a territory of India. "It's not only me or my party's commitment, but it's a part of a resolution unanimously passed by Parliament in 1994 during Congress government headed by PV Narasimha Rao," he said.

column2: Clashes erupt during BJP's protest in WB; police use water cannons
column3: Clashes erupted in West Bengal's Kolkata on Wednesday during a protest organised by BJP workers over hike in electricity tariff. Police fired water cannons to stop BJP workers marching towards Calcutta Electric Supply Corporation (CESC) office. "CESC...is doing unethical business in West Bengal whereas the same company is providing electricity to other states at a much cheaper rate," BJP said.

column2: India very capable of tackling terrorism on its own: PM Modi
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday said terrorism has become a global threat and an ideology that is deeply rooted and flourishing in Pakistan. He added, "The whole world needs to take a pledge and stand up against those who give shelter and training to the terrorist. India is very much capable of tackling the menace on its own."

column2: Animals are dying because of plastic trash: PM Modi
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday highlighted the need to eliminate single-use plastic in the country saying animals are dying because of plastic trash. "The problem of plastic is growing each day...fishes living in rivers, ponds are...dying because of plastic pollution in the water bodies," the PM added. PM Modi also urged traders to use very less plastic for packaging.

column2: Sacking of NSA Bolton won't lead to talks with US: Iran
column3: The resignation of US National Security Adviser (NSA) John Bolton will not lead to US-Iran talks, Iran said on Wednesday. US President Donald Trump on Tuesday said he asked Bolton to resign as he "strongly disagreed" with Bolton's suggestions. Last year, the US pulled out of 2015 nuclear deal with Iran, under which Iran agreed to curb its atomic programme.

column2: Vanessa Hudgens, Zendaya attend Vera Wang's show at NYFW
column3: Actress-singer Vanessa Hudgens and actress Zendaya were among the celebrities who attended designer Vera Wang's show at the New York Fashion Week on Tuesday. Vanessa wore a golden sparkly mini-dress with a grey coat and black shoes. Meanwhile, Zendaya wore a grey top with sleek black leggings and completed her look with hoop earrings and shoulder-length loose hair.

column2: China removes tariffs on some US goods ahead of Oct talks
column3: China has removed retaliatory tariffs on 16 types of US products ahead of talks scheduled in October. The 25% additional tariffs were put in place last year by China on about $50 billion worth US imports. The exemptions will start on September 17 and last for a year. The list included varieties of animal feed, cancer drugs gefitinib and capecitabine.

column2: India's fuel demand rises 2.8% in August
column3: India's fuel demand rose 2.8% in August compared to the same month last year, when it rose 0.8%. Fuel demand had risen 3.3% in July 2019. Data from the Petroleum Planning and Analysis Cell (PPAC) said that consumption of fuel totalled 17.04 million tonnes. Sales of gasoline, or petrol, were 8.9% higher from a year earlier at 2.5 million tonnes.

column2: Diljit Dosanjh postpones US show after FWICE's letter
column3: Actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh has postponed his show in the US, scheduled to be held on September 21, after FWICE wrote a letter urging him to cancel the show saying that it's being promoted by a Pakistan national. "I would like to state that my contract is only with 'Shri Balaji Entertainment' and nobody else as mentioned in the...letter," he added.

column2: Vaiko files habeas corpus plea in SC for Farooq Abdullah
column3: MDMK chief and Rajya Sabha MP Vaiko on Wednesday filed a habeas corpus petition in the Supreme Court for allowing former Jammu and Kashmir CM Farooq Abdullah to travel to Chennai. Vaiko wrote in his petition that he had invited Abdullah for an event in Chennai on September 15 but he has not been able to contact him.

column2: All 10 Jammu districts normal, Leh & Kargil also normal: J&K DGP
column3: Jammu and Kashmir DGP Dilbag Singh has said the region is very close to being restored to normalcy. "All 10 districts of Jammu have become entirely normal. All schools, colleges, and offices are open. Leh and Kargil are also normal, there is no restriction of any kind there," said Singh. "More than 90% areas are free of restrictions," he added.

column2: Twitter CEO's firm Square sues San Francisco for $1.3mn tax refund
column3: Twitter Co-founder and CEO Jack Dorsey's mobile payment company Square is suing the US city of San Francisco for nearly $1.3 million in tax refunds. Square claimed that it's not a "financial services" company as the city claims, but an "information" company, which is taxed lower. "We've done everything we can over several years...in pursuit of a resolution," Square said.

column2: Apple to release macOS Catalina update in October
column3: Apple will release the Catalina update for its macOS operating system series in October, as per its official website. The Catalina update will see Apple's iTunes being split into three separate apps, Apple Music, Apple TV, and Apple Podcasts. The update will also see a smoother porting of iOS or iPadOS apps through Project Catalyst and Sidecar.

column2: Tesla-rival Rivian raises $350 million from Cox Automotive
column3: US electric pickup truck startup Rivian has raised $350 million in an equity investment by global automotive services company Cox Automotive. The Tesla rival said the two entities will explore partnership opportunities in service operations, logistics and digital retailing. Rivian had raised a $700-million investment round in February led by Amazon and a $500-million investment from Ford in April.

column2: India, Pak should resolve Kashmir issue through dialogue: UN Chief
column3: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres' spokesperson Stéphane Dujarric has said that Guterres appeals to both India and Pakistan to deal with the Kashmir issue through dialogue. Guterres remains very concerned about any potential escalation between the two countries over Kashmir, Dujarric added. Guterres met PM Narendra Modi on the sidelines of the G7 Summit last month in Biarritz, France.

column2: Aren't you worried about 1,50,000 deaths: Gadkari on revised traffic fines
column3: Talking about the amended Motor Vehicles Act, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said, "This is not a revenue income scheme, are you not worried about deaths of 1,50,000 people?" "If state governments want to reduce this, is it not true that people neither recognise law nor have fear of it?" he added. The new fines came into effect from September 1.

column2: Slain Saudi journo's last words were 'you'll suffocate me': Reports
column3: According to a Turkish newspaper, the last words spoken by slain Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi were, "You'll suffocate me." Khashoggi had urged his killers not to cover his mouth as he had asthma. Khashoggi, a Saudi government critic, was killed and reportedly dismembered inside the Saudi consulate in Istanbul last year.

column2: North Korea says it tested a super-large multiple rocket launcher
column3: North Korea tested a "super-large multiple rocket launcher" on Tuesday, which was observed by the leader Kim Jong-un, the country's state media said. The test was aimed at "measuring the time of combat deployment", the state media added. North Korea carried out the test hours after it offered to resume nuclear talks with the US.

column2: US designates chief of Tehrik-e Taliban Pakistan as global terrorist
column3: The US has designated Noor Wali, the leader of the Tehrik-e Taliban Pakistan (TTP), as a Specially Designated Global Terrorist. "Under Noor Wali's leadership, TTP has claimed responsibility for numerous deadly terrorist attacks across Pakistan," the US' State Department said. The designation seeks to deny terrorists the resources to plan and carry out attacks, the State Department added.

column2: UK PM's decision to suspend Parliament is unlawful: Scottish court
column3: Scotland's highest court of appeal on Wednesday ruled that UK PM Boris Johnson's decision to suspend the Parliament is unlawful. The UK Parliament was suspended on Monday night until October 14. The suspension of the Parliament will effectively reduce the time for MPs to debate on Brexit, which is scheduled for October 31.

column2: ONGC considers buying out rest of petrochemical firm OPaL
column3: ONGC is planning to buy out the rest of a Gujarat petrochemical project it does not already own. ONGC Petro additions Limited (OPaL), in which ONGC has a 49.36% stake, operates a plant in Dahej which primarily makes polymers. ONGC's stake in the project could rise to 93% if it converts share warrants and debentures into equity.

column2: Hong Kong Exchanges offers to buy London Stock Exchange for $39 bn
column3: Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing has made an unsolicited $39 billion bid to acquire the London Stock Exchange Group. This comes just weeks after LSE announced a plan to purchase financial information provider Refinitiv. Hong Kong Exchanges, which owns the London Metal Exchange, said the proposed deal would go ahead only if LSE's proposed takeover of Refinitiv doesn't proceed.

column2: Exes will be invited to my wedding with Jennifer: Alex
column3: Talking about his wedding with actress-singer Jennifer Lopez, Alex Rodriguez during a talk show said that their exes would be invited to the couple's wedding and added, "The more the merrier." Alex further said that he has no clue about the location, the clothes he is wearing and date of his wedding. The couple got engaged in March 2019.

column2: Sachin wishes Onam, shares post on artist who sketches with legs
column3: On the occasion of Onam, ex-India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar took to Twitter to praise a Kerala artist, Pranav, who sketches with his legs. Sachin shared a picture of a caricature Pranav drew for him, writing, "I am just amazed by his drive and motivation...This...truly symbolises the spirit of Kerala." Onam, Kerala's annual harvest festival, is celebrated over 10 days.

column2: Om Birla's mindset caters to caste-ridden unequal India: Sibal
column3: Criticising Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla for his remarks on Brahmins, Congress leader Kapil Sibal said his mindset caters to a caste-ridden unequal India. Birla had earlier said at an event in Rajasthan that Brahmins are held in high regard by virtue of birth. "We respect you Birlaji not because you're a Brahmin but because you're our Speaker," Sibal tweeted.

column2: YSRCP trying to strangulate TDP: Naidu's son after detention
column3: After being put under preventive house arrest along with his father N Chandrababu Naidu ahead of a protest march against the ruling YSRCP, TDP leader Nara Lokesh stated, "This is the murder of democracy... This is dictatorship." Lokesh added, "The ruling party is trying to strangulate our party across Andhra Pradesh."

column2: Hold Mumbai North leaders accountable: Deora as Urmila quits Cong
column3: After actor-turned-politician Urmila Matondkar resigned from Congress on Tuesday, former Mumbai Congress chief Milind Deora said, "Mumbai North leaders MUST be held accountable!" "After [Matondkar] decided to fight LS elections from Mumbai North, I supported her campaign wholeheartedly as...President. I stood by her when she was let down by those who brought her into the party," he added.

column2: Age gap between me & my wife same as age gap between me & mom: Milind
column3: Appearing in a video with his wife Ankita Konwar, model-actor Milind Soman spoke about the age gap between them and said, "There is a big age difference." After Ankita said, "26 years", Milind commented, "So it is the difference between my age and my mother's age." "I think everybody should be free to choose who they love," he added.

column2: This feels strange: MeToo accuser on Aamir working with accused director
column3: Aspiring actress Geetika Tyagi, who had accused director Subhash Kapoor of sexual misconduct, has said Aamir Khan's decision to work with him "feels strange". "It's not like someone [from their end] reached out to me. It'd have been a fair game had they considered both sides of the story," she added. "Aamir re-hiring him doesn't affect my case," said Geetika.

column2: SL deny Pak's claim that India influenced their cricketers to not go to Pak
column3: Sri Lanka Sports Minister Harin Fernando has rubbished Pakistani minister Fawad Chaudhry's claim that India influenced their cricketers to opt out of their tour to Pakistan. He added that some players opted out "purely" based on 2009 incident when their team bus was attacked by terrorists. "Respecting their decision we picked players who were willing to travel," he said.

column2: Apple to release iOS 13 on September 19 globally
column3: Apple has announced that its upcoming iOS 13 will be released on September 19 worldwide. Apple unveiled iOS 13 at Worldwide Developers Conference in June which features dark mode, 'typing by swiping' letters on keyboard and redesigned Reminders. It also automatically hides duplicate photos, lets users add profile photos to iMessage, and has 'Sign-in with Apple' option to create accounts.

column2: iPhone 11 lineup to feature front camera slo-mo video 'slofies'
column3: Apple has added the slo-mo video feature to its 2019 iPhone lineup's front cameras to record videos in slow motion, which it has termed "slofies". Apple updated its TrueDepth front camera to a 12-megapixel sensor on the iPhone 11, 11 Pro and 11 Pro Max for wide-angle shots when rotated to landscape. The front camera can also record 4K60 videos.

column2: Uber, Ola ruined everything: Singhvi takes jibe at Centre
column3: After Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman claimed automobile sector has been affected as millennials prefer Ola and Uber, Congress' Abhishek Singhvi took a jibe at the Centre, tweeting, "Uber, Ola have ruined everything (Uber, Ola ne sab kar diya bantadhar)." Singhvi added, "Economy will cross $5 trillion, but how? Youths aren't getting jobs. Will you hold Opposition responsible even for this?"

column2: Cong-NCP to contest on 123-125 seats each in Maha polls: Chavan
column3: The Congress and Nationalist Congress Party will contest on 123-125 seats each and leave 41 constituencies for smaller allies in the upcoming state polls, former Maharashtra CM Prithviraj Chavan has stated. Chavan added, "Talks are on with the Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi, Swabhimani Shetkari Sanghatana, Samajwadi Party. If alliance talks work out, 41 seats would be allocated to smaller allies."

column2: WeWork to reject SoftBank's request to delay its IPO: Report
column3: Co-working space startup WeWork is reportedly pressing ahead with its plan to go public despite its main investor SoftBank's push to delay its Initial Public Offering (IPO) over valuation concerns. WeWork's parent firm The We Company may reportedly seek a valuation as low as $15-18 billion. SoftBank has invested $10.65 billion in WeWork since 2017 through its $100-billion Vision Fund.

column2: Swiggy to debut in payments with consumer wallet, UPI: Report
column3: Bengaluru-based foodtech giant Swiggy has been working on launching its payment product for the past few months, including a consumer-facing wallet as well as UPI, Entrackr reported citing sources. "The product is at least three-to-four months away from the official launch," Entrackr quoted a source as saying. Swiggy recently also launched its instant pick and drop logistics service 'Swiggy Go'.

column2: Where's the plan to get out of gloom: Chidambaram on economy
column3: Former Finance Minister P Chidambaram, who's currently lodged in Tihar jail in connection with the INX media case, has said that he's "deeply concerned" about the economy. "Lower incomes, fewer jobs, less trade and lower investment affect the poor and the middle class. Where is the plan to get the country out of this decline and gloom?" his tweet read.

column2: PK Mishra takes charge as Principal Secretary to PM Modi
column3: PK Mishra, who was serving as the Additional Secretary to PM Narendra Modi, took charge as the Principal Secretary to Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday. Mishra, a 1972 batch Gujarat cadre IAS, had earlier worked with Modi when he was the Chief Minister of Gujarat. Additionally, PK Sinha was appointed as the Principal Advisor to the Prime Minister.

column2: PM picks plastic from waste along with women garbage workers in UP
column3: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday met women who pick plastic from garbage in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura and extended a helping hand to them. Pictures showed PM Modi sitting with the women, talking to them and helping them with segregation. PM Modi is in the state to launch a campaign against single-use plastic products.

column2: Words like 'Om', 'cow' don't take the country back to 16th century: PM
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday, said, "When some people hear the words 'Om' and 'cow', they say the country is back to the 16th century. Such people are only destroying the nation." He was in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura to launch the National Animal Disease Control Programme (NADCP). He also played with a cow and a calf at the event.

column2: MP minister helps clear traffic jam after getting stuck in it
column3: A video has surfaced online showing Madhya Pradesh Sports Minister Jitu Patwari helping in clearing traffic after he got stuck in a jam in Indore on Tuesday. The 44-year-old leader and some men could be seen directing the traffic in the video. The jam was caused at an intersection point, where traffic lights were not working.

column2: LeT terrorist behind attack that injured 2-yr-old girl killed in J&K
column3: A Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorist, who was responsible for firing at civilians that injured three people including a two-year-old girl, has been killed in an encounter in J&K's Sopore. The terrorist identified as Asif Maqbool Bhat had created lot of terror, police said. Bhat deployed people to put up posters, threatening civilians against opening shops or carrying out daily activities.

column2: India, ASEAN agree to review 10-year-old free trade pact
column3: India and the 10-member Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) have agreed to review their decade-old free trade pact. Their joint statement on Tuesday said the review aimed to make the agreement more "user-friendly and simple". Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said it will "help protect the interests of our industry & farmers, create jobs & boost 'Make in India'".

column2: Priyanka Chopra, Kriti Sanon attend New York Fashion Week
column3: Priyanka Chopra on Tuesday attended designer Oscar de la Renta's show at the New York Fashion Week 2019. Priyanka wore a black full-sleeved dress with a mesh of golden chains around the waist and chose black heels to complete her look. Meanwhile, actress Kriti Sanon wore a green shiny ankle-length dress and carried a Coach bag for the Coach show.

column2: He knew others' lines as well: Ayushmann on working with Big B
column3: Talking about working with Amitabh Bachchan in the upcoming film 'Gulabo Sitabo', actor Ayushmann Khurrana said, "He is that co-actor who's very collaborative." He added, "So, the butterflies were gone when I met him on the set." The actor further said that Bachchan was always prepared with everything on the sets and he knew others' lines as well.

column2: Fire breaks out on the sets of ‘Coolie No. 1’, no casualties reported
column3: A major fire broke out on the sets of Varun Dhawan and Sara Ali Khan starrer 'Coolie No. 1' on Wednesday at Filmistan Studio, Mumbai. The incident reportedly took place at 12:30 am and around 15 workers were present at the time, who immediately informed the fire station and the police. No casualties or injuries have been reported so far.

column2: Want to play till 40 like Ryan Giggs: James Anderson
column3: England pacer James Anderson quashed talks of his retirement, saying, "I have not thought for one second about retiring. In fact, I'm going to look into how Ryan Giggs was able to play football at the highest level until he was 40." "[I]t definitely feels possible to play until I'm 40 if the hunger is still there," the 37-year-old said.

column2: Microsoft patents Google Home Mini-like portable speaker design
column3: A design patent filing by Microsoft made public recently revealed a Google Home Mini-like portable speaker. The speaker, with a fabric covering on top alongside volume buttons and the ability to make, receive and mute calls, could be related to workplace communication platform Microsoft Teams and meeting rooms, reports said. Microsoft will hold its Surface hardware event on October 2.

column2: Had asked Urmila to keep away from petty politics: Sanjay Nirupam
column3: After actor-turned-politician Urmila Matondkar resigned from the Congress, party leader Sanjay Nirupam stated, "I had requested her to keep away from internal petty politics." Asking Urmila not to resign due to "petty politics" as infighting takes place in every organisation, Nirupam added, "You are always welcome in the Congress party, please keep patience and work with the party."

column2: Tasmanian farmer jailed for 11 months for importing garlic
column3: Letetia Anne Ware, a Tasmanian farmer, has been given an 11-month jail sentence for illegally importing garlic bulbs that could have put Australia's agricultural sector at risk. The 53-year-old imported almost 2,200 garlic bulbs from the US and Canada. The varieties of garlic were potential carriers of Xylella fastidiosa, a bacterium rated as a big threat to plant biosecurity.

column2: TikTok promotes responsible online conduct with #WaitASecToReflect
column3: TikTok, a short-form video platform, is running a consumer awareness initiative to drive responsible online conduct. The campaign #WaitASecToReflect aims to inspire users to pause for a second and think about their online conduct. As part of this campaign, TikTok has partnered with the Digital Empowerment Foundation to execute a digital literacy programme focused on the usage of UGC platforms.

column2: Apple unveils iPhone 11, iPhone 11 Pro & 11 Pro Max starting from $699
column3: Apple has unveiled A13 Bionic processor-powered iPhone 11, iPhone 11 Pro and 11 Pro Max starting from $699, $999 and $1,099, respectively. iPhone 11 has a 6.1-inch display and 12MP ultra-wide dual-camera setup while 5.8-inch iPhone 11 Pro and 6.5-inch 11 Pro Max have 12MP triple rear cameras. iPhone 11's battery lasts one hour longer than iPhone XR, Apple claimed.

column2: MoneyTap helps young customers live the life they want
column3: MoneyTap, India's first 'Credit Line' app, enables young adults to get instant credit at the tap of a button. More than 30% of MoneyTap customers borrow money on the app to fund their dream travel and aspirational purchases. With hassle-free application, the flexibility of borrowing amount, and instant money transfer MoneyTap seeks to make the credit process simple.

column2: Ex-Andhra CM Naidu put under house arrest amid protests against YSRCP
column3: TDP chief and former Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu and his son Nara Lokesh were put under house arrest on Wednesday. TDP leaders and workers who were trying to go to Naidu's residence were also stopped by police. This comes after TDP called for a protest march against the ruling YSRCP over increasing attacks on its party workers.

column2: Rocket blast at US Embassy in Afghanistan on 9/11 anniversary
column3: A rocket exploded at the US Embassy in Afghanistan's Kabul on Wednesday, the anniversary of the 9/11 terrorist attack on the US. No injuries have been reported in the incident. It is said to be the first major attack in the Afghan capital since US President Donald Trump called off peace talks with Taliban and Afghan President Ashraf Ghani.

column2: Diljit gets FWICE's letter for accepting Pak national's invite to US
column3: The Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) has written a letter to actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh, requesting him to cancel his upcoming show in US on September 21. It added that the show is being promoted by Pakistan national Rehan Siddiqi. "Your performance for the Pak national will set a wrong precedent," FWICE stated.

column2: Sanjay was disturbed his dad didn't live to hear he isn't a terrorist: Wife
column3: Sanjay Dutt's wife Maanayata, while speaking about Dutt being cleared of terrorism charges related to 1993 Mumbai blasts, said, "He used to be disturbed his father didn't live to hear the court say that he wasn't a terrorist." "That had tarnished the family name and bothered him for years," she added. Dutt was, however, convicted for illegal possession of weapons.

column2: No compassion for me? Tanushree on Aamir working with MeToo accused
column3: Commenting on Aamir Khan's decision to work with sexual harassment accused director Subhash Kapoor, Tanushree Dutta said, "Nobody [asked] me how I was doing when my livelihood was snatched away after the 'Horn Ok Pleassss' harassment episode." "No compassion for me, Aamir?" she questioned. Aamir, who earlier quit Kapoor's film over the accusations, recently announced that he'll rejoin the film.

column2: India hold Asian champs Qatar to goalless draw in FIFA WC Qualifier
column3: India held Asian champions Qatar to a 0-0 draw in a Group E second round 2022 FIFA World Cup Qualifier match on Tuesday to earn their first point in the competition. Qatar failed to beat Indian goalkeeper Gurpreet Singh Sandhu and score despite having 27 shots on target. Sandhu captained India in the match in Sunil Chhetri's absence.

column2: He's under no pressure at all: England head coach Bayliss on Root
column3: England head coach Trevor Bayliss has said captain Joe Root is under "no pressure at all" despite failure to reclaim Ashes from Australia. "He's not come under question from anyone making any decisions," he added. Everyone goes through periods where they don't score as many runs as they'd like. I think Australia have bowled...well to him," he further said.

column2: Period app by Delhi's Sheroes sharing data with CleverTap: Report
column3: Delhi-based social networking platform for women Sheroes' period-tracking app Maya is sharing sensitive health data with analytics platform CleverTap in addition to Facebook, as per UK-based Privacy International. Maya's privacy policy states that the data may be shared with advertisers. Responding to the report, Sheroes claimed it removed Facebook and CleverTap software that caused data leakage.

column2: Jack Ma performs in rock star costume at farewell on 55th birthday
column3: Alibaba Founder and Chairman Jack Ma, who turned 55 on Tuesday, dressed up as a rock star to perform Chinese pop songs at his farewell ceremony. He was seen tearing up as employees enacted skits and sang songs. "There are so many opportunities, and I love excitement so much, which is why I'll retire early," Ma told guests and employees.

column2: Facebook bans graphic self-harm pics to help prevent suicide
column3: Facebook, on World Suicide Prevention Day on Tuesday, banned graphic images of self-harm to help fight against suicide after heavy criticism on moderation of violent and potentially dangerous content. The social media giant also said that such content will become harder to search on its photo-sharing platform Instagram. It also would not appear as recommended content on Instagram, Facebook added.

column2: McDonald's to buy AI startup Apprente to automate drive-thrus
column3: American fast-food giant McDonald's has announced that it is acquiring a California-based AI voicetech startup Apprente to automate its drive-thru menu. Founded in 2017, Apprente specialises in building voice-based AI agents that can take orders in multiple languages and accents. McDonald's plans to implement self-service kiosks across nearly all US and Australia restaurant locations before 2020.

column2: Cong MLA misbehaved with female staffer after missing flight: Air India
column3: Congress MLA Vinod Chandrakar has been accused of misbehaving with a female Air India staffer at Raipur airport last month after she denied him permission to board the plane after he arrived late, an Air India report stated. Meanwhile, Chandrakar said he was on time and accused the staffer of yelling at him and urged administration to check CCTV footage.

column2: Scooter rental startup Vogo may raise $50 mn led by Steadview
column3: Steadview Capital is reportedly in talks with Bengaluru-based scooter rental startup Vogo to lead a $50-million funding round. Existing investors including Matrix Partners, Stellaris Venture Partners and Kalaari Capital could also reportedly participate in the round. Founded by Anand Ayyadurai, Padmanabhan Balakrishnan, and Sanchit Mittal, Vogo offers round-the-clock scooter rental services.

column2: Uber fires 435 employees from product, engineering teams globally
column3: Uber has confirmed the firing of 435 employees from its product and engineering teams worldwide. "Previously, to meet the demands of a hyper-growth startup, we hired rapidly and in a decentralised way," Uber said, adding that it now wants to focus on "lean, exceptionally high-performing teams." This comes weeks after the ride-hailing giant fired 400 marketing employees globally.

column2: Rajnath to receive 1st Rafale jet on Air Force Day in Oct: Report
column3: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will receive the first of the 36 Rafale fighter jets in Paris on October 8, which is celebrated as Air Force Day, a media report stated on Tuesday. Further, during his visit, Rajnath will hold extensive talks with the top defence brass of the French government on ways to deepen defence and security cooperation with India.

column2: Court set up in AIIMS to record Unnao rape survivor's statement
column3: A temporary court has been set up inside AIIMS premises in Delhi, with a judge present there to record the statement of the Unnao rape survivor admitted there. Rape accused MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar was also taken to AIIMS for the special hearing. The survivor was hospitalised after her vehicle was hit by a truck in Uttar Pradesh.

column2: Vicky shares childhood picture with SRK, says 'Dreams do come true'
column3: Actor Vicky Kaushal on Tuesday shared a collage on Instagram in which he is seen posing with actor Shah Rukh Khan. It included a picture from Vicky's childhood days in which he is seen alongside Khan and the other picture showed the two actors performing together at an award show. "Dreams do come true," he captioned the post.

column2: Cristiano Ronaldo scores four goals as Portugal thrash Lithuania 5-1
column3: Cristiano Ronaldo scored four goals as Portugal defeated Lithuania 5-1 in their Euro 2020 qualifier match on Tuesday. With his four goals, Ronaldo took his international tally of goals to 93. It was Ronaldo's eighth hat-trick for Portugal and 54th of his professional career. Portugal are placed second in Group B with eight points, five behind leaders Ukraine.

column2: Trump fires US National Security Adviser John Bolton
column3: US President Donald Trump announced in a series of tweets on Tuesday that he has fired National Security Adviser (NSA) John Bolton. "I disagreed strongly with many of his suggestions, as did others in the Administration," Trump said about Bolton. Bolton, a former attorney and diplomat, took over as the NSA in April 2018.

column2: Apple announces streaming service, to be free for 1 year for new users
column3: Apple on Tuesday announced 'Apple TV+', its own all-original video subscription service. Apple TV+ first shows will be available from November 1 this year in over 100 countries for $4.99 per month. Customers who purchase any new iPhone, iPad, Apple TV, iPod touch or Mac will get one year of Apple TV+ subscription for free.

column2: Tharoor shares pics from vacation, uses word 'kerfuffle' in tweet
column3: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday took to Twitter to share pictures from his vacation in Maldives. "A couple of weeks ago, before all the political kerfuffle in the media, I managed a brief three-day escape," he wrote in the tweet. Several users posted the meaning of 'kerfuffle', which is a commotion or fuss, especially one caused by conflicting views.

column2: Warner told me over beer how he tampered with ball: Alastair Cook
column3: Ex-England captain Alastair Cook revealed in his book Australia opener David Warner once told him over beer how he tampered with the ball in a match. "Warner mentioned...he used substances attached to strapping on his hand to accelerate ball's deterioration," Cook wrote. "I looked at Steve Smith who shot a glance that said...'Ooh, you shouldn't have said that'," Cook added.

column2: Jack Leach has become England's laughing stock: Kevin Pietersen
column3: Kevin Pietersen has said Jack Leach has become England's laughing stock as he has been unable to perform his duties as the main spinner. "You've got people in stands taking the mickey out of him, wearing masks and fake glasses," he added. "England are losing Ashes and he's only taken eight wickets at 30 in three Tests," he further said.

column2: All India Radio signs deal with BCCI to provide live cricket commentary
column3: The BCCI has announced a two-year radio rights arrangement with All India Radio (AIR) for live commentary of Team India's matches at home. The audio commentary will commence from the first match of India's upcoming T20I series against South Africa on September 15. The arrangement also includes domestic tournaments including Ranji Trophy, Irani Cup and Deodhar Trophy among others.

column2: Apple announces Apple Arcade gaming service starting from $4.99/month
column3: Apple on Tuesday announced 'Apple Arcade' gaming service that will let Apple users play games across iPhones, iPads, Macs and Apple TV devices. Apple Arcade will be available as of September 19th in over 150 countries. Over 100 new games will be available to the users through the subscription service starting from $4.99 per month.

column2: Apple unveils Watch Series 5 with 'always on' display starting at $399
column3: Apple unveiled Apple Watch Series 5 with an 'always on' display option so users can see the time without having to move their wrist. It features a built-in compass, a new app that tells users their latitude, longitude and direction, and emergency international calling. Apple Watch Series 5 (GPS) starts at $399 and Watch Series 5 (GPS+Cellular) at $499.

column2: Apple launches new 10.2-inch seventh generation iPad starting at $329
column3: Apple on Tuesday introduced the new seventh generation iPad featuring a 10.2-inch Retina Display and support for the full-sized Smart Keyboard. Starting at $329, the new iPad includes an A10 Fusion chip, support for the first-generation Apple Pencil and a Smart Connector for attaching Smart Keyboard. For the first time, the iPad features an enclosure made from 100% recycled aluminium.

column2: Police case against parents of 1-yr-old who fell off jeep in Kerala
column3: A case under the Juvenile Justice (Care and Protection of Children) Act was registered against the parents of the one-year-old girl who fell off a moving jeep in a forest area in Kerala, police said on Tuesday. She suffered injuries to her face and forehead due to the fall. Her father dismissed the allegation that they wanted to abandon her.

column2: SC-monitored non-discriminatory process: India to UN on Assam NRC
column3: India has briefed the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC) on the National Register of Citizens (NRC). India said, "It is a statutory, transparent, non-discriminatory legal process mandated and monitored by the Supreme Court of India." This comes after UN rights chief Michelle Bachelet said the National Register of Citizens exercise in Assam has caused "great uncertainty and anxiety".

column2: NRI businessman Rami Ranger nominated to UK's House of Lords
column3: NRI businessman Rami Ranger has been nominated to the UK's House of Lords, the Upper House of the country's Parliament, by former UK PM Theresa May. Ranger started his first company, a shipping cargo business in 1987, and later an export company named Sun Mark Limited. He's been conferred royal honours MBE and CBE for services to business and community.

column2: 31 killed, 100 injured in stampede at Shia shrine in Iraq's Karbala
column3: At least 31 people were killed and over 100 others were injured in a stampede on Tuesday at a Shia shrine in Iraq's Karbala, as pilgrims were marking the holy day of Ashura, officials said. The toll of casualties is not final, officials added. The stampede reportedly occurred when one pilgrim tripped, while thousands of others were performing a ritual.

column2: Israeli PM vows to annex West Bank's Jordan Valley if re-elected
column3: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Tuesday vowed to annex Jordan Valley in the occupied West Bank if he wins the re-election next week. Netanyahu also vowed to apply Israeli sovereignty over the northern Dead Sea. Netanyahu said that the steps would be taken in coordination with US President Donald Trump's administration.

column2: Tennis player enrolls in Harvard days after winning US Open
column3: Bethanie Mattek-Sands announced on Twitter that she is set to attend Harvard Business School, just days after winning the US Open mixed doubles title. Bethanie will also be joined by former world number one in women's singles, Caroline Wozniacki. The duo is following five-time Grand Slam champion Maria Sharapova, who studied for a business course at Harvard in 2016.

column2: Ronaldo earns 3 times more than any other Serie A player: Reports
column3: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo reportedly earns over three times more than any other player in Serie A. Ronaldo earns around £28 million-a-year in wages at Juventus after taxes, which is three times what his Juventus teammate Matthijs de Ligt gets as the second-highest earner in the league. The third spot is taken by new Inter Milan's new signing, Romelu Lukaku.

column2: Iran female football fan who self-immolated over rules, dies
column3: Sahar Khodayari, an Iranian female football fan, has died from burns a week after setting herself on fire outside a courtroom, after learning she may face six months in prison for trying to enter a stadium. The 29-year-old, who had tried to enter the stadium posing as a man, had spent three nights in jail before being released.

column2: MIT researchers create programmable ink to let objects change colours
column3: Researchers at MIT have developed a new programmable ink that lets objects change colours when exposed to ultraviolet light. The 'PhotoChromeleon Ink' uses a mix of photochromic dyes that can be sprayed or painted onto the surface of any object, including shoes, cars or phone cases. The process can take about 15-40 minutes, depending on the shape of the object.

column2: 40% Indians fear losing job for controversial posts online: McAfee
column3: A study by cybersecurity firm McAfee on Tuesday said that over 40% Indians agreed that they could be fired from their jobs for controversial content on their social media. About 25.3% admitted they did not know how to change the privacy settings of their profiles, while over half the users in India have at least one dormant social media account.

column2: Kejriwal stealing our credit for reducing Delhi pollution: Tiwari
column3: BJP leader Manoj Tiwari on Tuesday said Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal is "stealing" the central government's credit for the reduction of air pollution in the city. "There are facts to expose how Kejriwal has been taking credit...through white lies," he added. Last week, Kejriwal said efforts by his government and many others have helped in significantly reducing Delhi's air pollution.

column2: Feel burdened I couldn't pay Jaitley my last respects: PM
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday paid tribute to former Finance Minister Arun Jaitley during a remembrance meet in Delhi. "We were friends for so long but I couldn't pay my last respects to him. There will always be a burden on my heart," he said. PM Modi was on a foreign tour when Jaitley passed away last month.

column2: Pune police stop Maharashtra CM's convoy for transporting heart
column3: Pune traffic police stopped Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis' convoy to ensure speedy transportation of a heart for transplant. The heart was being moved through a green corridor to a hospital around the same time when CM's convoy was scheduled to pass from there. "We asked the CM's convoy to wait and gave priority to the green corridor," police said.

column2: Pakistan making false allegations on Kashmir: India at UNHRC
column3: Addressing the UN Human Rights Council (UNHRC) on Tuesday, Vijay Thakur Singh, Secretary (East), Ministry of External Affairs, said Pakistan is making false allegations and concocting charges over the situation in J&K. "World is aware that this fabricated narrative comes from epicentre of global terrorism, where ring leaders were sheltered for years," Singh said in a veiled reference to Pakistan.

column2: We need to do better: Sonali on pollution caused by Ganpati Visarjan
column3: Actress Sonali Bendre has shared a picture showing the pollution caused by Ganpati Visarjan at Mumbai's Juhu beach. The picture shows multiple large Ganesha idols and other puja items lying discarded at the beach. Sonali tweeted, "After yesterday's visarjan...If these aren't signs of damage we're causing then I don't know what are! This cannot happen we need to do better!"

column2: Billionaire Jack Ma steps down as Alibaba Chairman on 55th birthday
column3: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba's billionaire Co-founder, Jack Ma, stepped down from his role as Chairman on his 55th birthday on Tuesday. Ma co-founded Alibaba in 1999 and is currently the world's 20th richest person with $41.8 billion wealth, as per Bloomberg. A former English teacher, Ma last year said he will return to teaching after retirement.

column2: IIT professor removed after foreign student accuses him of molestation
column3: IIT-Kanpur on Tuesday removed a professor after a foreign student accused him of molesting her. The student reportedly complained about the incident to the Women's Cell but the authorities didn't take any notice and tried to cover up the matter. The student then reported the matter to the embassy of her country, which then directed IIT-Kanpur to investigate the matter.

column2: 6 children drown in lake while immersing Ganesha idol in Karnataka
column3: Six children, all aged between 8 and 12 years, drowned in a lake while immersing a Ganesha idol made of mud in a Karnataka village. Eight children had gone to the lake and six of them entered the water with the idol, while two waited outside. According to reports, the six children drowned after they waded deeper into the water.

column2: Reported US spy worked in Kremlin, was fired years ago: Russia
column3: Russia on Tuesday said that an American spy worked for the Kremlin and was fired several years ago. Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said that the spy did not have direct access to President Vladimir Putin and his job was not at a senior official level. Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said separately that he had never heard of the spy.

column2: Pak asks UNHRC to launch int'l probe into situation in Kashmir
column3: Addressing the UN Human Rights Council (UNHRC) on Tuesday, Pakistan's Foreign Minister Shah Mahmood Qureshi asked the body to launch an international investigation into the situation in Kashmir. "What is happening in Jammu and Kashmir is not a country-specific situation in this council's parlance," he added. "We must act decisively and with conviction," he further said.

column2: Fall and rise in GDP growth rate part of growth process: Sitharaman
column3: Commenting on GDP growth rate falling to 5% in the first quarter, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said fall and rise of growth rate do happen and it's part of the growth process. "Our full focus is now on how GDP growth can rise in next quarter," she added. Notably, India's GDP growth dipped for the fifth quarter in a row.

column2: Germany says it can pump 'many, many billions' into economy
column3: Germany has said it's ready to pump "many, many billions of euros" into its economy to counter any significant growth slowdown. Germany's economy contracted 0.1% in the April-June quarter. "It'll be very important for us as the largest economy in the middle of the EU, whether we're actually able to counteract a negative economic trend," Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said.

column2: Cost of Indian refinery project with Aramco to rise: Oil Minister
column3: India's planned refinery and petrochemical project, which is being built with Saudi Aramco and Abu Dhabi National Oil Company, will cost more than the originally planned $45 billion, Oil Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said on Tuesday. The 1.2 million barrels-per-day (bpd) coastal project is being built at Roha, Maharashtra. It is expected to be commissioned in 2025.

column2: It's time to have a gay superhero: Ruby Rose on playing Batwoman
column3: After being cast as lead in 'Batwoman', Ruby Rose said that it's time to have a gay superhero and added, "Batwoman....means so much to me because she's so comfortable within her sexuality." "It's a character that I wish I could've seen on television growing up," she said. 'Batwoman' is reportedly television's first superhero series led by an openly gay character.

column2: Boycott, Strauss given knighthoods in ex-PM May's honours list
column3: Former England cricket captains Geoffrey Boycott and Andrew Strauss have been given knighthoods in ex-Prime Minister Theresa May's resignation honours list. Boycott, 78, scored 8,114 runs in 108 Tests for England from 1964 to 1982 and was captain on four occasions. Strauss led England to two Ashes wins, as well as the number one Test ranking.

column2: Man City first team to have spent €1 billion to build squad
column3: Premier League champions Manchester City are the first team to have spent more than one billion euros to assemble their squad, a study has shown. CIES Football Observatory's study claimed that French champions Paris St-Germain (PSG) were second in the list after having spent €913 million while Spain's Real Madrid were third with a spending of €902 million.

column2: Period apps shared sensitive user data with Facebook: Report
