column3: Period tracking apps like 'Maya' and 'MIA Fem' shared users' sensitive health data with Facebook, said UK-based advocacy group Privacy International. They allegedly shared user data on menstruation cycles, symptoms, moods, contraceptions, in-app personal notes and sexual activity with Facebook and third parties. It added the apps begin sharing data with Facebook even before users could consent.

column2: Essential to hold elections for Cong leadership posts: Tharoor
column3: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor said it's essential to hold elections for most leadership posts in the party, even for the working committee membership. It will also help inject new energy within the Congress, he added. "I'm confident that under the leadership of (interim party President) Sonia Gandhi, the party will be working towards that end soon," Tharoor further said.

column2: BJP is protecting accused: Owaisi on Tabrez lynching case
column3: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday accused the BJP government of diluting Tabrez Ansari lynching case. Earlier today, the Jharkhand Police dropped murder charges against 11 accused in the death of Ansari, who was beaten by a mob in June. "In every state ruled by BJP, the accused are protected and the criminal cases against them are diluted," he alleged.

column2: Pepperfry eyes going public in 12-18 months: CEO Ambareesh Murty
column3: Pepperfry CEO Ambareesh Murty said that he plans to take the company public in 12-18 months. "Our CFO has set up an IPO day, next month, where the board is only going to talk about strategy as we go forward for an IPO," he said. Murty added that Pepperfry aims to reach about a billion-dollar GMV in next two years.

column2: Most Indian unicorns, active startups from Delhi-NCR: Report
column3: Delhi-NCR has the largest number of active startups in India at 7,039, followed by Bengaluru and Mumbai, as per a report by Silicon Valley-based TiE and Zinnov. These startups had a cumulative valuation of around $50 billion. Delhi-NCR also has the most amount of unicorns at 10, producing at least one unicorn each year since 2013, the report added.

column2: Jaguar Land Rover sales decline by 6.7% in August
column3: UK-based automaker Jaguar Land Rover (JLR), the luxury car unit of Tata Motors, has reported a 6.7% decline in its August retail sales at 34,176 units compared to August 2018. While Jaguar sales fell 17.8% year-on-year to 9,702 units, the sales of Land Rover declined marginally by 1.4% to 24,474 units. However, JLR's retail sales in China grew 17.4% year-on-year.

column2: Astronauts make cement in space for the first time
column3: For the first time ever, astronauts made cement in space as part of a project studying the effects of microgravity. The project, called the Microgravity Investigation of Cement Solidification, was conducted aboard the ISS. The cement mixed in space was found to have more open spaces as compared to cement mixed on Earth, pointing towards the former's lower material strength.

column2: Designer Tom Ford showcases his collection at NYFW
column3: Designer Tom Ford on Monday showcased his Spring 2020 collection, Sporty, at the New York Fashion Week 2019. It included trousers in several colours which were paired with breastplates in the same hue. "I think that it's a time for ease, and... a return to the kind of luxurious sportswear that America has become known for all over the world."

column2: Iran urges India to resume Iranian oil imports amid US sanctions
column3: Iran's Ambassador to India Ali Chegini urged India to follow an independent line and called on the government to resume importing Iranian oil. Chegini said that the two countries had reached almost $13 billion in two-way trade but the pace slowed down after India stopped oil imports following US sanctions imposed on May 2. India was Iran's second-largest oil customer.

column2: Pak Foreign Minister mentions Kashmir as 'Indian state of J&K'
column3: Pakistan Foreign Minister Shah Mahmood Qureshi on Tuesday mentioned Kashmir as "Indian state of Jammu & Kashmir". Qureshi is in Geneva for the 42nd Session of the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC). While speaking during the session, Qureshi said the Indian government's decision to alter J&K special status by revoking Article 370 is illegal under international law.

column2: I was drugged and sexually assaulted in college: Actress Camila Mendes
column3: Actress Camila Mendes, who plays 'Veronica Lodge' in 'Riverdale', has revealed she was drugged and sexually assaulted during her freshman year in college. "I had a very, very bad experience," she said. Camila added that she got a tattoo which reads 'To build a home' after her freshman year, which works as a reminder to "strengthen her sense of self".

column2: Why would Rohit get five tons in WC: Shastri on alleged Kohli-Rohit rift
column3: Team India head coach Ravi Shastri has rubbished reports of an alleged rift between Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, saying he feels it is absolute nonsense. "If [there was a rift] why would Rohit get five hundreds in the World Cup? Why would Virat do what he is doing? How would they have partnerships together?" Shastri added.

column2: Automobile sector affected as millennials prefer Ola, Uber: Sitharaman
column3: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said, "Automobile industry is affected by BS6 and mindsets of millennials, who now prefer to have Ola or Uber rather than committing to buying an automobile." "The automotive industry had its good times two years ago," she added. On Monday, Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers said domestic automobile sales witnessed worst-ever drop in August.

column2: Overcrowded roof collapses during Muharram procession, 20 injured
column3: An overcrowded roof collapsed during Muharram procession in Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool district late Monday night, leaving around 20 people injured. All the injured have been taken to a hospital for treatment. Hundreds of people had gathered to participate in the procession at the B. Thandrapadu village when the incident happened.

column2: ED calls Shivakumar's daughter for questioning in money laundering case
column3: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned Congress leader DK Shivakumar's daughter Aisshwarya for questioning as part of its probe into the money laundering case. She has been asked to appear before the ED on September 12. The agency has found documents pertaining to a trust handled by Aisshwarya, while scrutinising the financial dealings of Shivakumar, said an ED official.

column2: TN man invites PM Modi to daughter's wedding, PM writes letter to him
column3: TS Rajasekaran, a retired regional medical researcher from Tamil Nadu, wrote a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi inviting him to his daughter's wedding scheduled for September 11. PM Modi replied to the invite with a letter that read, "It's my pleasure to learn about the wedding of your daughter...Thank you for inviting me on this momentous occasion."

column2: J&K police bust LeT module in Sopore, arrest 8
column3: The J&K police on Monday busted a module of terror group Lashkar-e-Taiba in Sopore and arrested eight people involved in threatening and intimidating locals by publishing posters supporting terrorists. As per reports, the police also seized computers and other incriminating material used in drafting the posters.

column2: N Korea fires projectiles after offer to resume talks with US
column3: North Korea fired a new round of short-range projectiles on Tuesday, hours after it offered to resume talks with the US over the denuclearisation of the Korean Peninsula. The launches were detected by South Korea. North Korea has demanded an end to US sanctions as well as an end to US-South Korea military exercises for the talks to go forward.

column2: You can tie my hands, but I will not delay Brexit: UK PM
column3: Refusing to delay Brexit any further, UK PM Boris Johnson said, "No matter how many devices this Parliament invents to tie my hands, I'll strive to get an agreement in the national interest...This government will not delay Brexit." Johnson added that his government will strive to negotiate a deal while preparing to leave without one.

column2: Trump nominates Indian-American as Florida district judge
column3: US President Donald Trump on Monday nominated Indian-American Anuraag Singhal as a district judge for the southern district of Florida. Singhal, who studied at the Wake Forest University School of Law, is the first Indian-American to be nominated to this position in Florida. His appointment is pending approval by the US Senate.

column2: S Jaishankar criticises China for its 'one-sided' trade policies
column3: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Monday criticised China for its 'one-sided' trade policies amid ongoing negotiations for Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership. Speaking during a panel discussion in Singapore, he said "Chinese protectionist policies" have created a significant trade deficit between the two nations. India's trade deficit with China stood at $53.6 billion in 2018-19.

column2: Good choice, he's interesting: Bale on Pattinson being cast as Batman
column3: After Robert Pattinson was announced as Ben Affleck's replacement as 'Batman', actor Christian Bale said, "Good choice. I'm sure he'll come up with something interesting." Bale, who has previously played 'Batman' jokingly advised Pattinson, "Just be able to pee by yourself. You don't feel much like a superhero when you can't take a piss by yourself."

column2: Will we even last 15 minutes: Shahid on 1st meeting with Mira
column3: In an interview with Vogue India, Shahid Kapoor said that during his first meeting with Mira Rajput they talked for seven hours. "[I thought] 'Here we are, sitting in this room on these two big sofas with nobody else around...Are we even going to last 15 minutes?" he added. They got married in 2014.

column2: Australia warns India against Huawei in 5G network: Reports
column3: After India sought their input, Australian cybersecurity officials reportedly advised India against the use of parts from Chinese telecom equipment maker Huawei in its 5G network. In 2018, Australia became the first country to ban Huawei from providing equipment for its 5G network citing national security risks. India is still mulling whether to allow Huawei in the upcoming 5G trials.

column2: Economy falling into deep abyss of recession: Priyanka Gandhi
column3: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Tuesday criticised the government by saying that the Indian economy is falling into a deep abyss of recession. "The sword is hanging on the livelihood of millions of Indians," she tweeted. "The decline in the auto sector...is a sign of negative growth in production-transportation and the declining confidence of the market," Priyanka further wrote.

column2: No Indian will be left out: Smriti Irani to Mamata over NRC
column3: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Tuesday criticised West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee for opposing the National Register of Citizens (NRC) and said that the government is committed to protecting the rights of every citizen. "No Indian will be left out," she added. The CM's opposition to the NRC proves the dichotomy on her stand on illegal immigrants, Irani further said.

column2: Edtech startup WhiteHat Jr raises $10 mn in Series A round
column3: Mumbai-based edtech startup WhiteHat Jr has raised $10 million in a Series A funding round led by existing investors Nexus Venture Partners and Omidyar Network. Silicon Valley-based venture capital fund Owl Ventures also participated in the round. Founded in 2018 by former Discovery Networks India CEO Karan Bajaj, WhiteHat Jr provides online live coding lessons to kids.

column2: QuintoAndar raises $250 mn in round by SoftBank, becomes 'unicorn'
column3: Brazilian real estate startup QuintoAndar has raised $250 million in Series D round of funding led by SoftBank. The round has taken the company "to unicorn status", according to CEO Gabriel Braga, although he did not disclose its exact valuation. QuintoAndar had raised about $64 million in Series C, bringing their total amount raised to about $345 million so far.

column2: Delhi constable suspended over viral video of drinking in public
column3: The Delhi Police on Tuesday suspended a constable after a video of him drinking alcohol in public went viral. Constable Kapil Khokar was suspended and attached to district police line after a video in which he was seen drinking alcohol in public went viral, the police said. A departmental inquiry has been initiated against the constable, the Delhi Police added.

column2: Designer Phillip Lim showcases his collection at NYFW
column3: Designer Phillip Lim on Monday showcased his collection at the New York Fashion Week 2019. Lim's collection showcased jumpsuits, raincoats and leather scarves in green, blue and mustard yellow colours. "That's our DNA basically, clothes that we work in, clothes that we live in. It's about pushing what the uniform can be to make it... more refined," Lim said.

column2: Russian fund bidding for Jet faces disqualification: Reports
column3: One of the two bidders for grounded Jet Airways, Russian fund Treasury RA Creator, may be disqualified by the airline's lenders, as per reports. Treasury RA Creator reportedly didn't provide enough information about itself to the resolution professional and didn't deposit the amount mandatory to access airline's data. This would leave South American conglomerate Synergy Group as the sole bidder.

column2: Urmila Matondkar resigns from Congress 6 months after joining party
column3: Actor-turned-politician Urmila Matondkar has resigned from Congress around six months after joining the party. "My political and social sensibilities refuse to allow vested interests in the party to use me as a mean to fight petty in-house politics instead of working on a bigger goal in Mumbai Congress," she stated. She had contested from Mumbai North seat in General elections.

column2: Court grants protection from arrest to Shehla Rashid in sedition case
column3: A Delhi court on Monday granted relief from arrest to Jammu and Kashmir People's Movement leader Shehla Rashid, who was booked for sedition. Rashid had tweeted that the armed forces allegedly tortured civilians and ransacked houses in the Valley after J&K's special status was revoked. "I am of the view that the matter requires investigation in detail," said the judge.

column2: Restrictions reimposed in parts of J&K ahead of Muharram
column3: Restrictions were reimposed in several parts of Jammu and Kashmir ahead of Muharram on Tuesday. Commercial hub of Lal Chowk and adjoining areas were completely sealed off and large number of security force personnel were deployed, officials said. Restrictions have been placed as a precautionary measure for maintaining law and order in the Valley, they added.

column2: India threatened SL players to opt out of Pak tour, alleges Pak minister
column3: Pakistan minister Fawad Chaudhry has accused India of threatening Sri Lankan cricketers to opt out of their upcoming tour to Pakistan. "This is really cheap tactic, jingoism from sports to space is something we must condemn, really cheap on part of Indian sports authorities," he tweeted. As many as 10 cricketers including Lasith Malinga have opted out of the tour.

column2: Smith accused of mocking Leach by wearing spectacles during celebrations
column3: Australia batsman Steve Smith has been accused of mocking England spinner Jack Leach by wearing spectacles while celebrating his team's victory in the fourth Ashes Test. A journalist also claimed that Smith also mocked Leach's batting style in the team huddle. Leach had remained unbeaten on 1 while batting at number 11 in the third Ashes Test, which England won.

column2: India's first unicorn InMobi's B2C arm Glance raises $45 million
column3: Glance, the business-to-consumer (B2C) unit of India's first unicorn startup InMobi, has raised $45 million in its maiden funding round. The funding was raised from Peter Thiel and Ajay Royan's investment firm Mithril Capital. InMobi Co-founder and CEO Naveen Tewari said that the current round has not closed and could bag another $30-55 million in the next two months.

column2: Paytm Entertainment raises $4.5 million from parent firm One97
column3: Paytm Entertainment has raised $4.5 million from its parent entity One97 Communications at an $81-million valuation, Entrackr reported citing RoC filings. Paytm Entertainment, which develops and operates an online ticketing platform for booking movie and event tickets, has raised the funding after a 15-month gap, Entrackr revealed. The arm has raised $13 million to date from One97, it added.

column2: Acupuncturist puts needles too deep, punctures patient's lungs
column3: A New Zealand-based acupuncture practitioner has been reprimanded by the New Zealand Health and Disability Commissioner (HDC) after puncturing the lungs of a patient while performing an acupuncture procedure. The patient, who was told by the practitioner to rest-off the pain, was taken to an emergency room by her husband where she was diagnosed with collapsed lungs.

column2: Concerned about unemployment, economy: J&K village heads to Naidu
column3: Vice President Venkaiah Naidu met village heads (sarpanches) from Jammu and Kashmir in Delhi on Tuesday. According to reports, the village heads informed Vice President Naidu about the grass root problems. "We were concerned about the economy and unemployment, especially fruit exports. He (Naidu) has assured more peace and prosperity for J&K than all other states of India," they said.

column2: Man throws 3-yr-old from 7th floor, says did it to get rid of black magic
column3: After a 43-year-old man threw his friend's three-year-old daughter from the bedroom window of his house on 7th floor in Mumbai, he told police that he also planned to kill the girl's twin to get rid of black magic. In his diary recovered by police, he allegedly wrote that a 50-year-old woman in Morocco had performed black magic on him.

column2: US extracted CIA spy close to Putin: Reports
column3: The US in 2017 extracted a CIA spy who was close to Russian President Vladimir Putin, reports quoting US officials said. He was reportedly extracted after US President Donald Trump shared classified information with the Russians. The spy was crucial in providing information that led US intelligence to conclude Putin had directly ordered Russian meddling in 2016 US presidential elections.

column2: Trump declares US-Taliban peace talks 'dead'
column3: US President Donald Trump has said that the US-Taliban peace talks are "dead". Trump's statement came after he revealed that he had cancelled secret talks with the Taliban and Afghan President Ashraf Ghani at the Camp David presidential retreat. He said this was in retaliation to the killing of an American soldier by the Taliban in a suicide attack.

column2: JPMorgan creates 'Volfefe' index to track impact of Trump's tweets
column3: JPMorgan analysts have created an index to quantify the impact of US President Donald Trump's tweets on the interest rates market. The bank named the index "Volfefe", after Trump's "covfefe" tweet from 2017. The analysts used machine-learning techniques and their own volatility model to study how his tweets have caused US government bond interest rates to either fall or rise.

column2: Yes Bank nears deal to sell stake to one of world's top 3 tech firms
column3: Yes Bank is close to securing a deal to sell a minority stake to a global technology company to help boost the private lender's capital, CEO Ravneet Gill said on Tuesday. He described the buyer as one of the world's top three technology companies. Gill added the stake sale was likely to be less than 10% initially but could rise.

column2: Maanayata has been my support system, fortunate to have her: Sanjay
column3: Talking about his life after serving a jail term, actor Sanjay Dutt said, "The dark clouds are gone, I'm finally at peace." The actor further said that after his father passed away, his wife Maanayata remained his support system. "I'm... fortunate to have a wife like her. Her focus has always been home, husband, kids and her work," he added.

column2: Schumacher in Paris hospital for 'secret treatment': Report
column3: Former Formula One world champion Michael Schumacher was reportedly admitted to a Paris hospital for a "secret treatment" on Monday. Reports further claim that the former champion would undergo treatment based on stem-cell transfusion. Schumacher, who turned 50 in January, has not been seen in public since a skiing accident in the French Alps five years ago.

column2: BJP selectively uses beef policy where it's advantageous: Goa Cong
column3: After Union Minister Pralhad Joshi said the government would consider banning beef in Karnataka after consulting citizens, Goa Congress said, "They are selectively trying to use it where it is advantageous to them." It added, "Where it is disadvantageous to them, they will just leave it. Goa is one issue, Kerala is another issue... Why not a policy on beef?"

column2: Over 3 animal species in India have gone extinct: Researchers
column3: Three species of animals, namely the Indian Cheetah, the pink-headed duck and the Great Indian Bustard, have become extinct due to desertification in India, researchers have revealed. "[Y]ou'll realise how much changes have occurred because of the impact of deforestation and desertification," Kailash Chandra, Director of the Zoological Survey of India, stated.

column2: Miscreants allegedly vandalise Ambedkar statue in UP village
column3: A statue of BR Ambedkar was allegedly decapitated by miscreants in Uttar Pradesh's Ghunna village on Tuesday. According to a report, protesters from the Dalit community took to streets with sticks and weapons after the incident. "I suspect that the statue was broken under a conspiracy by the villagers," one of the protesters alleged.

column2: Taiwan files complaint against ICT in WTO over import duties
column3: Taiwan has dragged India into the World Trade Organisation (WTO) over imposition of import duties on 11 categories of ICT products, in excess of India's bound duty rates, alleging breach of global trade norms. The norms mandate duty-free imports of the products, Taiwan says. However, India says those items are different from the ones on which duties are imposed.

column2: Reducing Chandrayaan-2 Orbiter's orbit dangerous: Ex-ISRO official
column3: Responding to reports that ISRO is planning to reduce Chandrayaan-2 Orbiter's orbit, a former ISRO official told IANS that doing so is a "dangerous idea". "Even if Orbiter is able to pick weak signals, in all probability, it won't be able to revive Vikram," the ex-official said, adding that the Orbiter will consume more fuel to maintain the lowered orbit.

column2: 38-yr-old Maharashtra woman having 11 kids gets pregnant for 20th time
column3: A 38-year-old woman from the nomadic Gopal community in Maharashtra's Beed district has become pregnant for the 20th time, doctors said. The woman has had 16 successful deliveries and three abortions so far and is now seven months pregnant, they added. Five of her babies died within a few hours or days of delivery, while 11 have survived.

column2: What are you doing: PoK activist to Pak Minister over Chandrayaan-2
column3: After Pakistan Minister for Science & Technology Fawad Hussain criticised Chandrayaan-2, PoK human rights activist Arif Aajakia asked him, "Only those who try can fail. Fawad Hussain what are you doing?" "You're fooling people. Fawad Hussain you're Minister for Science. Think about the future of this country. In the age when there's metro everywhere, you're in rickshaws," Aajakia added.

column2: Kim tests positive for autoimmune diseases Lupus, Rheumatoid Arthritis
column3: Reality television personality Kim Kardashian was tested positive for autoimmune diseases Lupus and Rheumatoid Arthritis, as revealed in 'Keeping Up With the Kardashians'. The episode showed her doctor telling her that this could be a false positive and she'll need to schedule more appointments. An autoimmune disease is a condition in which the immune system mistakenly attacks the body.

column2: Taylor Swift threatened to sue us over 'Tay' chatbot: Microsoft Prez
column3: American singer Taylor Swift threatened to sue Microsoft over trademark issues with the 'Tay' chatbot, Microsoft's US version of the Chinese chatbot 'XiaoIce', Microsoft President Brad Smith revealed. He said Swift alleged that use of the name 'Tay' created a false and misleading association between her and the chatbot. Notably, Microsoft withdrew the bot after it started posting 'racist' tweets.

column2: Huawei drops lawsuit against US over seized equipment
column3: Huawei has dropped a lawsuit against the US after it released telecoms equipment seized on suspicion of violations of export controls. Huawei had sent equipment from China to a testing laboratory in California which was being sent back after the testing was done. Huawei said the equipment was released after the US confirmed no export licence was required.

column2: Video shows Tesla driver asleep in moving car; Tesla calls it a prank
column3: A video posted by a US man shows the driver of a Tesla car sleeping as the car speeds along a highway. Responding to the video, a Tesla spokesperson said, "Many of these videos appear to be dangerous pranks or hoaxes. Our driver-monitoring system repeatedly reminds drivers to remain engaged and prohibits the use of Autopilot when warnings are ignored."

column2: Techie dies of heart attack after argument with traffic police in UP
column3: A 35-year-old techie from Noida died of heart attack at a hospital after an altercation with the traffic police over a suspected violation, his father has alleged. Noida Police said the incident took place on Sunday evening in Ghaziabad. The 65-year-old father alleged misbehaviour by the traffic police in the name of checking under the amended Motor Vehicles Act.

column2: India rejects Pak, China statement on J&K; calls J&K integral part
column3: India on Tuesday rejected a reference to Jammu and Kashmir in a joint statement by Pakistan and China that described the Kashmir issue as a dispute left from history. "J&K is an integral part of India," Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Raveesh Kumar said. India also told the countries to stop work on China-Pakistan Economic Corridor that passes through PoK.

column2: Smoke engulfs train coaches in Bihar, no injuries reported
column3: Smoke engulfed two coaches of the Darbhanga-Kolkata Express in Bihar on Monday night, following which the train was stopped at Jhajha railway station and passengers vacated the coaches, said a media report. Railway officials and staff brought the smoke under control and the train resumed operations an hour later. No casualties or injuries have been reported.

column2: Delhi contractor arrested over conspiracy to kill SAIL Chairman
column3: Delhi Police has arrested a private contractor for allegedly hatching a conspiracy to kill Steel Authority of India Limited (SAIL) Chairman Anil Kumar Chaudhary for rejecting coal supplied by his son's US-based company. At least six more people were arrested in connection with the case. Chaudhary was attacked with iron rods on his head, neck, knees and legs last month.

column2: Man pastes RC, licence and insurance on helmet to avoid challan
column3: A Gujarat man has pasted his driving licence, insurance, pollution certificate and his bike's registration certificate on his helmet to avoid being fined under the amended Motor Vehicles Act. He said he wants to keep the documents handy whenever a traffic police officer stops him. "This way I am never hassled," he added.

column2: Japan will have to dump radioactive water into Pacific: Minister
column3: Tokyo Electric Power will have to dump radioactive water from its destroyed Fukushima nuclear power plant directly into the Pacific Ocean, Japan's Minister of the Environment Yoshiaki Harada has said. Tokyo Electric Power has collected over one million tons of contaminated water in tanks. The utility says it will run out of space by 2022.

column2: I don't know Bhojpuri actors, can't expect B’wood to know me: Rakul
column3: Actress Rakul Preet Singh said that she doesn't expect people in Bollywood to know her as she herself doesn't know Bhojpuri actors. "I've to work from scratch here and that's all right," she added. The actress further said that she wants to do all types of roles and hopes that the industry gives her opportunities to do so.

column2: Rishi returns to India after 11 month-long cancer treatment in US
column3: Actor Rishi Kapoor, who was undergoing cancer treatment in New York since September 2018, on Tuesday morning returned to India with his wife Neetu Kapoor. "BACK HOME!!!!!! 11 Months 11days! Thank you all," Rishi tweeted after returning to India. Rishi, who recently turned 67, had earlier revealed that he is now cancer-free.

column2: Ramos equals Casillas' record with 167th appearance for Spain
column3: Spain's national football team captain Sergio Ramos has become the joint-highest cap holder for his nation after equalling former captain Iker Casillas' record of 167 appearances. With 21 goals, the 33-year-old defender is also the joint-tenth on the list of highest goal-scorers for Spain. "My excitement to keep going is still there and possibly exceed the 200 caps," Sergio said.

column2: Reservation will be needed till there's untouchability: RSS leader
column3: Addressing a press conference in Pushkar, RSS Joint General Secretary Dattatreya Hosabale stated, "On the issue of reservation, it will be needed till the time there is untouchability, economic need, and its beneficiaries feel they require it." Hosabale added, "The day it stops and its beneficiaries say, 'we do not need it anymore', it will be stopped."

column2: If Congress behaves like BJP, why would it get votes: Tharoor
column3: Addressing reporters on the sidelines of an event organised by Congress' minority department, party MP Shashi Tharoor said, "If we try to behave like the ruling party, then why should anyone vote for us?" He added, "It is those who agree with us, who want an India for everyone, they are the ones whom we should speak for."

column2: Increase traffic fines 'gradually': Road safety experts to Centre
column3: Amid hefty fines being imposed under the Motor Vehicles Act, road safety experts have asked the Centre to "gradually increase" traffic fines. A road safety activist has suggested usage of "rubber stamps with road safety messages to be imprinted on challan". "This form of challaning, coupled with temporary reduction...will help improve road behaviour leading to greater safety," the activist added.

column2: Delhi man kills 20-day-old daughter after argument with wife
column3: A man allegedly killed his own 20-day-old infant daughter after arguing with his wife in Delhi's Bindapur area on Friday. The accused, who got married to his wife in 2018, had argued with her over her going to her maternal home. He then took his daughter to his room, strangled her and then drowned her in a tub, police said.

column2: Govt to spend $130 billion in military modernisation: Reports
column3: Indian government has reportedly decided to spend $130 billion for "fleet modernisation in next 5-7 years across all armed forces". Government's immediate priority is procurement of 2,600 infantry combat vehicles and 1,700 future ready combat vehicles for the Indian Army, as per reports. The Navy has reportedly finalised a plan to procure 200 ships, 500 aircraft and 24 attack submarines.

column2: Aamir rejoins Mogul after quitting film over MeToo allegations on director
column3: Nearly a year after he quit 'Mogul' over sexual misconduct allegations against its director Subhash Kapoor, Aamir Khan has confirmed he'll star in the film. He revealed IFTDA sent a letter saying he should wait for the court's decision. Aamir added he also talked to women who had worked with Kapoor and all of them "spoke very highly of him".

column2: Trash talking those under 21 should be illegal: Akshay on son being trolled
column3: Actor Akshay Kumar, when asked about his 16-year-old son Aarav’s pictures being subjected to “nasty comments” by trolls, said, "Trash talking anyone under 21 publicly should be illegal." "Those that troll toddlers and teens, I have no words for that kind of behaviour," he added. "All we can do as parents is teach our kids to be thick-skinned," said Akshay.

column2: Conflict between India, Pak less heated now than 2 weeks ago: Trump
column3: Speaking about tensions between India and Pakistan, US President Donald Trump said, "India and Pakistan are having a conflict over Kashmir as you know. I think (it) is a little bit less heated right now than was two weeks ago." He further reiterated his offer to mediate between the two countries, adding, "I get along with both countries very well."

column2: 1,000 Amazon employees to protest inaction on climate change in US
column3: Over 1,000 Amazon employees in the US have planned a mass walkout on September 20 to protest Amazon's lack of action around climate change. In an internal petition, the employees made three demands. This included a halt on funding to politicians and lobbying groups which deny climate change and a bid for Amazon to achieve zero carbon emissions by 2030.

column2: New prosthetic leg tech lets amputees feel foot, knee in real-time
column3: ETH Zurich-led researchers have developed a new prosthetic leg technology with sensors and electrodes to give wearers a sense of knee movement and feedback from the foot's sole on the ground. The modified prosthetic helped two patients with above-the-knee amputations walk faster and consume less oxygen. The two patients also saw significant loss in phantom limb pain.

column2: Apple modifies App Store search to not always put own apps first
column3: Apple has confirmed that it modified the algorithm related to its App Store searches so that its own apps do not always get displayed first. This comes after Apple faced heavy criticism and potential anti-trust investigations over allegations of unfair favouritism and rankings. Apple had said the App Store algorithm grouped apps by developers and displayed them by their popularity.

column2: Video shows minister saying grab SP, DM by collars to be big politicians
column3: A video has surfaced online, showing Chhattisgarh Minister Kawasi Lakhma telling school children, "If you want to become a big politician, grab the collars of the collector and the Superintendent of Police." Reportedly, the video was shot during a Teachers' Day function. However, the minister has said he's being "misquoted" and his remark, which is being shown, is "fake".

column2: Startup making satellites for ISRO raises funds from Paytm CEO
column3: Mumbai-based spacetech startup Kawa Space has raised an undisclosed amount in its pre-Series A funding round from Paytm Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma. Founded by Kris Nair and Bala M, Kawa Space designs and operates Earth observation satellites. It has won a contract to build over 27 satellites for the Indian government and Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO).

column2: Logistics unicorn Delhivery raises $115 million from CPPIB
column3: Gurugram-based logistics unicorn Delhivery has raised $115 million from Canada's largest pension fund manager, Canada Pension Plan Investment Board (CPPIB). CPPIB bought an 8% stake in the startup from an unnamed existing investor, reportedly at a $1.5-billion valuation. Delhivery closed its $413-million Series F funding round led by SoftBank Vision Fund at over $1.5-billion valuation in March.

column2: SoftBank urging WeWork to halt its IPO over valuation: Report
column3: WeWork's main investor SoftBank is reportedly pushing for the co-working space startup to halt its planned Initial Public Offering (IPO). This comes days after The Wall Street Journal claimed that the startup is planning to cut its valuation to significantly less than the earlier reported figures at the lower $20-billion range. WeWork was last valued at $47 billion in January.

column2: US moon mission successful as they launched on Ekadashi: Ex-RSS leader
column3: Ex-RSS leader Sambhaji Bhide, who heads Shiv Pratishthan Hindustan in Maharashtra, has said that scientists in the US succeeded in their 39th attempt to send their craft to the moon because they had launched it on 'Ekadashi'. He claimed that following 38 failed attempts, US scientists sent their spacecraft based on the Indian time measurement system.

column2: Ex-MLA from Pak PM's party seeks political asylum in India
column3: A former MLA from Pakistan PM Imran Khan's party PTI is seeking political asylum in India, saying minorities are being treated badly in Pakistan. Baldev Kumar added that Hindus and Sikhs are killed on a daily basis in Pakistan. Kumar, who was an MLA from a reserved seat in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Assembly, reached India with his family on Monday.

column2: 32-yr-old dyes hair to look like 81-yr-old at Delhi airport, caught
column3: A 32-year-old man from Gujarat was caught on Sunday by CISF personnel at Delhi airport for allegedly impersonating an 81-year-old man by using a fake passport. He dyed his hair and beard white and came on a wheelchair to board a New York-bound flight. "The appearance and skin texture of the passenger seemed to be much younger," an official said.

column2: One person dies every 40 seconds from suicide: WHO
column3: WHO Director-General Tedros Ghebreyesus has said that one person dies every 40 seconds from suicide despite progress in suicide prevention activities in some countries. "We call on all countries to incorporate proven suicide prevention strategies into national health and education programmes in a sustainable way," he added. "Every death is a tragedy for family and friends," Tedros further said.

column2: I was told I am too big to walk the ramp in college: Sonakshi
column3: Actress Sonakshi Sinha in an interview revealed that she wanted to walk the ramp during a fashion show in college, but a "thin girl" told her that she is "too big to walk the ramp" and should instead handle the lights. "I just felt really bad...[T]here is so much you want to do when you're growing up," she added.

column2: I used to get bullied for my dance at school: Nora Fatehi
column3: Actress Nora Fatehi has revealed that people used to bully and laugh at her for her dance at school. "[T]he girls in the school... were fabulous dancers. I used to copy them and tried to get accepted but they always rejected me," she added. "I was told I wasn't on their level of dancing," she further said.

column2: US-based firm 3D prints mini human heart using cardiac muscle cells
column3: Chicago-based BIOLIFE4D has become the first US company to successfully 3D-bioprint a mini human heart, it announced on Monday. It used patient-derived cardiac muscle cells and bioink (similar to gelatin) to replicate actual human biomaterials. The printed mini heart has the same structure as a full-sized heart. The company hopes to eventually bioprint a full-sized functioning human heart.

column2: Precious treasure: PM Modi on Principal Secretary Misra's farewell
column3: At the farewell programme held for outgoing Principal Secretary Nripendra Misra on Monday, PM Narendra Modi described him as "a precious treasure" and a capable officer adept in conflict resolution. "Nripendra Ji guided me...He is an officer who understands how India's democratic system works," PM Modi tweeted. The 1967-batch IAS officer had announced his decision to resign last month.

column2: Odd, interesting shot: Actress on criticism for semi-nude pic post chemo
column3: Actress Selma Blair, who underwent chemotherapy treatment for multiple sclerosis, has defended her decision to post a semi-nude image of herself on Instagram. Replying to users, Selma wrote 'I think it's a vulnerable, humourous, odd and interesting fashion shot. I like it' and 'To each his own'. However, several users also praised the picture and called it "brave" and "fantastic".

column2: CEO Pete Lau tweets picture of upcoming OnePlus TV
column3: OnePlus CEO Pete Lau has tweeted a teaser image of the upcoming OnePlus TV with the caption, "No detail is too small.'' The image seems to reveal a carbon fibre back and a metallic-finish support bar. This comes after the OnePlus TV was confirmed to feature a 55-inch QLED panel, a custom Gamma Colour Magic processor and eight speakers.

column2: I'm being treated as if I committed a crime: Saaho director on criticism
column3: 'Saaho' director Sujeeth has said he is being "targeted" for the critical failure of his film, adding, "I am being treated as harshly as if I have committed a crime." "I am just staying away from the media...because of all the negativity being thrown at the movie," he added. "Fortunately, Prabhas sir and the producers are supporting me," said Sujeeth.

column2: Richa Chadha seeks police's help over man's obscene tweet
column3: Actress Richa Chadha has tweeted to Jodhpur Police after a man tagged her in an obscene tweet. Sharing the screenshot of the tweet, Richa wrote, "Hope the 'chef' doesn't serve food that's as dirty, stanky and stale as his unoriginal joke." A Twitter user claimed that he has identified the man as Pushpendra Bala from Jodhpur.

column2: 10 Sri Lanka players including Malinga pull out of Pakistan tour
column3: As many as 10 cricketers including Lasith Malinga, Angelo Mathews and Dimuth Karunaratne have pulled out of Sri Lanka's tour to Pakistan due to security concerns. The players were reportedly given a free hand in deciding whether they wanted to travel with the side or not. Sri Lanka are scheduled to play limited-overs series in Pakistan from September 27 onwards.

column2: Govt to provide 60% funding to startups for cow by-products: Report
column3: Startups aimed at commercialising cow by-products like cow dung and urine will receive up to 60% of their initial investment as government funding, a report said on Monday. "We will encourage youths to go for cow-based entrepreneurship...and research on the medicinal value of cow by-products," Vallabh Kathiria, Chairman of Rashtriya Kamdhenu Aayog was quoted as saying.

column2: Stop drama, stand up, CISF allegedly tells woman on wheelchair at airport
column3: Virali Modi, a disability rights activist, has claimed a CISF woman constable misbehaved with her at the Delhi airport. She added that she constantly explained to the constable that she cannot walk and despite that the constable told her, "You have to stand up for security checking! Stop doing drama!" Virali added the constable later denied saying anything to her.

column2: IAS officer who resigned is traitor, should go to Pakistan: BJP MP
column3: BJP MP Anantkumar Hegde has called IAS officer Sasikanth Senthil "Gaddar" (traitor), days after the 2009-batch bureaucrat resigned as Deputy Commissioner of Dakshina Kannada. "The first thing he should do is to migrate to Pakistan along with those who have supported his views," said Hegde. In an interview to Hindustan Times, Senthil said he quit due to Article 370 revocation.

column2: Man enters Delhi airport with edited ticket to see off mother; held
column3: Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) on Saturday caught a man who had allegedly edited his flight ticket to gain entry into Delhi airport's Terminal-3 (T-3) to see off his mother travelling to Srinagar. He was handed over to Delhi Police and a case was registered against him. CISF personnel had spotted the man roaming suspiciously in check-in area of T-3.

column2: Muzumdar appointed South Africa batting coach for India series
column3: Mumbai's Amol Muzumdar has been appointed the batting coach of the visiting South African team for the Test series against India beginning October 2. The 44-year-old amassed a total of 11,167 first-class runs at an average of 48.13. Muzumdar, who also served as Rajasthan Royals' batting coach, said, "To be associated with an international side is a huge honour."

column2: Pollard officially named Windies limited-overs captain
column3: All-rounder Kieron Pollard has officially been named the Windies captain in the limited-overs formats. CWI president Ricky Skerritt made the announcement in a press conference in Trinidad on Monday. Pollard, who last played an ODI for the Windies against Pakistan back in October 2016, replaces Jason Holder and Carlos Brathwaite as the new ODI and T20I skipper respectively.

column2: 45 Google employees faced retaliation for complaints to HR: Report
column3: As many as 45 Google employees reportedly faced retaliation after they complained to Human Resources on issues like workplace harassment and unethical work culture. They alleged retaliation in forms of demotion, being pushed out and negative reviews, Recode reported. In 2018, 20,000 employees held a walkout protest against Google's handling of sexual harassment accusations against top executives.

column2: Wunderlist Founder offers to buy app back from Microsoft
column3: Christian Reber, the Founder of to-do lists app Wunderlist, has offered to buy the app back from Microsoft which acquired it in 2015. Adding a list of improvements he would make to Wunderlist, Reber further offered that Microsoft could keep the team and focus on its own task-management app 'To-Do'. Stopping app updates, Microsoft had announced it will retire Wunderlist.

column2: Tech firms may be allowed to sell users' public data: Report
column3: India is reportedly mulling guidelines which would require technology firms like Google and Facebook to sell collected non-personal data to anyone in India seeking access to it, including government and private entities. The firms, including the likes of Amazon, will have to share data collected in their operations including traffic, buying and illness patterns, The Economic Times reported.

column2: Amazon to let customers pick up orders from Mumbai stations
column3: E-commerce giant Amazon has partnered with Indian Railways to enable customer pickups across four railway stations in Mumbai. It will set up kiosks at high footfall locations inside Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus, Thane, Dadar and Kalyan stations to let customers pick up their packages. Customers will be able to select one of the pickup points during checkout on the website.

column2: Uber mulls offering small loans to its drivers: Reports
column3: Ride-hailing giant Uber is reportedly looking at directly offering loans to its drivers. Reports said Uber sent in-app messages to some drivers, saying it's "building a new financial product" to help drivers "in a time of need". Uber reportedly surveyed the drivers on whether they had taken small loans before and the amount they would request if Uber offered loans.

column2: Pro-Putin party loses a third of seats in local Moscow polls
column3: Russia’s ruling United Russia party, which supports President Vladimir Putin, has lost one-third of its seats in the Moscow city assembly, reports said on Monday. The party won 25 of 45 seats in the assembly and retained its majority. In the 2014 polls, United Russia had won 28 seats and a further 10 through independent candidates whom it had backed.

column2: Pak's human rights commission dysfunctional for past 3 months
column3: Pakistan's National Commission for Human Rights (NCHR) has reportedly been dysfunctional for over three months due to the completion of tenures of its top functionaries. The new members will have to be appointed by Pakistan PM Imran Khan and opposition leader Shehbaz Sharif through consensus. Pakistan has accused India of human rights violations in J&K after Article 370 revocation.

column2: Children in Hong Kong form chains in support of protests
column3: Hundreds of uniformed school students, many wearing masks, formed human chains in districts across Hong Kong on Monday in support of anti-government protesters and chanted, "Hong Kong people, add oil". "The school-based human chain is the strongest showcase of how this protest is deep-rooted in society," said Alan Leong, an alumnus of Wah Yan College in the city’s Kowloon district.

column2: Clashes erupt in PoK against Pak Army atrocities
column3: Protests reportedly erupted in Pakistan occupied Kashmir (PoK) against atrocities by the Pakistan Army and human rights violations. "The people of PoK are suffering," a protestor said, adding that Pakistan was committing human rights violation in PoK. The protestors reportedly shouted slogans against the Pakistan Army and pelted stones at the police, who in response charged them with batons.

column2: BSNL plans to fire 30% contract staff unpaid since Dec'18: Report
column3: BSNL is reportedly planning to lay off about 30% of its contract workforce amid "financial stress". The company has been unable to pay its contract workers since December 2018, while several hundred employees have also been unpaid for months due to cash-crunch. Meanwhile, Union Minister Arjun Meghwal said government plans to provide BSNL with a financial package.

column2: Baby falls out of SUV in Kerala; parents drive away without noticing
column3: A video showing a baby falling out of a moving SUV in a forest area in Kerala has surfaced online. The video shows the one-year-old girl crawling on the road as her parents drove away without noticing that she had fallen out of the vehicle. The baby girl was later rescued by forest officials and handed over to the parents.

column2: BSP to contest Haryana Assembly elections alone on all 90 seats
column3: Bahujan Samaj Party's Rajya Sabha MP Satish Chandra Misra has said that BSP will contest Haryana Assembly elections alone on all 90 seats. "We'll not have alliance with Congress or anybody else," said Misra. Earlier, BSP supremo Mayawati tweeted that her party was ending the alliance with former MP Dushyant Chautala's party JJP due to disagreement over sharing of seats.

column2: 21-year-old boy beheads father for not letting him play PUBG
column3: Raghuveer Kammaar, a 21-year-old college student from Karnataka's Belagavi, beheaded his father for not letting him play PUBG. As per police, Raghuveer's father had been trying to get him off PUBG for months and they had frequent fights over his addiction to PUBG. Raghuveer was arrested by police on Monday and has confessed to killing his father to the police.

column2: Hyderabad ragpicker killed after his bag explodes; police probes case
column3: A ragpicker was killed in Hyderabad on Sunday after a bag that he tried to open exploded on the street. The man, identified as 35-year-old Ali, sustained serious burns on both his hands and later succumbed at a government-run hospital. Cyberabad Police Commissioner VC Sajjanar, who visited the blast scene, said that it was suspected to be a chemical explosion.

column2: MJ Akbar case came at great personal cost to me: Priya Ramani
column3: Journalist Priya Ramani, against whom former Union Minister MJ Akbar filed a defamation case for alleging sexual harassment, told a Delhi court that the case came at a great personal cost. "I've nothing to gain...I'm a well-known journalist and live a quiet life with my family in Bengaluru. It's not easy for any woman to make such disclosures," she said.

column2: Chinmayanand raped me, exploited me physically for 1 year: Law student
column3: The postgraduate law student, who had levelled harassment charges against BJP leader Swami Chinmayanand, has alleged that he raped her and also physically exploited her for one year. "On Sunday, the SIT quizzed me for about 11 hours. I have told them about the rape. Even after telling them everything, they have not arrested Chinmayanand yet," she added.

column2: There will always be a name more saleable than you: Shweta
column3: Talking about the rat race to be more saleable, actress Shweta Tripathi said in an interview, "There will always be a name bigger and more saleable than you." "I think I'm not going to give up on who I am," she added. "People who want to work with me will do that irrespective of all this," she further said.

column2: Kevin Hart will need 4 months of therapy after crash: Reports
column3: Actor-comedian Kevin Hart will reportedly go through at least four months of physical therapy after he suffered injuries in a car accident. Hart will be under the guidance of medical professionals and they'll transfer him to an outpatient facility once he's stable enough to do physical therapy, reports added. Hart suffered back injuries when his car crashed on Mulholland Highway.

column2: I am what I am today because of 'Naagin': Mouni Roy
column3: Talking about her career in films, actress Mouni Roy said that whatever she is today is because of her show, 'Naagin'. "That show is popular... But for now, I am only focusing on films," she added. The actress who made her Bollywood debut in 'Gold' further said that her transition from television to films wasn't really tough.

column2: Those who don't believe in party's ideology can leave: NCP MP
column3: NCP Rajya Sabha MP Majeed Memon on Monday said that those who do not believe in the party's ideology, principles and loyalty could leave the party. Memon also said that leaders leaving the party to either join the Shiv Sena or the BJP is a passing phase. It will ultimately be a victory of democracy, he added.

column2: RBI panel praises Telangana startup model, urges others states to replicate
column3: A committee constituted by the Reserve Bank of India has recommended that Telangana's innovative model for start-ups should be assessed for possible replication in other states. The expert committee headed by UK Sinha, the former Chairman of SEBI, submitted its report in June. The state's various incentives for startups and incubators are the reasons for its mention in the report.

column2: Gurugram-based fitness startup Fitso raises $1.5 million
column3: Gurugram-based fitness startup Fitso has raised $1.5 million in Pre-Series A round from venture capital firm SRI Capital, Zomato Co-founder Pankaj Chaddah and Helion Ventures Co-founder Ashish Gupta. Sprout Capital and China's IPV Capital also invested in the round. Co-founded in 2015 by Naman Sharma, Rahool Sureka and Saurabh Aggarwal, Fitso is a full-stack sports facilities provider.

column2: Nissan CEO Hiroto Saikawa to step down on September 16
column3: Nissan CEO Hiroto Saikawa will step down on September 16 and will temporarily be replaced by COO Yasuhiro Yamauchi, the Japanese automaker's board announced on Monday. This comes after Saikawa admitted to an internal probe's findings that he and other executives were overpaid in a stock-related payment program but has denied wrongdoing. He had reportedly received $440,000 in excess compensation.

column2: Reliance looks to partner with startups to boost waste management
column3: Reliance Industries is planning to partner with global and domestic startups which have figured out ways to curb waste generation and help them expand its waste-to-energy and circular economy initiatives. Reliance will develop intellectual property with the startup that will be owned jointly. It has reviewed a few hundred applications and is looking at a model that can be replicated.

column2: Artificial leaf creates medicine with sunlight for the 1st time
column3: Researchers at the Eindhoven University of Technology have managed to create two types of medicines from a "mini-reactor" that, similar to leaves in nature, absorbs sunlight and drives chemical reactions. The reactors have very thin channels running across them like a leaf's veins. Sunlight triggers the molecules of the liquids running through the microchannels and starts a chemical reaction.

column2: Centre intends to expel illegal immigrants from India: Amit Shah
column3: Addressing the fourth conclave of North East Democratic Alliance (NEDA), Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that the Centre intends to expel all illegal immigrants, not just from Assam but from the entire nation. "Congress governments sowed seeds of strife in the Northeast. The party did not care for the Northeast and because of that militancy flourished," he added.

column2: We will not give even an inch of Kashmir to Pak: Tharoor
column3: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Monday said that India will not give even an inch of Kashmir to Pakistan. All the opposition parties stand with PM Narendra Modi on the J&K issue being taken to the United Nations by Pakistan, Tharoor said. In India we can criticise the government over Kashmir but outside India, we are one, he added.

column2: Manipur in favour of NRC, will approach Centre: CM Biren Singh
column3: Manipur Chief Minister N Biren Singh on Monday said the state government was in favour of a National Register of Citizens (NRC) and will approach the Centre to implement it. The state government had approved a resolution for NRC, the CM said. The Centre was clear that no illegal immigrant will be allowed to stay in India, he added.

column2: Designer Prabal Gurung asks 'who gets to be an American?' at NYFW
column3: Designer Prabal Gurung's models on Sunday draped sashes which read, "Who gets to be American?" for his catwalk finale at the New York Fashion Week. Talking about their outfits, Gurung said, "I wanted to explore this idea of what America looks like, who does America belong to?" Gurung also featured models of different sizes and those belonging to different ethnicity.

column2: We've inputs there may be terrorist attack in South India: Lt Gen SK Saini
column3: Lt Gen SK Saini, General Officer Commanding-in-Chief, Southern Command on Monday said, "We've inputs that there may be a terrorist attack in Southern part of India." "Some abandoned boats have been recovered from Sir Creek. We're taking precautions to ensure that designs of inimical elements and terrorists are stalled," he added.

column2: Kerala on alert after Army warns of possible terror attack in South India
column3: Kerala Director General of Police (DGP) Loknath Behera has said that an alert has been issued to all districts of the state following Army's warning. "Police across the state have been directed to maintain vigil at public places," he added. Army had said that it received inputs that a terrorist attack may take place in southern part of India.

column2: My mother didn't trust my judgement in men: Janhvi
column3: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has said in an interview that her mother didn't trust her judgement in men, because she loves 'very easily'. "She would say that...she will choose someone for me," Janhvi added. Asked about what she looks for in an ideal partner, Janhvi said, "He should be really talented and passionate about what he does."

column2: My daughter refuses to step out with family due to photographers: Akshay
column3: Akshay Kumar has said it "breaks his heart" to hear his six-year-old daughter Nitara say she doesn't want to come out for dinner with her family because of the paparazzi. "I really don't blame [kids]...Until our kids decide to be in any form of limelight after college years, I don't think they should be publicly followed or scrutinised," Akshay added.

column2: Afghanistan defeat Bangladesh to record their 1st ever away Test win
column3: Afghanistan defeated Bangladesh by 224 runs at Chattogram's Zahur Ahmed Chowdhury Stadium to register their first-ever away Test victory. Afghanistan captain Rashid Khan became the first player to score a fifty and take 10 or more wickets in debut match as captain. Afghanistan also became the second Test side after Australia to win two of their first three Tests.

column2: He has no minimum common sense: Siddaramaiah on K'taka BJP chief
column3: After Karnataka BJP chief Nalinkumar Kateel said former CM Siddaramaiah might be behind Congress leader DK Shivakumar's arrest, Siddaramaiah said, "I pity on him, he has no minimum common sense." Siddaramaiah added, "It's a politically motivated statement, there is no truth in that. It's absolutely false." Kateel had said, "I think Siddaramaiah did this because he saw DK Shivakumar's growth."

column2: Class 4 girl raped by Vice-Principal, class teacher in Jharkhand
column3: A Class 4 student of a school in Jharkhand's Dhanbad district was allegedly raped by the Vice-Principal and the class teacher in the sickroom of the institution a month ago, police said on Monday. The FIR was lodged against the two teachers, including the Vice-Principal, and school's sickroom nurse under different sections of the Indian Penal Code and POCSO Act.

column2: Even my car was fined for speeding: Transport Minister Gadkari
column3: Talking to reporters about the new traffic violation fines on Monday, Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said, "Even I've paid a fine...A car registered in my name was fined for speeding on the (Bandra-Worli) Sea Link recently." He said that Union Minister VK Singh was also fined recently. "The high fines will lead to transparency, and not corruption," he added.

column2: 4 dead, 1 missing after car accident in Madhya Pradesh
column3: Four people were killed while one person was missing after the car they were travelling in met with an accident near a village in Sehore on Bhopal-Indore road in Madhya Pradesh on Monday. Police said the search was underway for one missing after the "massive accident". The car is believed to have fallen into a culvert after the accident.

column2: Iran says British oil tanker could be released soon
column3: The British-flagged oil tanker seized by Iran could be released after the imminent completion of legal proceedings against the tanker, Iranian Foreign Ministry spokesman Abbas Mousavi has said. Iran seized the British tanker near the Strait of Hormuz for alleged marine violations in July, two weeks after British forces detained an Iranian tanker near Gibraltar.

column2: Joe Root doesn't seem to be able to inspire England: Chappell
column3: Former Australian cricket team captain Ian Chappell criticised England Test captain Joe Root, saying, "Joe Root is what I would class as a reactionary captain... As important as anything, he doesn't seem able to inspire his team." "[H]e (Root) just doesn't seem to have that inspirational spark as a captain," Chappell added about the England Test captain.

column2: Kohli has proven he's best white-ball batsman: Kagiso Rabada
column3: Speaking ahead of his side's tour to India, South African pacer Kagiso Rabada praised Indian captain Virat Kohli, saying, "[He] has proven that he is the best batsman in [the] white-ball format." "He is already regarded as a great of the game with some pedigree. Playing him is an opportunity to test yourself as a player," Rabada added.

column2: Losing hurts but want to carry on as Eng Test captain: Root
column3: On being asked about retaining the Test captaincy after England's failed bid to regain the Ashes, Joe Root said, "Definitely, yeah. Whenever you lose, it hurts. I have to take that on the chin." Root added that he and the England team needs to focus on the next week when they face Australia in the last Ashes Test in London.

column2: Pollard appointed Windies limited-overs captain: Report
column3: The cricket board of the Windies cricket team has reportedly named Kieron Pollard as the captain of the side in the limited-overs formats. The 32-year-old will replace Jason Holder in the ODI format, while he will be taking over from Carlos Brathwaite in the T20I format. Notably, Holder will continue holding his position as the Windies Test captain.

column2: Google removes 24 apps infiltrated with 'Joker' malware
column3: Google has removed 24 Android apps from its Play Store after a new malware infiltrated them a few weeks ago. Dubbed the 'Joker', the malware had been installed over 4,72,000 times by Android handset owners across wide geography of the globe. The Joker-laced apps perform illegal actions including authorising premium subscription, read SMSs, steal contact information without the owner's permission.

column2: Google, Facebook allowed political ads during polls: Russia
column3: Russian communications watchdog has accused Google and Facebook of allowing political advertising during regional elections on Sunday despite being asked to ban it. It said this could be seen as an "interference" in Russia's sovereign affairs. Google said it supports "responsible political advertising" while Facebook said it was the advertisers' responsibility to comply with local election laws.

column2: Investopad Co-founders launch $25-mn VC fund Good Capital
column3: The Co-founders of seed-stage incubator Investopad, Rohan Malhotra and Arjun Malhotra, have launched an early-stage venture capital firm Good Capital. The sector-agnostic venture capital fund, with a corpus of $25 million, will invest between $100,000 to $2 million in startups' seed and Series A funding rounds. Good Capital had completed its first close of $12 million two months ago.

column2: PM Modi calls for global boycott of single-use plastic
column3: PM Narendra Modi on Friday called for a global boycott of single-use plastic at the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification (UNCCD) being held in Greater Noida, Uttar Pradesh. He said the forest cover in India had gone up by 0.8 million hectares between 2015-17. Trees cut for development projects are compensated by planting more trees, PM Modi added.

column2: 80 lakh students stopped eating mid-day meals in past 3 yrs
column3: The number of students availing the Centre's Mid-Day Meal (MDM) scheme dropped from over 10 crore in 2015-16 to 9.17 crore in 2018-19 (over 80 lakh), government data revealed. MDM scheme covers children studying in classes I-VIII of government schools, government-aided schools and special training centres. Reports of substandard meals served under MDM had come up in the past.

column2: Tory Burch showcases collection inspired by Princess Diana at NYFW
column3: Designer Tory Burch presented her Spring/Summer 2020 collection at the New York Fashion Week on Sunday, which was inspired by Princess Diana's personality. The collection included soft vintage floral prints and baggy puffed-out sleeves that showed the 80s subculture. Talking about the collection, Tory said, "I felt she had a fearlessness and being a humanitarian...she was very inspiring."

column2: SEBI making e-voting app for retail investors in companies
column3: Markets regulator SEBI is working on an e-voting app for retail investors of listed companies, to increase their participation in management proposals and corporate governance. The SEBI said it may also provide links to recommendations of registered proxy advisors to help investors make informed decisions on proposals. Effective governance is necessary to protect shareholders' interest, it added.

column2: SBI cuts lending rate by 10 bps for the 5th time this year
column3: State Bank of India reduced its lending rate by 10 basis points across all tenors, which will come into effect from September 10. This is the fifth reduction in lending rate from SBI in FY 2019-20, coming down to 8.15% from 8.25% after it cut repo rates by 1.1% last week. Other banks are likely to follow SBI's lead.

column2: BSP leader involved in 13 cases of murder, robbery hit by 25 bullets
column3: BSP leader Virender Mann involved in over 13 cases, including those of murder, robbery and assault, died after being shot 20-25 times by a group of armed assailants in his car in a crowded market in Delhi's Narela. Police detained Mann's driver, who escaped unhurt, for questioning and his role in the killing has not been ruled out so far.

column2: Vikram lander is in a single piece but in a tilted position: ISRO official
column3: Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander is in a single piece, however, it's in a tilted position, an ISRO official associated with the mission has said. "It'd a hard-landing very close to the planned touchdown site as per the images sent by orbiter's camera," the official added. "We are making all-out efforts to see whether communication can be re-established," the official further said.

column2: Apple, Foxconn admit to hiring too many contract workers for new iPhones
column3: Apple and Foxconn have admitted to using far more temporary workers than allowed by Chinese labour law to make the latest iPhones. The violation was discovered by China Labor Watch (CLW) after a long investigation. The CLW said undercover investigators worked in Foxconn's Zhengzhou plant in China, including one who was employed there for four years.

column2: Twin Union Territories of J&K, Ladakh to have a common high court
column3: Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh will become two separate Union Territories from October 31 but will have a common high court, J&K State Judicial Academy's Director Rajeev Gupta said on Sunday. He added that 108 central laws would be applicable for the two UTs, while 164 state laws would be repealed and 166 state laws will continue to be applicable.

column2: Binny Bansal to launch $400 million VC fund for startups: Reports
column3: Flipkart Co-founder Binny Bansal is planning a $400-million venture capital fund to support startups, reports said on Monday. The fund's primary focus will be on Indian startups, however, it will also back entrepreneurs in Southeast Asia. Bansal, who quit as Flipkart's Group CEO last year, is expected to launch the fund, based out of Singapore, by this year's end.

column2: Former Union Minister Kalraj Mishra takes oath as Rajasthan Governor
column3: Former Union Minister Kalraj Mishra was sworn in as the Governor of Rajasthan at an oath-taking ceremony held at the Raj Bhawan in Jaipur on Monday. Rajasthan High Court Chief Justice Shripathi Ravindra Bhat administered the oath of office to Mishra who replaced Kalyan Singh after the completion of his five-year tenure. Mishra became the 22nd Governor of the state.

column2: Won't fine you for breaking signals: Nagpur Police jokes about lander
column3: In a tweet on Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander, the Nagpur City Police joked, "Please respond. We are not going to challan you for breaking the signals!" The lander lost contact with the ground station moments before touchdown. However, ISRO Chief K Sivan has said the exact location of lander has been found with the help of thermal images sent by orbiter.

column2: More Americans will die: Taliban after Trump ends Afghan talks
column3: US President Donald Trump's decision to cancel Afghan peace talks will cost more American lives, the Taliban has said. Trump abruptly cancelled the talks, aimed at ending the nearly 18-year-long war in Afghanistan, after Taliban claimed responsibility for an attack in Kabul last week that killed an American soldier and 11 others.

column2: I wish I could defy age: Akshay on turning 52
column3: On being asked about the secret of his fitness at 52, Akshay Kumar jokingly said that he wished he could defy age and added, "Honestly, the secret is to... live as clean as you did when you were small." The actor further advised the youth to treat their body as a temple. Akshay celebrated his 52nd birthday on Monday.

column2: Sonia Gandhi summons MP CM Kamal Nath, Scindia to Delhi
column3: Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi has summoned Congress leader Jyotiraditya Scindia and Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath for separate meetings in Delhi on Tuesday and Wednesday, respectively. Scindia and Nath reportedly disagree on who should lead the MP Congress unit. Some state party functionaries and their supporters had threatened to resign if Scindia wasn't made the state unit chief.

column2: 1500 pilgrims stranded due to landslides in Uttarakhand
column3: More than 1,500 pilgrims reportedly got stranded at various places in Uttarakhand's Chamoli after landslides blocked many routes following heavy rainfall. "CM has spoken to officials of Chamoli and Pithoragarh...relief work is going on at full pace ensuring steady supply of essentials such as medicines, rations," an official said. A cloudburst occurred in Govind Ghat area on Saturday.

column2: I don't want any officer to be arrested: Chidambaram
column3: Former Finance Minister P Chidambaram who is currently lodged in Tihar jail asked his family to tweet on his behalf. "I've no answer. No officer has done anything wrong. I don't want anyone to be arrested," his family tweeted. "People have asked me 'If the dozen officers...haven't been arrested, why have you been arrested?'" stated his another tweet.

column2: BJP has proved to be Mahmud Ghazni's grandfather: Congress MLA
column3: Congress MLA from Madhya Pradesh's Lahar Govind Singh said that BJP has proved to be Mahmud Ghazni's grandfather and added, "When Mahmud Ghazni invaded, he devastated Hindustan and plundered the Somnath temple, but still spared a few things...BJP didn't leave anything." "Kamal Nath-led government is facing various problems as...Shivraj Chouhan-led BJP government looted the state like Mahmud Ghazni," he added.

column2: Man booked for giving wife triple talaq via WhatsApp voice note
column3: A 34-year-old man was booked by Kerala police for allegedly giving triple talaq to his 29-year-old wife via WhatsApp voice note. "As per the wife's complaint, the talaq message was sent to her brother's phone having WhatsApp account," an official said. "The accused was said to be in the Gulf when the incident happened," he added.

column2: Great Learning offers Digital Marketing course with live projects
column3: Great Learning's PG Program in Strategic Digital Marketing offers real industry-projects that helps learners gain real-world expertise. Learners work on live projects using Google Analytics, Google Adwords, Facebook Ads, SEO, Content Marketing, Mailchimp, and more. Program participants learn from leading faculty and are mentored by industry experts, in addition to receiving a certificate from Great Lakes Institute of Management.

column2: Nadal clinches his 19th Grand Slam title, one away from Federer's record
column3: World number two Rafael Nadal defeated world number five and first-time Grand Slam finalist Daniil Medvedev to win his fourth US Open title. Nadal clinched the final with a scoreline of 7-5, 6-3, 5-7, 4-6, 6-4. The 33-year-old Spaniard has now won 19 Grand Slam men's singles titles, just one fewer than Roger Federer's all-time record of 20 major titles.

column2: Was yelled at by directors in early days, thrown out of movies: Priyanka
column3: Actress Priyanka Chopra, while speaking about the early days of her career, revealed, "I didn't know anything or anyone. I was yelled at by directors." "I was thrown into movies, I was thrown out of movies," she added. "I taught myself confidence. I learnt it's what you do after failure that makes you a success," said Priyanka.

column2: It'd be exciting to have female Bond but I doubt it'll happen: Brosnan
column3: Speaking about a female 'James Bond', actor Pierce Brosnan said, "I think we've watched the guys do it for the last 40 years...I think it'd be exhilarating, it'd be exciting." However, he added he doesn't think it's going to happen under the watch of the franchise's producers. Brosnan portrayed 'James Bond' in 'GoldenEye' and 'Tomorrow Never Dies' among other films.

column2: Steve Smith will take 'cheater' tag to his grave: Steve Harmison
column3: Former England pacer Steve Harmison has said that Australia batsman Steve Smith will always be remembered for the ball-tampering scandal irrespective of what he does now. "He's tarnished the game. When you are known as a cheat, and he is, I’m not going to sugar coat it. He cheated...that’s on your CV. You take it to your grave," Harmison added.

column2: Media hypes certain players: Rabada on Jasprit Bumrah's rise
column3: Referring to the rise of India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah and England pacer Jofra Archer, South Africa fast bowler Kagiso Rabada said that he admires them as they are good bowlers. However, he added, "The media hypes certain players, and that's okay." He further said, "You are not always at the top, that's one thing I can tell you."

column2: Australia defeat England by 185 runs in Manchester Test, retain Ashes
column3: Australia defeated England by 185 runs in the fourth Test at Manchester on Sunday to take a 2-1 lead in the 2019 Ashes. With this, Australia retained the Ashes as they cannot lose the series even if they lose the next match at The Oval. Prior to this, England had failed to win the Ashes at their home in 2001.

column2: Obstacles on Moon may be stopping signals: Chandrayaan-1 Director
column3: Mylswamy Annadurai, the Director of India's first Moon mission Chandrayaan-1, believes that obstacles on the Moon's surface may be stopping the Vikram lander from receiving signals. "There is always a two-way communication between the orbiter and lander, but we can attempt to communicate through one way," Annadurai said and added that communication will not be for more than 5-10 minutes.

column2: PM's gesture great morale booster for ISRO scientists: DRDO Chairman
column3: DRDO Chairman G Satheesh Reddy has said ISRO scientists were able to locate Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander after PM Narendra Modi hugged and consoled ISRO Chairman K Sivan who broke down. "It's...great morale booster for scientists who saw last mile glitch in mission. I think after that gesture...scientists again started working on it started looking for what actually happened," he added.

column2: India can set up base on Moon in 10yrs, bring Helium-3: Ex-DRDO scientist
column3: Former DRDO scientist A Sivathanu Pillai has claimed India will be able to set up base on the surface of Moon in ten years. "In space programme, we're one of the four countries that has complete mastery over technology," he added. "India will be able to set up a factory on Moon to...bring the extracted Helium-3 to Earth," said Pillai.

column2: 27-yr-old Anupriya becomes Odisha's 1st tribal woman commercial pilot
column3: Anupriya Madhumita Lakra, 27, is the first tribal woman from Maoist-affected Malkangiri district of Odisha to become a commercial pilot, according to the Hindustan Times. Lakra will join the Indigo airline as a co-pilot later this month. Lakra's father, who is a police constable, said that it was difficult for him to fund her pilot training but he took loans.

column2: Allahabad HC judge Vikram Nath named Gujarat High Court Chief Justice
column3: Senior judge of the Allahabad High Court, Justice Vikram Nath, has been appointed as the Chief Justice of the Gujarat High Court on Sunday following the Supreme Court Collegium's recommendation sent last month. Notably, the SC Collegium reversed its earlier recommendation to appoint Nath as the Chief Justice of the Andhra Pradesh High Court on the Centre's request.

column2: Schools to be shut in 5 MP districts on Monday amid rain
column3: Heavy rainfall in various parts of Madhya Pradesh has forced the administration to keep the schools closed on Monday, according to reports. All government and private schools in Bhopal district will remain closed tomorrow in view of the heavy rainfall in the district. Similar measures have been taken in other districts like Raisen, Vidisha, Sehore and Mandla.

column2: Pakistani astronaut congratulates ISRO for 'historic attempt'
column3: Pakistani astronaut Namira Salim has congratulated India and ISRO for the "historic attempt" to make a soft landing on the south pole of the Moon. "The Chandrayaan-2 mission is indeed a giant leap that makes the global space industry proud," she said.
