"No matter which nation leads, in space, all political boundaries dissolve," she further said.

column2: Pakistan has 'secretly' released JeM chief Masood Azhar: Report
column3: Pakistan has "secretly" released Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) chief Masood Azhar to plan terrorist operations, according to a report quoting Intelligence Bureau (IB) officials. "Pakistan may try to use the current situation and the Indian government's focus in J&K to target somewhere else," an IB official said. Recently, Azhar was declared individual terrorist by India under a new anti-terror law.

column2: Tamil actor-director Rajasekar passes away in Chennai
column3: Tamil actor and director Rajasekar, who was in his sixties, passed away in the early hours of Sunday in Chennai. Rajasekar started as a director in the Tamil entertainment industry and is known for directing films like 'Palaivanacholai' and 'Chinna Poove Mella Pesu'. As an actor, Rajasekar is known for Bharathiraja's 'Nizhalgal' and Praveen Bennett's directorial serial 'Saravanan Meenatchi'.

column2: Face detection app used by Madurai Police leaks data: Report
column3: The facial recognition app CopsEye used by Madurai Police to detect criminals leaked the data of suspects and police officers, security researchers have alleged. The app, developed by startup GeoMeo Informatics, lets Madurai Police match photos of suspects against a criminal database to check if they have a criminal record. The app has since been taken down from Play Store.

column2: Porsche hikes stake in electric car startup Rimac Automobili
column3: German automobile manufacturer Porsche has increased its stake in Croatian electric sports car and electromobility components startup Rimac Automobili to 15.5%. In June 2018, the German sports car maker had purchased a 10% stake in Rimac for an undisclosed amount. "We intend to intensify our collaboration in the field of battery technology," Porsche said.

column2: Northeast, mainland India relations since Mahabharata: Shah
column3: Union Minister Amit Shah on Sunday said cultural relations between Northeast and mainland India have existed since Mahabharata's time. "In Mahabharata, Babruvahan or Ghatotkach were from the Northeast. Arjun had married Chitrangada in Manipur, Sri Krishna's grandson also got married in the region," Shah said. The relations were temporarily affected during the 'gulami' (slavery) period, he added.

column2: President Kovind to become first Indian President to visit Slovenia
column3: President Ram Nath Kovind's three-nation tour to Slovenia, Iceland and Switzerland will make him the first Indian President to visit Slovenia. "To continue India's engagement and boost the bilateral relations...#PresidentKovind emplanes for State visits with a high level delegation," Ministry of External Affairs Spokesperson Raveesh Kumar tweeted on Sunday night.

column2: US is still working toward a peace deal with Taliban: Pompeo
column3: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Sunday said the US is still working towards a peace deal with the Taliban. The talks will not proceed further until the Taliban starts delivering on its commitments, he added. On Saturday, President Donald Trump said he cancelled the peace talks and a secret summit with the Taliban over the recent Kabul blast.

column2: Iranian tanker reaches destination, oil sold: Iran
column3: Iran's foreign ministry spokesman on Sunday said Iranian oil tanker Adrian Darya-1 had reached its destination and sold its oil. The tanker was photographed by satellite off the Syrian port of Tartus. The tanker, which was seized by Gibraltar over suspicions of carrying oil to Syria in breach of EU sanctions, was freed after receiving formal written assurances from Iran.

column2: Michael Clarke has skin cancer removed from his forehead, shares pic
column3: Former Australia captain Michael Clarke had skin cancer removed from his forehead this week after previously being diagnosed with three non-melanoma lesions. The 38-year-old shared a picture on Instagram, writing, "Another day, another skin cancer cut out of my face... youngsters out there make sure you are doing all the right things to protect yourself from the sun."

column2: Did not rest for a day in 100 days: Rajnath on NDA govt's 2nd term
column3: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Sunday said the BJP-led NDA government did not rest even for a day and did an "incredible" work during the first 100 days of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's second term. PM Modi said that the government took several important decisions during this period, including for those in the banking sector and for national security.

column2: Siddaramaiah might be behind Shivakumar's arrest: K'taka BJP chief
column3: Karnataka BJP chief Nalinkumar Kateel has said that former Chief Minister Siddaramaiah might be behind Congress leader DK Shivakumar's arrest by the Enforcement Directorate. "I doubt Siddaramaiah is the reason for the case on DK Shivakumar. I think Siddaramaiah did this because he saw DK Shivakumar's growth," said Kateel. Shivakumar was arrested under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

column2: People troll ex-NASA scientist for calling Moon 'planet', she responds
column3: Former NASA rocket scientist Anita Sengupta on Saturday responded to trolls after calling Moon a 'planet' instead of 'satellite' in a tweet about ISRO's Vikram lander. "Planetary EDL (Entry, Descent and Landing) as a discipline covers airless body DL, our moon is an airless body," she tweeted. She also gives classes on the subject at the University of Southern California.

column2: 90 stray dogs found dead with legs tied with strings in Maharashtra
column3: At least 90 stray dogs were found dead with their muzzles and legs tied with strings in Maharashtra's Buldhana district. The incident came to light due to foul odour emanating from decomposing carcasses. "Police suspect the strays were picked up from the city limits, killed, and their carcasses dumped in the forest area," an official said.

column2: Goa swimming coach accused of raping 15-yr-old sent to 6-day custody
column3: A Goa court on Sunday sent swimming coach Surajit Ganguly to six-day police custody for allegedly raping a 15-year-old girl training under him. Ganguly was arrested from Delhi on Friday after a video of him allegedly molesting the girl surfaced online. Ganguly served as the chief coach of the Swimming Association of Goa for about two and a half years.

column2: KCR inducts 6 ministers including son, nephew and 2 women
column3: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrasekhar Rao (KCR) expanded his Council of Ministers on Sunday. While former minister and KCR's son KT Rama Rao and nephew Harish Rao were inducted into the cabinet, four new faces including two women were accommodated. The four new ministers are Sabitha Indra Reddy, Gangula Kamalakar, Satyavathi Rathod and Puvvada Ajay Kumar.

column2: Madras HC lawyers declare 1 day boycott over Chief Justice's transfer
column3: The Madras High Court Advocates' Association, which comprises 18,000 lawyers, has announced a boycott over the transfer of Chief Justice Vijaya Kamlesh Tahilramani. Advocates from the Madras High Court and the Magistrate courts will not be appearing for their cases on Tuesday. Tahilramani resigned on Friday after the Supreme Court Collegium declined her request for reconsideration of transfer.

column2: Less than 2% Ganesha idols immersed in Bengaluru this year made of PoP
column3: According to Bengaluru's Municipal Corporation, less than 2% of the idols that were immersed in the first few days of the Ganesh Chaturthi this year were made of Plaster of Paris (PoP). Officials said only 3,871 (1.44%) out of the 2,67,772 idols immersed in the six zones in Bengaluru were made of PoP. This comes after campaigns against PoP idols.

column2: Pak holds belly dancing show to woo foreign investors, video goes viral
column3: Aimed at attracting foreign investors, Pakistan's Sarhad Chamber of Commerce & Industry (SCCI) recently organised the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Investment Opportunities Conference and SCCI's Business Excellence Award in Baku, Azerbaijan. A video from the conference has gone viral, showing belly dancers performing on stage for the attendees. The event was held from September 4-8.

column2: Tum jiyo hazaaron saal, tweets Sachin on Asha Bhosle's 86th b'day
column3: Wishing veteran singer Asha Bhosle on her 86th birthday, former Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar shared a picture with her and captioned it, "Tum jiyo hazaaron saal, saal ke din hon pachaas hazaar!" The 46-year-old further wrote, "Thank you for your lovely and evergreen voice. Happy Birthday @ashabhosle Tai." A user reacted to the tweet saying, "Both are my favourites."

column2: I feel like I have evolved as a cricketer: Hanuma Vihari
column3: India batsman Hanuma Vihari has said that he "personally feels" he has evolved as a cricketer. Vihari, who scored 289 runs at an average of 96.33 to become the highest run-scorer in the recently concluded Test series against West Indies, said, "For me, I have got better with every game." The 25-year-old made his Test debut in September 2018.

column2: Multiple US states launch antitrust probe of Facebook
column3: A coalition of attorneys general from several US states on Friday announced the antitrust investigation of Mark Zuckerberg-led social media giant Facebook on whether it "stifled competition". It will also determine whether Facebook's actions endangered consumers' data and increased the price of advertising. Similar antitrust probes are expected against "dominant" technology firms like Google.

column2: Google confirms antitrust review by US Department of Justice
column3: Google has acknowledged it is facing scrutiny under the US Department of Justice's review of online platforms. Google said it's been asked to provide information about the past antitrust investigations it has faced, adding it also expects similar inquiries from US state attorneys general. In 2013, the Federal Trade Commission cleared Google from 'search bias' allegations in an antitrust probe.

column2: Researchers find bug in Pepperfry portal that exposes user details
column3: Researchers have detected a security flaw in online furniture store Pepperfry, which could have allowed users to sign in to another registered user's account, reports said. The bug also revealed a user's personal information and allowed hackers to hack the site and change the user's first and last name. Pepperfry said the bug was fixed within the hour of detection.

column2: Hong Kong protesters urge Trump to 'liberate' their city
column3: Hong Kong protesters on Sunday marched to the US Consulate and urged US President Donald Trump to help bring in more democratic freedom to their city. Protesters waved US flags and carried posters that read "President Trump, please liberate Hong Kong". The protesters also urged the US to pass a bill that would impose sanctions against Chinese officials suppressing democracy.

column2: China plans to invest $1 bn in Pakistan development projects
column3: China is planning to invest $1 billion in development projects in Pakistan, seeking to boost bilateral ties, Yao Jing, China's Ambassador to Pakistan, said. He added that the pace of development projects under the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor is satisfactory. "Market access will increase Pakistan's exports by $500 million, which will reduce the disparity between bilateral trade," he said.

column2: Trump calls off secret summit, peace talks with Taliban
column3: US President Donald Trump on Saturday said he called off a secret summit with the Taliban and Afghan President Ashraf Ghani and also called off the peace talks with the insurgent group. Trump said the summit was cancelled after the Taliban claimed responsibility for Thursday's attack in Kabul. A US soldier, along with 11 others, was killed in the attack.

column2: Bella Hadid, sister Gigi Hadid walk for Ralph Lauren at NYFW
column3: Models and sisters Bella Hadid and Gigi Hadid walked for Ralph Lauren's collection on Saturday night at New York Fashion Week. Bella wore a floor-length low-cut burgundy shiny dress and complimented her look with long earrings. Meanwhile, Gigi wore black trousers, a white button-up shirt with a black bow-tie and a silver coat at the show.

column2: Coffee Day appoints IDFC Securities to advice on debt
column3: Coffee Day Enterprises (CDEL) on Saturday appointed IDFC Securities as an advisor to identify strategic options including divestment of its stake in Coffee Day Global and other group firms. It will also advise it on refinancing of existing debt, CDEL said in a regulatory filing. It is trying to sell stake in different assets since its founder VG Siddhartha died.

column2: Nissan CEO Hiroto Saikawa planning to resign soon: Nikkei
column3: Nissan Motors CEO Hiroto Saikawa reportedly said that he plans to resign soon, amid doubts over Nissan's recovery, Nikkei said on Sunday. This comes following reports last week that he and other executives were paid more than they were entitled to. Saikawa took responsibility for scandals involving ex-Chairman Carlos Ghosn and will reportedly leave once as a successor is found.

column2: Critic said I'm wooden material, should return to family business: Suniel
column3: Suniel Shetty has revealed that even after the success of his first film, a "powerful" critic of that time called him "wooden material". "He said I should go back to my family's restaurant business," Suniel added. "I took it up as a challenge. I told myself I needed to do something where I could be different," the actor further said.

column2: I do a film when I say I'm doing it: SRK on rumours of signing a film
column3: Shah Rukh Khan has responded to rumours that he has signed a new film. "Boys & girls I do a film when I say I am doing it," he tweeted. Reports had said that Shah Rukh is being considered for an action film by director Ali Abbas Zafar, adding that the film might also star actress Katrina Kaif.

column2: KBC helped dad recollect memories he forgot post brain surgery: Bhuvan
column3: YouTuber Bhuvan Bam on Friday took to Twitter to thank Amitabh Bachchan and the makers of Kaun Banega Crorepati. He wrote, "The questions have helped my father recollect many of his life's past memories which he had otherwise forgotten post brain surgery." "His participation/eagerness in the show is like a breath of fresh air and gives us hope," Bhuvan added.

column2: Revoking Article 370 biggest decision: Javadekar on NDA govt's 100 days
column3: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar, while speaking on completion of 100 days of the BJP-led NDA government, said that the Centre's biggest decision was revoking Article 370 and 35A, and dividing J&K into Union Territories. Javadekar said that an important aspect of revoking Article 370 was that Pakistan knocked several doors including United Nations', but the entire world stood with India.

column2: US Open winner apologises to crowd, says 'I know you wanted Serena to win'
column3: After defeating Serena Williams in the US Open final, Canada's 19-year-old Bianca Andreescu, while addressing the crowd, said, "I know you guys wanted Serena to win, so I am so sorry." She added that crowd's cheers for Serena were the hardest to overcome in the second set which she won 7-5 after being 5-1 at one point.

column2: You have to earn selection, no one says 'Bhai team mein aaja': Pant
column3: Wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant has said that he has worked hard and earned his place in the Indian cricket team. Adding that nobody has gifted the spot to him, Pant said, "Koi nahi bolta ke, 'Bhai team mein aaja'. Aisa nahi hota hai. If you don't perform well, you won't be selected. It's as simple as that."

column2: Radio Pakistan's website hacked, hackers write 'We got an eye on you'
column3: The website of Radio Pakistan, the state broadcaster of Pakistan, was hacked on Sunday. A message on the website read, "Hello admin, you are very secured. Appreciated your security. We got an eye on you." The hacking of the website was announced on a Twitter account @TheCrashRulers, that tweeted, "Radio Pakistan Website Hacked by Team #CrashRulers."

column2: Article 370 different, Centre will not touch Article 371: Amit Shah
column3: Addressing the 68th plenary session of the North Eastern Council, Home Minister Amit Shah said that while Article 370 was temporary in nature, Article 371 is about special provisions in the North East. "BJP government respects Article 371 and will not alter it in any way," said Shah. He added that there is a vast difference between the two articles.

column2: Money laundering case against Rolls-Royce by Enforcement Directorate
column3: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has registered a money laundering case against London-based engine-maker Rolls-Royce Plc and its subsidiary Rolls-Royce India Private Limited. A report quoting two officials said the case pertains to dubious payments in the form of commissions in return for contracts from three state-run Indian companies.

column2: First tranche of data from Swiss banks mostly includes closed accounts
column3: A large portion of the first tranche of data shared by Switzerland this month relates to accounts already closed due to fear of action, bankers and regulatory officials said. However, the data provides full details of the entire flow of funds to and from all the accounts active even for a single day in the year 2018, bankers said.

column2: Jennifer Lopez walks on Toronto International Film Festival red carpet
column3: Actress-singer Jennifer Lopez and her fiancé Alex Rodriguez walked on the red carpet of Toronto International Film Festival 2019 for the premiere of her film 'Hustlers'. Lopez wore a golden yellow gown and complimented her look with a high pair of silver sandals. Actress Lili Reinhart and Constance Wu were also among the celebrities who attended the screening.

column2: Farhan Akhtar, Mahesh Bhatt condole Ram Jethmalani's demise
column3: Following the demise of Supreme Court lawyer and former Union Law Minister Ram Jethmalani, actor Farhan Akhtar tweeted, "The time spent in conversation with you has always remained etched fondly in my memory. Condolences to the family." Meanwhile, Mahesh Bhatt tweeted, "Even the sky must learn to say goodbye to the stars. I thank you sir for touching my life."

column2: People have not stopped offering me films: Sonakshi Sinha
column3: Actress Sonakshi Sinha said that she feels great post the success of 'Mission Mangal' and added, "For me at least, success has been long overdue." "[Even] if few of my films haven't done well, people haven't stopped offering me films," she further said. Sonakshi added that she's been busiest over the past few years and has four releases this year.

column2: BBC partners with Google, Twitter, FB to fight 'fake news'
column3: The BBC has partnered with Google, Twitter and Facebook to devise a strategy to fight fake news, it announced on Saturday. Measures include targeted approach that uses 'early warning system' during critical periods like elections or when lives may be at risk. The move comes following criticism of technology firms for not doing enough to prevent spread of 'false news'.

column2: MIT Media Lab Director resigns over alleged links to Epstein
column3: Joi Ito, the Director of MIT Media Lab, has resigned from his post after a New Yorker article alleged the Media Lab had concealed the extent of donations received from late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. It alleged the contributions from Epstein were marked as anonymous in internal records, evading public disclosure. MIT had earlier admitted getting $800,000-donations from Epstein.

column2: Congrats to Modi govt on 100 days of 'no development': Rahul
column3: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday congratulated PM Narendra Modi's government on completing 100 days in office and accused it of not carrying out any development. Gandhi alleged that there was "a glaring lack of leadership, direction and plans" to turnaround the "ravaged economy". The Congress said "tyranny, chaos and anarchy" described the first 100 days of Modi government.

column2: OYO enters Mexico after opening LA flagship hotel: Reports
column3: OYO has reportedly launched operations in Mexico with over 10 hotels, as a part of its expansion plans in US. CEO Abhinav Sinha declined to confirm the development. OYO earlier said that it was expanding footprints in US and partnered with hospitality investment and management company Highgate to open its first flagship property OYO Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.

column2: Laundry startup UClean to foray into home services with Chem-Dry
column3: Faridabad-based laundry services startup UClean announced its partnership with US-based Chem-Dry to venture into the home services segment. Founded in 1977, Chem-Dry is a carpet and upholstery cleaning franchise chain. UClean, which was founded in 2016 by IIT alumnus Arunabh Sinha, is planning to open 100 franchisee-run Chem-Dry stores by 2020 across Tier 1 and Tier 2 cities across India.

column2: Don’t fear hefty ‘challans’ if you abide by the law: Gadkari
column3: Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari on Sunday said there should be no fear of hefty 'challans' if one is abiding by the law. Post imposition of the Motor Vehicles (Amendment) Act, 2019 from September 1 the fines for traffic violation have been increased steeply. Gadkari also said the government has completed 70% of work of fixing 786 accidental spots.

column2: Aurobindo Pharma recalls over 2,000 bottles of drug in US
column3: The US arm of Indian pharmaceutical major Aurobindo Pharma has recalled 2,352 bottles of cholesterol-lowering Simvastatin tablets in the country. The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) cited incorrect lot number labelling as the reason. It classified the recall as Class III, which happens in situations where the use of the product is not likely to cause adverse health consequences.

column2: Exact location of Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander on Moon found: ISRO
column3: ISRO Chairman K Sivan has said that the exact location of Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander on the lunar surface has been found. He added that the orbiter clicked a thermal image of the lander through its high-resolution camera. "But there is no communication yet. We are trying to have contact. It will be communicated soon," he further said.

column2: It must have been a hard-landing: ISRO Chairman after lander located
column3: After announcing that ISRO has located Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander on the lunar surface through the orbiter, ISRO Chairman K Sivan said, "It must have been a hard-landing." "We don't know if Vikram module was damaged during the hard-landing on the lunar surface," he added. Vikram lander had lost contact with ground station 2.1 km from Moon's surface on September 7.

column2: What are some of the important cases handled by late lawyer Jethmalani?
column3: Veteran lawyer Ram Jethmalani, who passed away on Sunday, handled many high-profile cases, including defending Indira Gandhi and Rajiv Gandhi's assassins. He had represented Amit Shah in the Sohrabuddin encounter case and contested on behalf of Manu Sharma in the Jessica Lal murder case. Jethmalani also represented Kanimozhi, daughter of former Tamil Nadu CM Karunanidhi, in the 2G scam case.

column2: Karthik apologises to BCCI after being spotted in TKR's dressing room
column3: KKR captain Dinesh Karthik has apologised to BCCI after a picture of him sitting in Shah Rukh Khan-owned Trinbago Knight Riders' dressing room went viral. Karthik, in his response to BCCI's show-cause notice, said he went there on the request of TKR coach Brendon McCullum. He assured BCCI that he won't be seated in TKR's dressing room for remaining matches.

column2: ISRO won't just get us on Moon but to farther galaxies: Sachin
column3: Commending ISRO scientists for their efforts on Chandrayaan-2, ex-India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Salute your efforts, ISRO. Jai Hind!" He added, "Rakesh Sharma, on how India looked from space, said 'Saare Jahan se Achcha, Hindustan Humara'. ISRO won't just get us on the moon but to farther galaxies & we shall say with pride, 'Saare Jahan se Achcha, Hindustan Humara'."

column2: CamScanner app returns to Play Store after being removed over malware
column3: CamScanner, an app used popularly to convert physical documents into PDF files, has returned to Google's Play Store after being removed last month. The app was removed after it was found to have an advertising library containing the malicious Trojan Dropper module. The company removed all the ad SDKs that were not certified by Google Play with the new release.

column2: Manmohan Singh, Ghulam Nabi Azad pay last respects to Ram Jethmalani
column3: Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh and senior Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad on Sunday paid their last respects to veteran lawyer and former Union Minister Ram Jethmalani. Jethmalani passed away at his Delhi residence at the age of 95 earlier today. "In his death India has lost an eminent jurist, an able administrator and a seasoned parliamentarian," said Manmohan Singh.

column2: Head constable deployed at PM Modi's Haryana rally murdered
column3: Pradeep, a head constable in Faridabad police, was found murdered at an apartment on Sunday, police said. He was deputed to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's rally in Haryana's Rohtak. Police said that it appears that Pradeep had a fight with someone on Saturday night who hit him in the head with a glass bottle.

column2: RBI selects vendor for app to help visually impaired identify notes
column3: The Reserve Bank of India has selected Daffodil Software Pvt Ltd to develop a mobile app for the visually impaired to help them identify currency notes. As many as 16 vendors had shown interest in developing the app and five made to "final ranking", said an RBI document. The RBI says an internet connection wouldn't be required for its app.

column2: India knows me at 44, better late than never: Pankaj Tripathi
column3: Talking about his success in the film industry, actor Pankaj Tripathi said that India recognises him only now when he's 44 years old and added, "Better late than never." The actor who hails from a village in Bihar, further said that the challenges were a little more for him but he has no complaints as that happens in every field.

column2: Malinga jumps 20 places in T20I rankings for bowlers
column3: Sri Lanka fast bowler Lasith Malinga jumped 20 places to number 21 position in the latest Men's T20I rankings for bowlers. This comes after his match-winning performance in the third T20I against New Zealand where he became first bowler to take four wickets in four successive deliveries twice in international cricket. Afghanistan spinner Rashid Khan is currently leading the list.

column2: BCCI lifts ban on Rajasthan Cricket Association imposed in 2014
column3: The BCCI on Saturday lifted the Rajasthan Cricket Association's (RCA) suspension which was imposed on it in 2014 after it elected ex-IPL chief Lalit Modi as President. BCCI also approved RCA's new constitution which falls in line with the Lodha recommendations. Jaipur's Sawai Mansingh Stadium wasn't able to host a single international match since October 2013 because of the ban.

column2: Getaround may raise $200 mn at unicorn valuation: Reports
column3: SoftBank-backed car-sharing startup Getaround is reportedly seeking to raise over $200 million at a $1.7-billion valuation which would give the US-based startup a 'unicorn' status. With this funding, Getaround will have raised over $600 million to date, reports said. Founded in 2009 by Sam Zaid, Jessica Scorpio and Elliot Kroo, Getaround earlier acquired car rental startup Drivy for $300 million.

column2: 100 days of Modi govt: Amit Shah enlists 'historical decisions'
column3: On completion of 100 days of PM Narendra Modi-led BJP government, Home Minister Amit Shah said, "Modi government is synonymous with national security, development and welfare of poor." Shah added that decisions like "removal of Article 370 & 35A from J&K or to free Muslim women from the curse of Triple Talaq" are a result of PM Modi's decisive leadership.

column2: 'Tribal area' status for Ladakh being discussed: NCST
column3: The ministeries of home, law and tribal affairs and the National Commission for Scheduled Tribes (NCST) have "broadly" agreed to a proposal to recommend 'tribal area' status for Ladakh, an NCST official said. "A final call will be taken on the matter on September 11," he added. Leaders in Ladakh have reportedly demanded a 'tribal area' status for the region.

column2: Ram temple to be a reality soon: BJP's Sambit Patra
column3: BJP leader Sambit Patra on Saturday said a Ram temple in Ayodhya will soon be a reality as it is one of the core agendas of the party. People earlier claimed Article 370 revocation in J&K would not be a reality but it was "abolished", Patra said. "All the core agendas of BJP will soon be a reality," he added.

column2: Darkest night before dawn: Union Minister on economic slowdown
column3: Union Minister of State for Animal Husbandry Pratap Chandra Sarangi said that there is a "slight slowdown in our economy" and added, "We're living in the darkest night before dawn." "GST, demonetisation, a lot of processes are going on...[S]o much has been done, infrastructure has been readied for rural development," he further said.

column2: Oil firms resume fuel supplies to Air India at six airports
column3: Indian Oil-led public sector oil marketing companies (OMCs) have resumed jet fuel supplies to flag carrier Air India from Saturday, following talks mediated by the government. This comes after the OMCs halted fuel supplies to Air India at six domestic airports on August 22 over unpaid dues. Air India has now agreed on payment terms for future jet fuel purchases.

column2: Bianca beats Serena to become 1st Canadian to win Grand Slam singles title
column3: World number 15 Bianca Andreescu has become the first Canadian to win a Grand Slam singles title. The 19-year-old achieved the feat by defeating 23-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams in the US Open final. Bianca won the match with a scoreline of 6-3, 7-5. She also became the first teenager to win a Grand Slam title in 13 years.

column2: SC lawyer and former Union Minister Ram Jethmalani passes away aged 95
column3: Veteran Supreme Court lawyer and former Union Minister Ram Jethmalani passed away at his residence on Sunday morning in Delhi at the age of 95. He had been on round the clock medical help for last two weeks. Jethmalani had served as the Law Minister and the Minister of Urban Affairs in the Atal Bihari Vajpayee-led NDA government.

column2: 29-yr-old female hiker falls 500ft from cliff in US National Park; dies
column3: An Arizona woman named Danielle Burnett died after falling 500 feet down from Half Dome granite formation in Yosemite National Park. The 29-year-old was dead when emergency officials found her and park officials are investigating the accident. The Half Dome trail traverses 14-16.4 miles and gains 4,800 feet in elevation, and the climb involves use of cables to ascend safely.

column2: I used to get 3/100 in Math in school, I was that good: Virat Kohli
column3: India captain Virat Kohli, in an interview, said he used to get 3/100 marks in Mathematics in school. "I was that good. I didn't understand why someone would even want to learn Math," he added. "I haven't used any of those formulas in my life till now...I used to be like 'What the hell is going on?'" he further said.

column2: Qadir's stats don't do justice to his genius: Pak PM Imran Khan
column3: Condoling the demise of ex-Pakistan spinner Abdul Qadir, Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan tweeted, "Qadir's bowling statistics do not do justice to his genius. Had he been playing cricket now with the modern DRS system...Qadir would've gotten as many wickets as the great Shane Warne." "Qadir was a genius, one of the greatest leg spinners of all time," he added.

column2: Warner gets out for 3rd straight duck, records his first pair in career
column3: Australia opener David Warner got out for his third straight duck in Test cricket after being dismissed LBW on Stuart Broad's bowling in the second innings of the fourth Ashes Test on Saturday. Warner, who was dismissed for a two-ball duck in the first innings, registered his first pair in his Test career. Warner is playing his 78th Test match.

column2: Chandrayaan-2 mission is a huge step forward for India: US
column3: Chandrayaan-2 mission is a "huge step forward for India and will continue to produce valuable data to fuel scientific advancements," Alice G Wells, Acting Assistant Secretary for South and Central Asia tweeted on Sunday. She also congratulated ISRO on their "incredible efforts" on Chandrayaan-2. We have no doubt that India will achieve its space aspirations, the tweet further read.

column2: PM inaugurates India's first greenfield industrial smart city AURIC
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday inaugurated the 10,000-acre Aurangabad Industrial City (AURIC), India's first greenfield industrial smart city. The utilities in the city will be managed by the Command and Control Centre, which is housed in the five-storey administrative building called the Auric Hall. AURIC city is part of the Delhi-Mumbai Industrial Corridor.

column2: Space is hard, ISRO has inspired us: NASA on Chandrayaan-2
column3: Reacting to Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander losing contact with ISRO as it was about to land on the lunar surface, NASA tweeted, "Space is hard. We commend ISRO's attempt to land their Chandrayaan-2 mission on the Moon’s South Pole." It added, "You have inspired us with your journey and look forward to future opportunities to explore our solar system together."

column2: Deeply pained to know about the passing away of Jethmalani: Shah
column3: Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday condoled the demise of veteran SC lawyer and former Union Minister Ram Jethmalani. "Deeply pained to know about the passing away of...Ram Jethmalani ji. In him we have not only lost a distinguished lawyer but also a great human who was full of life," he said.

column2: We've enough bad leaders, make India into 'true Ram Rajya': Murthy
column3: Infosys Co-Founder Narayana Murthy on Saturday claimed there were enough bad leaders in the country and asked youngsters to make India into a "true Ram Rajya". "What's important for you people is to show honesty, discipline, hard work, high aspirations, open-mindedness and then say we will make this country a developed country," Murthy said at the Bangalore Business Literature Festival.

column2: I see Klusener making serious impact in India series: SA coach
column3: Talking about team's newly appointed assistant batting coach for India series Lance Klusener, South Africa's interim team director Enoch Nkwe said, "I see him making a serious impact." He added that the former all-rounder has "plenty of experience" and that he would add a lot of value to the team. Klusener played 171 ODIs for South Africa between 1996-2004.

column2: Qatar strongest team in group, won't be easy to beat: Stimac
column3: Talking ahead of India's World Cup qualifier match against Qatar, Indian football team coach Igor Stimac said, "Playing them will not be easy." The Croatian said team immediately shifted its focus on the match against Qatar after losing 1-2 to Oman, adding Qatar is the strongest team in Group E. "However, it's a great opportunity to learn," he further stated.

column2: Maharashtra Cong alleges scams in Metro Bhavan, PMAY houses
column3: Maharashtra Congress' Sachin Sawant on Friday wrote to the PMO alleging scams in the proposed Metro Bhavan as well as in the construction of 90,000 houses under Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY). Specific contractors have benefitted from the change in terms and conditions of the tenders, the complaint stated. A high-level inquiry is required to uncover the truth, Congress said.

column2: Today is my 'Ghar Wapsi' to Cong after six years: Alka Lamba
column3: Chandni Chowk MLA Alka Lamba rejoined the Congress after six years on Friday, hours after quitting the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), and said, "Today is my 'Ghar Wapsi'." Lamba arrived at Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi's house and took primary membership of the party. She had quit the Congress in 2013 to join the AAP.

column2: Appoint female coaches to prevent molestation cases: Goa NSUI
column3: Goa NSUI on Friday said female coaches and physical education instructors should be appointed in all coaching centres and schools across Goa to prevent molestation cases. "CCTVs in all coaching centres and institutions' playgrounds should be made mandatory," the NSUI added. This comes after a video of swimming coach Surajit Ganguly molesting a 15-year-old swimmer surfaced online.

column2: 2000 Raghuvanshis travel to Ayodhya claiming Lord Ram's lineage
column3: Around 2000 Raghuvanshis from 15 districts of Madhya Pradesh left for Ayodhya on Saturday to render the symbolic message that they're real descendants of Lord Ram. The trip will reportedly witness them bathing in Saryu and offering prayers at Ram Lalla temple. This comes a month after Supreme Court asked whether anyone from Raghuvansha clan was still living in Ayodhya.

column2: 6 drown in Gujarat after immersing Lord Ganesh's idol
column3: Six persons from a Gujarat village drowned in a river while taking a bath after immersing an idol of Lord Ganesh, police said on Saturday. According to the police, the six people drowned apparently after they failed to gauge the depth of water. Their bodies were fished out on Saturday morning by teams of the NDRF and local officials.

column2: Take adequate precautions: Mumbai Police to citizens amid IMD alert
column3: After IMD predicted heavy rains in Mumbai on Saturday, the Mumbai Police advised the citizens to take adequate precautions. "The IMD authorities have indicated intense spells of rain for the next four hours in Mumbai and other coastal districts," the Mumbai Police tweeted. "Considering weather conditions, we request Mumbaikars to take adequate precautions and ensure safety," they added.

column2: When there is space for dialogue, room for conflict disappears: PM
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said that when space is created for a dialogue, the room for conflict disappears. He said this while addressing the latest edition of 'Samvad', a global Hindu-Buddhist initiative for conflict avoidance and environment consciousness. "The spirit of dialogue is not exclusive, it has ample space for other, often differing point of views," he added.

column2: India has lost an exceptional lawyer: PM Modi on Jethmalani's demise
column3: PM Narendra Modi condoled the demise of veteran Supreme Court lawyer and former Union Law Minister Ram Jethmalani saying that "India has lost an exceptional lawyer". "During the dark days of the Emergency, his fortitude and fight for public liberties will be remembered," he tweeted. "He may not be here but his pioneering work will live on," he further added.

column2: Raipur man distributes free cloth bags to discourage plastic use
column3: A man in Chhattisgarh's Raipur is distributing home-made, free of cost cloth bags to discourage the use of plastic. The man, identified as Surendra Bairagi, said he was inspired by PM Narendra Modi's Independence Day speech where he urged people to shun single-use plastic. "The onus now lies with all of us to create awareness...and protect our earth," Bairagi added.

column2: 90-95% of Chandrayaan-2 mission's objectives accomplished: ISRO
column3: ISRO has said that 90-95% of Chandrayaan-2 mission's objectives have been accomplished despite the loss of communication with Vikram lander. The orbiter has already been placed in its intended orbit and "shall enrich our understanding of the Moon's evolution", it added. It further said the orbiter camera will provide high resolution images which will be useful to global scientific community.

column2: 40% of lunar missions in last 60 years have failed: NASA
column3: The success ratio of lunar missions undertaken in the last six decades is around 60%, according to US space agency NASA's 'Moon Fact Sheet'. Of the 109 lunar missions during the period, 61 were successful and 48 failed, it stated. In the early hours of September 7, Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander lost communication with the ground station during its final descent.

column2: He's living dangerously & kicking: Pooja Bhatt denies dad's death rumours
column3: Actress-turned-filmmaker Pooja Bhatt on Friday shared pictures of her father Mahesh Bhatt to deny his death rumours. "Here is ample proof that he is his usual self, living dangerously and kicking! In red shoes no less!," she tweeted. There were rumours that Mahesh Bhatt passed away after suffering a heart attack.

column2: Nadal into his 27th Grand Slam final after 2-hr 35-min US Open semi win
column3: Three-time champion Rafael Nadal has reached his 27th Grand Slam final after defeating first-time major semi-finalist Matteo Berrettini 7-6(5), 6-4, 6-1 in 2 hours and 35 minutes. The 33-year-old will face first-time Grand Slam finalist Daniil Medvedev in the summit clash on Sunday. Nadal has won 18 of the 26 Grand Slam finals he has played.

column2: Warner gives thumbs up to English fan who called him 'f***ing cheat'
column3: A video of Australia opener David Warner's reaction to an England fan calling him 'f***ing cheat' has gone viral. In the video, Warner can be seen going down the stairs with the rest of his teammates when the fan hurled abuse at him. Warner then looked back at him and gave a double thumbs up.

column2: Zomato fires 541 employees across customer support teams
column3: Gurugram-based Zomato on Saturday confirmed it has fired 541 employees, or 10% of its strength, across customer support teams based out of its Gurugram offices. This comes weeks after the foodtech giant fired about 60 employees from its customer support department. The startup had said the firings were carried out due to redundancies in its current customer support workforce.

column2: Maruti, Tata Motors urge parts suppliers to target zero defects
column3: Maruti Suzuki and Tata Motors have urged auto component manufacturers to build capabilities by investing in research and development (R&D) and ensure zero defect products. "Quality deserves much greater attention from the top managements at the suppliers," Maruti Suzuki CEO Kenichi Ayukawa said. Tata Motors CEO Guenter Butschek asked suppliers to take the ongoing crisis as a "fitness project".

column2: Global warming melts Sweden's highest peak to second-highest
column3: A southern peak of Sweden's Kebnekaise mountain lost the title of the country's highest peak due to global warming, scientists have confirmed. At the end of the summer melt on September 3, the northern peak was 1.2 metres higher at 2,096.8 metres than the southern, measurements revealed. The southern peak's height also plummeted to the lowest on record, scientists added.

column2: We are proud of our scientists: Mamata Banerjee on Chandrayaan-2
column3: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has lauded ISRO's efforts, tweeting, "We're proud of our scientists. ISRO worked hard for Chandrayaan-2." She added, "A befitting tribute to our founding fathers who envisioned India’s place in the league of scientifically advanced nations far ahead of their times." Earlier, she criticised BJP for using Chandrayaan-2 to divert public attention from economic crisis.

column2: World would reckon ISRO's technological advancement: Mauritius PM
column3: Mauritius' Prime Minister Pravind Jugnauth congratulated India and the ISRO team for their attempt to land Chandrayaan 2's Vikram lander. "Although it was not a successful landing this time, the world would (reckon) the major technological advancement of the Indian (Space) Programme. We look forward to collaborative efforts between Mauritius and the ISRO team in the future," he said.

column2: Will try to establish link with Vikram lander over next 14 days: ISRO chief
column3: ISRO Chairman K Sivan has said the Chandrayaan-2 team will try to establish link with Vikram lander over the next 14 days. He added the orbiter's life, which was earlier planned to be of one year, is now estimated at 7.5 years because of extra fuel. Vikram lander lost contact with ground station as it was about to touch down.

column2: Indians clean mess made by Pakistanis outside Indian embassy in London
column3: The Indian community on Saturday joined a campaign to clean the mess created by Pakistani protesters outside the Indian High Commission in London earlier this week. Pakistani protesters had damaged the Indian High Commission over Article 370's revocation in J&K. India's High Commissioner to the UK, Ruchi Ghanashyam, led the drive, and staff of the High Commission also joined it.

column2: Pak must recognise futility of such acts: India as airspace denied to Prez
column3: Responding to Pakistan's decision to deny President Ram Nath Kovind permission to use its airspace, India said, "We call upon Pakistan to recognise the futility of such unilateral actions." "We regret the decision of the Government of Pakistan to deny overflight clearance for the VVIP special flight which is otherwise granted routinely by any normal country," India added.

column2: Iranian tanker seen off Syrian port after release, pic suggests
column3: Iranian oil tanker Adrian Darya-1 has been photographed by a satellite off the Syrian port of Tartus despite an assurance by Iran that the vessel would not transport oil to Syria. The tanker, which was seized by Gibraltar over suspicions of carrying oil to Syria in breach of EU sanctions, was freed after receiving formal written assurances from Iran.

column2: Russia frees 24 Ukrainian sailors in exchange of prisoners
column3: Russia on Saturday released 24 Ukrainian sailors who were detained for allegedly violating Russia's maritime border in a naval standoff between the two countries in the Black Sea last year. They were released in an exchange of prisoners between Russia and Ukraine, with both releasing 35 prisoners each. A Russian journalist accused of spying by Ukraine was among those freed.

column2: Late ex-Zimbabwe President Mugabe betrayed his people's hopes: US
column3: The US has said that former Zimbabwe President Robert Mugabe, who passed away on Friday, "betrayed his people's hopes". "Mugabe helped liberate Zimbabwe but his human rights abuses and gross economic mismanagement impoverished millions," US State Department spokesperson Morgan Ortagus said. Mugabe ruled Zimbabwe for 37 years until he was ousted in a military coup in 2017.

column2: Putin warned Bush of attack 2 days before 9/11: Ex-CIA analyst
column3: Russian President Vladimir Putin had warned his then-American counterpart George W Bush of an impending terrorist attack two days before the 9/11 attacks in 2001, former CIA analyst George Beebe has said in his book. Putin told Bush that it was "something long in preparation" coming out of Afghanistan, Beebe wrote. Around 3,000 people were killed in the 9/11 attacks.

column2: Wakhare's 5-for helps India Red clinch Duleep Trophy title
column3: India Red spinner Akshay Wakhare took five wickets in 28 balls as his team beat India Green by an innings and 38 runs to clinch the Duleep Trophy title. Bengal batsman Abhimanyu Easwaran's 153 helped India Red take a 157-run lead in the first innings. India Green were bowled out for 119 runs in 39.5 overs in the second innings.

column2: Malinga's brilliance outperformed us: Southee on double hat-trick
column3: After Sri Lanka captain Lasith Malinga took four wickets in four balls and helped his team defend their total of 125, New Zealand captain Tim Southee said, "We were outdone by a piece of brilliance from Malinga." Praising Malinga, who registered bowling figures of 4-1-6-5 in the T20I, Southee added, "He has been a world-class bowler for a long time."

column2: Harry Kane one of the best finishers I've played with: Rashford
column3: Ahead of England's Euro 2020 qualifier match against Bulgaria, forward Marcus Rashford praised England captain Harry Kane, saying, "He's one of the best finishers that I've played with." The 21-year-old Manchester United player added, "Even though we're fighting for the same position...we really do drive each other on." With two wins in two matches, England are Group A table-toppers.

column2: Australia should go for the kill now in 4th Ashes Test: Ponting
column3: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting has said that Australia have to go "all guns blazing" and just "go in for the kill now" to win the fourth Ashes Test in Manchester. He added that Australia have bounced back well after letting the opportunity of winning the third Test slip. "Opportunities like this don't come around always," he further stated.

column2: We have begun a mission which directly affects all women: PM
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said the government has begun a new mission which will directly affect all the women in the country. He was addressing a meeting of women from self-help groups in Maharashtra's Aurangabad. "I bow to every woman who through self-help groups is contributing to the process of building a stronger and new India," he added.

column2: T'gana govt should declare health emergency: BJP on dengue outbreak
column3: Telangana BJP President K Laxman on Saturday expressed concern over the outbreak of dengue and malaria and said the state government should declare a health emergency. "There is no proper nursing staff, equipment and even doctors," he claimed. As of September 5, the state has recorded 2,786 cases of dengue and 1,156 cases of malaria this year, a report stated.

column2: Pakistan denies President Kovind permission to enter its airspace
column3: Pakistan has rejected a request made by Indian authorities to let President Ram Nath Kovind fly over Pakistani airspace for a visit to Iceland. Prime Minister Imran Khan approved the decision to reject the request, Pakistan Foreign Minister Shah Mahmood Qureshi said. He added that India's move to revoke Article 370 was responsible for the Pakistani decision.

column2: Journalist apologises for shouting at ISRO scientist
column3: Journalist Pallava Bagla apologised for shouting at ISRO scientist D P Karnik while he was interacting with the media after Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander lost contact with the ground station. "Why has the Chairman not come? Normally when something goes wrong, the Chairman comes," Bagla had asked Karnik. "Sorry, guys, my behaviour didn't conform with my standards...Pardon me ISRO," Bagla tweeted.

column2: Rapper A$AP Rocky's lawyer shot multiple times after assault case
column3: Henrik Olsson Lilja, a Swedish lawyer who represented US rapper A$AP Rocky in an assault case, was shot multiples times in Stockholm. Lilja had initially represented Rocky after he was arrested in Stockholm in June for alleged assault before a concert. It is not known if the shooting had any relation to Rocky's case.

column2: Article 370 wasn't about special status but special discrimination: Doval
column3: National Security Advisor (NSA) Ajit Doval on Saturday said that Article 370 was not about any special status but was a special discrimination against the people of Jammu and Kashmir. "Significant laws such as Right to Education and Right to Property were denied to them," he added. "Pakistan used Article 370 to catalyse terrorism to Kashmir," he further said.

column2: Apple made Siri deflect questions on feminism, #MeToo: The Guardian
column3: An internal Apple project advised developers to rewrite Siri's responses to deflect questions on feminism and the #MeToo movement, leaked documents seen by The Guardian revealed. "Siri should be guarded when dealing with potentially controversial content," Apple stated as the reason behind the move. "I'd blush if I could," Siri earlier allegedly responded to being told it was a "sl*t".

column2: Karthik spotted in SRK-owned TKR's dressing room, BCCI serves notice
column3: The BCCI has issued a show-cause notice to Dinesh Karthik after he was spotted in the dressing room of Shah Rukh Khan-owned Trinbago Knight Riders during their opening CPL match. A BCCI official said that BCCI CEO Rahul Johri has asked Karthik to explain why his central contract shouldn't be annulled. Karthik reportedly didn't seek prior permission from the BCCI.

column2: There is nothing like failure in science: Kohli hails ISRO's scientists
column3: After Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander lost contact with ground station during its final descent to land on Moon, Team India captain Virat Kohli tweeted, "There's nothing like failure in science, we experiment & we gain." "Massive respect for the scientists at #ISRO who worked relentlessly over days & nights. The nation is proud of you, Jai Hind!" he further said.

column2: Delhi airport starts 3-month trial of face recognition entry system
column3: Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport on Friday started a three-month trial of facial recognition entry system for domestic passengers of Vistara airline at Terminal 3. A Delhi International Airport Limited (DIAL) spokesperson said that the participation in the trials is purely voluntary. "A suitable consent form will be signed by passengers," the spokesperson added.

column2: Flipkart's PhonePe gets $7 billion valuation by Morgan Stanley
column3: Flipkart's payments service provider PhonePe is being valued at about $7 billion, as per American multinational investment bank and financial services firm Morgan Stanley. PhonePe could be worth as much as $20 billion in the bull case, the financial services giant added. PhonePe was reportedly valued at about $1.5 billion after the $16 billion Walmart-Flipkart acquisition deal.

column2: 3 held for allegedly spreading fake news of new churches in Tirumala
column3: Andhra Pradesh Police have arrested three people, for allegedly posting a misleading photo of a 'cross' and spreading misinformation that church-like structures were coming up in the Hindu temple town of Tirumala. The photo was posted online with the caption 'Churches coming up on the seven hills'. Police said it was taken from an angle, which could easily mislead viewers.

column2: 'Can't you stop apple trucks in J&K?' NSA reveals intercepted Pak messages
column3: Stating there are Pakistani communication towers 20km along border, NSA Ajit Doval revealed, "They're trying [to] send messages, we heard intercepts, they were telling their men [in j&K] 'how so many apple trucks are moving, can't you stop them? Should we send you bangles?'" He further said out of 199 police station areas in J&K, only 10 have prohibitory orders.

column2: Every Indian can feel the heartbeat of Chandrayaan-2: Mahindra
column3: After ISRO lost communication with Vikram lander on Saturday, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "The communication isn't lost. Every single person in India can feel the heartbeat of Chandrayaan-2." Communication was lost just as it was about to touch down. "We can hear it whisper to us that 'If at first you don't succeed, try, try again'," he added.

column2: 100 Taliban militants killed as Afghan forces recapture district
column3: Afghanistan forces have recaptured Wardoj district in Badakhshan province, killing at least 100 Taliban militants including many foreign fighters. The Ministry of Defence said in a statement that the security forces launched a major offensive to recapture the district. The Ministry added that the security forces did not suffer casualties during the operation.

column2: Canara Bank invites bids to sell its 30% stake in Can Fin Homes
column3: Canara Bank has invited bids to divest its entire 30% stake in its housing finance arm Can Fin Homes. The state-owned lender called off a similar move last year after receiving a lower than expected price quotation. This comes a week after Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman proposed the merger of the Bengaluru-headquartered bank with Syndicate Bank.

column2: I've other things I want to do now: Brad Pitt on retirement
column3: On being asked if he has thought about retiring from acting, Brad Pitt said that he'll do fewer movies because he has "other things he wants to do now." "When you feel like you've finally got your arms around something, then it's time to go get your arms around something else," he further added.

column2: Chance the Rapper, wife Kirsten blessed with baby girl
column3: American singer Chance the Rapper and wife Kirsten Bennett have been blessed with a baby girl. Kirsten on Friday shared the first glimpse of their newborn on Instagram and wrote, "Our sweet baby girl, Marli, is here." Chance and Kirsten got married in March 2019 and Marli is their second child. Their first child, Kensli, was born in 2015.

column2: Priyanka Gandhi criticises govt over '100 days celebration'
column3: Congress' Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Saturday criticised the government over its plans to celebrate 100 days in office amid the current economic slowdown. "Government is going to celebrate...But the auto, transport...mining sector will look at it as a celebration of their ruin," she tweeted. News of closing down of plants and job losses are coming from every sector, Priyanka added.

column2: 1 dead, 2 injured due to heavy rains in Pithoragarh, Chamoli
column3: At least one person died and 2 were injured due to heavy overnight rainfall in Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh and Chamoli on Saturday. At least three people got trapped under debris of their house damaged by the rainfall, as per Pithoragarh's DM. "The rescue teams...rescued two women and recovered the body of the man who was already dead," he added.

column2: PM Modi inspires faith, hope, optimism: Ravi Shankar Prasad
column3: Union Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad on Saturday called PM Narendra Modi "a leader who inspires faith, hope and optimism" after he was seen hugging ISRO Chief K Sivan. "PM gives an emotional hug to ISRO (Chief)...and reaffirms his faith in scientists and engineers of ISRO and Chandrayaan-2 team," Prasad tweeted along with a video. "Proud of our PM," he added.

column2: Avoid water pollution during immersion of Ganesh idols: PM
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday urged people to work towards preventing water pollution during Ganesh visarjan by ensuring that plastic and other waste do not go into the sea. "We need to protect the environment and do away with single-use plastic," he said while addressing a gathering in Maharashtra. The PM is on a one-day tour of the state.

column2: Typhoon disrupts power to 57,000 S Korean homes; turns toward N Korea
column3: A typhoon hit South Korea on Saturday, killing at least one person and disrupting power to 57,000 households before turning toward North Korea. Typhoon Lingling struck the island of Jeju and southern port cities overnight, damaging buildings as it moved north at 49 kmph. A total of 124 flights were cancelled, the Ministry of Interior and Safety said.

column2: Media attention to person who's lying had hurt me: Hrithik on Kangana
column3: Talking about his fall out with Kangana Ranaut over the last few years, Hrithik Roshan said, "What hurt me was that media gave attention to the audacity with which that certain person was indulging in lying and deceit." Kangana had claimed that the two of them were in a relationship during the shoot of 'Krrish 3', which Hrithik had denied.

column2: 230 Pak terrorists spotted; some infiltrated J&K, some held: NSA
column3: National Security Advisor Ajit Doval on Saturday said, "Pakistan is trying to create trouble. 230 Pakistani terrorists were spotted, some of them have infiltrated [Jammu and Kashmir], some have been arrested." "We are determined to protect life of Kashmiris from Pakistani terrorists even if we have to impose restrictions," Doval added.

column2: Convinced that majority Kashmiris support revoking Article 370: NSA
column3: Speaking about the situation in Jammu and Kashmir, National Security Advisor Ajit Doval said, "I'm totally convinced that majority of Kashmiris support the abrogation of Article 370." "They see greater opportunities...and employment opportunities. Only a few miscreants are opposing it," he added. He also asserted that the government is determined to protect lives of Kashmiris from terrorists.

column2: Indian viewers spend 70 mins a day on video platforms: Eros Now-KPMG
column3: An Eros Now-KPMG report revealed that an over-the-top (OTT) viewer in India spends approximately 70 minutes a day on video streaming platforms. The same is being done at a consumption frequency of 12.5 times a week. Viewers are accessing over 2.5 platforms at a given time, with movies as preferred choice on smart TV and larger screens, the report said.

column2: Bug found on Samsung, Huawei phones lets emails be 'stolen' via SMS
column3: Cybersecurity researchers discovered a vulnerability in Samsung, Huawei, Sony and LG devices that could let hackers use custom SMS to intercept all email traffic on target devices. The attacks require different methods depending on the phone and available information, Check Point researchers said. They claimed that among the four manufacturers, devices from Samsung were the easiest to be attacked.

column2: Social commerce startup WMall raising $5-7 mn round: Report
column3: Bengaluru-based social commerce startup WMall is raising a fresh funding round of around $5-7 million, Entrackr reported citing its sources. Sources claimed that the funding round is being led by Chiratae with participation from existing investors SAIF Partners and Venture Highway on a pro-rata basis. Founded in 2018, WMall sells products through a combination of video and text.

column2: PM Modi, ISRO will make it happen one day: Bhutan PM on Moon landing
column3: After Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander lost contact with ISRO's ground station, Bhutanese PM Lotay Tshering said, "We are proud of India and its scientists today." "Chandrayaan-2 saw some challenges last minute but the courage and hard work you have shown are historical...I have no doubt PM Narendra Modi and his ISRO team will make it happen one day," he added.

column2: No communication with Vikram lander; as good as lost: ISRO official
column3: Hours after India's second Moon mission Chandrayaan-2's Vikram Lander lost contact with ground stations, an ISRO official told PTI, "There is no communication with the lander. It's as good as lost." "There is no hope. Very, very difficult to re-establish contact," the official added. Communication with the lander was lost when it was 2.1 km away from the Moon's surface.

column2: PM inaugurates 1st metro coach built under 'Make in India' in Mumbai
column3: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday inaugurated the first coach for Mumbai Metro which has been manufactured under the 'Make in India' programme. He also laid foundation stone for three metro lines in the city. PM Modi was accompanied by Governor of Maharashtra BS Koshyari, CM Devendra Fadnavis and other leaders at the inauguration.

column2: West Bengal Assembly passes resolution against NRC implementation
column3: The West Bengal Legislative Assembly on Friday passed a resolution against implementation of National Register of Citizens (NRC) in the state. "The implementation of the NRC is nothing but a political vendetta of the BJP-led central government," CM Mamata Banerjee said. She further claimed that NRC is nothing but an attempt to divert people's attention from the ongoing economic crisis.

column2: ISRO lost link with lander, not hopes of 1.3bn Indians: Vice Prez
column3: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Saturday said, "There is nothing to despair. ISRO only lost communication with the lander (Vikram) and not the hopes of 1.3 billion Indians." "I salute ISRO scientists, engineers & everyone else associated with Chandrayaan-2 for their hard work & dedication in trying to conquer new frontiers in space exploration," he tweeted.

column2: Why not PM: PM Modi as student asks for tips to become President
column3: When a student present at the ISRO Centre in Bengaluru asked PM Narendra Modi to give him tips to become the President of India, PM Modi replied, "Why President? Why not Prime Minister?" The student was one among the 60 students selected through ISRO's 'Space Quiz' competition to watch the landing of Vikram Lander along with the PM.

column2: 2-yr-old injured in firing by terrorists to be shifted to AIIMS in Delhi
column3: The two-year-old girl, who was injured in firing by terrorists on civilians in Jammu and Kashmir's Sopore, is said to be in critical condition. NSA Ajit Doval has asked the authorities to bring her to All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in Delhi. Other than her, three more people were injured in the terrorist attack.

column2: Iran begins using new advanced centrifuges to enrich uranium
column3: Iran nuclear agency spokesman Behrouz Kamalvandi has said the country has begun using new advanced centrifuges to enrich uranium - the latest step in reducing its commitments under the 2015 nuclear deal with world powers. Kamalvandi added that 40 such centrifuges are now operational. "All these steps are reversible if the other side fulfils its promises," Kamalvandi further said.

column2: Cruise ships can provide shelter to Hurricane Dorian victims: Trump
column3: US President Donald Trump on Friday suggested that cruise ships can provide shelter to Bahamians left homeless by Hurricane Dorian. "Any cruise ship companies willing to act as stationary housing, etc., I am sure would be appreciated!" he tweeted. The death toll from Hurricane Dorian in the Bahamas has risen to 43, according to media reports.

column2: 7 nations sign Amazon rainforest preservation pact amid fires
column3: Seven South American countries have signed a pact to protect the Amazon amid global concerns over massive fires in the rainforest. Bolivia, Brazil, Colombia, Ecuador, Guyana, Peru and Suriname signed the pact, to set up a disaster response network and satellite monitoring, at a summit. More than 80,000 fires have broken out in the Amazon rainforest this year.

column2: Man tells UK PM 'please leave my town'; video goes viral
column3: During a recent visit to the town of Morley in England, a man told UK PM Boris Johnson, "Please leave my town." A video of the interaction between the man and Johnson went viral on social media, wherein Johnson could be heard telling the man in response, "I will very soon." Several people confronted Johnson over his efforts on Brexit.

column2: Every film made in Afghanistan is a triumph: Angelina Jolie
column3: Actress Angelina Jolie has come out in support of Afghan movie 'Hava, Maryam, Ayesha' saying that every film made in Afghanistan is a triumph against odds. "When the future of Afghanistan is hanging in the balance...it reminds us of all that is at stake for millions of Afghan women," Jolie said. The film premiered at Venice Film Festival on Friday.

column2: Tony Stark would hack them: Fan after Downey Jr's Instagram hacked
column3: After actor Robert Downey Jr's Instagram was hacked, a fan jokingly commented, "Tony Stark would hack them back." In Marvel Cinematic Universe, Downey Jr plays the character of Tony Stark aka Iron Man. Downey Jr had tweeted, "I'm sorry to say my Instagram has been compromised. Please steer clear for the time being until it's sorted...[I] love you 3000."

column2: Uttarakhand government to use bamboo to repair 5,000 schools
column3: Uttarakhand government will repair over 5,000 schools in dilapidated condition by using bamboo in order to make the buildings earthquake resistant. "Uttarakhand Bamboo and Fiber Development Board has been roped in. The methods used to renovate...will be time-bound and cost-effective," said an official. Reportedly, 100 schools falling under highly vulnerable category will be repaired by April 2020.

column2: No failure in science, only experiments & efforts: PM Modi at ISRO
column3: While addressing ISRO scientists after Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander lost contact with the ground station, PM Narendra Modi said, "There is no failure in science. There are only experiments and efforts." "I am not here to preach you, I have come here to seek inspiration from all of you," he added. He further said, "We will scale newer heights of success."

column2: Communication with Vikram lander lost at 2.1km from lunar surface: ISRO
column3: ISRO Chief K Sivan has said that the descent of Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander was normal and as planned till an altitude of 2.1 km from the lunar surface after which communication between lander and ground station was lost. He added that the data is being analysed. The spacecraft was scheduled to land on the lunar surface at 1.53 AM.

column2: These are moments to be courageous: PM as Vikram lander loses contact
column3: After Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander lost contact with ground station, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "These are moments to be courageous, and courageous we will be!" "Ups and downs are a part of life...India is proud of you," he told the scientists at ISRO. "You all have done a big service to nation, science and mankind. I'm with you always," he added.

column2: PM Modi hugs ISRO Chief K Sivan as he breaks down
column3: After addressing ISRO scientists in Bengaluru, Prime Minister Narendra Modi hugged ISRO Chief K Sivan as he broke down. Sivan had made the official announcement after Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander lost contact with the ground station moments before touchdown. During his address, Prime Minister Modi said, "I can proudly say that the effort was worth it & so was the journey."

column2: Aap log makkhan nahi, pathar pe lakir karne wale log hain: PM to ISRO
column3: Commending ISRO scientists for their efforts on Chandrayaan-2, PM Narendra Modi said, "Aap log makkhan pe lakir karne wale nahi, pathar pe lakir karne wale log hain." "Friends, I could feel what you were going through...You live for India's honour, I salute you," he added. Communication with Vikram lander was lost at 2.1 km from lunar surface.

column2: Chandrayaan-2 orbiter intact and safe in lunar orbit: ISRO official
column3: The Chandrayaan-2 orbiter is intact, functioning normally and safely in the Lunar orbit, an ISRO official said after the communication with Vikram lander was lost 2.1 km from the lunar surface. The orbiter has the mission life of one year and its payloads will conduct remote-sensing observations from a 100 km orbit.

column2: Nicotex seeks to inspire smokers to quit with #WeBelieveYouCan
column3: Smoking is a tough habit to beat, often riddled with pitfalls, says Nicotex. In order to help smokers kick this habit, Nicotex has launched a new campaign #WeBelieveYouCan which seeks to offer unconditional support and unwavering belief. It enables smokers to create personalised quit plans, schedule counselling sessions and get other information using a chatbot on nicotex.in.

column2: Medvedev beats Dimitrov in US Open semi, reaches his 1st Grand Slam final
column3: World number five Daniil Medvedev defeated world number 78 Grigor Dimitrov 7-6(5), 6-4, 6-3 in two hours and 38 minutes in the US Open semi-final to reach his first Grand Slam final. Medvedev will face either 18-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal or 23-year-old Matteo Berrettini in the final. Medvedev has won 20 of his last 22 matches.

column2: Google bans ads for unproven, experimental medical treatments
column3: Google on Friday announced a new 'Healthcare and medicines' policy to prohibit ads for unproven or experimental medical techniques. This includes treatments that lack biomedical or scientific bases, including most stem cell therapies and gene therapy, Google said. The changes were reportedly made in response to heavy criticism against online marketing by stem cell clinics over unapproved treatments.

column2: CARS24 raises $52 million in ongoing Series D round
column3: Gurugram-based used car buying startup CARS24 has raised $52 million, likely in its ongoing Series D funding round, Entrackr reported citing regulatory filings. Entrackr's sources said that the ongoing round is likely to be closed between $90-100 million. Founded in 2015, CARS24 had closed its $50-million Series C funding round led by Sequoia Capital in October last year.

column2: We aren't sure: ISRO scientist on being asked if Vikram lander has crashed
column3: On being asked if Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander has crashed, ISRO scientist Deviprasad Karnik said, "We don't have any result yet. It takes time. We aren't sure." ISRO Chief K Sivan earlier said the descent of lander was normal and as planned till an altitude of 2.1 km from the Moon after which communication between lander and ground station was lost.

column2: There will be a new dawn, a brighter tomorrow: PM to ISRO scientists
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday told ISRO scientists, "There will be a new dawn and a brighter tomorrow very soon." PM Modi, addressing the scientists over Chandrayaan-2's Vikram Lander losing contact with the ground stations, said, "There is no failure in science, only experiment and efforts." "Everyone stands in solidarity with our scientists," he further added.

column2: Lander hasn't crashed; it's in contact with orbiter: Ex-ISRO scientist
column3: Former ISRO scientist D Sasikumar has said that the communication loss with Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander may not have been due to crash landing. "In my opinion, it is not a crash landing because the communication channel is on between the lander and the orbiter," he added. The communication data which is missing is being analysed now, he further said.

column2: Poets will say Chandrayaan-2 rushed to hug Moon: PM Modi
column3: Addressing ISRO scientists after the Vikram Lander lost contact with ground stations, PM Narendra Modi on Saturday said poets will say Chandrayaan-2 rushed to hug Moon. Historians and poets will say that we've described Moon so romantically in life that Chandrayaan-2 adopted this in its nature, he added. Vikram Lander lost contact with ground stations 2.1 km from Moon's surface.

column2: PM reaches Bengaluru to watch Chandrayaan-2's landing from ISRO centre
column3: PM Narendra Modi has arrived in Bengaluru to witness the landing of Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander on the lunar surface from the ISRO centre. PM Modi will also be interacting with around 60 winners of the Space Quiz conducted for students of Class 8 to 10 across India during the event. The spacecraft is expected to land at around 1.55 AM.

column2: With Chandrayaan-2, ISRO showed exemplary commitment: Prez Kovind
column3: Commending ISRO scientists, President Ram Nath Kovind on Saturday tweeted, "With Chandrayaan-2 Mission, the entire team of ISRO has shown exemplary commitment and courage. The country is proud of ISRO. We all hope for the best." Communication with Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander was lost at an altitude of 2.1 km from the lunar surface, ISRO said.

column2: Not running for Prez and helping re-elect Trump: Ex-Starbucks CEO
column3: Former Starbucks CEO Howard Schultz has abandoned plans for an independent presidential run, saying he didn't want to split the electorate and help re-elect US President Donald Trump in 2020. Schultz also said it was tougher than expected to grab moderate voters' attention. Democrats had worried that an independent candidate could divide the anti-Trump vote in the November 2020 election.

column2: Current situation not final destination: SRK on Chandrayaan-2
column3: After Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander lost contact with the ground station, actor Shah Rukh Khan tweeted, "Sometimes we don't land or arrive at the destination we want to...[O]ur current situation is never and not our final destination." Amitabh Bachchan wrote, "Pride never did face defeat...our pride, our victory...Proud of you ISRO." "You are our hero ISRO," Taapsee Pannu tweeted.

column2: Took me 30 years from Sallu and Salle to Bhai and Bhaijaan: Salman
column3: Actor Salman Khan at NEXA IIFA Awards 2019 press conference said, "It's taken me about 30 years. From Sallu and Salle to Bhai and Bhaijaan...a long time to achieve that." He added that he is going to work so hard that his fans would always get to see him on-screen, on TV and in real life.

column2: Sedition case against me politically motivated: J&K activist
column3: Kashmiri activist Shehla Rashid described the sedition case filed against her as "frivolous, politically motivated and pathetic attempt" to silence her. The Delhi Police on Friday booked Rashid on sedition charges and for promoting enmity by allegedly spreading fake news about the situation in Jammu & Kashmir after Article 370 revocation.

column2: We're with you ISRO: Sitharaman after Vikram lander loses contact
column3: After Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander lost contact with the ground station, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman took to Twitter and wrote, "We are with you ISRO. You have brought the nation, its young minds and all, together in sensing your achievements in Space. You will succeed." Vikram lander was 2.1 km away from lunar surface before losing contact.

column2: Your work is not in vain: Rahul Gandhi to ISRO
column3: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi congratulated ISRO for their "incredible work on the Chandrayaan 2 Moon Mission." He said, "Your work is not in vain. It has laid the foundation for many more path breaking...Indian space missions." This comes after Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander lost its contact with the ground station when it was 2.1 km away from landing on Moon.

column2: Ganesha idol placed in Chandrayaan-2 replica in Hyderabad
column3: A five-foot-tall Lord Ganesha idol has been placed inside a 23.5-foot replica of Chandrayaan-2 in a residential society in Hyderabad to mark Ganesh Chaturthi. A resident said the spacecraft replica weighs about 650 kg and is made of iron. Residents have made arrangements for the live telecast of soft-landing of Vikram lander of Chandrayaan-2 on the Moon.

column2: India stands with our hard working scientists at ISRO: Shah
column3: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that the nation "stands with our committed and hard working scientists at ISRO." Shah added, "ISRO's achievement with getting Chandrayaan-2 so far has made every Indian proud. My best wishes for future endeavours." Communication from Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander to the ground stations was lost at an altitude of 2.1 km, ISRO had confirmed earlier.

column2: Female fan came to my house, said we've been chatting for months: Vicky
column3: On being asked about his craziest fan encounter, actor Vicky Kaushal revealed that a woman once came to his residence in Mumbai and talked with his parents, insisting that she had been chatting with him on Facebook for months. "She found it very difficult to believe that it wasn't me who was talking to her," Kaushal said.

column2: Had no clue I became charsi of the country: Vicky on Johar's party
column3: Talking about being accused of taking drugs at Karan Johar's house party, Vicky Kaushal said he was in Arunachal Pradesh with no network when the controversy on the video took place. "Obviously I [didn't] know. I [had] no clue that I've become the 'charsi of the country'!" he added. He said reading about the allegations started affecting him.

column2: Former Pakistan spinner Abdul Qadir passes away at the age of 63
