column3: Former Pakistan leg-spinner Abdul Qadir died at the age of 63 after suffering a cardiac arrest in Lahore on Friday. Qadir played for Pakistan in 67 Tests and 104 ODIs between 1977 and 1993. Qadir also represented Pakistan in two World Cups (1983 and 1987) and after retirement, he also served as chief selector and also as a commentator.

column2: Malinga takes double hat-trick, 1st bowler with 5 int'l hat-tricks
column3: Sri Lanka fast bowler Lasith Malinga has become the first bowler to take four wickets in four successive deliveries twice in international cricket. The 36-year-old took his second double hat-trick by dismissing New Zealand's Colin Munro, Hamish Rutherford, Colin de Grandhomme and Ross Taylor in the third T20I. He also became the first bowler to take five international hat-tricks.

column2: Brazil's 49-yr-old legend Cafu's son dies at 30 while playing football
column3: Danilo Feliciano de Moraes, the 30-year-old son of World Cup-winning ex-Brazil captain Cafu, passed away after suffering a heart attack while playing football with friends in São Paulo. "Our Cafu has lost his son...Danilo. It's with a sad heart that we offer our deepest condolences to his family at this saddest of times," Cafu's former club AC Milan tweeted.

column2: Paytm to start planning for IPO in 22-24 months, says CEO
column3: Paytm will start preparations for an IPO in the next 22-24 months, CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma has said. The payments giant last raised $300 million from Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway in 2018 while Sharma recently revealed that the company's valuation increased to $15 billion. He said he wants Paytm to generate more free cash flow before entering the public market.

column2: Sonia Dhawan, accused in Paytm CEO extortion case, rejoins company
column3: Paytm's former Vice President of Communications Sonia Dhawan, accused of blackmailing and making extortion bid on CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma, has rejoined the company. She has joined Paytm's gaming platform First Games as the Vice-President of Corporate Communications. Dhawan was granted bail in March this year after spending nearly five months in jail.

column2: Chandrayaan-2 rover moves at a speed of 1 cm/s, has 14-day life
column3: Chandrayaan-2's Pragyan rover will be deployed a few hours after the Vikram lander lands on the Moon and will conduct missions for 14 days. The six-wheeled rover can travel up to 500 metres from the landing site at a speed of 1 centimetre/second. Government entities located in Bengaluru will receive information from 13 payloads aboard Chandrayaan-2’s orbiter, lander and rover.

column2: Ronaldinho Brazil's new tourism ambassador, despite seized passport
column3: Former Brazilian footballer Ronaldinho has been named as a tourism ambassador for the nation, despite being a citizen who had his passport seized by the authorities due to an unpaid environmental fine and other debts. Ronaldinho and his brother were fined £6.9 million after getting convicted of illegally building a fishing trap in a permanent preservation area in 2015.

column2: You had a rocket, a goal scorer and me: Benzema on Bale, Ronaldo
column3: Speaking about his partnership with Gareth Bale and Cristiano Ronaldo at Real Madrid, Karim Benzema said, "You had a rocket (Gareth) and a goal scorer (Ronaldo), and then there was me, the piece that made it all work." "I played a different role. For me, he [Ronaldo] was the best goalscorer even if he played on the left," Benzema added.

column2: Chhetri cannot score every time: Indian team coach Stimac
column3: Following India's loss to Oman in their Asian 2022 World Cup qualifying tie, Indian football team coach Igor Stimac spoke about over-reliance on captain Sunil Chhetri. Stimac said, "You see all of our goals come from Sunil but he cannot score every time." "[W]e could have killed the game before the break, but we were not lucky there," Stimac added.

column2: Mohammad Nabi set to retire from Tests after B'desh Test
column3: Afghanistan allrounder Mohammad Nabi has announced that he will retire from Test cricket after the conclusion of the ongoing one-off Afghanistan-Bangladesh Test. The 34-year-old will still remain active in limited-overs cricket. The Afghanistan team will next face the Windies in the one-off Test scheduled to begin from November 27 in Dehradun.

column2: USA Powerlifting bans transgender women from competing as women
column3: USA Powerlifting has banned all transgender women from competing as women. The organisation claims that transgender male to female individuals having gone through male puberty have an unfair competitive advantage over non-transgender females due to increased bone density and muscle mass from pubertal exposure to testosterone.

column2: Rare two-headed snake found in US, nicknamed 'Double Dave'
column3: Scientists have named a rare two-headed rattlesnake 'Double Dave' after finding it in a forest in the US state of New Jersey. The name 'Double Dave' was coined because it was discovered by the environmentalist Dave Schneider and his colleague, also named Dave. Researchers claim that the snake's two heads work independently of each other.

column2: Sex ratio at birth went from 918 to 931 in five years: Irani
column3: Union Minister for Women and Child Development Smriti Irani on Friday said the Sex Ratio at Birth (SRB) has improved by 13 points from 918 to 931 in the past five years. Irani attributed the success to the Centre's 'Beti Bachao, Beti Padhao' campaign. Uttar Pradesh, Haryana, Uttarakhand, Delhi and Rajasthan reportedly performed well in improving the SRB.

column2: Man allegedly commits suicide in police custody in Kupwara
column3: A villager arrested in timber theft case allegedly committed suicide inside police lockup in Kashmir's Kupwara, police said. "Since the death took place in police custody, a magisterial inquiry under section 176 of the Criminal Procedure Code has been initiated," an official said. He had hanged himself and was found dead in the toilet attached to the lockup, official added.

column2: 293 suspects arrested so far in Sri Lanka Easter blasts case
column3: Sri Lankan police on Thursday said at least 293 people have been arrested so far in connection with Easter Sunday bombings that killed over 250 people on April 21. Police spokesperson said 115 suspects were in remand custody and 178 others were in detention. The attacks were claimed by Islamic State but authorities blamed local extremist group National Thowheed Jama'ath.

column2: China supports HK govt in bid to end protests: Premier Li
column3: China will support the Hong Kong government to bring the protests in the city to an end, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang said on Friday. "People should believe that Chinese people have the ability and wisdom to manage its affairs," he said. The Premier's comments came after German Chancellor Angela Merkel called for a peaceful solution to the Hong Kong crisis.

column2: Flow of undocumented migrants towards US fell by 56%: Mexico
column3: Mexican Foreign Minister Marcelo Ebrard has said the flow of undocumented migrants heading towards the US border fell by 56% between May and August. Ebrard credited the reduction in flow of migrants to various measures taken by his government. In June, US President Donald Trump had threatened tariffs against Mexico if it did not curb migrant flow towards the US.

column2: It'll be a problem if you give freebies: SC on AAP's free Metro scheme
column3: While hearing AAP-led Delhi government's plea on Metro's Phase IV expansion, the Supreme Court said, "If you allow people to travel free...give freebies, there'll be a problem." "On one hand it's extending sops but in court, it wants direction to centre to bear 50% operational losses, if ever incurred," the court said while talking about free rides for women scheme.

column2: At 14, I talked to my girlfriend's dad as her female friend: Ayushmann
column3: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana revealed in an interview that when he was 14, he used to talk to his then girlfriend's father as her female friend whenever the father answered the call on the household landline phone. "And we used to talk for hours because her dad thought that she was talking to a girl," Khurrana said.

column2: Teacher puts boxes on students' heads to prevent them from cheating
column3: A Mexico teacher made his students cover their heads with cardboard boxes to prevent them from cheating, with a picture of his act going viral. Parents asked for the teacher to be dismissed, saying the act should not be tolerated. In response to the criticism, the school explained that it was a dynamic exercise to help the students' psychomotor development.

column2: Abu Dhabi may back SoftBank's $108 billion Vision Fund 2 in Q4 2019
column3: Abu Dhabi state fund Mubadala is expected to invest in Japanese conglomerate SoftBank's $108-billion Vision Fund 2 in the fourth quarter of 2019, Reuters reported. The conglomerate had announced the fund in July, with backing from Apple, Microsoft and Kazakhstan, among others. Earlier, the UAE and Saudi Arabia had contributed nearly two-thirds to SoftBank's first, $100-billion Vision Fund.

column2: Amazon may also go offline in India with AmazonBasics label
column3: Amazon is reportedly planning to foray into the offline retailing business in India with its private label 'AmazonBasics'. The label is one of Amazon's largest-selling global brand, which it reportedly wants to push through over 2000 retail stores of three retail chains, Future Group, More and Shoppers Stop. Amazon has picked up stakes in the three chains in the past.

column2: KIA Motors to start exports through Chennai Port from September 20
column3: South Korean carmaker KIA Motors will begin exporting vehicles manufactured at its new Anantapur plant via the Chennai Port Trust. The first lot, which is expected to be shipped on September 20, will contain 500 vehicles and the volume will be increased gradually. KIA Motors India COO Jong Soo Kim said the company manufactured 6,000 cars in the first month.

column2: Large underwater observatory disappears without a trace
column3: A large underwater observatory that was stationed at a depth of 22 meters in the Baltic Sea has vanished without a trace. The $330,000 observatory, managed by ocean research agencies, had been on the seafloor in a restricted area off the northern coast of Germany since December 2016. Divers sent to locate the observatory only found a shredded transmission cable.

column2: Minister among 400 evacuated as metro work damages Kolkata buildings
column3: Kolkata Minister Tapas Roy was among over 400 persons forced to evacuate their homes and shops in the city after over 50 buildings developed cracks, apparently due to ongoing construction work for the underground tunnel of the East-West Metro project. The precautionary evacuation notice was served following an inspection by a Kolkata Metro Rail Corporation team.

column2: Finish graduation, marry boyfriend when he turns 21: Madras HC to girl
column3: Madras High Court has directed an 18-year-old girl to complete her graduation and wait for her 19-year-old boyfriend to turn 21 before getting married. This comes after the girl's father alleged the boy kidnapped his daughter, who recently started college. The court asked the girl to stay in hostel till graduation as she didn't want to live with her father.

column2: Watching porn is not anti-national: K'taka Minister defends Deputy CM
column3: Karnataka Law Minister JC Madhuswamy on Thursday defended Deputy CM Laxman Savadi over the 2012 controversy when he was found watching porn in state Assembly. "Watching video in Vidhana Soudha isn't an anti-national activity...Watching the video (porn) was morally wrong, he accidentally switched it on and watched it," he added, stating that there's no point in criticising Savadi.

column2: Masked man enters Russian Election Commission chief's house; tasers her
column3: A masked man broke into the home of Ella Pamfilova, the head of Russia's Central Election Commission on Friday, and repeatedly tasered her, Russia's Ministry of Internal Affairs said. The Ministry added that the man later fled. The attack happened two days before Russians vote in regional elections, including in Moscow.

column2: Minister asks why car sales not rising, man says 'people have no money'
column3: MoS Finance Anurag Thakur was heckled at an event after he asked an audience of automobile component makers why car sales were not rising despite discounts and government initiatives. An audience member shouted, "This is a delayed effect of demonetisation. People don't have money." Thakur responded, "Thank you... If that's the delayed effect, how do you move from here?"

column2: China cuts banks' reserve ratios, frees up $126 billion for loans
column3: China's central bank on Friday said it's cutting the amount of cash that banks must hold as reserves, releasing a total $126.35 billion in liquidity. The People's Bank of China (PBOC) has now cut the reserve requirement ratio (RRR) seven times since early 2018. China's economic growth slowed to a near 30-year low of 6.2% in the April-June quarter.

column2: 'Genius' Smith on track to go down as one of the greats: Ponting
column3: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting has said 'genius' is the word that would describe batsman Steve Smith's current form. Ponting added that Smith, who smashed his third Test double hundred, is on track to go down as one of the best to play cricket and he only compares to Don Bradman. He further said Smith's concentration levels are unbelievably good.

column2: New journey: Caster Semenya after joining football team
column3: Two-time Olympic 800m gold medallist Caster Semenya, who is currently appealing against IAAF's introduction of a new testosterone limit for female athletes, has joined Gauteng-based football club, JVW FC. Semenya, who said she is looking forward to this 'new journey', cannot defend her 800m world title in Doha without taking hormone-suppressing drugs, something she has refused to do.

column2: AIMIM activist arrested in BJP leader BS Tomar's murder case
column3: Uttar Pradesh police on Friday arrested AIMIM activist Arif Muzim for his alleged role in the murder of BJP leader BS Tomar in July. The police said, "During the investigation, many names came up and the accused were remanded." Tomar was murdered by unidentified assailants who fled after the crime but left their two-wheeler behind.

column2: Study finds mixture of drugs to cause biological de-ageing
column3: A new study has found that volunteers who were given a mixture of drugs for a year lost an average of 2.5 years of their biological ages. The research revealed that the identification marks on the volunteers' genomes that represent their "epigenetic clock", as well as their immune systems, improved despite the passing of time.

column2: 12 puppies beaten to death in Mumbai, 4 suspects booked
column3: Police have booked 4 suspects after 12 puppies were found dead in Mumbai's Goregaon, officials said on Tuesday. An animal rights activist found 10 puppies dead and 2 barely mobile, a day after he took them to a small tent to provide shelter from rain. Reportedly, bodies of the puppies were mutilated with their eyes popping out.

column2: I&B Ministry decides to discontinue single-use plastic
column3: Union Ministry of Information and Broadcasting has reportedly decided to do away with single-use plastic inside the premises of units under it and is encouraging staff members to turn to recycled paper. "Implementing a clean and green environmental initiative was the need of the hour which was a collective responsibility," an official statement stated.

column2: UK court rejects bid to stop PM Johnson's parliament suspension
column3: London’s High Court on Friday rejected a legal challenge against British PM Boris Johnson’s suspension of parliament before Brexit. The court also said it could be taken to the Supreme Court for a final appeal. At the end of August, PM Johnson announced he would suspend parliament from mid-September to mid-October so the government could announce a new legislative programme.

column2: Pak PM sends 'red letters' to 27 ministries over performance
column3: The office of Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan has sent 'red letters' to 27 ministries for "critical delay" in the tasks they were assigned. This is reportedly the first time that such letters, which act as a final warning, were sent. The Prime Minister's office noted that the red letter would factor into the performance report of the concerned ministries.

column2: Priyanka Chopra features on cover of Vogue India September issue
column3: Actress Priyanka Chopra has featured on the cover of the September issue of fashion magazine Vogue India. She was styled by Sabyasachi for the cover photo and can be seen wearing a gold-spotted pink mesh top. "Everything that I am today or am doing in America, I learnt in India. I'm just showing a perspective of it," Priyanka told Vogue.

column2: Vidyut Jammwal swings a full gas cylinder for work out; shares video
column3: Actor Vidyut Jammwal on Thursday shared a video which shows him exercising with a gas cylinder. "For the non-believers, THIS is a FULL CYLINDER...YOUR body is ready to train, ur mind just doesn't know it. Stop the excuses," he captioned the video. Vidyut added that all safety measures were taken while filming the video.

column2: J&K activist booked for sedition over her allegations against Army
column3: Delhi Police on Friday booked Kashmiri activist Shehla Rashid on sedition charges and for promoting enmity by allegedly spreading fake news about the situation in Jammu and Kashmir after Article 370 revocation. Rashid last month had tweeted that armed forces were creating "an environment of fear", adding that they were "entering houses at night, picking up boys, ransacking houses".

column2: Pakistani video shows Kohli, Dhawan playing for Pak in 2025, gets trolled
column3: A Pakistani video showing Virat Kohli, Shikhar Dhawan, Ravindra Jadeja and Ravichandran Ashwin playing for Pakistan against England in 2025 T20 World Cup final at 'Srinagar Cricket Stadium' went viral. In the video, the commentator introduces Pakistani openers as "two legendary batsmen Babar Azam and Virat Kohli". Reacting to it, a user tweeted, "Har dream ki ek limit hoti hai."

column2: Facebook announces $10-million contest to detect 'deepfakes'
column3: Facebook, along with Microsoft, the Partnership on AI and several universities including Oxford and MIT, has announced the Deepfake Detection Challenge (DFDC) to help detect 'deepfake' videos. Facebook has committed $10 million to the program. It will commission researchers to produce realistic deepfakes to create a data set for testing detection tools that will participate in the contest.

column2: Aircel-Maxis case against Chidambaram adjourned indefinitely
column3: A Delhi court on Friday adjourned the Aircel-Maxis case involving former Finance Minister P Chidambaram and his son Karti indefinitely. The court said, "Prosecution seeking date after dates," adding that the prosecution may approach the court as and when the probe is complete. The CBI and ED had sought adjournment on the ground that response to Letters Rogatory was awaited.

column2: WeWork planning to cut its valuation by over 50% for IPO: Report
column3: Co-working space giant WeWork's parent firm The We Company is planning to cut its valuation to somewhere in the $20-billion range for its Initial Public Offering (IPO). This would mark an over 50% drop in the $47-billion valuation it gained in its last private funding round in January. Founded in 2010, the SoftBank-backed startup confidentially filed for IPO in April.

column2: Scientists behind 1st black hole image get $3 million prize
column3: Event Horizon Telescope (EHT) team of researchers responsible for the first real image of a black hole has won a $3-million award 'Breakthrough Prize' in fundamental physics. The image took 347 astrophysicists across 60 institutions in 20 different countries and eight high-powered telescopes to be captured. The black hole is at the galaxy M87's centre, 55 million light-years from Earth.

column2: PM urges nation to watch Chandrayaan-2's landing, says he's excited
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to urge the nation to watch Chandrayaan-2's Moon landing, saying, "I am extremely excited to be at the ISRO Centre in Bengaluru to witness the extraordinary moment in the history of India's space programme." "I have been regularly and enthusiastically tracking all updates relating to Chandrayaan-2 since it was launched," he added.

column2: Class 10 girl threatened for riding Royal Enfield bike in UP village
column3: A Class 10 student's family in an Uttar Pradesh village has said they were threatened by two men after the girl had gone to a local market to buy milk on Royal Enfield Bullet last month. Her uncle alleged that the duo barged into their house and fired in the air as they didn't want her to ride the bike.

column2: Fire breaks out in a train at New Delhi Station, 4 fire tenders on spot
column3: A fire has broken out in two coaches of the Chandigarh-Kochuveli Express at platform number eight of the New Delhi Railway Station. Huge plumes of smoke were seen rising out of the train. As many as four fire tenders are present at the spot, while all passengers have been evacuated safely.

column2: China supports withdrawal of extradition bill: Hong Kong leader
column3: Hong Kong leader Carrie Lam on Thursday said that China "understands, respects and supports" her government's move to formally withdraw an extradition bill. The bill, that had triggered months of anti-government protests, was withdrawn on Wednesday. "We must find ways to address the discontent in society and look for solutions," Lam further said.

column2: Fitch downgrades Hong Kong for first time since 1995 after protests
column3: Fitch Ratings has downgraded Hong Kong's long-term foreign-currency issuer default rating for the first time since 1995 following months of protests in the city. The rating was lowered to AA from AA+ with a negative outlook. Disagreeing with Fitch's downgrade, Hong Kong Chief Executive Carrie Lam said, "The chaos over the past few months has not weakened...the rule of law."

column2: US man who rapped about killing girlfriend charged with her murder
column3: A US man who rapped about killing and burying his girlfriend in a video posted online has been charged with her murder. Robert Camou had earlier been arrested for beating and strangling his girlfriend, Amanda Custer, in April. Authorities suspect that Camou killed her in July while he was out on bail for the April attack.

column2: India's biggest drugmaker ordered to undergo forensic audit
column3: India's biggest drugmaker, Sun Pharma, has said it is undergoing a forensic audit of its financial statements as ordered by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI). The markets regulator has asked for a forensic audit of the company's financial statements for three financial years to March 2018. Sun Pharma, however, did not specify a reason.

column2: L'Oreal invests in consumer-brand focused Fireside Ventures
column3: L'Oreal has said that it invested an undisclosed amount in Fireside Fund II, the second investment fund by Fireside Ventures. Fireside Ventures is reportedly aiming to raise $100 million in its second outing and announced the final close of its debut fund at $52 million in 2018. Launched in 2017, the fund invests in Indian consumer brands across various sectors.

column2: Languages transmit information at 39 bits/second: Study
column3: A study conducted on 17 different languages has shown that most languages have roughly the same information transmission rate, which lies around 39 bits per second. The study found that despite differentiating factors between languages, like the number of distinct syllables and the average speech rate, the rate at which information is conveyed is roughly the same.

column2: There's got to be politicians who care about air quality: Tharoor
column3: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Thursday said that discussion on air quality is very limited in the Parliament because it is not a determinant of votes in India. "There's got to be enough people in the political space who care about the issue," he added. "Sometimes the broader issue comes up during winter months...just after Diwali," he further said.

column2: North Korea tells UN to cut international aid staff: Reports
column3: North Korea has reportedly told the United Nations to cut the number of international staff it deploys in the country because the world body's programmes have failed. "UN supported programmes failed to bring the results as desired due to the politicisation of UN assistance by hostile forces," a North Korean official wrote to a top UN official.

column2: UK plans another vote on Monday to push for snap election
column3: The UK government said on Thursday that the members of parliament will get another chance to vote for an early election on Monday. The move comes after the House of Commons rejected PM Boris Johnson's plan for a snap election on October 15 in a vote on Wednesday. PM Johnson wants to stick to the Brexit deadline of October 31.

column2: Good Bye to AAP: Alka Lamba as she announces resignation from party
column3: Alka Lamba on Friday took to Twitter to announce her resignation from the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP). "The time has come to say "Good Bye" to #AAP and to resign from the primary membership of the Party. The past 6 years journey was a great learning for me," she tweeted. This comes amid reports that she's planning to join Congress.

column2: Former Zimbabwe President Robert Mugabe passes away aged 95
column3: Former Zimbabwe President Robert Mugabe has passed away at the age of 95 after battling ill health. Mugabe was ousted from power in a military coup in 2017, ending his 37-year reign. Mugabe, who was Zimbabwe's first post-independence leader, had once declared that only god could remove him from office. Zimbabwe President Emmerson Mnangagwa called Mugabe "an icon of liberation".

column2: Rajinikanth's daughter's bag, her husband's passport stolen at UK airport
column3: Rajinikanth's daughter and filmmaker Soundarya and her husband Vishagan Vanangamudi's luggage and his passport were recently stolen from Emirates chauffeur lounge at London's Heathrow airport. In her tweet, Soundarya criticised the airline, saying she received an email from the authorities stating the CCTV cameras in the lounge were faulty and "didn't record anything on the day of the theft".

column2: Nicki Minaj announces retirement, says she wants to have a family
column3: Rapper Nicki Minaj on Thursday took to Twitter to announce that she was retiring from the music business. "I've decided to retire & have my family. I know you guys are happy now. To my fans, keep reppin me, do it til da death of me," she wrote. In June, Minaj said she planned to marry boyfriend Kenneth "Zoo" Petty.

column2: Apple may add in-display fingerprint tech to 2020 iPhones: Report
column3: Apple is developing in-display fingerprint technology for its iPhones, which could be used as early as by next year, Bloomberg reported. The technology is reportedly in testing and the deadline could extend to 2021. Apple introduced facial recognition technology Face ID for the iPhone X in 2017 as a replacement to its fingerprint technology Touch ID, introduced in 2013.

column2: Alibaba buys Chinese gaming giant NetEase's e-comm unit for $2 bn
column3: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba has acquired Chinese gaming giant NetEase's luxury goods import e-commerce platform Kaola for about $2 billion. The import platform will be integrated with Alibaba's Tmall, leading to the creation of the largest cross-border e-commerce platform in China. NetEase was reportedly in talks to merge Kaola with Amazon China, earlier this year.

column2: Amazon to start food delivery from next month in India: Report
column3: Amazon India is reportedly set to start its food delivery service from next month and has started signing restaurants, promising to charge one-fourth the commissions charged by Zomato and Swiggy. The service will reportedly be first offered in Bengaluru, followed by Mumbai and Delhi. Amazon is also reportedly in the final stages of acquiring Foodpanda's infrastructure from Ola.

column2: Elon Musk trolls Porsche for calling its 1st electric car 'Turbo'
column3: Electric carmaker Tesla's Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to troll German luxury automaker Porsche for calling its first-ever electric car "Turbo". "Um [Porsche], this word Turbo does not mean what you think it does," Musk wrote. Turbochargers, found in internal combustion engine vehicles which use fossil fuels, increase performance by pumping more compressed air into the engine.

column2: ISRO shares cartoon featuring Chandrayaan-2 ahead of Moon landing
column3: Ahead of Chandrayaan-2's Moon landing on September 7, ISRO has shared a cartoon featuring the orbiter and Vikram lander. In the cartoon, the orbiter tells the lander, "It was great travelling with you so far Vikram...Best of luck! I hope you reach the South Pole soon." Vikram lander successfully separated from the orbiter on September 2.

column2: KKR acquires Indian pre-school chain EuroKids International
column3: US-based investment firm KKR has acquired a majority stake in Indian education services provider EuroKids International from an investor consortium led by Gaja Capital. EuroKids runs 1,115 pre-schools and 35 K-12 schools across five countries. The company will continue to be managed by its current team led by Co-Founder and Group CEO Prajodh Rajan, who will remain a shareholder.

column2: SC notice to govt over new law declaring individuals as terrorists
column3: The Supreme Court has issued a notice to the Centre on PILs seeking direction to declare the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Amendment Act, 2019, unconstitutional. The act empowers the government to designate a person suspected to have terror links as a "terrorist". Recently, JeM's Masood Azhar, LeT's Hafiz Saeed and underworld don Dawood Ibrahim were declared 'individual terrorists' under the act.

column2: After doctor killed, 7 doctors posted at Assam tea estates resign
column3: Several doctors in Assam have tendered their resignations citing security threats following the murder of 73-year-old Dr Deben Dutta of Teok Tea Estate in Jorhat district, said a report. Dutta had died after being thrashed by garden workers following the death of their co-worker at the hospital. Further, there are reports of doctors in some tea gardens abstaining from work.

column2: 9-yr-old dies after eating poisoned birthday cake sent by his uncle
column3: A nine-year-old boy was among two dead after eating a poisoned birthday cake he had requested his uncle to send in Telangana's Siddipet district on Thursday. Two other family members also fell ill and are undergoing treatment. Police have filed a case of attempt to murder against the boy's uncle and the investigation is underway.

column2: Ex-campaign staffer who said Trump forced a kiss drops lawsuit
column3: A former campaign staffer for US President Donald Trump who accused him of forcibly kissing her in 2016 has dropped her lawsuit, saying it's difficult to pursue "justice against a person with unlimited resources". The lawsuit alleged that Trump leaned in so close that Alva Johnson felt his breath, adding she turned her head, trying to avoid a kiss.

column2: I'd rather be dead in a ditch than delay Brexit: UK PM Johnson
column3: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson has said he would "rather be dead in a ditch" than ask the European Union to delay Brexit beyond October 31. "It achieves absolutely nothing. What on earth is the point of further delay," he added. However, Johnson declined to say if he would resign if a postponement had to happen.

column2: Brazilian minister calls French First Lady 'truly ugly'; apologises
column3: Brazilian Economy Minister Paulo Guedes on Thursday called French First Lady Brigitte Macron "truly ugly". This comes days after Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro appeared to endorse an attack on her appearance. "The President said it, it's true...The woman is truly ugly," Guedes said. An aide of Guedes later said the minister "asks for forgiveness for the joke he made today".

column2: I've seen very selfish people in this industry: Kangana
column3: After Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) gave approval to cut over 2,500 trees for a Metro car shed in Aarey Colony, Kangana Ranaut was asked whether she would like to appeal to her colleagues from Bollywood. She said that she has seen very selfish people in this industry who "show a lot of indifference when it comes to...people of our country."

column2: Being a girl studying in English medium school a privilege: Richa
column3: Richa Chadha said that after researching for her film 'Love Sonia', she realised that it's a privilege to be an educated girl in India and to study in an English medium school. "I've decided to consciously devote...time to charity causes and do my bit for society," she added. "Girl education is very close to my heart," she further added.

column2: Britney Spears fearful of losing her sons' custody: Reports
column3: After Britney Spears' ex-husband accused her father Jamie Spears of physically abusing their elder son, Britney is reportedly fearful that she might lose her sons' custody as her dad acts as her conservator. As per a report, Britney feels that Jamie put her in jeopardy. "She was very upset with him and left with the boys," the report further stated.

column2: On track to raise $2 bn by 2019: Ride-hailing unicorn Go-Jek
column3: Indonesian ride-hailing unicorn Go-Jek is on track to raise $2 billion in its ongoing Series F funding round before 2019 ends, the startup's President Andre Soelistyo said. Reportedly valued at $10 billion, Go-Jek has secured investments from Visa and Mitsubishi Motors, among others in the ongoing round. It had raised about $1 billion from Google, Tencent and others in February.

column2: B'luru physiotherapy startup ProPhysio raises Series A funding
column3: Bengaluru-based physiotherapy startup ProPhysio has secured an undisclosed amount of funding in its Series A round from NestaVera Group of companies. Founded by Pramod Ravindra, Bhagwati Nambi Rajan and Pratima Nagpal, ProPhysio helps patients with their physiotherapy needs both at home and in clinics. ProPhysio said it will use the funds for AI-driven solutions to treat various health issues.

column2: Deepika turns showstopper for Abu Jani-Sandeep Khosla's show
column3: Wearing an embellished lehenga, actress Deepika Padukone turned showstopper for fashion designers Abu Jani and Sandeep Khosla at a fashion show in Mumbai on Thursday. The show, which celebrated the duo's 33 years of completion in the industry, witnessed Deepika dancing on the song 'Disco Deewane' with the designers.

column2: Iske haath mai jaan nahin hai: Ishan Kishan sledges Mayank Markande
column3: During the Duleep Trophy final against India Green, India Red wicketkeeper Ishan Kishan teased his ex-Mumbai Indians teammate Mayank Markande while he was batting. "Iske haath mai jaan nahin hai," Kishan was heard saying. "Khelne ka mann nahin hai bhai ko...nahin mann hai is bande ko khelne ka," Kishan further said. Markande scored an unbeaten 76 in the first innings.

column2: 15-year-old Rohtak-born Shafali Verma earns maiden India Women call-up
column3: Rohtak-born 15-year-old batsman Shafali Verma has been included in the 15-member India Women squad for the first three matches of the five-match series against South Africa. Shafali had scored 34 runs off 31 balls for Velocity against Trailblazers in the Women's T20 Challenge earlier this year. Sachin Tendulkar is Shafali's favourite player.

column2: Yahoo mail, website face 6-hour global outage for some users
column3: Thousands of global users took to social media to complain of Yahoo facing an outage across its services including mail and website for over six hours on Thursday. Acknowledging the issue, Yahoo apologised to its users and said that the cause for the same was a technical issue from its side. "Most services are back online," it tweeted later.

column2: Goa govt mentions Parrikar as current CM in Teachers' Day wishes
column3: Goa government on Thursday released a media statement wishing people on Teachers' Day and mentioned late Manohar Parrikar as the current Chief Minister. "Goa CM Manohar Parrikar has wished teaching class on 56th Teachers' Day," the statement read. The former CM passed away in March this year and was succeeded by Pramod Sawant.

column2: PM Modi refuses sofa at photo session, asks officials for chair
column3: PM Narendra Modi refused to sit on a sofa kept specially for him at a photo session in Russia on Tuesday and expressed his desire to sit on a chair like others. In a video shared by Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal, officials can be seen replacing the sofa with a chair. PM Modi was in Russia on a two-day visit.

column2: Kiran Nagarkar, novelist and playwright, dies aged 77 in Mumbai
column3: Novelist and playwright Kiran Nagarkar, known for his books 'Cuckold' and 'Bedtime Story', passed away at the age of 77 in Mumbai on Thursday. He had suffered brain hemorrhage earlier this week. Nagarkar wrote eight novels in English and Marathi. He had published his first novel, 'Saat Sakkam Trechalis' (Seven Sixes Are Forty Three), in Marathi in 1974.

column2: H&M halts leather purchases from Brazil due to 'severe' Amazon fires
column3: Fashion retailer H&M has stopped purchasing leather from Brazil for the time being due to "severe" fires in Amazon rainforest. This comes amid concerns that Brazil's cattle industry contributed to deforestation of Amazon rainforest. "The ban will be active until there are credible assurance systems in place to verify that the leather does not contribute to environmental harm," H&M said.

column2: Western firms didn't see e-commerce gorilla coming: Reliance Brands CEO
column3: Reliance Brands CEO Darshan Mehta has said that Western companies "overbuilt" their store estates and did not see the "e-commerce gorilla" coming. "Look around and you'll always find many of them up for sale, whether it be in New York, London or Milan," he added. The company, which recently bought Hamleys, is looking to buy fashion and child-focused retailers abroad.

column2: Boman Irani to be awarded at Bollywood Festival in Norway
column3: Actor Boman Irani will be felicitated for his outstanding contribution to Indian cinema at 17th Bollywood Festival on Friday in Oslo, Norway. "I am thankful to everyone who has loved my work over the years and has contributed to my success," he said. The actor will also participate in an interactive session with the audience.

column2: Kashmir issue does not concern Muslim community: UAE to Pak
column3: UAE Foreign Minister Sheikh Abdullah bin Zayed Al Nahyan on Thursday said Kashmir is not an issue concerning Muslim community but a dispute between India and Pakistan. He also urged India and Pakistan to resolve issue through talks. Foreign Ministers of UAE and Saudi Arabia, Adel bin Ahmed Al-Jubeir, arrived in Pakistan on Wednesday to discuss the issue.

column2: Wonderful to see Ishant maintain his consistency: VVS Laxman
column3: Praising fast bowler Ishant Sharma for his performances in the recently concluded Test series against West Indies, former India batsman VVS Laxman said, "It was wonderful to see Ishant maintain his consistency of the last few years." Laxman also talked about Sharma's maiden Test fifty, saying, he must have felt delighted. The 31-year-old took 11 wickets in the two-match series.

column2: Steve Smith paddle-sweeps crowd's beach ball for a four
column3: During the first innings of the ongoing fourth Ashes Test, a beach ball thrown in by the crowd reached Australia batsman Steve Smith due to strong winds. As soon as the ball approached Smith, he paddle-swept it towards fine leg. Ben Stokes, who was standing at that position, looked on as the ball crossed the boundary rope.

column2: Smith missed Test cricket but Tests missed him more: Aakash
column3: After Steve Smith slammed a double hundred in the first innings of the fourth Ashes Test, cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra tweeted, "Steve Smith missed Test cricket. But Test cricket missed him a lot more". Other users reacted saying, "Call an exorcist this man is possessed...what a player", and "Batting in a world of his own! Steve Smith continues to dominate. Freak."

column2: Microsoft India, CBSE partner to train 1,000 teachers in AI, ICT
column3: Microsoft India and Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) have partnered to train 1,000 teachers with an aim to integrate cloud-powered technology in K12 teaching. The programme will provide teachers access to Information and Communication Technology (ICT) tools and include aspects of AI, gamification through Minecraft and other collaborative tools. The programme will start on September 11.

column2: YouTube launches a separate fashion vertical
column3: Online streaming platform YouTube has launched a separate "/Fashion" vertical for fashion and beauty video content. The vertical, within YouTube's website and app, lets viewers subscribe to the category without subscribing to individual channels and creators, and will also feature original content. YouTube said its fashion and beauty channels have grown over six times between 2014 and 2018.

column2: Nissan CEO admits receiving excess pay, denies wrongdoing
column3: Japanese automaker Nissan's CEO Hiroto Saikawa has admitted to being overpaid at the firm but denied any wrongdoing, adding he would return the excess amount. An internal Nissan probe reportedly found Saikawa and other executives had received improper compensations. He said the overpayments were made in a scheme created under ousted Chairman Carlos Ghosn who was arrested for financial misconduct.

column2: DGCA suspends 2 pilots for flying with tail support attached
column3: Aviation regulator DGCA on Thursday suspended two IndiGo pilots for two months for flying a Hyderabad-Vijaywada flight on July 24 with the tail support attached, an official said. The pilots continued the journey even though they were informed about it by the Air Traffic Control (ATC) immediately after the take-off. The period of suspension would be calculated from July 24.

column2: Need wider G7-style group which includes India, China: Putin
column3: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Thursday that Russia was ready to host a meeting of the G7/G8 group of nations, and would welcome a wider format featuring India, China and Turkey. Putin, who was speaking at an economic forum in Russia's Far East, said he could not imagine an effective international organisation without India or China.

column2: Taliban suicide blast kills 10, injures over 40 in Kabul
column3: A Taliban suicide blast in the centre of Kabul killed at least 10 people and wounded more than 40 on Thursday, officials said. The blast destroyed cars and shops near the headquarters of Afghanistan's NATO office and the US embassy. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack while the insurgents and the US have been negotiating a peace deal.

column2: Govt sensitive to slowdown in auto sector: Maruti Suzuki CEO
column3: Maruti Suzuki CEO Kenichi Ayukawa on Thursday said the government is sensitive towards the slowdown in auto sector and is taking steps to reverse it. To revive the sector, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman had announced in August that government departments would be allowed to buy new vehicles. Sales slowdown has been due to factors like GST rates, farm distress etc.
